column6: No comment
No comment
No comment

What a total rip off!! The food was fine. But it was dish after dish of a piece of fish sitting in a sauce. No veggies (unless you count a few raw peas). No bread to sop up the endless parade of gravies and curries. No crispy textures or contrasting flavor elements. And a thimbleful of rice with our mouthful of tuna. The meal was fine. It was just outrageously overpriced for what it was. And beware: If you paid $155 pp on Tock for your reservation, that was not a deposit. You're still paying $255 for your $120 value meal and hoping the kind people at Tock refund your credit card weeks after your gullible purchase.

Outstanding and unforgettable dining experience at Clover Hill. We were blown away by the attention to detail, flavors, and execution of the menu. It's a small, intimate space perfect for a nice date (maybe not the first, make sure you like them ;)) or a group of 4-5. The service was also excellent and knowledgeable, considering there are 8-9 dishes per seating. I haven't been this excited about a restaurant in a very long time and hope they continue to do their thang!

What can I say. I had dinner at Clover Hill restaurant in Brooklyn Heights to celebrate Lizettes birthday.  It was Michelin Star Chief Mitchell. I can say everything was 100 stars. Food. Service. Presentation. Staff = exceptional.  If you want an experience, this is the place to go. He did his thing. The food was exceptional.  Service was great. Pipper was our host and she was great. Very personal and engaging. Ambiance was awesome.

For all its great reviews and Michelin star, this restaurant was a disappointment.  The food was what one might see in a Michelin level of distinction.  Good, tasty, but not exceptional.  And it was expensive.  Two small rolls with butter was $15.  The other dishes were about a 25 percent higher than most recent two-star and many of the one star restaurants that we have been to in the last three months.  That would be about 12  restaurants.

Being totally honest, I came into this experience with lower expectations. I have had a few similar new one star restaurants in New York...especially Brooklyn that just seemed hype over execution. Enter clover hill. A (literally) hidden gem in an obscure corner of Brooklyn heights. Actually this block in Brooklyn is worth a visit alone. Chef charlie Mitchell is on his way to his second Michelin star very soon. He has taken fine dining and infused it with American spice and excitement. His delightfully filling menu is hit after hit. Once you enter the dark, moody, small interior you are greeted by a friendly and knowledgeable staff. The pace of the meal is just fine. The drink menu is streamlined but solid. If I have one note it is I would love some sort of menu to accompany meal service. Call me old fashioned but I like to read what I'm eating not just heat it. This is a seafood focused menu and I am fine with that. I'd even say no need to upgrade to the meat dish. Fish is what they do so go for the ride. The crab tart was a fun take on the dish and took me to summers on the boardwalk! I could eat that farro porridge every day! So delicious. Check it out!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Very exciting! Ambiance & food were just wonderful! Very refreshing and thoughtful dinner! Chef & team are very kind & sweet. Will be back
No comment
Very cozy little spot. On the slightly fancier side but every bite was delicious! Had the short rib cannelloni which rocked and was very happy with the madeleines. Would absolutely go back

Amazing. Don't know how else to describe it. What a hidden gem! We had brunch and dishes there are a revelation - it's innovative, delicious, and beautiful. I also love that the portions are not huge - they are just the right size to fill up but not overeat. The ambiance made my partner and I to own a place like that were we would take our friends and family to hang out. Beautiful decor. We are sad it's so far from where we live in Manhattan, but we will definitely won't skip it when we are next in the neighborhood.
Brunch was amazing! French omelette was fantastic. Melted in my mouth. The perfect balance for a brunch. My husband enjoyed the pork belly on the side. Will stop by again on the next visit for sure.
Excellent food, service and atmosphere. The tasting menu is very inviting and tastes incredible.

I walked in expecting just a really nice dinner and walked out experiencing culinary art. I was treated to what can only be described as a dining experience from beginning to end. The music was a whole vibe. The staff were wonderful to interact with. The food was outstanding!!! I cannot recommend this place enough. Worth every penny to eat in this wonderful space.

This meal was amazing. Great service too. We reserved the bar (which is a la cart) and we didn't realize, but was July 4th weekend, so was not busy and we got to sit at a table. The tables are normally for the tasting menu, but we had a choice. We did a la cart and loved it! I'm sure the tasting menu is fantastic too. Small  cozy place with such a good vibe. Highly recommend.

We had the most delicious brunch here! We had the hen egg, omelette and pate. They were super accommodating to my gluten allergy. We even had a little dessert. The coffee was delicious, with espresso drinks as good or better than a high quality coffee shop. Will go again!

A lot to like about this place! Attentive waitstaff, creative dishes and nice coffee! I had a latte and the crushed potato with black pepper and fried egg. Everything about the dish was really, really nice though I guess I got kinda bored? Potatoes are awesome but it was really the focal point of the dish and after a while I was like...I just don't want anymore of this. A bit of bacon or pancetta would have maybe made up some of this ground? My girlfriend had the waffles with apple. She said the waffles were really good but the smoked apple was kinda weird. Would like to come back and try other things! The only slightly off putting stuff was some of the plants were dying and some of the waitstaff were dressed formally and others were very casual. I don't mind what you wear as a waiter, live your best life but it felt super Brooklyn hipstery which we never want.

This place honestly left a lasting impression. I'm looking forward to going back. The food was visually pleasing AND equally flavorful, which I feel is rare to come by! The staff was also very welcoming. Great place for a date night or even a nice dinner with friends. Def worth it!!!

Wow!  Every bite was a special occasion. I went to a really famous Michelin star restaurant the day before and this was the place I would return to again. Quaint and charming local neighborhood restaurant but world class food.
What an incredible addition to the neighborhood. Clover hill combines a cozy neighborhood vibe with Michelin level food. Could not recommend the tasting more.
No comment
No comment

Beautiful restaurant with creative and elevated cuisine. Love that it's open for breakfast on the weekends - probably one of the only places in the neighborhood other than chains or diners open before 11am. We had the truffle potatoes and eggs (so rich and delicious!) and the toast with ricotta and pears and got to sit with our toddler in a lovely window seat overlooking the street. We were probably one of the only families so it's not overrun with children but also not unwelcoming to children either. =)

Brunch was absolutely outstanding, down to the perfect toast. The scone was served on cream, and was unbelievably flavorful. I would definitely order the bacon and the truffle potatoes and eggs again. Even the temperatures of everything were perfect.

I LOVE this new restaurant in the neighborhood. It's very welcoming, has a beautiful design, and everything from the cutlery to the sugar bowl is elegant! The music is not too loud so it's a great place to talk and you really feel like you can stay all day. The trout with beets is delectable! The service was very attentive and friendly as well. I love how open it is, it's great for a huge group or even for a more intimate date.
Amazing brunch food. Ordered the trout, monk fish, Apple and celery salad, and pistachio scone and all were excellent.

If you're looking for a warm inviting dining space to settle in and eat phenomenal food, Clover Hill is the place to go to. Exceptional service and a great place to spend time with friends and family who will enjoy themselves!

This neighborhood has been crying out for a restaurant of this caliber for years - ever since Iris Cafe closed. Clover Hill is cozy and approachable while serving up Michelin Star quality food in an affordable tasting menu style experience. They are BYO at the moment, so reservations are highly suggested so that they can steer your beverage purchase based on the nightly menu - another lovely and personal touch that makes it all the more worthwhile.
Masterful flavor combinations. Fresh ingredients. Above average plating. Cozy decor. Welcome to the neighborhood!
Just what the neighborhood needs! Really good, unique food. Cozy setting. Best brunch I've had in a while. The celery and apple salad was a sleeper hit.

This place is fantastic. The best brunch I've had in a very long time. Unassuming, yet very close attention to detail in all facets of execution - from high quality service to beautiful handcrafted plateware, high quality napkin linens, and phenomenal food. Will certainly be back for more. Try the pistachio scone w satsuma jam and the truffled potatoes and eggs.

This is a fantastic addition to the Brooklyn Heights/ Cobble Hill neighborhood -- the food is creative, carefully crafted, and delicious.  We were very impressed with the quality and the plating. Every dish was something I had never had before... from scallops with salsify (the best scallops I've ever had), goat cheese dumplings with savory cabbage, etc. They change the dinner menu weekly, so it's clear they have a lot more tricks up their sleeve. Our server was very attentive, too. It's a quiet, charming atmosphere in a cozy townhome on a cobble street in Brooklyn. It should be a destination, and definitely worth a trip from Manhattan or elsewhere. The tasting menu at $95 was a good value but the dishes can be ordered off the menu too. And the BYO option makes the evening much more affordable. Really excellent. Michelin star worthy, if they don't have one already.
No comment
No comment
Came here for Sunday brunch. Inside is classic Midtown vibes. Server was attentive and kept refilling coffee. Food has a great taste and was served quickly.

My friend and I decided to try the brunch. We got some Kir Royales, which were nice and bubbly. I also enjoyed the Croque Monsieur. Service staff was very accommodating, even helping us work through some pricing issues. All in all, it was a lovely French-style brunch experience.
No comment

It was okay... I wouldn't travel to come here. It was typical French cuisine. The food itself did not blow me away. The presentation for the tuna tartare and the beef tartare was nice. The bone marrow just just regular bone marrow with no seasoning, not even salt. We ordered the Dover sole special (with wilted spinach, potatoes, and a brown butter sauce). The Dover sole was room temperature and dry. The potatoes weren't cooked all the way. The bronzino was better but again nothing special. My girlfriends ordered a passion fruit crème brûlée for dessert and the presentation was nice but the texture was a little odd. The service over all was excellent. The bill came out to $150 each with tax and tip for the three of us $450. For $150 per person for a meh experience I would not go back.
No comment
No comment
No comment

I came here for their bottomless brunch on Sunday and it was great! For the brunch, you can get bottomless Mimosas or Kir Royale (champagne and creme de cassis). Then, you get a sweet or savory entree. I got the French toast with berries and lemon chantilly, which was perfect- bread wasn't too thick and it was all cooked well. My friend got the yummy smoked salmon Benedict, and even the breakfast potatoes on it were excellent. We closed out by getting the apple tart with vanilla ice cream - the ideal conclusion to a delicious brunch.

I came here as was looking for a nice place to have dinner. Saw their prix fixe $45 menu before 6 pm on their website. It was beautifully decorated for the holidays. Liked the atmosphere a lot. That said, the food was on the middling side and portions were small. I left a bit unimpressed at the food.
No comment

10/10 food. 10/10 service. 10/10 ambiance. Our server William was amazing, we were celebrating a birthday and he made it super special. We started off with the escargot and had the magret and steak frites as our main. We ordered a bottle of red and it was delicious. The managers were also extremely helpful and welcoming. Would recommend this to anyone and we will be back when visiting New York again.

Top to bottom excellent.  We came based on reviews and proximity to our hotel and it was delightful in every way (Don't miss the back wall bookcase with Michelin guides from 1901 to present) - it was a delight and I'd recommend to anyone; dark and cozy yet energized with great food and staff.

Love. Food was exceptional. We got the pre-fixe $35 three course lunch special that they serve from, I believe, 11am-3pm. Timing could be slightly off there. We had frog legs, lamb with roasted potato, and passion fruit crème brûlée. I ate there like a week ago and my mouth is watering on tastebud memory just writing this review. Customer service, impeccable. We had a rez at 12p but the trains were not cooperating and they let us switch it to 12:30p without incident. Granted it was a Wednesday afternoon and not too busy but still. Luis our server was spot on and, very much in the French dining style, made sure every thing was great and then let us sit around undisturbed. He was always close by though right when you needed him. Spot is a little higher on the price scale but it's Park Ave in NYC so have reasonable expectations. Great experience. Amazing food. Beautiful space.
No comment

Fabulous dinner and the service was truly wonderful.  Our waitress Katie was a gem, guiding through the menu with a wealth of knowledge. She made the entire experience so memorable.  The mussels were portioned generously and the fries that accompanied them hit the spot.  We came to dine early at 630pm and by the time we left almost every table in our sightline was filled.  Definitely want to come back for seconds!
Their Escargot is absolutely delectable! It's well worth the trip just to taste that dish alone! The atmosphere is warm and sophisticated, beautiful environment as well. Eat inside not out. Enjoy!

Went to La Brasserie for lunch during Restaurant week. It was a great way to try out a place normally out of my price range, so happy that I did. Food were beautifully plated and flavors went together so nicely. I normally don't order cold soups, but the gazpacho with watermelon sorbet intrigued me, and was delightfully surprised. The staff was attentive but did not hover, our reservation was at noon when they just opened and was not busy at all.
No comment
Every bite, every sauce, even the mild toughness of the steak frite reminded me of Paris! Fries were amazing and not cold (and I picked up). Well done!
No comment

Always an amazing meal at la brasserie. From the moment you walk in, Julie the hostess makes you feel at home. The wait staff are extremely attentive and helpful when deciding what to order. The kitchen is extremely accommodating. They were willing to make two of the appetizers without meat as I am a vegetarian but still wanted to experience the classic items. The manager Kamil came over to check on us and even offered us a free dessert because another guest was being extremely rude and he wanted to make sure we still enjoyed our experience. The apple crisp dessert was one of the best I've ever had! Can't wait to come back again!
No comment

I was looking forward to going to this recently new restaurant, right where Les Halles used to be and where my husband and I ate often.  But right from the start things started going downhill.  After we sat down a waiter asked if we wanted sparkling or plain water.  My husband and I wanted plain (or tap water) and our guest wanted sparkling.  He came back with two bottles of Evian, both sparkling and plain.  I was mad that now we had to pay for water.  A little while later an hispanic waiter (English not good) took our drink order and dinner order.  The wine never appeared.  I had to flag down a bus boy or waiter (hard to tell who is who) to get our wine.  Then, two minutes later our orders came.  I ordered the Magret de Canard, and no one brought me a steak knife, so I again, had to flag down someone.  My husband sort of liked the Blanquette de Veau and our guest liked the Branzino.  I did not like the sauce for my duck and I should have asked for it on the side.  I also had to cut the fat off on either side.  Typically, glasses of wine were expensive.  But really the service was way off the mark.  We will not be coming back.

Beautiful restaurant.  Excellent service.  There is a $35 prix fixe, but we had to ask for the menu twice... they don't just provide it.  Food was very good... but I'm not a candidate for French food.  The French simply do not give you enough food!  My cream soup (which was delicious) was maybe 6 spoonfuls, but with a lovely crab cake (small) in the middle.  Branzino fish was small.  Drinks are excellent.  All in all, an excellent meal for the prix fixe... but don't bring a hearty appetite.

Haven't been inside since it was Les Halles, so happy to hear it has been re-opened. Still has the beautiful interior and the space while spacious is also so charming. We had a lovely brunch. With amazing service - the staff were all so helpful and nice and super professional. Top-notch. I had the avocado toast that was seasoned perfectly. The béarnaise sauce that comes with the fries is addictive. If you're looking for classic French with amazing service don't pass this place up.

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: No comment

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: No comment

Really excellent classic French favorites--steak frites, frogs legs, frisée salad, plats du jour. The room is comfortable and the service is lovely. We have had a great lunch and a wonderful dinner here.

I returned to La Brasserie because my last experience was perfection, from the greeting I received from the hostess, to Nikolina, our amazing server, the delicious food and lovely ambiance. This time I was greeted by a man, who promptly informed me that I did not have a reservation. I was about to take out my phone to show him my confirmation when the lovely hostess advised him(I later learned his name is Bashir) that I did in fact have a reservation. She proceeded to give me my choice of table, I sat down and was joined by my party. We were so happy to have Nikolina taking care of us again. Our appetizers arrived and were delicious. The entrees arrived, and I ordered the Steak Frites medium rare. It arrived black and blue.  I just can't eat steak at that temperature, so I asked that it be cooked to temperature. Bashir brought it out after about 2 minutes. The end pieces were rare, and the middles were still cold in the middle. I moved them to the side and decided to eat just the ends. I wasn't going to enjoy it, but I'd a kitchen can't cook your steak to the right temperature on the 2nd try, you just live with it. Nikolina noticed and asked what was wrong and I explained and she took the plate and said that the kitchen would make it right. Much later, after my dining companions already finished their entrees, Bashir brought out a new steak that was cooked to medium rare. He asked me if I ordered medium well or medium rare, because this steak was medium well, and what I received before was medium rare. And he said this rudely and abruptly. Now I don't know about you, but I've ordered plenty of streams and I know the difference between black and blue and medium rare, and when I order a medium rare steak at The Grill, I get steak #2, perfect pink ring around a red center that is warm.  He said enjoy, in an offhand way and my husband, who was infuriated by how he spoke to me in such a condescending manner, replied not so much. The supercilious Bashir proceeded to offer a mocking bow, with the swirling hand gesture.  This led to a bit of a scene, I'm not gonna lie. Nikolina came over, she was very upset. She sent over the other manager, a tall gentleman with a beard, who really didn't know how to handle the situation at all. Besides saying I'm sorry, he didn't say much or do much to diffuse the situation. I just asked for the check, from which he didn't even have the wherewithal to remove the steak, which I left uneaten. I don't need any favors, but when your employee has antagonized your guests to the point where they have to leave food uneaten, you should do something that acts like mouthwash on the bad taste in their mouth. As for Bashir, who I think is a misogynist, he shouldn't be anywhere in front of clients. As for me, I will never go back to this restaurant.
No comment
Wonderful restaurant, great bar service, charming and efficient staff. Can't recommend enough!!!

Amazing restaurant.      We were entertaining out of town friends and decided to try La Brassiere since we are big fans of Anthony Bourdain.      The food was excellent but I want to talk about the service.       A number of us ordered the steak frites and selected the pepper sauce.        My god we were blown away by the flavor.      We spent 3 hours at the restaurant so it was late when we got the bill and the kitchen was closed.      Not knowing the latter, I asked if it was possible to take a small cup of the sauce to go.      We waited a bit only to find out they reopened the kitchen and made the sauce fresh for us.     I mean, who does that.      Just incredible on how happy they made our evening.       Superb
No comment
3 stars are charity- ordinary food poor service - unfortunate reinvention of a great restaurant- Anthony would be saddened if he saw what passes for a brasserie
This was actually so good. The steak frites was perfectly cooked and the fries were delightfully seasoned and had a lovely crunch. Surprised this restaurant doesn't have more reviews.

Three friends and I who all recently graduated from college chose to dine at La Brasserie last night because we saw they were participating in NYC restaurant week and that Anthony Bourdain worked at the location under previous owners. We were very excited and ordered off the prix fixed menu and added some appetizers as well. The food was good and well presented (I think the Panko crusted escargot was fine but had too much parsley to the point where that's all you tasted). For drinks we wanted to share a bottle of wine and our waiter recommended the Sancerre. Without a drink menu in front of us we simply asked if we could please have the cheapest bottle as we were four young women all meeting after work from our new jobs. The wine came out and was so delicious we ordered two bottles throughout the meal - little did we know that the cheapest bottle was $110! La Brasserie is a beautiful restaurant and is a place for fine dining so this might be fine for other patrons but we felt it was inappropriate of our waiter to not at least warn us that the bottle we were ordering was very expensive since we were obviously a young group and had explicitly asked for the cheapest bottle! Maybe we would attend again in a few years when we can afford it lol

At the time that I'm writing this review 04/22, La Brasserie was only opened for 1 month. We dropped in and they gave us the most amazing charcuterie platter and their wines are wonderful. Even their coffee was just amazing . The staff is welcoming and serious about their drinks and their food. Can't wait to come back! We love this place .
Incredible food, excellent service. Upscale without being pretentious. The best meal I've had in a long time.

Really wonderful French restaurant! Had a great menu, even an homage to Anthony Bourdain (used to be chef at previous restaurant at same location). Food was excellent and staff was top notch. Will be back again.

What a disaster. We waited over an hour for our entrees. Service was surly. Steak was cold and stringy. Fries would cold and greasy. Béarnaise was gummy. This is mediocre tourist food hoping to capitalize on Bourdain's good name. Bourdain would be appalled.

Good food, good service but DO NOT GO. They pad the bill charging extra for bottles of wine not ordered. A very perfunctory apology but clearly not at all surprised or upset. If you feel the absolute need to go, PLEASE doublecheck your bill!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

KUUN, you've saved my a** on two Friday nights when I had no reservations, and you made a small corner pocket for me and my spouse. (My bad.) Grant it, the line was crushingly long, and we had to wait for our food. But, hey this is New York City, where don't you have to wait in line? You welcomed me, and at the end of a long week, you did not disappoint - even your cheery waitress lightened my spirits. Here's to your stone bowl Bibimbap, and your fabulous condiments!
No comment

I came here for my birthday and we had a reservation even though it didn't seem too busy and the host had a special table reserved for us with a sign too! They were very welcoming and warm. Our waitress suggested recommendations and we had no idea what was good here so we ended up ordering the BoSsam w/ the Ssam, the JokBal, with a stew. It was enough for the four of us. Our favorite was the BoSsam, the meats were very well cooked and very tender. The sauces that comes with everything were also really good, definitely made in-house. The ingredients all tasted very fresh and good quality. I also had a cocktail since I saw that they had an open bar that looked very inviting haha. I would come here again to try more of their main dishes and try more of their drinks.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Got the kalbi tang for takeout and it came with banchans! Not a fan of the kimchi - it was more pickled / sour than I prefer. The kalbi tang was really good and the meat was really tender
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Stopped by to meet a friend for dinner and had a great time catching up over kimchi stew & soju!  Service was attentive and friendly, they let us stay later than the technical time frame because we kept ordering and it was nearing the end of the night. A great find in downtown BK!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Overpriced and not great quality. I ordered the Honey Pork Belly Jimbap Box. The meat was too sweet for my taste. I wish I would have been warned to eat certain items first, as some of the items like the fried zucchini were quite nasty once they got a bit cold and soggy. My friends were also underwhelmed by their orders, so it's safe to say we won't be coming back.
No comment
No comment
No comment
My first time trying Korean food and it was excellent! Nice atmosphere, delicious food, and interesting drinks and cocktails. Only 4 stars because I wish the bibimbap had more meat in it.

column3: Town of Hempstead, Long Island, NY
column6: Surprised to find a really good Korean food spot in Brooklyn.  There's not as many options on the menu that you might see at larger Korean restaurants but I like that they only serve the essentials for when there is a Korean food craving.  The dukkboki had a good amount of spice and the rice cakes were soft yet chewy. Will definitely be back to try some of the other menu items.
No comment
No comment
This was a cute little spot in downtown Brooklyn. There's a lot of options and all the dishes were pretty good, no stand outs but all the dishes I think are worth it!

Good food. Service was fine when you flagged them down. They were very skimpy on the ssam lettuce. Which is such a crappy thing to do. I take off two stars for that. They're hoping you don't ask for more (I guess???) but you should flag them down and don't worry about asking for more lettuce wraps. They know they're wrong. You're right.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I got the honey glazed pork belly which was tender, juicy, and sweet. It's a really good complement with rice, but feels a little over priced at $30. overall the food i got and friends got were all exceptional, just for a much higher price
No comment
No comment
No comment

Everything was delicious! We got the veggie mandu and sweet & spicy boneless chicken for appetizers, and the JaeYook Bokum and brisket noodle soup for mains. The real standout was the JaeYook Bokum - wow that special Kuun sauce was amazing!! We thought the dining space was cool, nice vibe. Service at the restaurant was a little slow but we didn't care because we were so impressed with the food.
No comment

The interior was nice and spacious, but the music kept abruptly stopping and starting again every other second (as if it was buffering). I ordered the honey pork belly but it was mostly chewy fat. I left still hungry.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I gave this place 4 stars due to the initial service. We were seated & then ignored. No one came to take our orders after they sat us down for a good 15 minutes. We called a male waiter attention & he was attentive to us after that. I'm usually chill but it was off putting sitting there being ignored while others are being serviced. Besides that the food is delicious ‍
No comment

stopped by this place on a whim while walking around Brooklyn bc we were craving Korean food and this place did not disappoint for lunch. everything was presented so beautifully, the sweet and spicy boneless chicken was delicious and you get a lot of it. I got the jipbab box with the honey pork belly box, it really is so much food for one person and I was stuffed, everything was excellent. bf got a pork dish and he said it was very tasty. they have a cool cocktail menu too and we each got one even though it was 12 pm bc it's always happy hour somewhere right?!
No comment

Really good staple to have around the area if you're craving for some Korean food! The chicken wings, the jjampong and the hot stone bibimbap are some of my favorites. I also appreciate their outdoor setup where they've arranged mosquito zappers in the tent! It makes me way feel more at ease whenever I sit outside
No comment
No comment

Hands down some of the best Korean food I've ever had (and I lived in LA for several years). I'm specifically talking about the honey pork oyster saam...it's literally the only thing I order because it's so freaking good and the only place I've ever had a legit version with the marinated oysters and all the fixings. I'm actually salivating right now, it's that good!!
No comment
No comment

Originally tried to check out Atti, but it was packed and they suggested this sister place next door. Glad we did. Solid food. Good service, even though we sat outside (In a heated covid booth). The hot stone bi bim bop was right on, as was the French 75. Wife and son's soups were both hot. And spicy.

I was searching for a good Korean spot in Brooklyn and I'm so glad I found Kuun! The food was delicious and the service was great. I love the interior design as well - very modern and minimalistic. Would definitely come back to try more menu items.
No comment

Kuun was really nice food. Nothing overly fancy but still nice enough. Definitely worth the price. The drinks were really good. Tried a few different drinks and each one was very nice. Not too sweet for sure. The only reason it's not a 5 star is because it took us a while to get service. I'm gonna chuck that off to the fact that most restaurants are understaffed at the moment but definitely a solid 4.5 outside of that. Would be back.

Invited my family over to my apt and ordered catering from here. Every single one of my family member loved the food, they especially enjoyed the honey pork belly. Will definitely get catering from here again next time I am hosting. The restaurant provided napkin, chopsticks and spoons. The serving tongs and scoops were my own. I didn't know rice came with my order, which was a plus. It went well with the two meat dishes. It was five serving of each platter. And I ordered it for 12 people.
Kunn was delicious for most part. We ordered vegetable dumplings, very good, the Pork Jjajangmyan... so good.  The only negative was green tea had a bitter aftertaste‍
too expensive, but yummy! the music was too loud, i found. the service was quick and great.
Kuun was not worth it. The food here is overpriced and did not taste good at all. The modern spin on Korean food unfortunately did not land.
No comment

Hands down one of my favorite restaurants! The interior is designed beautifully and the food is amazing. I have tried several of the drinks and the presentation for them is always pretty. The wings are a perfect appetizer. The kimchi fried rice with bulgogi is everything. I've gotten it both times that I've went to the restaurant. The flavors of the dish are amazing. A decent sized portion that you can take home half for lunch the next day (but it tastes so good that you will most likely finish it in one sitting at the restaurant.) The staff is very pleasant and check on you throughout your dining experience. Highly recommend this place.

Really enjoyed our delivery from Kuun. The bulgogi was flavorful. The consistency of the Jabchae was spot on. Both reheated well as leftovers - however my one complaint is the tiny serving of rice with your order. You'll need 2! The braised potatoes didnt look like the picture, were slightly undercooked and shockingly spicy! I'll order from here again and try other menu items!
The food and the service was good, the cocktails was great, the only problem will be the portion is a bit small for the price they are charging for the food. But overall was good

I've had Kuun a few times now for various cravings: kimbap, yukgaejang, bossam wraps, jjajangmyeon, tangsuyuk - paired with makgeolli (rice wine) and/or soju! The presentation of food is great, although the food itself is a hit or miss and I think the price point is relatively high for what it is. The restaurant is clean and cozy, and packed full when I most recently came in for dinner on a weekday. I'll be coming back for the ambience & convenience!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

If I could give 0 stars it would be more accurate. Came here before a concert and I waited over an hour for food that never came. (Bulgogi stew). Told a waiter I no longer wanted the food and in the end there was no communication and guessing they came out with it anyway since there was a stew in their hand but they didn't even know where to put it and took it back to the kitchen. After asking for the check they still put the stew on my bill and came out to check that there was no stew bowl on my table before taking it off the check. No apologies were given to me and meanwhile tables that were seated well after us were served all their food pretty fast. Was recommended this place by a friend as I was told their food is good. I would avoid this place unless you just have too much time on your hands and want to be forgotten :) I gave the benefit of the doubt at first since they looked pretty busy but these online orders seemed to be coming out pretty fast too so overall a very poor experience.

Recently had dinner here with my family. We ordered a variety of food, such as the dukbokee, fried chicken, and kimchi soup. My personal favorite was the dukbokee :) The kimchi is INCREDIBLE. So good and flavorful. The staff was very kind, and made sure we never ran out of napkins (which we needed constantly). The restaurant has a very nice atmosphere, and the music was nice to listen too.

I was craving traditional Korean food and decided to check out this place by delivery! I ordered jokbal (marinated and boiled pigfeet) and kimbap. Jokbal was very tender yet chewy, did not have the pig smell at all. The portion size was mediocre, maybe good for 1.5 person. You can get side dish + ssam for extra charge (total $40 for jokbal combo), which I though was worth. Kimbap was also tasty! If you are nearby or crave Korean food, I recommend checking this place out

Believe it or not, Koreans do not eat bbq everyday of the week.  Try Kuun to taste delicious Korean food with an attentive wait staff and clean lines atmosphere.   Located in downtown Brooklyn with the feel of a really good neighborhood restaurant, this food will fill your belly with goodness.   I give it a four only because I didn't try the bar, but I did notice a nice selection of Sake and beer.
No comment
Great vibe, and aesthetic. I took my Fiancé and her brother and the meal didn't disappoint. Overall great experience.
Good food and decent service. Has options to eat outdoors and indoors. Rice was slightly undercooked but rest of it (pork, eggs, kimchi etc. ) were pretty well done.

Ordered the hot stone bibimbap with pork. It was deee-licious  The pot was crackling upon arrival, and the egg yolk cooked in all that heat. I love the atmosphere, table setting and banchan (side dishes). The only reason I gave Kuun 4 stars is because kimchi is NOT included with the banchan. I hope Kuun will reconsider adding this as part of the basics, but if not, I'll still come back for the hot stone bibimbap
great korean food that is an accessible location to us. the bulgogi and wings are very good. But delivery was slow.
Waited 20 mins after being seated and no help. Ironic that this place is spelled Kuun.
very delicious food (: very nice spot to hang out and eat with friends! Would definitely come again
Beautiful restaurant! Got the jjajangmyeon and bossam entree. Everything was delicious and I enjoyed the presentation. Overall, was very pleased with the food, experience, and service! Will be back.

Ordered delivery from this place for many times since it opens and through pandemic. We regularly love ordering from them. However, this time is very disappointing, the price of fried chicken is the same and the amount is literally less than half from their typical portion. When we call the restaurant to confirm, the answer we got was "sometimes we get smaller pieces of chicken". I don't think that is an acceptable response. The quantity should be more if the pieces are smaller, not providing only half a portion and charged regular price.
No comment

Wonderful Korean cuisine experience! Amazing food, stellar, attentive and friendly service and tasty cocktails! We ordered Dukbokee, Hot Stone Bibimbap with Bulgogi, KalbiJjim and Kimchi Jeon. All was flavorful and perfectly prepared! Also love the atmosphere. Check this place out you won't be disappointed!
No comment
Loved the food and service!! Everything was so delicious and exceptional!! The noodles were really great and filling and the meat dishes were also flavored so well.
Ordered delivery which was delivered fast, hot, and delicious! Will definitely order again!
No comment
So happy to have a Korean restaurant in the neighborhood. We got the short ribs, seafood pancake, dumplings and bibimbap and everything was so tasty.
Excellent food! I am recommending this Korean barbecue restaurant in heart of Downtown Brooklyn..
Service was great! Food was also delicious as well, would definitely recommend! Love the ambiance too!
The food is amazing. The staff is super friendly. I would keep going back because the ambiance is also great!Bo Ssam BoxBoneless ChickenKimbapJjajiangmyeon
No comment

Get the plum berry mojito!!!!!!!!!! It was so delicious. Best cocktail I've had in awhile. I also enjoyed the Beef Mandu which was also yummy! Only reason this is not a 5 star review is because of service. My friend is allergic to egg. She ordered the Bibimbap which egg is no where listed on the menu. When we received the order we had to send it back because it egg was front in center and broke when we tried to scoop it out. Ever since that moment the waitress seemed not very happy with us even though we had no control over an allergy and the egg wasn't on the menu. It was hard to get a hold of the waitress for the check. I guess she was pretty much done with us since we sent a whole bowl of food back. So overall only downfall of the experience is the menu not listing all the items in the dish that's a common allergy. I still think it's worth visiting this spot and enjoying the food and drinks they have. I ordered a small this time because I had things to do after lunch. Oh! Go here for lunch. It's not busy. It's very chill lunch spot if you're eating with a friend or dining alone. 10/10 would visit again.
Amazing. Food, service, interior, drinks - thumbs up! I love this place! Highly recommend!

I absolutely loved this restaurant! I had dukbokee and the hot stone bibimbap. Service was quick and we got side dishes while waiting for our entrees. The dukbokee was sweet and spicy in the best way possible! It was also very filling and a generous portion of rice cakes and fish cakes. The hot stone bibimbap was also very filling and spicy with the provided sauce! It was also filled with so many well cooked vegetables. I would recommend having the hot stone bibimbap on colder days, because it stayed really warm for a much longer time. Regardless, everything was delicious!!
No comment

Soo good! It's hard to find great tofu soup in Brooklyn. My husband and I would need to travel to flushing whenever my cravings come. We visited KUUN twice this month ordering the honey pork belly and vegetable tofu soup (adjusted the seafood tofu soup upon request). The pork belly was melt in your mouth good and tofu soup was hearty. Also I brought my pup with me both times and they allowed us to sit in their outdoor setup .

3.5 stars but rounding up bc of covid. They have a couple tables available for outdoor dining. The food is decent but the portions are small and the prices are high, even for korean food standards. That said, the kimchi pancake is tasty but was burnt. I had the jajangmyeon which was really good. They top it with cucumbers and a couple slices of pork belly. The husband had the sweet and spicy pork which was also very good but the dish came out a bit cold. Or maybe it got cold quickly because we were outside? Overall, a great spot if you want authentic korean food. I'll be back to try the jokbal and kimchi fried rice!
No comment
Their attention to detail is amazing! Everything tasted so delicious. And the dining area is so well decorated, I love all the plants :)

The place is cute and has room to breath and relax, staff is nice and explains all the items. Check shows what we ordered. The dishes were delicious and there were many little sides to enhance the flavor. What we ordered was enough for 2 hungry people and left overs. Will be back for this soup again.
No comment

So happy we found this lovely Korean restaurant in Brooklyn NY. The food is absolutely delicious and the service was very good and friendly. We are not experts when comes to ordering Korean food and the manager took her time to explain the dishes to us. The quality of the dishes we had were excellent and tasty. I actually like them more than many of the Korean restaurants we tried in Korean Town in Manhattan. Looks like it's going to be my new favorite. Highly recommended!

This is hands down the best Korean restaurant in the downtown Brooklyn area! It's a tad pricier than most Korean restaurants, but the quality is definitely worth it for the price! I've ordered takeout from here twice and the hot stone bibimbap was perfectly cooked and still crispy on the bottom! This restaurant does what most restaurants cannot do for their delivery items- main the taste and texture of it as if you were dining there in person. I definitely recommend their hot stone bibimbap as well as their boneless chicken and soondubu.
Everything was so good! Walked out stuffed happy and comfort fooded!! Esp loved those spicy chicken wangs
Good jjangmyung and solid takeout. Would definitely recommend for a quick bite and affordable food.
No comment

Ordered the jjamppong and the jjajiangmyeon. Both were tasty but I think I preferred the jjamppong. Wasn't too spicy, had lots of seafood, noodles had good texture. Regarding the Jjajiangmyeon-- good flavor, again noodles had nice texture, just wish it had a little more meat. Food was packaged well, no issues with delivery.

Randomly found this place-VERY GOOD! I loved everything I ordered. I got the kimchi fried rice which was very flavorful, the LA Kalbi ribs combo which was also perfect flavoring, and kimbap. Kimbap was a bit higher priced than expected. Overall a pleasant experience.
No comment

I ordered Pork Jjajangmyun  and was very disappointed.  I could tell the sauce was made  from scratch (or used a soy jar sauce with fresh ingredient)   however, the sauce was too sweet. In other words, the cook added too much sugar.  This dish should not be improvised to please westerns pallet.
No comment

This place is about 2 miles from me and i have only discovered it today and ordered delivery from them. I got hot stone bibimbap and it came really hot and delicious with the sauce. I'm not too good with spicy but the sauce was just right. The rice was somewhat burnt so it was perfect (despite not in a hot stone bowl). Even delivery, they manage to package everything very presentable. Flavorful. Kimchi fried rice with bulgogi and egg was also very good. The Kuun Wings are good but not memorable. Overall, the items i ordered were all yummy, so i look forward to returning. Even for outdoor dining one day. Other reviewers had some delicious looking photos so i cannot wait to try them out in the future
I've only ordered take out so can't speak to the dining experience.  The food was high quality Korean BBQ and enjoyed it a lot. Glad it is open since Korilla in metro tech closed.
No comment

I am so happy this place exists. First of all, it is very aesthetically pleasing and CLEAN. Talk about details - glasses down, utensils wrapped, masks on. This was my first time eating out in over a year and I had no qualms about it once we arrived. Second of all, the food is 100! I have never seen kimbap on a restaurant menu before (kimbap is usually best made fresh at home) and was really excited to try it - I was not disappointed. Fresh rice, clean taste - I only managed to grab one before the rest of my family ate them up (cue waitress shaking her head since she suggested we order 2). I won't bore you, but all the other dishes were also on point - definitely in my top 5 list of best restaurant bulgogi i've ever eaten. I highly recommend you get one of their non-alcoholic drinks - I ordered a sparkling ginger lemonade and everyone at the table quickly followed suit. Overall, great meal, great experience, FANTASTIC service, and will definitely eat here again.

Just fantastic, all around. We've ordered in a truly embarrassing amount of Korean food throughout the pandemic, and Kuun is far and away the best. Their fun selection of banchan and kimchi is what initially drew us, and they didn't disappoint! We are especially addicted to the yukgaejang, which is perfectly spicy and filled with tender beef and a variety of vegetables; and the kimchi jeon with just the right amount of slightly charred depth. The tteok are always just the right texture whether they're on skewers and in tteokbokki -- never soggy! The kimchi fried rice is solid even on the second day, and the japchae is the definition of *yummy.* I realize I'm now basically going through the entire menu, so I'm going to stop... and see if they're open right now for dinner.
No comment

No comment

Wow just wow this dish is $16 for very small portion. My friends got me the bibimpap and I thought it was only $10 but everyone can make it for like $5. Just go to ur local grocery store. Waste of money in my opinion.
No comment

This spot is FANTASTIC. They have a nice outdoor seating area that is well spaced out so we felt extremely comfortable. The food really hit the spot, everything was 5 star delicious.  We got the Kalbi Bo Sam Box ($25) and the Pork JjaJangMyun ($16). The Kalbi was hearty and yummy, grilled well, and the jjajangmyun was savory, the noodles were perfectly springy and topped with a generous serving of the sauce (loaded with onions, veggies, and pork bits). The box came with side dishes including a marinated fresh oysters, and your general meal comes with banchan as well (small plates but refillable!). I do wish it was slightttyyy cheaper or have lunch specials esp considering the other options in the area, but regardless, HIGHLY recommend this place. I will be back.
Kuun is hands down the best quality food in the area. Especially if you like Korean. They sometimes overcook the meat so I always make sure to ask for 'medium' and they are good at adjusting.
No comment

Ordered kuun on seamless! I got the sweet & spicy wings, dukbokee, and the seafood jjambbong. The wings were super crispy and held up despite delivery! The jjambbong was also amazing and had a huge portion of noodles and seafood. The only thing i was slightly disappointed by was the dukbokee - it was a little too sweet for my taste.
This Korean restaurant near our accommodation at Sheraton Hotel Brooklyn New York is a hidden gem!  The kimchi fried rice and seafood soup are the best among all I have tried.  Highly recommend!!

Really cute and relaxing atmosphere to eat here. The food is decent quality - the bibimbap and the jjampong were both quite good. The jajangmyeon's flavor is a bit bland.  Maybe not as top notch flavor as some restaurants in Korea town but definitely still very decent food.
good quality and quantity, despite the price increase due to inflation
Love the soup and japchae here! Less a fan of the wings. But it's very good Korean food in the area! Will order regularly for Korean food cravings!
No comment

"Mmmm!" "Ahhhhh, OMG!" These were the sounds of dinner tonight as we gobbled up our take-out meal from Kuun. This is exactly the restaurant we've been hoping for, for many years: delicious Korean food, large portions, right in our neighborhood (and open practically all day too). We had the kimbap, japchae, kimchi pancakes, kimchi fried rice, and fried tofu bimbimbap - all made vegetarian and insanely flavorful. Hands down just as good as anything we've gotten in K-Town in Manhattan, and I couldn't be happier that they are within walking distance to us. We will be back... maybe even later this week :-)
Just went here for lunch. Our waitress was extremely helpful explaining the dishes. Loved the little appetizer minced fish. A pleasant surprise for a new food to try
I ordered dinner from Kuun.  It arrived on time and was delicious.  The portions were so generous that I had another meal from this one delivery.  I will definitely order again.

Kuun is a Korean restaurant on Livingston Street, Downtown Brooklyn.  The outdoor seating is super cute and with tables spaced more than 6 feet away. This made me feel more comfortable dining outdoors during this crazy pandemic period. You will be served water and complimentary pickled vegetables shortly after getting seated. Our server was always appropriately masked, very polite, helpful and even gave my pup a refreshing bowl of water .  I had the pork Jjajangmyun (noodles with perfect texture and firmness!) and excellent savory soybean sauce - not spicy at all and generously portioned too (I had more than my fill and then some to bring home). My husband loved the (very) spicy seafood Jjambbong (ramen). In summary: Great food, great service, and great outdoor seating!
Fast delivery and delicious food - and so much of it! I am a sucker for banchan, will definitely be ordering from here again

Ever since moving to Brooklyn, we've been trying to find a place that resembles the food we'd get in Manhattans Ktown.  Safe to say we've found it!  We got the Jokbal, Kimchi Pancake and Squid Bibimbap and it didn't disappoint!  Felt like we were back on a random third floor in Ktown.

Ordered delivery for lunch and was pleasantly surprised by how delicious everything was. We ordered seafood soon du bu, jap chae, bulgogi kimbap and jajangmyeon.  Probably way too much food for 2 people.  Meal comes with ban chan which we really appreciated.  Some of the other Korean spots around here charge you for ban chan!  Looking forward to dining in sometime in the future!
My son and I were just looking somewhere close to eat and stumbled across Kuun. Short and sweet menu. We loved it.

Made reservations for 5 PM before a Nets game and was immediately seated outside, as requested. There were multiple electric heaters to keep us warm. Our waiters were attentive and courteous. Food arrived very quickly after we placed our order and everything was delicious. Highly recommend for a quick bit before any events at the Barclays Center

Best authentic Korean food in Brooklyn. When I had the grilled mackerel I felt like I was in Korea. I can see that they used fresh and good ingredients. I really liked the $10 banchan set too. Whenever I'm craving for good Korean food, I will order from this place again!
Holy smokes: this place is AMAZING. We ordered a meal for the family on New Year's Eve and it was  incredible - fantastic Galbi and one of the best scallion pancakes I've ever had. Run don't walk.
This is probably my best Korean restaurant in downtown Brooklyn. Strongly recommend Pork Jjajang Myun and chicken wings. They do have outdoor seating btw.
No comment

I invited my book club to eat here after we finished reading Crying in H Mart and everyone loved it. I previously ordered the pork belly from here for takeout but decided to get something different this time. I ordered the Chicken Kalguksu which was SO good-- Korean noodles are underrated! I know everyone else liked their dishes and drinks. Amazing service as well.

Wow!  All the dishes tasted great.   The service was excellent - they were very attentive.  We ate outside and the area had several outdoor heaters which really made it pleasant.  Best food during our four day stay in Brooklyn.  Just a 7 min walk from the Sheraton.  The Jabchae with glass noodles tasted great along with the dumpling soup and Don Katsu.
No comment
Place is dope with great variety and high quality food. Has all the dishes you'd expect and portions are solid. Glad to have another great Korean option nearby!
I love this Korean restaurant! Their dishes are so good and well packaging we you order a delivery!
No comment

This is a great addition to Downtown Brooklyn.  I've tried several menu items (pork belly, fried pork, Zhajiangmian were exceptional) and they are all very tasty.  The food is a bit pricier compared to similar establishments but it is money well spent.  Generous portions and solid service.

Been meaning to try this place so decided to order delivery the other night. We got the chicken kalguksu and galbitang. Both were pretty decent, no complaints there. The only bad thing was the atrocious banchan (side dishes) we got. Gave us a good laugh -- two slices of cucumber, two pieces of broccoli and a "coleslaw" which really consisted of several pieces of shredded cabbage sitting in a soup of mayonnaise (as pictured). Wasn't even enough for two people. Docking a star for that reason. Hopefully it was just an off day for them.

We were waiting for a table outside and they cleaned it well for us. But they decided to seat the white people (who came after us) at the table they prepped for us instead. So we just left. The food is good though as I've had it before.

Ordered this for takeout recently and honestly wow! I really enjoyed the fresh greens, pickled condiments and pork belly in the bo ssam box--everything was so fresh and clean tasting. Item was slightly on the pricier side but you get what you pay for--phenomenal quality!

I keep this a 3 1/2 stars I don't know what happened from Friday to Saturday but the chicken wings sweet and spicy it was a big change from Friday  I order the sweet-and-spicy chicken my brother the rice I found the chicken did have the spicy or sweet taste it was overly better with the chicken look humongous I ordered the dumplings the pretty good I don't care for the sauce they came with it that'swasnt  spicy enough surprising taste when I go there again I don't know I don't know if they Changed cooks or what rush so fast to get the food out they making it not like the First time I eat it

The food and the service were both really good but the place has an infestation of fruit flies. I killed two before I even sat down. It was constant and really spoiled what would have otherwise been a very nice meal.  Had the JeYook and hot stone pot Bibimbap both were very good.

YES. Brooklyn desperately needed an authentic Korean restaurant, and this is it. Not only do they have a huge variety of options but they don't skimp out on portions. There's even Chinese-Korean options! I've missed jjangjjangmyeon so much, and up until now the only place I could get that dish was commuting all the way to Flushing. I can't speak for what their restaurant looks like because of coronavirus, but delivery has been exceptional. They packaged everything so carefully and I really appreciate their consideration.
No comment
The outdoor dining was very loud due to the traffic and dishes that are usually complementary at other Korean restaurants had to be ordered for additional cost.  Generally too pricy.

I am so excited I don't have to go to Queens for certain Chinese/Korean dishes!  There's Noodles in Black Bean sauce JjaJangMyun and Sweet and Sour Pork TangSooYuk available.... we ordered the Jjajangmyun, Chicken KalGukSoo and the YookGaeJang... Excellent quality of food and ingredients.  Maybe a little gentle on the garlic but everything was very balanced and tasty!  Excited for the neighborhood to have this treat!

This part of downtown Brooklyn has little to no good food options. Kuun is an excellent addition to the area with a great variety of Korean dishes. I ordered takeout from here and was thoroughly impressed with the quality and service. I had to wait a little for my takeout order so they gave me some free foods, including LA Kalbi BBQ, which was unreal.

Good god! It has arrived! Tasty, fresh, authentic, real deal korean comfort food in Brooklyn. This is a delivery order only but they nailed it! Jajjangmyeon was the vest I've had in New York. Rich flavorful sauce with tender pork! The chicken wings were meaty and moist with a ton of flavor. Yookejang was solid. Even the ban Chan was nice although would have liked more. It's a little pricey but you are paying for quality. I will be back for more!

It's pricey but it's probably the only place in downtown Brooklyn that makes korean food that tastes as it should. The soups and all the entrees are exactly how a Korean mom would make it for her babies. After a long day, sometimes I just want food that tastes like a hug without me having to go out of my way to make it.. that's when I order Kuun's jjambbong or kimchi jjigae.. and the day will be made instantly better. Thanks Kuun!
Jajangmyun is the best I've had in the neighborhood! Authentic and love that the sauce doesn't have the over sweetened taste.  Love the boneless fried chicken as well.

Great Korean restaurant! We usually eat tofu soup at Korean restaurant but the visit to this place is surprisingly good! We ordered dumpling soup and it was delicious. Other dishes are good too. The spicy Korean source are excellent. Definitely gonna come back and try other dishes.
Everything was good. This my second time ordering, but the only food that I had a problem was the seasoned oyster it was too fishy and it made me have a stomach virus.
No comment
No comment
The little patio outside is wonderful with great heaters and nice tables. The staff is kind. The food is AMAZING!  Come!

This review is for delivery. Overall the food was excellent and definitely some of the best Korean delivery I have had during the pandemic. The sweet and spicy chicken wings are the bomb. Order a side of green cabbage kimchi, pull of some chicken from the wings and wrap it in the kimchi(you can thank me later). They were almost as good the second day reheated in the oven. The jabchae was also pretty stellar, not too sweet and held up very well as leftovers the next day. Vegtable Mandu also very good, these did not travel as well as other things. The seafood PaJeon is just one of my favorite things to eat and they did an excellent job. These are tricky dishes to get as delivery but they pulled it off. Now the BiBimbap was executed perfectly considering there is no stone pot. They managed to get the rice crispy for delivery and I am still trying to figure out how they did that. The one thing they did forget was the Gochujang sauce which would have been very disappointing if I did not have a tub in my refrigerator so that is one reason for not giving them five stars. The other reason was the sauteed black beens were under cooked and way too sweet and no sesame seeds. With the exception of these small mishaps the food was excellent. I highly recommend ordering delivery and I can't wait to try other things on the menu.

Interior is beautiful. Food is pretty good. Unfortunately, service is stank. Waitresses are not attentive nor do they have a good welcoming energy. I did not enjoy my experience here and I will not be back.

I ordered delivery from them tonight and am so glad I did! I am a Korean food addict, and have had a hard time finding Korean restaurants I like in my part of Brooklyn. The seafood pajeon was flavorful and fresh. The meat in the bulgogi ssam box was nicely prepared, and it came with lots of tasty accompaniments, including pickled vegetables and doenjang (fermented soy bean paste), plus the lettuce and perilla leaves for wrapping. I also got sautéed black beans and 2 kinds of kimchi--cabbage and radish--and all were excellent. I will definitely be ordering from them again. I hope they're able to stay afloat during the pandemic--I can't wait until I can finally visit in person!

Ordered delivery from here on a whim and was so pleasantly surprised! Amazing food and amazing flavors. Definitely the best Korean food in Brooklyn. So excited to try it again and taste the rest of the items on the menu. The Japchae and the rice cakes were two favorites! Excellent variety of banchan and kimchis!!
Excellent small bites and kimchi.  Great for delivery.  Kuun has been my Covid saving grace.
Not your run of the mill Korean restaurant. Exceptional quality and selections on their menu. Food delivered hot and fresh always.

Solid Korean food: authentic, quality ingredients, good packaging. Everything tasted like it should -- didn't feel like they were trying to skimp on things to shave costs or satisfy American palates. So glad Downtown BK finally has real Korean food!!

This has been a go-to Korean food delivery since COVID. Consistently good food, they prepare it fast and package well. Excellent choice!! Hot stone bibimbap with bulgogi is a particular favorite - definitely recommend.
The meals are always delicious and I sincerely admire and appreciate the tiny sides they put in each order!

I don't usually write reviews but this place was amazing. From the first bite, you could tell that everything would be good. We got the kimchee fried rice, crispy wings, kimbap, and seafood jjambong. Everything was amazing, but the seafood jjambong was the star. The broth was beautiful and you could tell the depth of flavor was fantastic.
Ordered delivery from Kuun. Everything we got was delicious and well prepared. We particularly liked the japchae. No complaints about the packaging or the delivery time. An excellent experience.

Best bib bim bab I have had in NYC! I ordered on DoorDash and once the fees were added it was about $18, but the portion was HUGE! I couldn't believe how many fresh veggies were in my bowl, it was really enough for 2 but it was so good that I finished it. Sauce was spicy and sweet (and generous portion again) and the bulgolgi was delicious. Can't wait to try their other meals, so excited for more great quality Korean! I've found other Korean places around BK to feel more "junky"/unhealthy, this felt fresh, authentic and delicious.

Love there is another Korean option in the area now! Ordered the jjajangmyun and sweet & spicy wings after a long day. The wings were delicious, had them with a side of the white radish banchan.  The jjajangmyun hit the spot, comparable if not better to what I've had in k-town.
By far the best korean i have had in this part of brooklyn. Jajangmyun, bulgogi and cucumber kimchi were all solid.

Food was amazing! Highly recommend the caico e pepe rice cakes, spicy rice cakes, pork belly buns, and caoullote sizzling steak! For drinks the stay good was a 10/10 the surfer Rosa was okay but gave a bit of a spicy kick towards the end which I didn't think agreed with the menu options I had ordered. Atmosphere: cute trendy and intimate place. Indoor bar seating with a few tables and outside they have a plexiglass enclosure with heated lamps to keep guest comfortable in the winter months. Very friendly and respectful wait staff. Impeccable restrooms. Most of you can't beat the views across the water.

I have mixed feelings about this new iteration of Momofuku Ssam Bar. I was a big fan of the old location and appreciated how intimate it was and how it reflected the David Chang swagger of the other earlier Momofuku restaurants. That vibe is nowhere to be found in the new location. It feels like an overpriced tourist trap geared toward people who have a lot of money to spend, want to dabble in some gateway Korean food (and/or perhaps are not comfortable with venturing to K-town), and want to see and be seen. It looks like it was designed for social media posts. That being said, the food was decent. Our group participated in the full Ssam tasting menu and liked all of the dishes. Nothing was exceptionally memorable for me other than the salad (randomly). All of the dishes were very "safe" and not terribly exciting, but they were well executed. The service was good until the end, when we were asked to leave because they had to "free up the table," even though all of the large tables around us were unoccupied. One other observation that I found to be somewhat interesting (as an Asian) was that I didn't see any Asians among the many staff members who were working there the night we went. I find that unusual for  an Asian restaurant, but perhaps this just happened to be case the night we went. Ultimately, I doubt I will return to Ssam because it just feels like a "new Coke" version of the old location, but I do think the overall experience would be enjoyable for most people.

They were all so drool worthy, really go there. I only got one picture because well it was all too good to take pictures of.

Been to every David Chang's places including MOMOFUKU Ko l, however this is the worst of his poor establishments. Ambiance was awkward. Serving staffs were so out all over the place. Menu itself is obnoxiously off balanced. Ssam Set ($105 per person) was terrible. Just couldn't wait to get out of there. Heavily salted and impossible to identify unpleasantly stimulating spices in all the dishes. Oysters were not fresh so we left 4 pieces out of 6 untouched. Striped Bass Tartare was basically cooked by hot weather temperature that tasted like wood. Prawns were uncooked. Short ribs, pork shoulder, pork belly were all over seasoned and the servers who grilled the meats for our table didn't even ask how we wanted our meats to be cooked. Drink menu was not making sense at all. Canned Korean rice wine and canned Korean flavored hard seltzer...? What a conspiracy. Hard to get servers' attention although they have tons of people on the floor. Please stop using Korean culinary terms in your menu and making your staffs to say them incorrectly. It's an insult to Korean heritage. My Thursday dinner got wasted down the drain.

Incredible food! We got the margarita, the ribs, shrimp, cacio e pepe rice cakes, and the fish. All of it was incredible!!

Came here to celebrate my boyfriend's birthday last night. We didn't have a reservation (Thursday) so they put us on the wait list. We waited for an hour- nothing. Turns out that they had written the number down wrong and given the table to someone else. The manager was super apologetic and sat us almost immediately after that- literally as soon as another couple left and the table was cleared. We had the ribs, the American ham & baguette, white kimchi, and the steak. Let me tell you the sweet & sour ribs were the star of the show. Melt in your mouth juicy and seasoned to perfection. I would get a double order as my meal next time lol. Our server was super knowledgeable and attentive as well. Finally, I had to try the PB&J cocktail. I was skeptical but it really tasted like PB&J! It was actually so good. Highly recommend this restaurant even after the little fiasco with seating and be sure to book a reservation- half of that was our fault

Have to admit that I came with very high expectations, having been a long-time listener + viewer of Chang and fan of Chef Eunjo Park. To begin with, the Freisling was fantastic - ice cold till the very end with a delightful lychee flavor. The Hanami highball on the other hand was good but much more subtle than I expected. We had the popcorn shrimp to start and it was very good - a shrimp version of Korean sweet and sour fried chicken, with lettuce wraps and pickled daikon to balance out the grease. Delicious and fun to eat.  For the second course, we had raw scallops. It was a bit of a letdown to find out that they changed the kimbap dishes I've been eyeing to just crudo... Of course, it was a mistake on my part to make the assumption but really hope they keep carrying the kimbap :') And if they do I'll definitely come back for that. Finally, the steak ssam was fantastic - sizzling hot, perfectly cooked, with plenty of veggies and lettuce wraps to eat with.

What an amazing experience! The ambiance was great. It was a bit windy when we arrived. They lowered the windows/doors to make it more enjoyable. Our waitress, Clara, was very friendly and informative. Any questions we had were answered with confidence. The food was amazing! If you live in the area; GO. Ask for Clara.

Long time fan and patron of Momofuku restaurants including Noodle Bar, Ssam Bar, Booker and Dax, Nishi and Ko (my 40th birthday, a breathtakingly beautiful and moving experience). Painful and bizarre experience this evening in the Seaport. Arrived early to our dinner reservation at the bar. Waited a while for someone to offer us a drink but eventually bartender did so, and we ordered, happy and excited to eat at a restaurant we've missed in the pandemic, and had never eaten at since its move from the EV. Had the wine list and menus in front of us as we began to cheers our first cocktail and look at the menus. A person--server, manager?--came around to our bar seats in a nearly empty restaurant (there was only one other person there), reached over me and plucked away the wine list. I said in a friendly way: "I was planning on looking at the wine list for dinner." The person looked at me with deadlights, coldly saying: "Should I bring it back or were you planning on holding it for the duration?" with an edge. I looked around in confusion. "Do you need it right now?" Again, deadlights. As if I were holding open the train doors during rush hour preventing the world from moving. She said fine, keep it and brusquely left. Her attitude was the opposite of hospitable. It was provocative, and scornful and ad hominem. It's hard to convey the strangeness and the low grade contempt/rage of the person talking to us in this review. Who cares about the wine list? Not me! Certainly was happy to relinquish it if someone else needed it! But there was no one there in the restaurant besides us and this person's attitude was nothing but disagreeable bordering on hateful. My partner and I looked at each other in bewilderment. We debated what to do and agreed we had no desire to stay for a meal after such a strange and odious interaction. I paid the check for two cocktails and we left, abandoning a dinner we had been looking forward to for a week. I explained to the hostess the reason we were leaving on the way out. She seemed to intuit why we were leaving but didn't apologize, only said she hoped we found a place to eat that we liked, as if we were hard to please, entitled guests. Hard to imagine ever wanting to go back.

OMG, Momofuku Ssam Bar was definitely impressive. The atmosphere and staff are phenomenal. Every single thing that we ordered was incredibly fresh and delicious. The crew was really welcoming and service is perfect. Momofuku Ssam Bar...Check it out I say.
Saam Bar is one of NYC's great restaurants and I'm so excited for its new life in South Street Seaport.
Very disappointing experience at this restaurant. I would say just don't here so many restaurants in NYC don't waste your time going to this one unless you want to leave disappointe.
Popcorn shrimp was fantastic, a bit expensive but that's a given for the area. Great service and clean.

The relocated version of ssam bar is a shadow of its old self. It used to be one of the most creative restaurants in the city. It's all 'just okay' and doesn't do justice to the Momofuku brand. The mall-like environment in the new location also doesn't help.

Chef Jo is back!! Kawi was one of my fave spots in NYC but the location was dark and far. Well now it couldn't be brighter and closer to us in Brooklyn. Relaxed but attentive service. Lacking the pretense of other restaurants of this caliber but still you can tell the team was well trained. The salmon kimbap is a dream - especially as a NY Jew who loves a good bagel and lox. The sausage rice cake was one of the best dishes I've had in a very very long time. For the non-pork eaters, well and even if you are, the cacio is also crazy good. Shaved truffles on top?  Yes pls. And the namesake ssams- pork belly is to die for. Omg the ribs and the wings too!!  Can't wait to go back when it gets warmer and the glass garage door things are wide open. OHHH and the cocktails are awesome!!  Lightseed Champion is a star even tho I don't like rye. And the spicy Korean margarita is delish. And the wine list is stellar. Ok. Rant over. I love it. And I can't wait to come back.

I was a loyal customer at the now closed East Village Saam Bar.  I ate there at least 20 times.  The new version, now at South Street Seaport (the anti-East Village), is a deep disappointment. It has none of the energy or ambiance of the original. It's severely corporate (although the views from the outdoor seating are indeed fabulous), large screen TV's on the walls, & wildly overpriced; the small portions are barely share-able, and the service was lousy (we ordered one cocktail which was served after most of the appetizers had arrived and the waitperson had to be reminded, & one appetizer arrived after the main courses were served, again, after a reminder). The food itself was very good, but the menu is smaller and the variety was limited. Many of the menu items that brought us to the old location were gone and they refused to make anything that was not on the menu (which they would cheerfully do at the old spot).  Did I mention it was overpriced?  I would not go back.  David Chang lost a loyal Saam Bar customer with his move out of the East Village.

This place is so freaking cute I absolutely loved it! The space is so well planned with the pasta bar in the middle and the seats around over looking all the chefs. Make sure to get a seat at the bar for a real show! We ordered the egg yolk ravioli, the vegan mafalda, and the fig salad and a glass of Gavi. They gave us some bread and olive oil and the oil was sooo delicious you can tell they care about quality. The raviolo was the star of the show I will come back strictly for this!! So so so delicious. The egg yolk was perfectly runny and the truffle was a perfect addition. Perfectly balanced, not heavy as you'd expect and it seems like a small portion but it's perfectly satisfying. The fig salad was delicious but I'd next time request without the dressing and add something a little acidic like a vinegar instead I think that was missing. The Mafalda felt like a minestrone soup sauce it was good but not my favorite. Still, I'd come back and try other dishes and or course get the raviolo again. Perfection!

Would give this joke of an establishment 0 stars if I could. Management and upper management are absolutely horrible. The food took forever, but they did apologize and give us a free tiramisu. We ordered the three vegetarian pasta options they have and all three were very flavorful and unique!

For my friend's birthday, we made a reservation for two at A Pasta Bar in their covered outdoor seating at 6:30 pm on a Saturday evening. The QR code menu was extremely helpful as each menu item was accompanied by a photo. For drinks, I ordered the Casual Affair and my friend got the Aperitif. I admit that the photos are slightly misleading as the drinks did not come with a straw, the watermelon slice in the Casual Affair was within the drink instead of on the rim, and the glass that the Aperitif came in was interestingly tall and skinny. I could definitely taste the vodka in my drink, but I felt that there was a nice balance of fruitiness with the alcohol. We were provided with three slices of free bread with olive oil, but the bread was a bit difficult to eat and was not warm. For entrees, my friend got the Chiocciole Al Ragu and I chose the Caramelle based on the interesting picture on the menu. I was extremely satisfied with the Caramelle. I was previously unfamiliar with Caramelle pasta, but it's essentially pasta in the shape of a piece of candy enclosing a filling inside. In this case, the filling was a mixture of zucchini, mint, and ricotta. I particularly enjoyed how the mint cut through the taste of the pasta, as it provided a refreshing different level to the taste. The mint pesto and burrata mousse not only made the dish look more creative, but were also delicious to dip the pasta in. The crushed pistachio served as a nice variety in texture and I liked the crunch that it had when eaten with the pasta. Overall, I genuinely enjoyed my experience at A Pasta Bar ⁠-- the service was great, the outdoor seating was pleasant, and the meal was superb. The meal was on the pricier end with most of the entrees costing ~$30, which is a bit much for the portions, but at least for my dish, I would say that it was worth it.

The service was amazing. They were very welcoming. One point the manager came and presented himself during the changing from apps to entree. The food was great. I don't live in New York but I wish there was like an Uber eats that would fly me the meal cause I would order this everyday to eat it LOL. The pasta was so fresh, the sauce was great. I'm 180 pound male saying that, so if you're above 180 don't show up hungry, if you come here the portions are smalls and the options aren't limited.
