Random date night with pasta cravings. Safe to say this place hit the spot. Quick service & polite hosts. My suggestion if you go here is to get the pasta tasting. If not then my favorite out of the bunch was the cheese fondue pasta...it was love at first bite haha.

I was worried this place would be too touristy and not that great but I was actually pleasantly surprised with the food and drinks. To drink I got Viva Vida (Tequila, mescaline, Jalepeño, infused green chartreuse, lime juice and cucumber) which was delicious and refreshing. For an app we ordered Proscitto (aged 24 months from Langhorne, Buffalo Ricotta with pistachio pesto, and foccacia bread). It was delicious! The ricotta was so smooth and creamy that I could have had a whole entree of just that and bread! Next for dinner we ordered the Tagliatella Al Tartufo Nero (Parmesan Cheese Fondue & Shaved Summer Black Truffle) and the Caramelle (Zucchini, Ricotta & Mint Stuffed Caramelle, Mint Pesto, Burrata Mousse & Pistacchio). The caramelle was amazingly delicious, one of the best pasta meals I've ever had. Im still dreaming of it so ill definitely be back.

I almost don't want to post this review to keep it a secret! So incredibly delicious - it might be the best pasta I've had in nyc. Then go back - again and again! I am.

I've been coming to this place for few years now and the food and service have been constantly great. The atmosphere is very hip with great music and terrific drinks! Also had my birthday there and I felt loved, welcomed and taken care of.

Came here on a whim for dinner with a few friends - did not regret it! The staff were super friendly, seating me early since i arrived before my friends did. Amazing ambiance - felt hip and was packed. The food was really good. I think Italian food is tricky to do really well and these guys nailed it. Their outdoor seating also looked really cute too :)
No comment

Stopped in for a quick bite. The sanitation isn't great flies and bathroom dirty! But the staff and food is incredible. Got the cucumber salad - clean and good. The truffle ravioli pasta was small but incredibly flavorful. Will be back to try more pasta dishes as that was amazing!

This place is cool. I appreciate an open kitchen environment. It's more personal, lol. A friend and I stumbled across this place bc we were in the area shopping. We were seated at the bar, which is a pasta bar. Your chefs are front and center preparing all the dishes. The menu isn't too intense, there is a little something for everyone on there. A few salads and shareable small plates. A good option of different pasta dishes. Dessert is available too. Everything is well crafted , especially with presentation. I ended up going with the tagliatella tartufo al nero, parmesan cheese fondue, and shaved summer black truffle. I enjoyed it. I def want to try the 24k gold spaghetti. Drinks were ok. Presentation was on point! Service was pleasant. Try it out.

A pasta bar was such a yummy experience!! I came here with my fiancé on a double date and the food was amazing. They brought bread to the table to start and for appetizers we ordered their burrata e prugna and were recommended their assortment of in house smoked lox with two types of spreads. Both were delicious and did not disappoint! for main, I ordered the Tagliatella al Tartufo Nero and my fiancé ordered the Tonnarelli Cacio e Pepe. They were very rich in flavor. By the end we had to get dessert so we tried their delicious tiramisu.  I genuinely had a great time. Loved the atmosphere and the music. However, if you're on a date keep in mind that the music may be a little too loud to hear each other.

Dined in a private villa with three others and sat comfortably. Decor in and outside the villa is super cute. There's also a speaker inside so you can listen to music during dinner as well as heater lamps to keep you warm! We sat comfortably inside even though it was raining at the time. The server we had (unfortunately didn't catch his name) was great! For 4 people we ordered 2 appetizers, pasta testing, and an order the ragu which we felt was enough. Favorite of the night was the chicken croquette and truffle pasta! All pasta was cooked to the perfect texture and tasted so fresh.
I'm not a big Italian or pasta person. But this place was next to my hotel so I gave it a try one night. It was absolutely delicious. I ordered the Alfredo with truffle . Highly recommended.

Like the phoenix, Sola Pasta Bar has soared from the pandemic ashes. A once small restaurant has now taken over the surrounding sidewalks and streets at the corner of West Broadway and Grand in the heart of trendy Soho. This place is happening like never before and it is awesome to see. New York City is back and terrific eateries like Sola Pasta Bar are leading the way. The cocktails are amazing and creative too.
I'm a little obsessed with this restaurant. We came with a party of 6 for a celebration and everyone was so happy with their meal. The apps were great def get the cheese board.

Very delicious and innovative pasta place! The raviolo was extremely good, with black truffle on top, egg yolk in the middle, and when you cut the raviolo the egg yolk just flowed out. The fig salad had a very balanced taste, a bit of sweet from the fig, salty from the prosciutto, and sour from the yogurt sauce. The bubble outdoor seating was well decorated. Servers were very helpful as well.

One of the first restaurants I tried out as NYC slowly reopened and I am so glad I chose this spot! If you love pasta, you need to come here. The flavors are amazing and the pasta is cooked to perfection! They have a lot of outdoor seating- super cute set up too. They take reservations- which is a huge plus and it will let you skip out on wait time- and you can pick outdoor or indoor seating when yoh book your reservations. Staff were all super friendly, incredibly helpful and accommodating. I will definitely be coming back here in the future. I went with their Tonarelli Cacio E Pepe and I am drooling just thinking about that perfectly creamy sauce  Highlt recommend checking out this spot!

Was not impressed by the dishes nor the flavor. It was also expensive and lacked the expected quality. The service and expected time for pasta was not where it should have been. Sadly don't think I will go back.
Omg Pierro our waiter was the cutest and the service was great. We had drinks outside it's a really cute spot

It is too bad the food was not as amazing as the service. Larger wine list and beer list needed. Super location and interesting pasta. Hard to compete w Littlr Italy down the street BUT A for effort w getting our large party in and literally the best service on our trip. The food just was good but not amazing
No comment

Located right next to the Soho Grand Hotel, A Pasta Bar is an innovative and funky Italian restaurant specializing in unique pasta dishes. To start, we shared the burrata with figs and the prosciutto - both were phenomenal and extremely filling. For my entree, I got the Chiocciole Ragu, which is basically rigatoni with meat sauce. It was extremely decadent and the pasta was cooked perfectly al dente. This is definitely a place that deserves a second visit.

My Partner placed a reservation here on a quiet Tuesday afternoon right when they open at 5. Being seated and getting a feel of the place it felt very intimate and low key probably because it wasn't as busy as other times, which I'm sure its very lively when its a busier primetime! The Server we had was very helpful with the menu very sweet and helped in any way he could! The food was amazing! The Appetizer we got was the Prosciutto and WOW it was very Savory and not too Salty, the Ricotta Spread they give you with it is the perfect touch and contrast to the Flavor of the Prosciutto as well! Now for my Entree all I can say is a Chefs Kiss because I have not had a Pasta dish like that in a long time that just felt as Authentic as it gets. The noodles were Al Dente, the Pork and Veal Ragu had so much flavor and any left over i had of the Sauce I spread on some toasted bread to just soak up all that flavor I did not want to waste!! The Presentation was good too! I would love to go back and try more from the Menu for sure! Thanks for the business!

A little pricey but delicious. The staff is friendly and great with recommendations. I recommend the tagliatelle even though it's expensive. I usually feel overwhelmed with pasta but the portion was perfect and lobster was delicious. Finished everything because it was so good.
No comment

This was my first time here and I loved it!! Our waiter was Italian which I always love at an Italian restaurant and the staff was extremely knowledgeable. Service was good and food was better. Pricey but worth it

The best Cacio e Pepe I've ever had....and I'm a traveler!  I'm in Rome every few months for work and I've never tasted anything quite like this..  just pasta perfection if you are a fan of this dish.
No comment
No comment

Holy shit bro. I've never had such good pasta in my LIFEEEEEEE. I didn't even like pasta before I came to this place tbh. Our server was really nice too and took great care of us. The truffle pasta was sooooo good. Everything was so amazing.

I absolutely loved this place. Took a friends for her birthday and she loved it as well. The outdoor tables are surrounded by flowers. Seats are very comfortable and plus size friendly. The food is delicious we had the pasta tasting menu which was a great way to try the different pasta offerings. I would totally go back !
No comment

This place is an absolute vibe. Exceptional pasta and cocktails. Being seated inside offers up a fun experience watching the chefs prepare the food. Outside seating is great too & top-tier for people watching in SoHo.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Came here for the pasta tasting for two and it is around $105 (without tax and tip). It was a fun experience but not worth the price since they give you half portions of each pasta. I recommend just getting their truffle pasta or cacio e pepe pasta instead for a full portion. The pasta tasting has a set menu of 5 and out of those 5 pastas we tried, only two stood out the most. Service was amazing and the restaurant is beautiful, worth checking out this place!
No comment
No comment

Phenomenal experience. I had the cacio e pepe and octopus, Both were delicious. If I had any suggestions it would be to enlarge the olive oil dipping plate and to tell whose Chianti they are pouring. Would any of those stop me from coming back? No

We stopped by for a drinks before our dinner reservation at another restaurant and I gotta say, their drinks were AMAZING and the food presentation looked fantastic!!! This truly made us wanna come back and try this food.
No comment
No comment
Soooo good ! The best outdoor dining in NYC for sure. Had craving for a good Italian food but was hard to find. And wow wow wow!!

Do I feel like I'm in Europe? YES. Does it taste like Europe? NO. Well, first of all, who's making these prices? I understand NYC prices but this was a BIT excessive if I may add. Pasta was great? It was good but not to die for. The music was pumping and the aperol spritz was great. I guess a cool place to impress your date, but get ready to spend $150+ on dinner with a couple drinks. If you have the money, go for it
No comment

This experience was horrific. Pasta was tasty. However, we weee seated an hour late because the lovely hostess accidentally cancelled our reservation. To make up for this they told us they would cover our first round of drinks. We confirmed this with them THREE TIMES. After being seated one hour later and eating our meal (which also was not served on time) we received the bill and we're charged for that first round of drinks. We were told by DOMINIC that the round would not be covered, even though we had confirmed three times with him personally before we ordered. He blamed his hostesses and was extremely disrespectful to all of the lovely employees that helped us tonight. This place is a scam and will literally never return and will tell everyone we know not to come here due to Dominic himself. 0/10.
The review is mainly for the service staff who kept asking me every 25 seconds if I was done with my food. I was annoyed. Please leave me alone.

Great hospitality by all the staff is the first thing that comes to mind. The ambiance is hip and trendy. We had the healthy salad which was nice but didn't stand out. Quite pricey for a small portion of avocado and cucumbers. The star of the show was the truffle pasta. Beautiful presentation and the taste was great. The tiramisu was not very flavorful, probably wouldn't order that again. Giving 4 stars because the staff were so nice!

I went for lunch with a girlfriend and it was a very pleasant experience. Great food and friendly staff!
No comment

I wasn't really impressed with this meal. The taste was just ok. I expected the black truffle to be more flavorful. And there really wasn't enough sauce to cover all of the pasta. I do appreciate that they still seated me even though my friend was 30 min late to the reservation. The dish just wasn't my favorite. I think it is a nice place to go to for a glass of wine or a date but I wasn't a huge fan of the food.

Definitely very good food nice atmosphere and good drinks. The problem is for what you're paying you can definitely get better. Spending the same amount on some pasta as what I have spent just recently for an upscale steak dinner is a bit hard to understand frankly.
The best pasta and clams I've ever had! Clams were plump, light sauce was very clammy. Fresh pasta was excellent. My family loved everything.  I'll miss this place when I leave NY

The concept of this restaurant is amazing but in my opinion the food and the service was...average. We had the steak tartar and two pasta dishes. The portions are good but I think they should give it a twist to the menu to make it as special as the concept.
No comment
No comment

Dominico and Jordy  My favorite. Every time I come I feel welcomed and the truffle pasta  just never fails. Jordy was such a sweetheart. The service was amazing as always. This will forever be our date spot. Thank you Dominico for always making our experience amazing here at SOLA and thank you Jordy for an amazing dining experience as well.
Very good! Pastas are delicious but it's a bit on the pricey side so beware. The service was also lagging the night I went (it was a Monday night) but no big deal.

Gosh, i just loveeeee this little spot. Their food is soooooo delishhh! The kitchen is an open concept and you can see them peeping your food right in front of you. Dishes are quite simple, yet delicious. We had the fig salad, the burrata with plums, the taggatelli pasta with fresh truffle, the squid ink pasta with uni and gold flakes and the cavatelli with pesto and cream. Everything was so fresh and just done the right way. The owner over sees the entire place and makes sure things are running properly. Very cute spot!

Delicious truffle cream pasta and vongole (incredibly flavorful). Highly recommend both dishes.

Very very very good pasta. I enjoyed the black truffle pasta it was amazing. Another pasta was the cacio e pepe, such a great taste with a nice strong pepper hindrance. The sauce so good. Appetizer was very good as well. I enjoyed the ricotta and prosciutto. Service was great. Tiny restaurant, packed on a Monday. Has a pasta bar so you can see what is being made. This place and Olio e pieu are the next up and coming amazing New York Italian.
No comment
Good vibes: music playing, windows open. had the Tartufo: fresh pasta, tasty sauce. I cleaned my plate up. Ended myself with the Affogato. Will definitely come back again

Tried this place with a group of friends on a Saturday night and we got a table outside. The pastas and drinks were delicious! The service was extremely friendly and attentive. I would definitely recommend coming here for a casual night with friends.

I was charged $300 for canceling a reservation due to COVID exposures. I canceled the plans due to my respect for other patrons and the staff, who  most likely don't want to be around 12 unmasked people who were exposed to COVID-positive individuals, even if those guests weren't positive themselves. At worst this is  an incentive for COVID-exposed people to go to a restaurant as long as they are not themselves positive, just to avoid a fee. At best it is a sign of very poor customer service.

I don't even know where to start! Came here for my boyfriends 40th birthday during COVID. Their outdoor greenhouses are amazing! Warm, super cute and cozy. They even had music! The novelty of being able to take your coat off while eating outdoors was not lost on either of us. We started with two delicious cocktails before moving on to a delicious bottle of red. But the food is really what sets the place apart. We started with the burrata, then got the $95 pasta 5-dish thing so we could sample lots of dishes. The cacio e Pepe was phenomenal as well as the tagliatelle with truffle. The pomodoro was also really flavorful! I didn't care for the squid ink pasta because it's just jot my jam but my boyfriend loved it/ They brought us a little tiramisu with a candle for my boyfriends birthday at the end too which was cute of them. The service was so lovely too: can't wait to come back and try everything else we didn't order! There wasn't much lol
#nyc #chelsea #italian #pasta Yum! Nice place and their pasta was amazing! Please go there and have a good pasta.

This was my second time here and it did not disappoint! Beautiful ambiance and innovative pasta/cocktails. Though service was slow that day (we and the tables around us had waited 30+ minutes for our pasta), our server kindly gave us a free dessert and a discount on our meal. Highly recommend this place for excellent food and service!

My family and I spent New Years Eve at this marvelous restaurant and we reserved 2 hours earlier and got a seat at the the chefs table, even though we didn't think it was ideal, it ended up being a spectacular experience watching the cooks make our food. Not to mention amazing service especially Bruno our server. Amazing night with amazing people and even more amazing food. 10/10 and 100% recommended. Thank you!!!
No comment
No comment
Good pasta service was ok...maybe indoors would have been better it was cold af outside music was great.

This place has been on my list for a while. I ordered the bolognese for my entree and shared the burrata and peach salad with some of my friends. The bolognese was pretty good, but there are other places I'd go to again versus returning to Sola.
No comment

"I came, I saw, I conquered.....and I will probably not be coming back." Solidly average at best. Atmosphere of Sola is very chic and trendy. Definitely prime date spot (where the guy pays) if you want the vibes - both inside and outside. Pasta is just meh. It's fine, but nothing out of the ordinary, and for the price, I consider it to be subpar. We did the pasta tasting and so tried their most popular dishes. My favorites are the truffle one (tagliatella al tartufo Nero) and the pepper one (tonnarelli cacio e pepe). Both of these had lots of sauces and were flavorful / rich. The pasta itself was on the chewier side but also quite mediocre if compared to other hand pulled pastas. The rigatoni was quite hard. Cooked but barely there. Maybe one of the worse dishes I've had in NYC lol. Gnocchi was good - cheese in the middle. We liked it. Uni pasta was meh. Nothing special, would not get again. Much better uni pastas at domo domo or Sakamai. Overall, mediocre pasta, trendy environment, but for the price, not super worth.

Incredible ambiance and even better food. We absolutely loved our wait staff, they were attentive and friendly! The bar in the center is where the pasta is made and dishes crafted so you can see the process while you wait for your food! Phenomenal

Here are screenshots of the menu I took while I was at the restaurant. They may have updated the menu between my dinner and their response to my review. I'm downgrading my review to one star as they seem to be trying to misrepresent what actually happened.
No comment
No comment

I've been coming to this restaurant for years and they never disappoint - the service is impeccable (even post pandemic) - the pasta is always divine - and the atmosphere is vibrant and cool. I was able to book one of their private greenhouses and it was so romantic and comfy. We had the fig salad, gnocchi and ragu - and since it was partner's bday, we even had dessert on the house with the waiter serenading us with the birthday song :) so happy to see this gem of a restaurant thriving!
No comment

The Aesthetics of this place is very nice however the food is not at all appetizing. I have to say it tasted as if I was eating mush- with no flavor, if you're in the mood for pasta overall good food, do not go here there are much better places out there.
No comment

Make sure you visit them before we can't dine outdoor when the weather gets colder! The settings for outdoor seating is not like the temporary built barns, they make you feel like we are supposed to dine out to enjoy the beautiful streets, the breeze and the food. Their service is warm and friendly, and their food is so great. I only ordered one squid ink pasta with clams, and it's so flavorful and delish. I'll bring my gf here next time! Make sure you check them out or it's your loss!
No comment

We had high hopes coming into this dinner the other night. But we were sadly disappointed by the food. We ordered the pasta tasting - very pricey by the way. We wished they would have let you picked the pasta you wanted because we were very disappointed by 3 of the 5. I hate to give the low review because the wait staff was awesome. Our waiter sensed that we didn't like the food, so he brought us our cannolis at the end. The cacio e pepe was good, but all the other pastas were not unfortunately so this is all I can suggest.

My girlfriend and I ventured into SoHo for an early birthday dinner and we were recommended to try A Pasta Bar from a friend. When we walked in, we were seated immediately next to the sign on the wall and were impressed by the ambiance of the restaurant. Having the kitchen in the middle of the restaurant was a nice twist. Our waiter was extremely attentive and always made sure our glass of water was full. We jumped right into ordering our pasta and were surprised with how quickly they served us (brought out our dishes within 5 minutes of ordering!). The pasta itself was absolutely delicious. The Rigatoni Arrabiata had an excellent balance of tomato and spice. I tried my girlfriends caccio y pepe and it was very well made! The sauce had the perfect amount of creaminess with a hint of pepper to balance it out. Additionally, I was very impressed by the plating of the pasta. We topped off our dinner with an order of Tiramisu which was pretty standard. Overall, A Pasta Bar was a great experience and I would highly recommend as a date night location. The only downside is that the menu is a bit on the pricier side, but I guess thats to be expected in NYC. Expect to spend atleast $80-$110 with tax and gratuity added on.
No comment
No comment

Pasta was great, restaurant had a smart/casual and hip ambience. Dishes are pricey for pasta, paid $39 for my tagliatelle with truffles but still would call it money well spent. Randomly walked in with zero expectations but enjoyed everything and would definitely be back.
GET THE TAGLIATELLE AL TARTUFO!! I have nothing more to say. Been dreaming about it ever since.
No comment

Went here over the weekend and had a great experience. The ambiance is beautiful. They did a great job with their covid outdoor seating. Its beautiful and gives you the same feeling as being inside. Salmon tartare was amazing! Probably the best i've had in a while in the city. My pasta with the octopus was amazing but a little too salty for me. The gnocchi dish was superb. The only reason I have 4 stars is because I felt some of the specialty cocktails were a little small. Two of us were ordering the Viva Vida ( could be spelling wrong) and without the ice cube, the drink was about 1/5 of the glass. But would definitely go back. I really would love to sit at the chefs table next time I go back
No comment

Sola pasta bar did not disappoint! This place stood out for a few reasons, starting with a well-heated outdoor seating area (safe to say our buns were happy at 16°F), attentive waitstaff, yummy cocktails, and buttery (GF) pasta. It was my first trying gluten-free pasta (was giving a friend company), and I was pleasantly surprised at the taste and texture. Definitely coming back, this time to check out one of their cozy cottages.
No comment

I'm giving the food here five stars. Exquisitely decorated private dining booths. But the inside of the restaurant is very minimal. And the regular outdoor dining booths isn't as nice as the private dining booths. That being said, here's my experience: basically got treated like I've never been somewhere nice. The waiter told us it was $200/per person to sit in a private dining booth. He didn't tell us how easy it is to spend over $200 in this restaurant (our bill was over $400 for 2 people). He also didn't let me get parmesan cheese on my cacio e pepe because  according to him 'it already has too much cheese'. Their cheese and bread options are very good. Their drinks were also lovely.

One of the best pasta dishes I have had. I tried  the lobster tagilaatella recommended by my server. It was really good, you could taste the freshness in all the ingredients. I stumbled across this place after searching for somewhere to eat, having no idea of its popularity. Getting a table for two was pretty easy. We were sat outside, decor was nice and it's covered. Our server was pretty helpful and attentive. Definitely will be coming back!
No comment

First experience here and it won't be my last! The quality of the food was met equally by the quality of the service. Martina was a phenomenal and gracious host and helped us through our dinner. Along with the other staff that helped us as well

Amazing food , the gentleman who speak with us amazing guy , and my son say everything with this picture !!

This place was obviously very cute and trendy because it's soho. The pasta was amazing and the drinks were great but the portion sizes were incredibly small. Also, we made a reservation two weeks in advance, putting down a $97 deposit under the impression (from the website) that the fee would be taken out of our bill. It was not. We were told they JUST changed the policy. Some BS if you ask me. Whatevs. We paid it bc were not dicks. All in all, good food, good service, just beware if you're making a reservation.

Simply amazing, especially given all the Covid restrictions. The food is absolutely amazing and our server Etienne was incredible. Super cool vibe. Everything was presented beautifully, especially the frose with flower garnish and the food is so good! Can't wait to return.

Great spot for pasta. Food was delicious as well as the service. Wish they allowed for two people to eat in their shed.

No comment

Not worth the $ IMO. My friend and I ordered the pasta tasting and all but one of the dishes came out cold. Flavors weren't bad but I wasn't blown away by any of them. The drinks are tiny and watered down. Service is okay - more on the inattentive end. There are so many better pasta joints in the city... Sola definitely feels far overhyped.

While not many are traveling to Italy right now, this is about as close as you'll get in the meantime. With perfectly cooked pasta, true Italian servers and ambiance, you will feel like you're in Italy. Reservations are highly recommended but even with, be prepared to wait. However, you will be rewarded for your patience with some of the best pasta Manhattan has to offer. They are currently offering outdoor dining with tables well spread out. The burrata appetizer was delicious and probably one of the best I've ever had. We personally ordered the tagliatella al tartufo- truffle, like many is the way to our hearts. Fideua- my personal pick and it did not disappoint. Tonnarelli Cacio E Pepe- while the black pepper is definitely apparent, beyond delicious. You can't go wrong with any one of their offerings.

We went there for our anniversary and my husband's birthday. Our server was so nice. We ordered their best seller but did not like it and they changed to the Gnocchi which I fall in love with. Wine was great as well. Will come again!
I am so glad we tried this restaurant. The food is very delicious and the staff was very friendly and considerate. They made us vegetarian 5 pasta tasting dishes. Which all of absolutely loved!

A very trendy pasta spot in Soho perfect for a date or even a small group. I had dinner here with 2 other girlfriends and surprisingly so the vegetable and shrimp tempura was one of my favorite items on the appetizer menu. The pastas we ordered were delicious, the ambiance was great, and the service exceeded my expectations. I will definitely come back to Sola Pasta Bar when I'm in the area.
No comment
No comment
Probably the best pasta place around my apartment. Great pasta, great appetizers, great desserts!

What a cool and trendy Italian restaurant! Even the music they were playing added to the vibe. Because of Covid, all the tables were separated by  plastic barriers and staff were all wearing masks. We started off with the pasta chips which came with burrata. I've never had or even heard of pasta chips before! There was an Italian seasoning on top of the pasta chips and dipping it in the burrata added the perfect balance of savoriness from the chips and creaminess of the burrata. The portion of the chips were small, but they also give complimentary bread and olive oil too in the beginning. If you have burrata leftover, they will also give you bread to eat with it. Be careful not to fill yourself up though because the pasta portions are a good size! I got the cacio e pepe for my entree. I loved it! The pasta was al dente and the sauce with the black pepper was delicious! They have plenty of vegetarian options to choose from. We ended it with chocolate and hazelnut gelato. The hazelnut was my favorite. You also can't go wrong with any of the cocktails! Our whole table ordered different ones throughout the night and they were all good.

The worst customer service I have ever experienced. I made an 8:45pm reservation at 10am for that night, and realized I had to cancel 2 hours later. I was charged $60 and thought that explaining my particular circumstance to the restaurant would result in an understanding that this charge was unreasonable for a same day cancellation before their business hours. Multiple back and forth emails with management left me nowhere and I was still charged. It has tainted my view of the restaurant that they are so strict with a policy that sometimes is unreasonable.

We specifically asked for egg free pasta given that our kids are severly intolerant to it, however they didn't heed our allergy request, confirmed no eggs in the pasta and 2 hours later we were rushing to the ER. Super disappointed
Prob the best pasta I've had in new York. Def recommend the rigatoni. Also the vibe of this place inside and outside is beautiful & we came at a busy time & they took care of us kindly & quickly.

I had such high expectations for this place and unfortunately, worst costumer service of my life AND THEY CHARGED ME DOUBLE the price that I paid for. Please do not bother coming here. Sadly, not a good experience at all.

I have a reservation at 8:45 at that restaurant and then wait about 35 minutes. I realized that they preferred to give the table to other people, maybe because they are Italian or they speak Italian, but there is a little racism in this restaurant. in the end they told me that there was no table available for me at 9:30 at night, when there is no longer another place available for dinner

My girlfriend and I got the pasta tasting menu for two, we loved it and the drinks were extremely good!!

Seriously?  My husband and I tried this place for a bite one night and the food was ok, but we felt transported to a disco in ibiza, with blaring music and neon lights. We arrived and the host ignored us, then when he did finally notice us, asked if we would like to have a cocktail at the bar, instead of asking us if we had a reservation (which we did). The food was unmemorable, and the vibe was not for us. But recently I walked by and an offensive neon sign with curse words is now hanging in the main dining area facing the street for all the children in the neighborhood to see! I find this offensive and disrespectful. Shame on you.

I came here for a late lunch and it was not busy at all. The waiter was very nice and the pasta was good. The servings were not super big but it was enough for what we wanted. The bread was good and the napkins were super cute!
Amazing food and service. Celebrated my good friend her birthday and the owner definitely made it an amazing experience. Definitely coming back soon! I loved the truffle pasta

Their cacio e pepe is my go to pasta. It's so rich and thick. Their lasgna is home made feel to it and done just right. If you want to have a nice restaurant experience this is one of the places to go.
The sunny corner location and dj music vibe goes perfect with the open kitchen and warm ambiance.  Today's $19 set lunch menu was a deal.  Pasta and bread was fresh as it gets

Was staying very close at "The James" about a block away. Wanted to stay close and found this absolutely incredible Italian restaurant. Not a ton of seating and definitely worth a reservation. Absolutely worth the wait. Modern pasta bar with a DJ.
No comment

I came here with some friends to celebrate a birthday back in September. We ordered their pasta tasting to share, which included 5 pre selected pasta dishes, Carciofi as an appetizer, and Tiramisu for dessert. The pasta dishes were good. There were interesting flavors and a nice variety of pasta types, sauces, and combinations. That being said, it wasn't the best pasta I've ever had and some of the dishes were definitely better than others. My least favorite but most aesthetically pleasing was the 24k gold spaghetti Ricci. It tasted really boring and bland despite its unique appearance. The gnoccho ripieno was a better dish, the gnoccho was incredibly soft and melted in your mouth. The sauce was also well made and went well with the pasta. The malfalda al ragu was one of the more traditional pasta dishes with bolognese sauce and Parmesan cheese but was actually one of my favorite because the spices in the sauce were so tasty and the home made spaghetti was equally great. The Tagliatella Al Tartufo Bianco D'Alba was another good dish with unique flavors. The truffle on top and the creamy sauce went perfectly together and created a blast of flavors in your mouth. The Tonarelli Cacio E Pepe was a little too heavy on the pepper and it drowned out any other flavors. As for the carciofi and tiramisu, these were both very average. The carciofi was quite bland and the artichoke has a strange texture that wasn't very pleasing. The tiramisu was more of a pudding than a cake but had the classic tiramisu taste. Surprisingly, their coffee was exceptionally good, might have been the highlight of the night. Their service was great and they put a candle on the dessert for my friend, a welcoming touch. Although it isn't the best Italian food I've ever had, I found it interesting and worth a try.

Loved everything about this place. Decor, vibe, wait staff, and most importantly the food. Sitting at the bar and interacting with the chefs is my favorite spot in the restaurant. The portions are good, some bigger than other dishes. But all very flavorful. Pasta (fresh) all cooked perfectly! Have been back a few times and will continue to come back.

I've been to Sola Pasta Bar a few times on a couple different occasions and the pasta has only gotten better and better each time. From the wine, cocktails, appetizers and pasta the entire experience is second to none. You get to watch the cooks make your pasta from scratch which is always exciting for me. I recommend this place to any local from NYC that hasn't been here yet and to any tourist that just wants a romantic/fun experience in the heart of Soho. This is your spot.

Stopped by for dinner before going to the Friends25 POPUP. The presentation of food was outrageous as was the taste!!! The Wagyu app comes in a dome filled with smoke- Instagram worthy &&& delicious! The Cacio was mouth watering, I liked it more than the gnocchi (both we're good though). My hubby and I split and we were so happy to taste everything. Ask for an extra piece of bread so you can wipe up the leftover sauce, you'll thank me later. Can't wait to go back! A+

This place is a fantastic find! We were looking for a quick bite and stumbled across Sola. We are always suckers for seats in front of the kitchen, so this place was perfect (the center bar is the kitchen!) The staff were inviting and friendly when we entered. The drinks are plentiful (cucumber margarita!), the menu is fantastic and the view is amazing. We  ordered an appetizer and two pastas which was perfect for 2. The gnocchi is incredible:  Perfect pillowy bites of heaven! Tiramisu for dessert was light and not too liquory. Kudos! We will definitely be back!

This might be the best pasta I've ever had, and I've tried pasta all over the world! The Cacio e Pepe is incredible - even better than anything I've tried in Italy. The people here are also incredibly nice. I've separately taken all of my family members here (who are very picky) and they've all been very impressed! Thank you Sola Pasta Bar!

The only reason I'm leaving the 2 stars that I did was because the food was delicious! Other than that, the experience for my friends and I was horrendous when it comes to hospitality. The birthday girl and I arrived for our 6pm reservation at 6:08. We reserved the cabin, (which we had to pay upfront prior to making the reservation.) the host let us know that our cabin wasn't ready but we could wait inside and have a drink while we wait. We sat inside the restaurant and we saw through the glass all of the cabins had guests. So we didn't feel bad about being 8 min late. We ordered cocktails and the other girls arrived and ordered as well. Around 6:45 we were escorted into our cabin. Before even sitting in our chair they were trying to get all of our orders in. We let them know we need some time to look over the menu. Minutes later another person came into our cabin to let us know since our reservation was at 6pm that's when the time starts on our 90 minutes. 45 min?! We have 45 minutes to enjoy a birthday dinner for our friend? We thought they were kidding, but then realized they were dead serious when they brought all of our 5 pasta tasting menus out ontop of eachother. My friend and I were actually holding our first tasting bowl in our hand trying to finish it as fast as We could because they were placing the next pastas on the table. I had to ask them to give us new plates and silverware, (as our previous pastas were red sauce and the new ones were cream) we ordered a bottle of wine during the pasta tasting. Our server proceeded to pour the entire bottle out in one round. I was in utter shock. I've never seen such disrespectful hospitality. Blatantly telling us to hurry the hell up and get out. There were at least 2-3 servers constantly in or around our cabin which made me feel very uncomfortable due to the fact we're in An enclosed CABIN with 4 people and now we have 7 people at all times in our cabin due to staff lingering, waiting to grab anything empty that they can clear and get us out quicker. (But with all of the people around my water was always empty) It was OBVIOUS, very noticeable they were kicking us out. When it came to ordering a dessert for our friend. We ordered and let them know it was her birthday. 1 minute after ordering  she got up to go to the bathroom and saw them coming out of the restaurant heading toward us with her birthday dessert and candle. How they got it that quick and raced out i have no clue, She had to walk back into the cabin and not use the bathroom because they put it down on the table without waiting, she had to blow out her candles and then leave her dessert sitting there to use the bathroom. When our bill came, they let us know they already took out 20 percent gratuity on the deposit we paid to reserve the cabin. Insane. Not only was the cabin a $99 min per person, but we spent way more than that and could have had a little bit more respect for our time, especially since we're supporting their business during these hard times. Seemed like they don't care about the quality of the experience only the money they are getting in their pockets. I will not be returning. And I will tell this story every time I hear about this place.

I give a 3 star for this place. I liked the atmosphere and the nice plates and the music to this place. Concerning the food is overpriced for the quality. I had a bad experience with my ink spaghetti with clams. It made me sick the next day...maybe was not that fresh. Also it tasted bitter and was one note, was not a good flavored pasta. But the pasta on itself seemed fresh and handmade.

This was a very trendy place (not surprising given the area in which it is located). That being said, I found it fairly authentic and interesting. Prices were not necessarily high considering the location, but the menu of course is fairly limited to just pasta, antipasto, and dessert. My boyfriend ordered the ragu (which I regret not getting because it looked delicious), and I ordered the gnocchi Ripieno. The gnocchi was not exactly my cup of tea or necessarily what I was expecting. I got 7 or 8 individual pieces of gnocchi stuffed with cheese and sauce. On top of the gnocchi was like a light oniony oil/gravy (almost clear in color).. it was unique and not bad, just not what I was expecting. I wouldn't have ordered it knowing that was what I was getting. The wine was good and fairly generously poured, and the bread was nice to munch on before receiving our meals. The ambiance was very nice and perfect for a nice lunch date. If in the area again, I'd consider returning.

Went here before Covid and really enjoyed their Cacio e pepe pasta. Great portion size and taste. It was a enjoyable meal.

Cute little restaurant in soho area. A little bit pricey for it's food quality, but nice interior desing. The Gnocchi was good, but my lobster pasta was kind of bad... I was hoping much more. Nice service.
I came here because of someone's review and let me tell you the best I've had so far  the service was great the food was even better

Some of the best pasta I've ever had! Came here on a Saturday night and had to wait a bit for 3 seats at the bar but won't fault them because the place is worth the wait! It's got a fun, trendy ambience with loud music--sitting at the bar watching the chefs make the pasta is part of the experience. The cocktails were amazing, I got the cucumber margarita which was refreshing. My friend got the golden trick goal, their take on the Moscow mule. They bring out unlimited bread and their speciality olive oil while you're waiting and although it would be nice if the bread were hot, the combo is still delicious. Speaking of waiting, you do have to wait a bit for your pasta but I can't fault them because it's clear everything is made SO fresh. For mains, we got the tagliatelle al tartufo, the cacio e pepe, and the pacheri al pomodoro. The tagliatelle and cacio e pepe were out of this world but the pacheri was quite good, too...just perhaps slightly more basic and less exciting than the other pasta dishes.

Amazing!  Service was top notch by absolutely every staff member. Although they were busy, we received great service and the attention to detail was spot on!  Pabel was our server and he was so attentive and personable.  And the food was delicious.  It was hot when served and so decadent.  We had a very romantic dinner although we were sitting on the sidewalk in SoHo.  Please try this for dinner!  You will not be disappointed!

The food was amazing! We opted for a seat that was placed half indoor half outdoor to get the best of the restaurant's vibe and the bustle of the city. We started off with olives and both ordered pasta dishes for dinner (Alfredo with black pepper and one with meat sauce) both were absolutely delicious and filling. Would definitely recommend this place!

By far the worst pasta I've ever had. All the pastas we had were bad. The chiefs look like a bunch of frat boys that just follow a series of steps and don't really know how to cook. It's just a trendy place with horrible food. Wine list is good though. I don't recommend if you actually want to enjoy your food.

What a fantastic place! From the hip ambiance, decor, service to the amazing food. The pasta chef is such an artist and pro; he cooks right in front of you (if you're sitting at the bar). Great Italian food!
Think of McDonald but for Italian food. I had the most tasteless pasta of my life here. If you enjoy food than this is the last place for you.
Amazing vibes. So chic inside from the plates to the glasses. Everything was so good and service was quick.

A little slice of pasta heaven in Soho. I've been frequenting this place since it first opened and has never disappointed. Not only is the pasta out of this world, but the staff and ambiance are absolutely wonderful. Luigi in particular is a spectacular chef and a night with him and his pasta is always a night to remember. Whether for a special occasion or just a regular Thursday night, if you're looking for pasta this is the place to go!
Literally the best hospitality I've ever received at a restaurant! We haven't even gotten food and I'm writing this because I'm stunned! I WILL be returning.

I came to Sola a few weeks ago and was blown away by the attentive staff, fancy drinks, great food, and the awesome plates! If anyone can find out what the plates are used at Sola please let me know! I wish I could get a set for myself.

I was able to get a reservation for 3pm for me and my girlfriend. The host sat us down and the restaurant had a really nice heated outdoor seating with plastic barriers for social distancing. I will start with the only positive - we ordered the Burata to start and then had the rigatoni and the calcio e Pepe for main course. The food was 5/5 no complaints whatsoever. However our waiter was absolutely terrible. We waited 20 minutes to get asked what we wanted from when we sat down and he had served the table next to us even though they came after us. When I asked him if I could order he rudely replied "wait". And then I had a separate waiter come to take our order. I had ordered a drink as soon as we sat down and the drink came after I was done with my meal. I asked if I could get another drink and the waiter instead came out saying "so sorry your drink never made it". He then came with the check without even asking if we were done and basically got kicked out before we even had a second to answer if we were finished. By far the WORST customer service I have ever experienced in New York. I do not recommend this place. If you're in the area I suggest you visit a much better restaurant for both food and customer service such as Osteria Morini. To the owner: I urge you to please train your staff on basic customer service and not treat customers like we're just a number. Stay away from this place if you want to enjoy a nice meal with a significant other.
Incredible pasta. Just straight forward, deceptively simple pasta, perfectly executed. Wine list is ok, tartufo is wonderful, other deserts less so. Go go go eat pasta.
Loved the interior, loved the service, loved EVERYTHING except the pasta... they came dry, and kind of cold... such a shame, because I really wanted to like this place :(
So much fun and delicious! Get the fun cocktails! And reserve a spot at the bar to get the full experience. Get something with truffles!

I'm not that kind of person to write a review but this is just unacceptable in my eyes . So my cousin and I went to get brunch and this is the only place that didn't have a line for the table which was great. Hostess was nice and place is cute. BUT! We got lobster pasta and when we started eating it we saw black short HAIR inside of it! And right away we knew it's now our hair bc we have long hair and it was inside the pasta. We called our waiter and told him about it. So what he does? He just takes away dirty plate and brings clean plate. We had to tell him to take away pasta bc of the hair that was inside it. So he did that and brought new pasta for us. We never heard  apologies or anything. It felt like that was a norm for that place and  it's okay to find someone's HAIR inside your food during COVID. They should really check if their stuff is wearing hair nets while preparing food. I'm scared to think and see what's going on in their kitchen. For $40 pasta I would expect better customer service. If you guys like pasta with hair inside then I guess you found your place. Enjoy! I'm Never going there again and will never recommend this place.
