Best pasta and sauce I've ever had. Very trendy and comfortable. Great service. Great food. New go-to next time I'm in SoHo!

This restaurant is a true gem with outstanding service and friendly ambiance. It's as close as you can get to authentic Italian food in Italy but with a modern and surprising spin. I had the squid ink ravioli and it was out of this world. The portion is perfect and it leaves all your senses satisfied. The chef and the waiter do a fantastic job hosting you. The open kitchen concept provides for a wonderful experience if you are sitting at the bar as you see the chef prepares your meal. Highly recommended! Will be back for sure every time I'm in NY. Oh! Save room for dessert. Their cannoli was sinfully good.

The ambience was dressy casual. They make the pasta in-house which is very important to me! You can taste the freshness in all their ingredients including the sauce. The portion sizes are very small by American standards. They literally weigh the pasta before cooking so maybe theres some science behind the portion sizes. What I really enjoyed is sitting by the bar and watching them make the pasta. Their menu has eccentric dessert and salad options and enough vegetarian options too.

New SoHo Chic same as old SoHo Chic. Get over yourself! But the food is actually very good...if you can stomach the crowd and actually watch and talk to the crew working behind the pasta par, you'd enjoy it. Very skilled. Humble staff.
No comment

This place is great! The staff is very welcoming and the food is amazing. I sat at the bar, facing the open kitchen and saw as they prepared the plates. I had the rigatoni with sausage and curry sauce which was great, and a great tiramisu for desert. For what I noticed everyone in staff in Italian which just adds to the place's charm and ambiance. 5 stars for sure.

Such a cute place for lunch of drinks. I personally very much enjoyed the pasta and wine. A little on the pricier side, but you are in SoHo. Two of the 4 walls were open to the outdoors and the pasta was made in front of you. I'd definitely come back and enjoy some other items on the menu but overall a very nice experience.
The pasta was great! Love the environment and will come again! Not too crowded on a sat night. Love sitting at the bar looking at the chef preparing your food for u.

Four people out eating Friday night. Two out of four pastas were cold and when we told the waiter he questioned us instead of bringing out new food. The food overall was ok, but the service bad. We got the check with the dessert and while eating the dessert the host asked us to pay and then leave the table without having time to finish our drink. We told the manager and instead of excusing the behavior of the host he replied, "this is how it is in New York". There are plenty of places in New York where you will be treated much better.
great experience! Came for a meal by myself at the bar and enjoyed the atmosphere as well as all of the waiters whom all speak Italian!  my pesto was amazing I highly recommend.
I love this place! I saw it a few weeks ago while exploring and I have been dying to try it! I went last night with a group of 6 and we had great service. The pasta was AMAZING!
No comment
No comment

Perfectly prepared, delicious pastas. Funky setting--sort of like pasta disco.  Had squid ink pasta with vongole and then the saffron mushroom pasta. Both were awesome. Nice radicchio salad too. Waiters are fun and helpful. Mesmerizing to watch the pasta preparation. Looking forward to coming back.

Best Pasta in New York. I went there last friday with one of my friend that was visiting from Italy and he loved it ! Really authentic flavor, cool place, the atmosphere was elegant and cozy at the same time ! I felt like home !
So delicious! Would highly recommend the rigatoni and spaghetti alle vongole. The overall vibe is super cozy and comfortable with lounge music playing. It's the perfect setting for date night.
The most amazing pasta in SOHO. Great wine selection too. Staff friendly and cool. Everything is super gnammy

I was really excited to come here for dinner after reading reviews on Yelp, NY Times and other places. I've had homemade pasta before and also have made it myself and thought the pasta here was good, nice and light, but not extraordinary. We started with the mozzarella and prosciutto which was good, but not amazing. The four of us shared the cacio e pepe, fusilli with meat sauce, and a fettuccine special that had fresh truffle on top. I didn't realize that the truffle pasta was market price and when the check came it was $60. I feel the server should've have mentioned this when he told us the specials. All of the pasta were good as well as the sauces that went with them. For dessert we had the tiramisu which was very good, not sweet. Overall, I'm glad I got to try this place, but doubt I would return as I feel there are dozens of other places in New York that are better and not as expensive.
Extremely overpriced! The manager is rude and unprofessional. Pasta was salty. Yesterday my friends went and they also had a mediocre experience as well. Very touristy place.

Went to Sola for date night and had a reservation sitting at the bar. Great atmosphere and food is delicious. We had the rigatoni carbonara which was recommended by the waiter and we loved it. Would definitely recommend this small intimate restaurant. TIP: make a reservation, even on a Sunday night it gets very busy after 7pm.

Came here about 10pm on a rainy mid week evening and got a table easily. Prices are fairly reasonable with entrees around $15-20. Small selection and they had sold out of a couple of things we wanted which was annoying but the dishes we had were well cooked and tasted good. Enjoyed sitting at the bar watching the food being prepared. Good place for a quick dinner.

For a "PASTA" place the service is weak. Took 15mins just to get bread, Foods over priced and rushed and Very Very Bland for "authentic" Italian pasta.. in short not worth the 1st visit let alone a repeat....

The mission on the website says "Stay humble. Stay simple. Let the food speak for itself." Sola Pasta Bar does none of those things. This place is trying so hard and it's painfully obvious. Over priced dishes for small portions of modern takes on classic Italian dishes. The food took forever, club music was blaring at 5pm in an empty restaurant. The food was over seasoned (I got a spaghetti dish with bacon and all i could taste was salt) and the pasta did not taste fresh. Do yourself a favor and walk the extra 20 minutes to Little Italy and get yourself some humble, simple authentic phenomenal Italian food that doesn't break your wallet in a place that doesn't feel like a night club.
Amazing service. Food so good I had to write this review while eating. Drinks were perfect. Music and atmosphere were amazing

Amazing concept open kitchen where you see the chefs hand-make every part of your meal. Sitting at the pasta bar was a unique experience as you feel apart of their family for the meantime while they prepare your dishes with such joy and passion. We got the charcuterie board and all the meats were thinly, perfectly sliced well portioned and bread to die for! We actually had a couple rounds of bread despite knowing we were going to carb out anyways  lobster gnocchi cooked to perfection going straight from the chefs hand as he gives us the plate to enjoy. Incredible. Possibly life changing really. Very fresh and intensely flavorful! I'm usually that person that adds pepper to everything and I felt that there was no need to add or substrate anything perfectly well balanced all around. With a bottle of wine probably one the best date/ romantic / yet causal and entertaining spots to grab dinner in SoHo. Highly recommend. Not to mention the wait staff was highly attentive, efficient, waters filled without even realizing or seeing anyone around us .. friendly and welcoming without being overbearing. Will certainly come back.
Amazing...chef massimo did again a great job , opening this amazing place , simple menu but very high quality great prices too... will be back soon
No comment

I was here with a friend last night. We were drawn in by the ambience, and we'd never heard of the place prior. I got the carbonara and my friend got their version of an alfredo sauce. The best parts about both dishes were the textures: the pasta was cooked perfectly al dente, the pork was a little crunchy, and the sauce was thick and creamy. However, my sauce was so bitter, which with carbonara I think is because of overcooked garlic. It was unbearable. The waitress asked me why I wasn't eating, and I almost never complain about food, and I especially hate wasting food, but this time I did both. She apologized, but I was still charged for it. Lastly, the prices were too high for the portion sizes. I'm not complaining about the size of the portion, just the price.

This is most likely the best pasta I had in my life.Loved the cocktail and tiramisu was icing on the whole experience. Loved the ambience and the people are really friendly. I found this place just like that but had a blast experience.

First of all, instead of pasta we were served Risotto. We didn't want to complain and decided to keep it. The worst thing happened later, when I got severe food poisoning after eating in this restaurant. I'm writing this review two hours after eating in that place, and I'm still in a a lot of pain. I hope this restaurant takes better care of its workers' hygiene and of the freshness of its food.
Very good pasta, but the drinks are weak and over priced. Lunch special is reasonable. Service is on the slow side.
The truffle pasta was out of this world. The truffle taste was intense and the sauce just complimented it.-

This is prolly one of my favorite Italian places in NYC. It is different and it is also authentic. It's really a bar but instead of drinks they have the pasta being made and all your dishes. It's like an Italian hibachi. It's so cool. The cooks are wonderful and informative. The food is so flavorful. We had the caice de Pepe and also the lasagna and both was beyond good. After visiting Rome and tasting the food there, this place definitely comes neck to neck. I have recommended this place to three people and every person loved it. They also offer lemoncello which was perfect.
Pasta is fabulous but the portions are small for the price. You'll be hungry if you just order the pasta.

Was disappointed overall. We ate there on December 19. The service was attentively pretentious. Our adult son ordered the lasagna, good not great. The dish was delivered in a small pot, not on a plate. My gluten free pasta arrived lukewarm and had to be returned for reheating. My husband's pasta dish was fine. Was surprised that there were no side dishes of vegetables or a simple mixed green salad.  I've spent long periods of time in Italy and have a side travel business that takes small groups to Italy. We were in NYC (where I'm from originally) and were celebrating a birthday and willing to spend money on the experience, but left feeling very underwhelmed. Made a reservation a week ahead and although seated promptly it did not appear that they were expecting us.

Really wanted to like this place due to the ambience of open kitchen - but for the price of the food the quality was not good. Pasta was not cooked right - plus if you have an open kitchen you can do better than just assemble food from various boxes - I would have expected some more fresh ingredients. Salad was just so so. This place has the modern look and good presentation of food but taste and quality is sub-par. There are plenty of options in the vicinity and I would not go back here again.

We were visiting from Toronto and had such a great time here! We sat at the bar and there were 2 chefs who were AWESOME! Having a restaurant with this style can be risky because you need to have staff that can be really personable and also do their job...cooking pasta. Really well executed. Definitely recommend.

Was in town for vacation and came across this place while walking through Soho saw quite a few people so decided to check it out and I have to say I was not disappointed soon as you walk in you feel a complete change in the atmosphere great music super friendly service and all with a awesome Italian accent. They have a pretty nice and varied menu a lot to choose from in regards to both food and drinks, but one of the most distinguished aspects is the open kitchen where you can see your pasta be prepared in huge woks  right in front of your eyes its truly amazing the price for the quality of food service and overall experience is very much worth it, hope to be back in the city soon to go back
Excellent service and delicious pasta! A warm, cozy environment to dine leisurely without having to shout to be heard. This is my favorite go-to spot in SoHo!

Decor and open kitchen idea in the middle is pretty neat and different in a good way. Food - it's ok, nothing special, although really really really small portion (check others pics)  for the price. BUT what a AWFUL experience me and my wife had with service, waiter if I recall name correctly from the receipt "Mauro". So we coming in the early evening and we were advised all the seats by left wall are free and we can grab any available. There was free table for four by the window. So we are sitting down, then suddenly waiter said "oh this table is reserved" - oh I thought maybe he forgot about that reservation, hence we took small table for two next to the "reserved" table. While we are reading menu, older couple has been given the table that we wanted AND table for four has been split so they can have "own" table. They definitely did NOT have reservation, but ok let's not ruin our nice evening. Finally waiter coming with complimentary bread and oil olive, he puts bread and small plate for oil on the table BUT NOT pouring oil. Instead we went to that older couple and gave them bread and olive oil. He is chatting with them (probably because he could speak Italian with them). And THEN after 2-3 mins he comes to our table to pour the olive oil. What the hell was that?????? If I was the owner of this business I would have closer look on this employee because I would NEVER go back there, purely based on this experience. I even tipped 20% with thought it goes to the others and cooks who deserve it NOT this "Mauro" - I hope one day someone give him a lesson, maybe owner of the place or other angry customer :) (I did not want to ruin the dinner for my wife)

Simply amazing!!! Some of the best pasta I've had (and we eat pasta a lot). Also a very cool atmosphere in general, love sitting at the bar and watch them prepare my food! One of the coolest spots in the area! Highly recommend

One of the best NYC restaurants I've been to in a while. Service and atmosphere were both great and the food was AMAZING. I never leave reviews but really felt compelled to. I wasn't asked to and don't know anyone who works here, just a really fantastic meal. Highly recommend.

Great drinks. I got the summer crash which was yummy and my friend got the rosemary gin fizz which was very refreshing. good vibe with attentive and kind waiters and bartenders. Music was on point  - loved the ambience- with open window walls and a crowd but not too noisy.

Very trendy spot, love the space but its gotten more expensive since it first opened. With the price of the dishes, we expected it to be executed better especially their fresh pasta dish. The pasta noodles were stuck together like a lump and there were a lot of scrap pieces, seems like they didn't care about the quality at all.

While we were ordering our food the server was approached by a girl and took down her number, pausing us. Afterwards forgot my drink order three times and then  attempted to make it himself - to what turned out to be the worst old fashion I've had in my life.

The food here is absolutely beautiful. Each bite has a lovely nuanced taste and it is obviously made with love and care. We sat kitchen-side for hours, tried 5 dishes, and loved each one all the more. We also enjoyed watching Chef Massimo train the others on cutting prosciutto and making gazpacho. Can't wait to go back. This restaurant is the best kept secret in the area!
Good food but entree came 30 minutes after everyone on the table were done eating.  Couldn't get order correct and one of the slowest service.

For the money this place was terrible. We started off with cold bread which sadly was the best part of the meal. In terms of pasta the noodle was appropriately cooked aldente however the noodle itself was not tasty at all. It almost tasted off egg and it was not a home made noodle. The sauce was bland with very little flavor and was too salty. It basically tasted like an egg noodle with salt and spice. I think siracha may  actually have added flavor, sadly. I tasted my friends dish and her plate was similarly bland and unpleasant. We did not stay for dessert because the entree was so bad. I would have preferred to stay home and reheat pasta with sauce from a jar. The ambiance of the place was the only pro. It was pretty. I knew we had made a mistake though when they placed dry pasta into the pan. The prices are absolutely outrageous. With little Italy sitting next door to the restaurant better either start cooking fresh food or lower their prices to match something like Noodles and Company which sadly makes better food.
The food was delicious but even better was our server Cassandra. She truly made our visit so much more enjoyable. The wine was also amazing!
Service was incredibly slow, had to wait 15 minutes for water. Waiters seemed overworked. Food was good.
Amazing pasta. Presentation excellent. Chefs and staff approachable, cool and knowledgeable.

Honestly, I'm so disappointed. I had such high hope for this restaurant because the reviews were so positive. My friend and I arrived and ordered a glass of wine. Our server was knowledgeable and very patient with our questions. He ended up suggesting his favorite dishes which we gladly welcomed. Everything seemed to be going really well and we eagerly awaited the arrival of our food.. but our food never came. We waited for over an hour for our pasta to be ready. The restaurant wasn't super busy so I still don't understand why our food took so long. Literally, an hour later, our server came and said that they were having issues preparing our food. He said it would take 10 more minutes.. 20 minutes later our food finally arrived. At this point I'm so so hungry and now also super irritated because the service took forever. I was thinking they would try and make it up to us somehow but they didn't. They asked for full price for the food we didn't even get to eat. I asked for the food to go because my friend had evening plans, and after 1.5 hours there was no way we would have time to eat it there. They gave us our food in paper bags but they didn't have plastic utensils to eat it on the go. I'm still very upset with the service as I'm now on the train, still hungry having spent money for food that will probably be cold by the time I get home. I am so disappointed by the service. I really expected more.

really an amazing meal. and the service was exemplary from the moment we walked in. A very cool spot on the corner of w. broadway and grand and a very nice table set up with a counter around the kitchen. Went with our daughter who truly loves all kinds of pasta and we started with a delicious appetizer of smoked salmon with fresh mozzarella and avocado cream and  a delicious dry aged prosciutto with burratta and olive oil. We then had a fabulous ragontini cooked perfectly a dente with a meat ragu followed by a lfettucini with shaved black truffles. The barolo also complemented the meal nicely

We are italians and as italians is not so easy to find a good italian restaurant. We stayed in NY for 10 days and we came to eat in this restaurant at least 3 times!! The menu is simple and really really good, the staff is amazing and very friendly. Everything they cook is delicious. The atmosphere and the location are great !!! We loved it, absolutely suggested. (P.s. many people are complaining about the price, I think it's totally in the range/honest for a good restaurant in Soho)

column3: South Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
column6: Been here twice, the first time the pasta was too salty (don't recall the dish I ordered) and yesterday where the pasta was bland and nearly tasteless. I will say their tiramisu is delicious and the servers are always friendly.

This is a great pasta bar! I came here with a family of six for my brother's birthday. The curry pasta was scrumptious!!! Wine was delicious and the service was impeccable. We had an amazing time and will definitely return!!!
The pasta was really good, however the service and the waiters were slow. Took forever to order, clean off the plates and pay the bill.
Excellent food and great visual experience to watch your meal cooked in front of you.
i down loaded this app just to leave a review. the server was bad the food was under seasoned, and OVER PRICED!! the only good thing about the meal was the wine.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Pretty good Indian food. As normal Indian people do, we ordered a few different dishes and ate family style. The vegetable korma was good, the saag paneer and chicken Tikka masala were also all good. The somosa are massive and pretty good as well. The Naan wasn't as fluffy as other places, but still decent. There was a little too much salt in the saag paneer. But definitely a good place and worth going back to. I also liked that they had a good kheer.

Really delicious Indian food, served fast. Came here on a Saturday before the evening rush so I did not have to wait and without a reservation. I think this place really picked up by 8, they have a bit of space for seating but they are in the heart of Williamsburg so never underestimate. The food was fantastic, now one of my favorites for Indian in Brooklyn. We ordered the Coconut Naan, Garlic Naan, Saag Paneer and Chicken Tikka Masala. Which was plenty food for 2 people, I did not have any space for dessert. This was the first time I have ever seen Coconut Naan so I had to ty it, I absolutely loved it, a bit on the sweet side but still ok paired with the right curry! A must try. The atmosphere was relaxed and intimate, with a menu suitable for a range of palettes. I'll definitly be back.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Pretty decent Indian place, but didn't stand out that much. Maybe because we got takeout so the flavors didn't stand out as much? The chicken tikka masala had good flavors but the chicken was kind of tough, and the Chana masala was tender but the flavor didn't pop. The samosas were HUGE though, and the naan and rice were solid. Decent prices so would go back to dine in if I'm in the area.
No comment

I didn't experience something worthy of five stars . What stood out the most was the amount of water I had to drink during my meal . It had to have been a record . The waitresses were busy refilling glasses like crazy. The food must have been super salty or spicy or something. My entree was disappointing (chicken sagg) . After three or four spoons I was done . Waiter even asked me if I enjoyed my food but I couldn't be transparent then and there so I'm here now with this review . Less would've been more in regards to this entree . They tried too hard with incorporating too much extras and the spinach ended up not even being detectable . I requested the food be mild and it had some spiciness to it as well which I hated . As for the other stuff their mango lassi was average as were the onion and cauliflower pakoras . There was no differentiating the two in regards to taste which needs to be questioned . The starts of the meal which were far and few were the lamb rolls and chicken samosas .

As an Indian, the portions were large (which is appreciated) but the food was a bit odd tasting - baingan bharta had absolutely no flavor and saag paneer was ok. Service and ambiance were nice, but I was hoping for more flavorful and authentic food given the high ratings.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Delicious food and excellent service always at this place. Can't get enough fog this place
No comment
No comment

Some seriously excellent Indian food that we were excited delivered to Park Slope through Uber Eats! Everything was 1 notch spicier than expected so it was not what I would call kid-friendly, but that just meant more for the adults to enjoy. Delicious lamb korma, excellent lamb rolls and tikka masala. We tried to order dishes for all to enjoy but next time we'll branch out. I will say that the portions were a nice size so we enjoyed this for a number of days after delivery. Happy to find a great delivery option for really excellent Indian food.
No comment
No comment

We came here quite early for lunch. The restaurant was still empty at that time. After a meal, this became my favorite Indian restaurant. Service here is great, the staff were very tentative. And food is all amazing. We ordered the lunch pre-fixe meal which comes with an appetizer, entree, and dessert, which I ordered butternut squash soup, chicken saag, and galub jamun. In addition we also ordered the atithi special platter (with chicken & vegetable samosa, lamb spring roll, and pakora), chicken briyani, and garlic naan. We LOVE everything we ordered. Portions were large, so it is well worth it!

My friend live in the neighborhood, and took me to this Indian place for the first time . Great deal $18 come with app , entrees and dessert. So we have 2 set of this prefix lamb and chicken dish was very spicy we got sweat in a good way. Mango drink , it's tasty yummy like a mango smooth milkshake. I love little touch of some crispy bread and spicy tamarind sauce they serve right after we sat down. We wait about 15 mins for the table tho. So they are busy , make a reservation guy. Service was super nice and the restaurant is very clean that what I like most about this place .
No comment

Wonderful and warm restaurant, the staff here are so kind and attentive. The food is authentic and will satisfy your craving for Indian food. Had the lamb samosas and chicken tikka masala. Friendly note, when they say very spicy.. it's VERY SPICY so please choose accordingly. I get the regular spice and I think that's perfect. Not too spicy and full of flavor. Also had the mango lassi and love that it's not very sweet, more in the tangy yogurt side. Really great Indian restaurant will def be back!
No comment

Have only had takeout from here but holy cow!! This place is wonderful! Every dish I've had comes super hot, the flavors are rich, the chicken is never over cooked, the naan is chewy and perfect. Everything here is 10/10.

I ordered takeout from here and it was good. Nothing special. Classic dishes and cooked well and spice levels were on point. Items were packaged well. I would order again or actually go here to experience the service and ambiance. Def order from here if craving Indian food!
No comment

This was my first time eating here and I can only say good things! I've been wanting to come here for a while, after seeing only positive reviews - and boy, I'm glad I did. The staff is friendly and the service is great, the food is flavorful and well priced, and everything came in large portions (I took home a good amount of leftovers). I had the Coconut Naan (definitely recommend) and Cheese Naan, as well as the Vegetable Samosa (delish) and Chana Masala (packs the heat ). Everything was absolutely amazing - can't wait to come back and try some new dishes!
No comment

I threw my husband a surprise birthday dinner last Saturday night at Atithi and it was amazing. The staff was incredibly helpful, nice, and very accommodating. They also set up the decorations and the table for me! Not to mention, the food was delicious! The highlight of the night was when they brought out the cake and played the birthday song while flickering colorful lights throughout the restaurant. All the guests had a wonderful time and we can't thank the Atithi staff enough! You made my husband's birthday a memorable one!

Absolutely recommend coming here! Food is delicious and prices are great, especially for Williamsburg. I highly recommend ordering the appetizer platter, it's like 4 different appetizers you get to try and everything is amazing (I particularly enjoyed the vegetarian samosas and the lamb roll). Chicken tikka masala was a tiny bit dry but the sauce was good, nice balance of spices. My friend had the vindaloo and when they say spicy, they REALLY mean spicy. Finally, the garlic naan was wonderful, simultaneously fluffy and crispy.
The dim lighting and tea light candles make this place so inviting abs charming. The food is an explosion of flavors. Absolutely delicious Indian cuisine. Saving this restaurant to my NY must haves.
No comment

The service and food were both absolutely incredible!!! I got the saag paneer, garlic naan, and limeade and everything was so well done. We were also very well attended to and everyone who served us was so kind! Definitely recommend!
No comment
Super good food, attentive staff and very clean. It was lovely to dine here before walking over to Brooklyn Steel for our gig

Update:  Had takeout dinner from Atithi after not visiting for awhile and it was even better .  You can't beat their Fixed Price special meals.  Great curries, samosas, bread, and dessert.  Still the best Indian food in Williamsburg!
Great food, excellent customer service, the staff is very attentive, constantly refilling our water, bringing napkins and checking in.
No comment

Pretty nice Indian restaurant in Williamsburg with a nice ambiance. Came around 5ish and was seated right away, as well as given a complimentary appetizer, with two really tasty sauces that were unfortunately snatched away. We ordered garlic naan, chicken tikka masala, and aloo chana paneer. Everything came shortly after we ordered. You can choose the spiciness level of the entrees, and we chose regular, but it was already quite spicy. The garlic naan was great, crispy, soft, and flavorful. I enjoyed the chicken tikka masala. It was pretty saucy and creamy, yet I do think the chicken may have been a bit overcooked. I liked the aloo chana paneer too, but I do wish there were more paneer cubes and potatoes than chickpeas, which I felt like I was eating mostly, Also, both were a tad bit spicy to my liking, but I also do not have good spice tolerance. Luckily, the waitstaff was constantly refilling my water, and the water was ice cold and refreshing. After we finished our food, they seemed to be setting up candles for dinner time. All in all, I did enjoy my experience at Atithi, but I would not recommend it to those who have a horrible spice tolerance.
Fabulous food and excellent service. Loved every minute of my meal and dining experience. Highly recommended.
Super tasty, friendly service, best Indian food in Brooklyn.
Food was great, service was great and Ambiance is just what you would expect honestly.
No comment

Food was absolutely delicious and the serving sizes were perfect especially considering the price. Great value and lovely and attentive customer service. BYOB vibe was great and it was pretty busy and everyone seemed pleased!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Finally a well above average for Indian cuisine in Williamsburg. Delicious fresh and flavorful. If you ask for medium, it will be spicy! If you want Indian food in Williamsburg, look no further, this would be the only place I would recommend.
AmaZing food and vibesss. The chicken masala was soooo good and I love the rice. Service was a bit slow however, waiter was super nice with recommendations
No comment
No comment
Finally found a great Indian restaurant in Brooklyn; most are just ok. This place was terrific.
No comment

I've been searching for great Indian restaurants in New York for a long time, and Atithi is easily my favorite I've tried so far. I got the chicken tikka masala, garlic naan, and the samosas and everything was phenomenal. I only wish they delivered to Manhattan so I could eat their food more often!
Cozy restaurant with amazing choices of food with and big portions. Very happy I found this place as I don't eat meat and they have various different dishes to choose from.

I was never the biggest fan of Indian food but my boyfriend convinced to go to Atithi with him and I have become the biggest fan. Out of all the Indian spots that I've gone to, this one definitely takes the crown. The staff is super nice too!
Got the chicken tikka masala and garlic naan. Delicious and would definitely recommend if you have a craving!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

This place is amazing! I've been looking for a great Indian spot in the area FOREVER and this is it. It's nicely decorated, staff was lovely, mint chutney was great, lamb kebabs were excellent and tender, everything had a good level of spice. I'm a huge fan of spicy food so love when a place can deliver and make my eyes water. I'll absolutely be back

What a delicious restaurant! I had the pleasure of having the saag paneer, vegetable samosa and rasmalai for dessert. I love Indian food but never had this dessert before and enjoyed it very much. It's not a typical cheesecake and the cardamom flavor is a very pleasant surprise. Looking forward to dining here again soon.
Yes yes yes. This was so amazing. As a Brit I miss good Indian food and nyc finally has some. BYOB and super cheap!! We paid $30 per head and ate eso much

Atithi Indian Cuisine is a rock solid choice when looking for Indian cuisine in Williamsburg. The prices are reasonable, the portions are generous, and the food is delicious. The inside of the restaurant has a nice and intimate aesthetic. Staff is very friendly and mindful. Customer service is excellent and the staff wears masks. I ordered the saag paneer, vegetable samosas, and  a dessert. All items were delicious and well seasoned. My favorite was the saag paneer. The spice level was medium and the spinach was fresh. I'll definitely go back to Atithi.

So glad I found this spot, it's likely going to be my go-to for Indian in the neighborhood. My friends and I went for the Lunch Special, which was a great deal considering the portions. Even the samosas we got as the included appetizer were huge. Everything was delicious and fresh, and I liked that you can customize your preferred level of spice for each dish. Chicken tikka masala is one of those "basic" dishes that can be forgettable, but Atithi's was the best I've ever had. Super tender meat in a rich sauce. We also got Coconut naan on the side, which I'd never had before, and it had just a perfect touch of sweetness. To top it all off, our server was incredibly attentive and cordial.

Everything was absolutely amazing. The wait staff is so incredibly kind & attentive. The food was absolutely delicious. Chicken samosas & lamb spring roll were just fantastic. Chicken curry was spiced perfectly & the naans where perfectly cooked. Cannot wait to come back again.
I got the chicken tikka masala and it was really good, very flavorful. The veggie samosas were also really good, and they were huge too.
No comment
Delicious Indian restaurant! Amazing food and service!! We enjoyed the chicken tikka masala and the aloo gobi. It was delicious and I highly recommend it!
No comment
We stopped in for lunch and it was absolutely delicious! The food and service were perfect. The portions were huge and the lunch special is a great deal. Will definitely come back!
Best Indian cuisine I've ever had! The staff is so lovely and kind as well!  The spices are so fresh and the flavors are popping.
No comment

Yum. I really enjoy this place. I was introduced to this place by a Yelp Elite event a have since been back for some more takeout. They are really quick and had my order ready earlier than expected. The lamb spring rolls are a must have! Each order comes with 2 and WOW, they're extremely flavorful and also very filling. The chicken samosas are also really yummy! They dough tastes very fresh, as if it was rolled out as I ordered. The cheese naan is extremely tasty! It was my 1st time trying cheese naan, as I always stick to garlic or plain. The shrimp curry and the shrimp biryani were delicious! I asked for my curry very spicy, and boy did they deliver! I will definitely return to dine in and try other menu items.

Wow! I was extremely impressed by this place! The food was amazing and the service was great! I was also impressed by the price for the lunch special! We got so much food for so little! This place is also BYOB so we bought our own beers. Everything we ordered was 5 stars! Make sure you try the Butternut Squash Soup. I never had it before but decided to try it, I loved it. The garlic naan was also to die for. I will definitely be coming back very soon!
No comment

please excuse my presentation i just wanted to eat lol. i picked up my food and from the train rode home i was ready to eat. everything smelled good. i kept going over the menu before i went and i am satisfied with my options. a little spicy but i'll make it. nice spot too. very attentive hosts as well. gave me some nice cold water while i was waiting for my food. decor is warm. i dipped my chicken samosa in the red sauce and its very good. green sauce was too much for me. i also had the chicken curry and rice and it was very good as well. i can see me going back
Delicious Indian food and great service! I love that they take reservations and a rare Byob in NYC!
No comment

Excellent authentic Indian food! This place is fairly new to the neighborhood but the service is amazing! Their Chicken Tikka Masala is sooo good! They also have a great lunch special! Welcome to the neighborhood! Can not wait to return!

Amazing food and great service! Really enjoyed their prix fix menu (only $18 for an app, entree, and dessert for dinner). I will definitely be coming back for the lunch special ($10 for the same). The lamb spring rolls and chicken samosas were fresh, flavorful, and so delicious! We tried the chicken tikka masala which was great and the saag paneer was a lighter version than others in the area but so good (and more my preference). I've previously tried their chicken vindaloo which is very spicy and flavorful as it should be! The kheer and rasmalai desserts were also great. Really wonderful service as well, definitely check them out!
No comment
Excellent service, waiters were always refilling water and handing us fresh napkins. Food was also excellent

Small, unpretentious restaurant with very good food. Service is friendly and helpful. Most dishes arrive quickly and are not sitting around. The best part is that the food tastes authentic and is better than the majority of the south Asian places in the area. Highly recommended.

Great food and service! Think this will be my new go to place for Indian food. Ordered the chicken tikka masala lunch special and the tandoori mixed grill. Lunch special was only $9.95 and it came with a choice of samosa! Can't beat this price! They even have a prifix which we'll try next time. Friendly staff:)
No comment

Can't say enough positive about Atithi. The food is fantastic and one of the few, few places where very spicy means that, though they have less spicy options. The owners and employees are very nice and gracious. Sometimes they are busy so there may be a wait, but that just speaks to the quality and demand. When I moved to live in a different area, this was top 3 among things I would miss.
No comment

We never had stellar Indian cuisine in Williamsburg--until now. Atithi is a wonderful establishment, friendly staff, and well-spiced and seasoned fare. The lunch specials are absolutely reasonably priced for the amount of delicious food you get. I often have leftovers that will take me through 2-3 sittings. I often get their vegetarian samosa and aloo gobi matar. Highly recommend. And do yourself a favor and try their coconut naan: delicious!
No comment
Great service. Very clean restaurant. Appetizers and lassi were good. The curries lacked flavor and tasted the same.

Atithi is my daughters favorite restaurant. We often order the naan, pekora, chana masala, chicken Tikka masala, chicken biryani, lentil soup and basmati rice. Everything is super delicious, cooked to perfection. Their portions are huge and their delivery service is super fast. The staff is super courteous, friendly and welcoming. When I dine in with my daughters; they are  some nice and very engaging. So please do not believe the false accusations made by a group of disgruntled individuals that are not real customers of Atithi.

The service is amazing and the food is so good. The basmati rice is already vegan (tsk tsk the other place up the block on grand who constantly gets my order wrong). I love the medium spice chana masala w extra plum sauce
Very delicious food, I would definitely come again. Also they have great vegan options.
No comment

This new Indian restaurant is off to an amazing start. We have ordered 3 times since they opened on 04/26/21. The chicken biryani is full of flavor and the chicken is so tender. The yellow lentil soup Mulligatawny was very tasty and perfect for today's rainy weather. The chicken Malai Kabab was by far one of the tastiest, healthiest and delicious options. The portions are very generous and I don't doubt that soon this new Indian restaurant will be booming with more customers. Best Indian restaurant in Williamsburg. Thank you Atithi and welcome to Williamsburg

Get takeout and delivery from here whenever I'm in the area. The best Indian food in Williamsburg imo. Love the chana saag and the samosas are huge and amazing. Portions are great as well- love the delivery dinner special. Will definitely visit in person too since they are byob.
I've been once for dinner and once for lunch. Both times the food has been outstanding. The service is great. Highly recommend
Amazing food - Amazing service - if you come to Williamsburg  and don't come here you are missing out !!! Ram is the best server and his recommendations are amazing !!!!

Yesterday, I took a walk to find something to eat and I stumbled across this cute restaurant and I ate here for lunch. It was such a pleasant break in my day. Bithi was my server and she was so kind and attentive to anything I needed. I ordered Rogan Josh lunch special which came with a vegetable samosa. The food was fresh and delicious. It also was a generous portion because I took some home for leftovers which I will be eating today.  I'm excited to bring my family next time!

As the world is slowly reopening I decided to take my crew out to eat. We came upon this restaurant by accident.  The restaurant we intended to go to was closed for a private party, we saw this restaurant and walked in. I want to start by saying that this was the best decision of the day. The waiting staff was both welcoming and friendly.  My party was made up of seven people (two adults and five children), they helped us pick out the best dishes for picky eater. Everyone left happy, full and a appreciation for Indian food.
Very good vegan/vegetarian options. The pakora is amazing. HUGE portions--my partner and I share a main every time. Their prices are very reasonable, too!

I love this place so much   I don't order Indian dishes from anywhere else now. I've only ever ordered delivery but eventually I would like to dine-in, it looks like a really happy and pleasant space. Every delivery I've had, the food is incredible - it warms my spirit - never ever had a bad meal :)
No comment

food is always amazing and the delivery guy is always on time I believe his name is Steven I had to ask because he so nice fast friendly I wanted to leave a review he makes ordering at this place so much easier amazin restaurant and fast delivery

The food and service here were both fantastic! One of the best new places we have tried lately. The lamb and chicken were both cooked perfectly and the sauces had incredible flavor. Would definitely recommend. Thank you to the lovely waitstaff as well.

Good food! When I ordered the saag paneer and they asked if I wanted it spicy or mild, I knew that I was in the right place. So many Indian places waterdown their wonderful and unique spices to accommodate more palettes. For me, spicy is good! The fact that they could adjust to your taste was important too.  I ordered takeout and the service was great. They even threw in a free mango lassi to cool off the chicken vindaloo which was very tasty!  I will definitely come again!
No comment
What an amazing spot . Service is amazing . Food is spectacular ! Price is so on point!

Atithi has a nice vibe. The wait staff are very attentive and friendly, and the decor is pleasant. We got our standards, the chicken tikka masala and the lamb saag, and Atithi did then very well. There was plenty of meat in each dish, and it was moist and tender. They don't pull their punches with the spiciness (even at the regular level), but I like that. We'll probably be back.

This has the best Indian food in New York City. You really should go here. Every dish I ordered was good from the samosas to the butter chicken. The tandoori mix was also very good. Anything on the menu is excellent.
No comment

Amazing amazing amazing. Can't believe this addition to the area. I'm no pro but have definitely tried every Indian place in wburg. This is made w love and so fresh. Presentation is superb and this is a review based on takeout / delivery. I believe the actual restaurant is BYOB which is so fun. Love !

I am so glad we decided to try Atithi last minute. It has become our go to for Indian food. We have tried almost every dish and I have to say I haven't been disappointed at all. Not only is the food great but the ambiance and  attentive staff make it worth the trip from Red Hook. I recommend trying the Atithi Special Platter, you get to try a variety of appetizers. The food portions are great for sharing or taking home. The soups are well seasoned and fulfilling. I love that they offer numerous vegetarian dishes that are just as flavorful.
No comment
Best Indian spot in Williamsburg! I depend on this place for take out and it never disappoints.

I visited this place on Sunday for dinner, and I've found my new favorite Indian food restaurant! The place is super clean and quaint. The staff is very friendly and super attentive. And last but not least the food is delicious with just the right amount of flavor, spice and portions. I'd highly recommend the Lamb rolls which were delicious (I almost ordered a second batch but my girl friend told me to stop being greedy ). If I could I'd give this place more stars!
Incredible experience food is authentic delicious and plentiful. Would highly recommend coming here.

First time ordering delivery tonight and it was excellent. We tried a number of items and none disappointed. The ability to customize the spice level is great for a household where everyone doesn't enjoy the same amount of spice. The standouts were the lamb biryani, chicken tikka, and the samosas (both).  The naan was also outstanding.
Incredible food at affordable prices! They've even given extra items the last couple of times I've ordered. Very generous and kind staff.

You need to try this place. Definitely the best Indian place in NYC! Lamb Rogan Josh is amazing. I had some garlic naan as well which was perfectly crisp and gooey. You can tell everything is carefully prepared with love and is an amazing price! Would give 6 stars if possible.

I popped in this place randomly cause l was so hungry, and omg. The food was really amazing, perfect balance of spices. I'm so glad l discovered this place. The staff is also super friendly. Will be back for sure.
No comment

It was a wonderful ambiance with incredibly attentive service! We were warmly greeted and were served some popadoms immediately. The three course pri fix was wonderful. The butternut squash soup and chicken samosa were hot and plentiful and full of flavor. The lamb saag and chicken tikka masala were hearty and portions were plentiful. The plain naan was incredibly fresh and was absolutely the best naan we've ever had.

I ordered takeout from Atithi a couple of days ago and I can't stop thinking about it! It was so delicious, I'm excited to try other options on their menu. The chicken biryani & chicken tikka masala were incredible. You can customize the spice level on the tikka masala and we got mild- it wasn't super spicy and had a slight tingle when you eat it. The sauce was so good and creamy. The biryani wasn't customizable for spice, so it was regular spice- it was definitely much spicier than the tikka, but it was delicious!! You can really taste all the flavors and herbs they use. I can't wait to stop by when i'm in the neighborhood again!

Absolutely loved it! Such friendly staff and delicious food! We ordered using their prix fix special of a 3 course for $17.95. This is an UNHEARD OF deal, and the quality of food was far beyond anything I was expecting for that price! I had their butternut squash soup, chicken tikka masala, and rasmalai and it was absolutely delish!! Definitely recommend and I will certainly be back! Thank you, Atithi!!

Brought my family here for lunch today... what a great find!  Super clean and excellent service. AND, the food was absolutely delicious. The $10 lunch specials are amazing in quality and quantity:  We were looking for  Indian food comparable to the Indian food we had at Dishoom in London and this place was spot on. Definitely worth the trip to Williamsburg.

I placed a delivery order over the phone. The customer service was very kind and friendly and my order got to me almost exactly at the delivery time they gave me. Portions were very generous and the food was great! I like spice so I went for the medium option on both plates and was happy - though I will say it's probably better to go mild if you're not into actual "runny nose" spice. I'll definitely be getting food here again!

Run don't walk to Atithi Indian Restaurant on Grand St.  Our lunch there today was fantastic and Rahm, the owner,  made it even more special with his gracious service.  As lovers of Indian cooking we've tried many restaurants across the boroughs and the quality of all of the dishes we tasted today ( Somosa, Chicken Tikka Masala, Lamb Saag, Cilantro Nan) were superb.  Generous portions and lunch/dinner specials will keep you coming back for more.  We're so happy to have discovered this relatively new restaurant!

SO delicious! My boyfriend is from Pakistan and doesn't typically like Indian/Pakistani food in America but this is the first place he liked. The curry is nice and thick and has a good amount of spice. The servers are attentive as well! The naan is also crisp and fluffy and not too oily/buttery. I do recommend!
No comment
They were off to a winner when the started with real popadoms. All dishes were exceptional, and it's BYOB. Excellent curry spot.
Best Indian food in Brooklyn. I've had several of their dishes and they have all been excellent. Very friendly staff as well- must try!
Got take out from here and the food was amazing. The appetizer platter was very good and great price. Chicken Tikka Masala was amazing too.
No comment

Cool East Village Dinner Night Out, crushed it for entertaining our out-of-town guest who love Viet cuisine but were floored by the take on the dishes here.  The ambiance of the awesome interior decor really set the mood for a fun night out as well.  Service was impeccable!  Such loving service!!!!!
No comment

Excellent food.  Beef shank was enormous and tender, though requiring a balance of white rice and for the sauce to fully immerse the inner portions of meat.   Fried okra was exquisite and the bone marrow dish was amazingly rich.
No comment
No comment

Whew chile, when I tell you the food here is REALLY GOOD, its the truth. I came for a date night one evening and we ordered the Goi Ga and the Roasted Bone Marrow. You would think that you couldn't elevate the taste of bone marrow but I was mistaken. Not only was it flavorful but it paired well with the bread. Chef's Kiss for sure. The chicken in the Goi Ga was so flavorful and juicy that I'm still thinking about it one week later. As for entrees, we got the BBH Beef Shank and it was a flavor explosion in my mouth. It was so much food that we had to take 75% of it home. The ambiance was very cute and the lighting made it a perfect spot for a date. This spot has solidified itself for top of my list and I will be returning.
No comment
No comment

Came here on a Saturday night with a reservation. It is not a big restaurant and was pretty packed, so I definitely recommend making a reservation. We were sat at the back of the restaurant and had ample space. Ordered a bunch of dishes including the banh mi board, monsieur platter, roasted bone marrow, ba's grilled shrimp, com chien cua, and the beef shank. Banh mi board came out first, and boy, it was delicious. Basically a deconstructed banh mi. Monsieur platter was good too, but wasn't anything amazing. The shrimp and bone marrow were exceptional and everyone at the table agreed. The plate that didn't really impress me was the beef shank. It was bland and lacked flavor for me, and my fiance agreed. And the price tag.. $125 lol I'd go again and order everything except the beef shank and platter. Oh, and drinks were on point too.
No comment
No comment

I came here for dinner on a Saturday and surprisingly we didn't have to wait at all without a reservation! I loved the vibe of the restaurant and the food was so good! We ordered the grilled shrimps (so tasty I wanted more!), roasted bone marrow (so yummy! One of my favorite), and the Monsieur platter (a little twist to classic spring rolls! The meats were good!). The cocktails were amazing! They literally tasted like juice (dangerous!). I definitely want to come back here and try their other items on the menu!

Came here for a birthday and it was so good! We got the banh kot, Monsieur Platter, and the bone marrow. It was very filling for two people. I recommend the Monsieur platter it's like a diy summer roll, delicious and fun. Service is super friendly and attentive.
No comment
No comment
No comment

I had a good experience here with a couple of nitpicks that are really just personal preferences. The marrow has a nice salty texture on the surface. It has a nice kick and might be a little too salty on it's own but the baguette cuts it very nicely. The crispy rice did crispy rice things and that Vietnamese sausage and anchovy had that bacon effect (where it just makes things better). The okra was flavorful but i like my fried Okra to not be so wet - i would have preferred the dressing to be a dip. I'll eat this place again.
No comment
Great casual ambiance. Laid back. Tables were very close together. Fast service. Bone marrow was the fave of the night.

Everything was so delicious, the com chay was my favorite along with the fish. The ambiance was super cute and the owners were very friendly , loved this place! Will definitely come back on my next trip back to NYC!
No comment
Beef shank is a must!  Great place for sharing dishes with friends. Fun atmosphere and the service was perfect.
No comment

No comment
No comment

I can't fathom giving this establishment anything less than five stars, the food is absolute amaze. fresh, unique and loaded with flavor, it's no wonder this place had a line halfway down the block. was certainly worth the wait!

I received the wrong item in my to-go bag so I couldn't come back to get it replaced. They were not even busy at this time so not sure why they would get something so simple so wrong. the sandwich I received was very dry, bland, and not worth the $11 they charged me. Furthermore, the girl taking my order got a bit of a condescending tone with me for no reason. would never come back ‍
Good flavors (mostly) but overpriced. Falafel is not that great! Lol. Shawarma is good. Side of potatoes are ridiculously portioned.
No comment
Definitely a great option for a casual coffee/lunch in Greenpoint. It's expensive, but that's almost a given at these distinctly quaint backyard places. I'll be back!
No comment

No comment

Every time I go here I regret it. They are just so unpleasant. There are so many other places in the area with friendly and nice staff. And, I work in the service industry as well so it takes a lot for me to write a bad review. I know it doesn't matter but -ew gross be nicer to your customers.
No comment
Used to be great. But came after covid and food was decidedly worse and people seem to care less :( sad

Enjoyed a delicious and chill lunch at Cafe Alula this weekend. We ate in the peaceful backyard garden. I loved my fattoush and side of labneh and za'atar pita. I highly recommend spreading the labneh on the freshly baked za'atar bread!  The menu has many other tempting options (e.g., mushroom shwarma!) so looking forward to coming back to try more!

One of the worst place.  Stay away.   Very rude waitress. They have wifi and not sharing.    The beverage is ok.   Avoid this place. So many nicer places around.   The morning lady is super super rude.   Not respect for foreigners.  Even going to the restroom, she's yelling at consumers.

Love this neighborhood spot! The falafel salad is amazing as is their smoked salmon sandwich. If you're coming for a coffee make sure to try the halloumi croissant with it - perfect combo. There is usually a line around lunch time but haven't had any issues with finding a seat in the front seating on the street or the back garden. I love the rose lemonade and they've also got a solid cold brew. The bill can come with a bit of a sticker shock when you start adding drinks to items that run you between $12-15 dollars but I've found the quality of food to be worth it.
No comment
No comment
Halwa latte was super delicious . Around the corner from my place I'll be back to try more.  Very inventive dishes here. Friendly service.
Wow incredible food, beautiful atmosphere and back patio. Even the plates out food was served on were beautiful. Got the halloumi and egg as a bowl and it was soooo good
Best place in the neighborhood for a quick lunch. Definitely a hidden gem. Get the raspberry cookies
No comment
This place is amaaaaazing.  The food is SO good.  Everything is homemade from scratch and you can taste the love.  Staff is very friendly and helpful.  I feel at home here.  Highly recommend!
No comment

No comment
No comment

Hands down the best brunch spot in the NYC area. I've been here a couple of times and I always have such a hard time choosing 1-2 items-- I always end up picking a handful. There are so many options! The food is fresh, plated beautifully, and delicious. The coffee is also great. The space is cute and very cozy( probably not a great spot for a big group).
No comment

Excellent food! Definitely recommend the mushroom shawarma and fattoush salad with grilled Halloumi. Staff was VERY friendly and helpful, especially the adorable girl that worked the window (think Amy Winehouse!)  Enjoyed our food and Rose lemonade in their lovely back garden. Can't wait to back!
I'm so happy I tried this place out! The food is delicious. It kind of reminds me of Batata in Windsor Terrace, Bk. I look forward to returning.

Hidden in the depths of hard-to-reach Greenpoint, Cafe Alula is a gem in the rough, with a lovely indoor space and gorgeous outdoor backyard patio. What's better than the space is the food. This was easily some of the best Mediterranean grub I've had in New York. It was hard deciding what to order because everything sounded amazing - they have a veg-friendly menu chocked full with salads, sandwiches/wraps, bowls, etc. - but I opted for the baked falafel bowl, complete with delicious roasted vegetables on a bed of rice, served with dolmas (my favorite). I also got the rose lemonade, which was less sweet than expected but refreshing nonetheless. It was a beautiful, wholesome meal that I would easily trek back out to Greenpoint for, especially to enjoy the outdoor seating area while it's still nice out.
Delicious and large menu which accommodates many preferences. Unpretentious vibes and tasty savory eats for any time of the day.

This small cafe was very cute and the food was amazing. We came for lunch and it was a bit of a challenge to find a table. After we placed our order, we had to walk towards the back outdoor area which was pretty small but great atmosphere. We ordered the Za'atar Avocado toast and the eggplant sandwich. I wanted to try the halloumi crossiant; however, it was sold out. If you want to try the halloumi crossiant then the earlier you come the better. Please let me know how it is if anyone tried it. The presentation of the Za'atar Avocado toast was amazing and the taste was amazing as well. I believe that the toast is the most important part and it passed my expectations. I would recommend giving this a try. On the other hand, I did not like the eggplant sandwich. I felt the flavor was overpowering. I am not sure if this is just me but this is how I felt after a few bites.

I recently relocated to Greenpoint (temporarily) and this was one of the first places I stopped in the morning to try out a breakfast item. Their croissants are amazing! They have four different flavors. I've tried the almond, chocolate and za'atar and they've all been fresh and still warm. The place always has people in line. Looking forward to trying some of their other items.
Sooo good! I'm not vegetarian but I really enjoyed my sandwich and Kambucha. Really nice terrace!
No comment

My favorite spot in the neighborhood. The zaatar croissants especially are otherworldly, but everything here is amazing. The orange blossom chia bowl, the salmon sandwich and the whitefish tarragon sandwiches are my go-tos. Friendly and sweet staff. Outdoor seating is perfect - not too enclosed, air travels well, seats distanced. This place is a freaking gem.
I look forwards coming to alula every time I get the chance. The food is out of this world and everyone that works here treat you like family. Also the vibe is chill af

Such a sweet little spot! The food here is delicious and they have so many vegan and vegetarian options, which I really appreciate. If you order in person, they also usually have baked goods that are not on the online menu.
No comment

Everything here is good, from the baked treats on the counter to the bowls and sandwiches. I am so glad to have such a delicious Mediterranean option available. I  working my way through the whole menu but I have had the haloumi and harissa breakfast sandwich, which is very tasty and not spicy; the eggplant breakfast sandwich, red lentil bowl, and cauliflower shwarma. All were truly scrumptious. I have no complaints here except that sometimes the pita sandwiches are a little bit messy. If they have croissants on the counter when you go, GET ONE, THEY ARE UNREAL. There is also a cute backyard.
No comment
lovely outdoor seating. very much enjoyed my rose matcha latte and egg and halloumi breakfast sandwich. anywhere that serves grilled halloumi is ok in my book

Very cute cafe in Greenpoint with lots of Mediterranean dishes! I came here today to do some work and ordered the Hummus & Egg Bowl as well as a Flat White and croissant. The hummus bowl was very filling and flavorful and included pita chips.
No comment
Super good food and very nice people. Small spot, but worth it. 100% coming back. There's a nice patio area that looks good for the warm weather. The breakfast wrap was AH-mazing.
Highly recommend the Indian curry bowl, it was full of flavor & delicious. Also recommend their blossom tea & matcha lattes!
No comment
No comment

absolutely love that i stumbled on this spot as i'm not typically this far over on franklin. we almost never pass it up now & go out of our way to eat here when in gpoint/wburg. so far we're stuck on their amazing tuna & falafel but have tried a couple of other things {like the chia pudding!} which have also been delicious. highly recommend

Unbelievable food and staff. It's easy to find healthy food and easy to find great tasting food, but to have them both at the same time is a bit trickier to find. Cafe Alula does just that. Great taste, healthy options, with a cozy and warm environment. Will definitely be back!
Surprised that the food wasn't that great here. It's always packed. The iced coffee was great, though. Would come back for coffee.

I came to visit Brooklyn for my birthday last week, and Cafe Alula became the star of every morning. The coffee is ridiculously good--Miami can't touch the brews here in Brooklyn. The oat milk alternative was insanely delicious, nothing like the watered down flavors of almond or coconut milk. And the food-OMG-the Avocado Za'tar sandwich or toast (you win either way!) became part of my daydreams. So delicious, flavorful, and lovingly made. There was a girl who was working there with short blonde hair, the nicest human we made contact with in Brooklyn. We came back again and again not only for the food, but for the service experience. 10/10 would recommend Cafe Alula to anyone looking for an unpretentious 5 star cafe experience.

I couldn't decide what to order & the lovely gal at the till kindly advised. The egg & haloumi harissa sandwich is the tastiest sandwich I've had in years. My regret is I don't come to Greenpoint often, because if I did I would be here weekly. Everything I saw come out of the kitchen looked tempting, and the coffee was excellent.
In neighborhood of pretty basic brunch food, this Lebanese cafe is absolutely yummy, beautiful, and has a pretty large backyard. Also great for vegetarians.
This place is consistently wonderful. Good food, cool, Middle Eastern influenced decor, friendly staff.
Just what the neighborhood needs! Not only amazing coffee but the food is FANTASTIC! Lebanese meets American meets Greenpoint. Go by and give Tony some love!

I can't believe I didn't know this place was here!  I ordered delivery of a tuna melt and a fatoush salad on Caviar.  The tuna melt was the best I have ever had, with cranberries and apples and cheddar.  The fatoush was delicious - perfectly dressed.  Delivery was extremely fast - it was at my door in less than 15 minutes!  I can't wait to visit in person and check out their cute backyard.  Happy to have you in the neighborhood, Alula!
Take back earlier comments. Get a table every time and in their magnificent garden and the food is as great as ever.

Absolutely lovely. Stayed nearby, tried a handful of coffee shops and this was our favorite. Backyard patio was pleasant and quiet. Avocado toast and zataar croissant excellent. Cold brew was nice too.

I recently moved to the neighborhood and frequent this cafe 3x a week. I did my round of all the other coffee shops and brunch spots in the northern part of greenpoint, and this is by far my favorite. All the sandwiches are delicious (love the bread), but I highly recommend the halloumi and harissa egg sandwich.

Just had coffee here this morning. Female barista was super helpful and friendly, and made one of the best espressos I've had in the neighborhood. Will come back for food and to enjoy backyard that was very cute and full of beautiful flowers
Small Lebanese cafe that sells amazingly fresh food. Mostly vegetarian (they have few seafood option), with interesting and very tasty options. I love it!

I really hate giving a bad review since it might hurt a small business which I support but I felt the need to write this review since the barista was extremely rude. At first I asked if they can do a matcha latte, the barista rolling her eyes said "ya". You could tell she wasn't in the mood to answer my questions or serve me. I specifically asked for almond milk since I am lactose intolerant. She proceeded to make my matcha latte with regular milk. As she was poring the regular milk I asked mentioned to her that I asked for almond. She said "too bad you did not specify if you want almond milk you will have to order another latte". This isn't a way to treat customers. She had a really bad attitude from the start and didn't want to be there. If you don't want to hurt your business you should looking into changing the people who work for you because they represent your business.

This cafe is a hidden gem! My friend and I stumbled upon this cafe the other morning while looking for a place to have some post-yoga tea and a light breakfast. The food was very delicious and the cafe its self is beautiful and quaint. I cannot wait to come back and try everything on the menu. I'm so happy to have found this spot!
Go to brunch or snack spot in Greenpoint. Their Muhammara and falafel sandwiches are to die for. Probably the best middle eastern food you can get in a few miles radius.

Wow. Delicious. Healthy. Clean. Great service. Wanted to eat the entire menu, settled on kale maple tahini salad (amazing), eggplant and egg in pita (scrumptious) and avocado toast with egg and zaatar (perfection). Coffee cake, still warm from the oven, for dessert. My new favorite brunch in Greenpoint hands down.

I absolutely love their food, it's so perfect. Staff is super nice, and the place is cosy and pretty, can't wait to enjoy the backyard in the summer. I love that it's fast but delicious Mediterranean food, not something that you find everywhere.
Go here and spend all your money! Everything on the menu is great, and the staff works hard to get your food out as fast as possible. It's THE best!
This is a great space to grab a coffee, get a really good breakfast, and work or read a while. The staff is excellent. It's definitely a bit of a Greenpoint gem

This has been my go to coffee spot and lunch spot since they opened a little over a year ago. It's basically my home away from home. Everything is delicious and made with love. The staff is super friendly and Tony the owner is the best! This little gem is one of greenpoints best secrets

Cafe is really cute and service is great but I just ordered the fattoush salad AND even paid $4 to add haloumi cheese and it just wasn't very filling. I think the cheese should come with it or hummus or some other form of protein, also that could justify charging $10 for lettuce and pita croutons.
Amazing food! Friendly staff! Cute location! Don't pass up the opportunity to eat here!
No comment

No comment
Sushi is fresh and generous in the fish. We shared a couple rolls and sashimi. The banh mi was interesting as the ground pork was in a an aspic form. Yummy still but def not traditional nor the best.

Was in town for work and craving sushi. I discovered this place due to Yelp reviews and I love a good food halls. This was not your typical hall, you sit down and the staff takes your order.  Inside, the space is warm and welcoming. My review is strictly on the sushi, I fell in love.  I ordered a Miso soup, it was just right. The Kani salad tasted very fresh and it didn't have a lot of filler which is great. I ordered the scallop special roll and it was amazing.  It had a touch of spicy notes but I love the texture of the scallops and thought everything went well with each other. Will be back. I saw and smelled a lot of Pho

Stopped by to grab a quick late lunch on a Sunday. There was lots of open seating and we decided to sit at the bar. We ordered from the sushi bar but there's a few different places you can order from.  The rolls were all really yummy and I was pleasantly surprised. The speciality rolls all had a unique flavor and the rice to filling ratio was very good.

No comment

3.5 stars but rounding up to 4. I ordered a large late lunch from Bedford Gardens and liked that there were multiple options to choose from: Pho, dumplings, sushi, boba tea, etc. I ordered the Taro Milk tea m, which was tasty, but there was not enough ice and it was quite sweet (more so than just other Taro milk teas I have gotten). It would have been nice to have some customization like at I'Milky. I also ordered the soup dumplings - scallop and pork. I was not a fan of them not offering vinegar and ginger for a standard soup dumpling sauce. I tried to get the hostess's attention but I think she was overwhelmed by the lunch rush. I really missed the ginger and the dumplings were...eh. Maybe a little bland and could have used something. The sushi was very fresh. I enjoyed the toro and salmon avocado lunch special rolls. If I were to come back again, I would just stick with sushi.
