Last night I had a great experience at Sushi Basho inside Bedford Food Hall. Their sushi was so fresh and the presentation unique with all the omakase toppings on their sushi's making it look and taste amazing. I will definitely come back again and recommend to all my friends and families!
No comment
No comment

Do you crave sushi, dumpling, pho, but cannot pick one? Maybe you should seriously consider this place. I was fortunate enough to try this new restaurant last week and the first impression I got was: wow this place is very clean! It may be because they opened not too long ago, but they managed to have very clean and nice lookin restaurant. They also have a very cute garden area in the back, but the only downside was that there were mosquitoes. Anyways, I got to try the momo sampler, chirashi bowl, Giant eel roll and egg custard. First of all, sushi was very fresh and they gave good portion. The Giant eel roll deserved the name giant as it came with big eel on top of the roll, which is usually not the case in other restaurants. The only thing I would recommend is make the batter of dumpling little but thinner if this could be done, but otherwise I enjoyed the experience. Will come back for sure!

All I can say is WOW. Our server was incredibly nice and thoughtful enough to ensure that all of our food was made fresh so it wouldn't be immediate but would be delicious. AND IT WAS INCREDIBLY ACCURATE!! The dumplings to start with were a sampler of chicken, potato, beef and pork. The pork and beef were standouts but the chicken was delicious and the potato was like a steamed samosa, and so delicious. Our main course was a headless shrimp boil and chicken wings. I would definitely come back for the boil - the shrimps were delicious and the sauce was the right amount of heat and salt but not overbearing. The added corn, potato and sausage were fun surprises! My partner wanted to pass along the corn was her favorite part! The price on the boil is very reasonable and we got a lot of shrimp! The wings were no slouch either. They were perfectly fried and so dang delicious. The dessert was the egg custard and was so good, we got one to go! Half off after 5 pm too! The custard was perfectly silky and a great balance of flavor. All in all, just a perfect menu for this event and I will be going back as the sushi looks great too!
Good, fresh sushi at good prices, and the hostess is so sweet. Love it, glad it's near my apt.

The sushi at this place is fantastic- and totally unexpected from an unassuming place entitled Bedford Food Hall. Of course, the name itself is deceptive because this is not really a food hall: it's a restaurant with four different cuisines on offer.  We only tried the momos- beef and pork were good, chicken and veggie were bland- and the sushi, because the waitress curiously steered me away from the shrimp boil that I had been considering. I'm glad she did because the fish was cut so beautifully in the sushi entree and was extremely flavorful, and there was an ample serving of different varieties of fish. It was accompanied by a tuna roll made from nice pieces of tuna. Husband had a shrimp mango roll, which had lovely chunks of tasty shrimp that were not overwhelmed by the mango, and a yellowtail jalapeño roll with tobiko on top that he was extremely happy with. I was too full from my sushi to try a piece.  If you are comfortable dining indoors, sit in their back room-  essentially an enclosed garden that's absolutely delightful. I am only holding off from giving this place 5 stars because I have only been there once and they also were not yet fully operational (liquor license pending and no dessert option the night that we were there).  I'll definitely be back though when I find myself in Williamsburg for something.

Everything was delicious. I recommend the chirashi bowl, big eel sushi and the momo dumplings. The staff was very attentive and nice. The location is only a month old but I can see this having a packed crowd soon
No comment

Just found this spot  been there counting today twice food is great place is clean. Staff  very attentive good experience am recommending you try for your self i mean a sushi spot with an excellent grilled cheez sandwich  how can you go wrong lol seriously very good spot..
No comment

Came in for lunch to go and there was a hair in my chicken corn soup :(((( the ambiance is great, food came out fast, they let me sit at the bar as I waited for my to-go order and even gave me water. Unfortunately I couldn't finish my soup due to the hair. :(

I came with my bf on Sunday night for dinner after visiting the Union Square market. We ordered salt and pepper squid and it was tasty. The batter was light and crispy. We also ordered the dim sum platter aka the Three Kinds of Dumplings which comes with 2 prawn dumplings, 2 Su Mai and 2 Bamboo Fungus dumplings and their Singapore Mai Fun. Service was friendly and attentive.
No comment
No comment

Normally, I am pretty intimidated going into Chinese restaurants, expecting to use Chinese to order food, with the unfounded fear I would be judged for ordering with an American twang. The servers were very nice and attentive when we went in a large group and helped explain the menu to my non-Chinese party members so I would not have to. While I am well acquainted with many of the dishes, especially Xiao Long Bao (also known as soup dumplings) and Chinese broccoli, it was nice to eat upscale Chinese food at the heart of Union Square.

This is the place if you're looking for some fancy and unique dim sum! I came here with my family when we were visiting nyc for the weekend. We ordered about 8 dim sum dishes for the 4 of us and we were pretty full! We ordered the snow white pork buns, Shanghai soup dumplings, crab meat soup dumplings, prawn dumplings, Avocado & shrimp spring rolls, elegant swan puff pastry, salted egg custard buns, and fried pot stickers. Everything was really good! My favorites would have to be the soup dumplings and swan puff pastry! It is on the pricier side but I would definitely come back here!

I ordered Kung Pao Chicken, I have no idea what recipe that  the chef follows to make this dish. It is totally different from traditional Kung Pao Chicken that I have eaten ever in around New York City and the world. It tasted so bad. I have order same from fast food Chinese joints which is better than this one. Horrible. They have the audacity to charge three times the price other restaurants'. DON'T GO THERE, DONT SPEND YOUR MONEY THERE.

Xu's Public House was a bit disappointing. While it markets that it has a bar with specialty cocktails, they seem to only have one bartender and if the bartender is not there then no cocktails. In fairness, the manager will make you a gin and tonic or a martini but that is about. There wine list is very simple, Red or White. The dim sum now seems to be brought in from outside rather than being made in house. With that said, xiaolongbao (soup dumplings) are very good. The rest of the food is also pretty good too except that the sweet and sour pork is made from a very poor cut of pork. Seems to me that they are cutting too many corners.
No comment
Had the cucumber salad amazing had the shrimp wonton soup so good and the ginger beef was delicious and service A+

Lovely servers, big portions, wonderful for sharing, great ambience -- what more is there to say? It's a bit on the pricier side, but we had a wonderful experience. Plus, they bring out oranges at the end! I feel like you can't go wrong with any of the dishes (we really enjoyed the garlic chicken, salt and pepper pork, and scallion pancakes. The egg tarts were fantastic too). I will also say, the value for money is great. As you can see below, the portion sizes are quite nice. Overall, wonderful experience. I'll be back!!
This is a new team operating the restaurant. Different menus but uses the same name and apparently same yelp profile...

Unfortunate that this place is currently closed. It was really good. I went twice and both times everything I had was delicious. It was upscale Chinese food in Union Square. I loved all their dim sum. Their truffle wontons and shumai were delicious. I also loved the giant soup dumplings they serve. Their noodles are fresh. I love the King Crab cold noodle dish. Their salt baked lobster and cheese is really good as well. Their egg yolk buns are definitely what you have to order for dessert. I truly hope they reopen. If they do, definitely check it out!
Overall good quality, attentive service. The food is quite delicate and light. The lobster dish is delicious and good portion for two.
No comment

The food was high quality and came out quickly. The pine one fish was definitely a favorite and very shareable! A bit pricey, but for the quality, it is definitely understandable. We sat near the door so it was cold with everyone walking in and out, but the place was otherwise great! Took a bit to get seated, so I would recommend a reservation.

Clean restaurant and cute ambiance. The service was great even tho the food/drinks took forever to come out. Some dishes looked well decorated while the taste is on the traditional side. The fired eggplant that was recommended as appetizer/veggie dish doesn't look good for picture yet quite tasty.
No comment

No comment
No comment
No comment

Stopped by on the way back from the yankee game with a friend for the "soft-opening" under the new ownership. What a great stop. Beyond the exceptional service the food was delicious. High quality Manhattan Asian cuisine. Would stop by again and recommend to a friend.
Best chinese restraunt in town. Have to come to try, as a Chinese, high recommended the Gulu pork, and dimsum delicious and yummy!

column3: Downtown Jersey City, Jersey City, NJ
column6: I called today inquiring about a private event pricing and a man who picked up was very rude. I asked for the price for 70 people which he responded to $35/person; but according to him it is impossible to buyout the entire restaurant for 70 people. According to him, he can do 50 people. Which then I asked, is it the same price? How much will that be for 50 people? (Thinking there might be a price variance given that there are less people) which he then answered "I already told you it's 35!" And remarked something in Chinese thereafter. What comes next? He hangs up. Given that this place gives an elevated dim sum experience compared to its China town counterparts like jing fong or golden unicorn, the communication and public relations are sub par compared to the latter mentioned. I can attest to that since I am in contact with the other dim sum places and was simply appalled by the impression and representation this man made.
No comment

Very expensive for a dim sum type restaurant. The mushroom xlb was interesting but difficult to eat. I didn't really care for the truffle shrimp dumplings, though my bf was a fan. The pork buns also seemed undercooked... I'm used to a nice sweet glaze on top too, but it just tasted like uncooked dough. Overall, the food was very nicely presented, but just ok taste wise for me. A bit too pricey as well.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

It's really one of my favorite Chinese restaurants in NYC. It's more like a mix of Shanghainess food and Cantonese food. My bf and I ordered crab meat soup dumplings (pretty authentic), and BBQ pork buns, one of their branding dishes. I like the creativity in the BBQ buns although it meets more the taste of Americans. Tao Jiao egg tarts were full of milky flavors (but almost too much). Fish filet tasted fresh and tender. Ginseng soup was not great. But overall I'd like to recommend this place.

To be honest its more like a 3.75. I came here with a friend after seeing all the raving reviews and i was slightly disappointed. Pros are that the restaurant's decor is upscale without being suffocating and they are surprisingly creative with food presentation. The food however are not as impressive. We had ordered the Shanghai soup dumpling, the bbq buns, the shrimp dumplings and the pork bone broth noodles. They were all ok, the best being the bbq bun. This is not to say that the food wasnt good though. The food was not impressive but neither was it disappointing.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

My fiancé found this place and since it's new we decided to try it.  Very nice, modern atmosphere, with a good layout.  Service was great and quick from start to finish.  The menu is authentic Shanghainese and all of the courses were delicious. The truffle wontons and blue crab with rice cakes stood out the most!  We also had an amazing tea with our dinner which was extremely refreshing.  The ribeye entree came out with a bang (see photo) and did not disappoint.  Overall a great experience.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

The food was good overall but overpriced, even with a Yelp coupon. The snow buns are solid tho but nothing was amazing for the price. I feel like you're just paying for the nice decor that you're eating in which isn't what I want but for some it's what they want to pay for so make your choice
No comment

I really have no complaints about this restaurant. Food is an A+, service is an A+, interior design A+ and pricing A+. Xu's Public House is a hybrid between Chinese traditional dishes such as dim sum and soup dumplings, with an American flare. So far I've been here twice (once for lunch and once for dinner) and each time, I try to order something different since their menu is bountiful. I really enjoyed their truffle dumplings, porn buns and dim sum items. When you come for dinner, they provide you with complimentary Hong Kong cakes to start! Two big tips  for this spot, if you check in on yelp, you get 10% off of your original bill and this restaurant is also  BYOB! Reservations are easy to make online as well.
No comment
No comment

Amazing contemporary Shanghainese Restuarant in Union Square. I came in with my friend around 5 Pm and they seated us upstairs that have spacious tables and amazing decor. The manager Kenny was very friendly to come greet us and tell about his restaurant and top dishes to try. We ordered the bbq pork buns, live crab noodles, mushroom Xlb, steamed sea urchin egg, peach jelly egg tarts, live crab rice cakes,  and blueberry yam pudding. Every thing was plated so well. If you want to experience a more upscale Shanghai joint, come here.
No comment
No comment

Some of the food items were over priced I believe but their food quality is pretty good. Some is worth and some is not. We ordered the soup dumplings, was 3 pieces for $9...so I had high hopes of differences but it was pretty typical to me. It was of course good but I had similar ones at cheaper price... However the cold noodles with king crab and uni was reallllly good. Though its like $42 I guess it's worth a try if you care more about the food quality. The noodle texture was perfect and the crab was fresh. Their chrysanthemum tea we ordered was good. I also like the atmosphere here!
No comment
No comment
No comment

The place is just soft opening but gave a pleasant surprise when my husband and I went there last night. Immediately you can tell from the decor and setting at Xu's, the owner's  ambition for an Asian-inspired fine dining experience. Overall, the atmosphere is amazing. For food, we ordered BBQ pork bun, fried wonton for starters and they didn't let us down, especially the BBQ pork bun, you can feel the layers of flavors gradually build in as the pork melts in your mouth. For main course we had King Crab cold noodle with sea urchin-- a taste of summer, I'd say, which reminds me of the good old days by the sea. We also had soup and sea urchin steamed egg, etc. For service, the waiters are very nice but kinda of lack experience, which shall be improved with time. Overall, 5 starts, I'd love to see more experience-oriented modern Chinese restaurants in the city.

Very nice place with decent food! Probably 'g top Chinese restaurants here. The food comes in small portion, and generally not oily/greasy. For cold appetizers, we get blueberry yam and seitan( kaofu). For food, we have special- chicken casserole, rice soup(泡饭), asparagus and mushroom, etc. Fresh ingredients that are not overwhelmed by spices or oil. There are also dim sum items: I would recommend any soup dumplings, snow mountain pork bun and egg tart. The place looks like it's a high-end pricy place. It's moderately priced with byob option if you are into this.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Wonderful upscale Chinese restaurant. The food is picture worthy as well as tasty! Interior is nicely done. Manager came out and chatted with my table. Wonderful chat. Food quality is super nice as well. Certain items made from scratch, how awesome is that. Will definitely be back soon
No comment
No comment

Awesome Shanghai food. I like its upscale decor immediately when walk in. Newly opened. Great place to treat friends and have a party. The service is very attentative from waitress to manager and owner. They are all hands on and take care of customers for any little problems. All food are like an art piece. It has Chinese tradition also fused with American culture. Highly recommended!

Over advertising. mediocre taste and service. I do not feel welcomed at all. We spoke him in Chinese he responded to us in English, so I figured that he did not understand Chinese, so I started to speak English with him, but he responded to me in Chinese.... for the whole time he talked in very low voice including bringing our food. I barely heard him. The food was just OK. Nothing special. But the price was not low at all.

Everything we got here was so delish. Highly recommend the Shanghai truffle wontons. They are to die for. Service is great. Atmosphere is nice and cozy. It's on the pricier side but you can taste the quality so totally worth it.

As a guy borned Guangdong and grown-up in Shanghai, this restaurant made the taste of my memory. I can't i imagine I can taste all these ingredients in such price. If you are a foodie who loves the original taste of the ingredients, you should definitely come and try.
Authentic food from Shanghai. I like the sesame balls desserts the most. Noodle entrees were a little mild on flavor. Overall good experience!

Great dine in experience for Chinese food. Very delicate and delicious dishes with very high food quality. Staffs are super friendly and helpful. Will check it out again in the near future for sure!! Highly recommend this place for high quality Chinese food!!
The environment is great, but the food really tastes mediocre... We went there right after it opens. The kitchen was too busy so they forgot one of the dishes we ordered. Gave us a 50% discount tho.

Beautiful Shanghainese&Asian fusion place hidden at union square west. I was surprised by the skylight on the 2nd floor, stunning decor and fine dining experience. Good place for a date or group gathering. we started with the avocado smoked salmon, a fresh combo of seafood and veggies. Snow mountain BBQ pork bun was amazing, best BBQ bun I have ever had. Different flavored handmade dumplings bring me the memories of what I had in Shanghai years ago, worth to try. The Morchella esculenta chrysanthemum tofu soap and Lobster risotto are very tasty too. Definitely will come back.
Great restaurant with awesome and innovative dish, owner attempted to achieve more than satisfactory experience from all eater.  Return is must.

This is a very disappointing experience. You can tell that the place is trying to be upscale but it lacks attention to details. Examples include the rest room is super dirty, the tea cup they gave to us was broken and filled with dirty cleaning water. Servers are nice but you can clearly tell that they are inexperience as I have to raise my hand for more than 30 seconds for them to notice me. Service is extremely slow. We didn't order much but we ended up spending two hours here for lunch, mostly waiting for food. This is very surprising as the restaurant doesn't seem to be that busy with plenty of empty seats. The foods are just ok, and definitely not worth it considering the wait time. The pork bun is not as good as the ones at Tom Ho Wan. The soup inside Shanghai Soup dumplings is really good but one of our friends from Shanghai said the meat is too lean. She has had better ones in flushing. We are very surprised by the four bubble yelp review. We do not recommend this place and will not come back again.
Food looks pretty but the taste is not local. Not good for Chinese to come here. But the environment is perfect which is quiet and beautiful.
No comment

In the four years I've been in New York, this is the best Chinese food I've had in the city. Beautiful decor and the dishes are Chinese with a modern twist that works really well. They just opened and it's definitely worth the visit before they get too popular.

I ordered a delivery through the RICEPO app. I ordered the ginseng chicken soup which is undrinkable. It was the bitterest thing I taste in my whole life. Since I'm Chinese and I do cook, I know it should be some of a bitterness if u add ginseng in the food, but that soup was wayyyy too much. And there were no sign of saying that this soup is a bitter soup base anywhere through their menu or elsewhere. I asked for help and see if they made a mistake in the ingredient, all I get was the answers like:"drink slow, it is bitter, it's your fault that u can't handle the bitterness". I don't even want a refund from this, but the attitude of the restaurant is just ARROGANT.

The place gives you a high-end vibe when you walk in.  The skylight on the second floor is definitely unique in NYC. However, this is all the positives about this place.  The service is better than average, but waitstaff is very obvious that they don't know much about the menu.  The biggest disappointment is the food.  Almost all the food we ordered are very underwhelming, taste bland and low quality.  I think they try too hard on the presentation, and completely overlooked the taste of the dish.  We will not go back.  There are so many better Chinese food for lower price too.

I wanted to love this place. It has two floors both beautifully decorated. Very cool and comfortable. We went there last night to celebrate two birthdays and we were a table of six. This place doesn't have a liquor license so we brought sake.  We asked the hostess for sake glasses.  She looked as if we had asked for this in a Mexican restaurant. I mean it is an Asian fusion place!  She was not able to offer a glass in lieu of the sake glass. We suggested water or wine glasses. She finally affirmed that she could bring wine glasses!  I mean you advertise you don't have a liquor license.  I would think you would be able to articulate glassware for it!  Then the waitress who honestly responded " I am not good at explaining things" when simple questions about the menu were posed   Then the execution of the dishes!  Forgotten dishes followed by inefficient delivery of the ones that were ready! Like we want two orders of shrimp dumplings and we get one.  In response to where the second one is, we get it's cooking!  At the end when entrees were being brought, 4 people got their dishes and two did not like for 1/2 hour!  We refused it at that point.  After asking to speak to manager they agreed to take the two dishes off the bill. I would think so since you never brought it!  Awful awful awful!  To top it off, the taste of the food is not great. It is meh at best. We are veteran restaurant eaters all New Yorkers.  Worse over all in a looonnnggg time!
Food is great, but needs to work on service. Also no alcohol licence yet... Well go back in a few months time...

Not sure why the host is a grumpy old dude. Not a good first impression when you walk in. Food is very average and bland. Soup dumplings were a huge disappointment. Hand picked crab meat is a nice idea, but really can't tell the difference except the small pieces of shell left in them. 红烧肉太一般，不嫩，没味儿。
I would rate it 4.5 but had to choose between whole numbers.  Refined subtle flavors, lovely presentation, and good service all contribute to a pleasant dining experience.

This is a brand new superb mainly Chinese style restaurant. We had 2 of the teas: five elements and a fruit tea both excellent. All the dishes and soups and appetizers were outstanding and all ingredients very fresh. Also the egg tarts for dessert are not seen outside of China. Highest recommendation for  food and service and modern clean decor.
such a nice place. Food is amazing!!! Please go try the food and enjoy the environment.

This brand new restaurant nearby union square is bound to be a gem once people step inside its doors and realize how incredible it is. The flavors of the food blew our minds, because the attention to detail and quality ingredients really shows. Not sure where to start because everything we had was amazing. My favorite dishes were the uni pastry (buttery uni topped onto a sweet flaky layered pastry) and Orange shrimp (crispy and huge shrimps with a tasty orange sauce). We also loved the Yangchow fried rice. It's made steamed instead of being cooked in a rice cooker which maintains the natural shape and flavors  of rice. This is just an example of how the extra time they put into the quality of the food really pays off. Other things to mention that we're top of the line - steamed egg topped w caviar, tiger prawn and lobster risotto, morchella esuelenta soup dumpling, squid ink shrimp dumplings, five elements tea. Last thing to mention of course is the beautifully designed interior and incredible service. We can't wait to be back as this spot really exceeded our expectations.
No comment

No comment
Yum yum yum!!! Omg these cheeseboards are so good. This was my first time having Georgian food and I'm sad that it took this long. Hard to beat this cheesy heavenly meal!!
No comment
No comment

Bread + cheese = you can't go wrong. Sooooo yummy, get ready for a full tummy. So many different variations of their cheese bread. It was almost impossible to choose! A little pricey, so come prepared for that! Would definitely come back with a group!
No comment

I came here with a few friends on a hot summer day because I've seen there cheeseboats on social media and put it on my list to try. The inside is very cute and I love how it's a very open space. My friend and I shared the Shkmeruli Chicken and really loved it. It's pretty large so I would definitely recommend sharing. The flavors were great and the bread was super soft. Service was great. I'll definitely be back!

First time at the cheeseboat and it was amazing. The service was fantastic - our waiter had recommendations for our table - the beef soup dumplings (the beef and the sauce was on another level) and the classic and steak cheeseboats for 3 people. (1 cheeseboat per person is too much). We loved the egg yolk from the classic cheeseboat, but the steak cheeseboat was the favorite. It came with a red wine sauce that really enhanced the flavor. We will definitely come back to try the Georgian chicken and goulda boats.
No comment
Terrible service! Avoid at all costs. We had a reservation, were seated, and then nobody acknowledged us again, took our order, nothing. They weren't even very busy! We left after 40 minutes!
No comment

Came on a Wednesday night for dinner with my brother and thought this place was pretty solid. Started off the meal with their Khinkali Soup Dumplings. Overall pretty good, although I will say the dumpling wrappers were a bit on the thicc-side. The Mushroom Penovani was great, so much oozy cheese! We asked our server what the best cheeseboat was and he suggested the Steak'n'Egg which is apparently their most popular one. It was pretty good, they really load these boats with cheese. The green cilantro sauce was served with everything which I really liked. Everything we ordered had a very strong umami flavor profile which felt a little redundant by the last dish we got. The green cilantro sauce was the real MVP. Overall good meal though, glad I got to try this place out.

We came on an early Sunday evening before the dinner crowds. Really cute place with lovely decor and a bar. We got the regular cheeseboat which was amazing and the imeruli khatzpouri which was too much for 2. We also got the pork ribs, they were charred and extremely dry, would not recommend. Overall a great place and would come back just for the cheeseboat.
No comment
No comment

This was my second time coming here and the fiod is DELICIOUS. I arrived about 15 min prior to opening and they allowed me to sit inside until the kitchen was open.  My waiter was really nice and took my order.  I was waiting for a while and noticed my waiter had their bag and was saying good bye to the bartender.  They walked out and didn't say anything to me.  I thought that was kind of strange.  I understand if your shift ends but at least let me know and alter me to who I should reach out to for future help.  My god did take about 30 minutes to Arrive but it was extremely tasty.  (I got the Bubba cheeseboat). At the end of the day I did enjoy myself and would recommend this spot to my friends.
No comment

No comment
Waited more than 1 hour for food with no explanation and not a single drink refill. The tip was included in the bill without warning.
No comment

No comment

Man oh man this place has a totally different vibe now. Less authentic and more desperate to fit into hipster demographic neighborhood. You're greeted with rap music. No more khinghali (Georgian dumplings) for lunch. I don't if it was the empty streets due to the covid19 pandemic or what but the vibes were totally off and weird. The cheese boat felt smaller and less cheesy too. Please bring back the old cheeseboat.

No comment

I love this place!! The cheeseboats are so good. I've tried the steak cheeseboat which was AMAZING and comes with a garlicky dipping sauce. The shrimp one is also good but I would have liked if it also came with the garlic dipping sauce. The steak one was definitely better. This place is definitely unique and a great place to take your friends who are visiting the area, none of my friends have heard of cheeseboats :)

I can't say how much I love this place. It's a cozy little place in Williamsburg. The food is amazing and the staff are super friendly. This place is a one of a kind place, they serve "cheeseboats". I mean what is a cheeseboat??? If you don't know what it is then you're missing out! I literally woke up the next day after I had it for the first time and was like "I'm going back there!" If you love pizzas this is definitely the place for you and it's a must try. They also have really good cheeseboat desserts-- which are mind-blowing. Mascarpone and fruits cheeseboat is probably one of my favorites along with the honeycomb cheeseboat. Overall it's a 5/5! They also do deliver too!
Great variety of tasty bread boats filled with different cheese and pairings. I highly recommend the brie and honeycomb cheese boat!

Cool restaurant in Brooklyn to go with a bunch of friends or family and eat some cheese. 2 things you should try - the dumplings and the cheese bread. Other than that, take your pick of the menu items. The service was fine and how many places serve food from Georgia (no, not the state south of South Carolina)? Make the trip to BillyBurg and try this place once. The decor is fun!
No comment

If you've ever wondered what a cheeseboat tastes like, well... it tastes exactly as it looks/sounds. It's cheese melted in dough, and with a runny egg on top. And sometimes other things. Definitely worth trying... once.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Second time coming here & does not disappoint! First of all, the interior of the restaurant is very cute. They have cute plants and vines (and wines ) on display - gives you a very cultural Georgian vibe. Second of all, the truffle cheese boat hachapuris are the BOMB DOT COM. My husband and I love truffle with everything and restaurants are usually stingy with their truffle oil. Definitely NOT the case here - you can really taste the truffle in their hachapuri. So fresh and delicious, could barely finish the full cheeseboat. Our friends also got the truffle cheeseboat and the brie cheeseboat with walnuts. They really enjoyed their hachapuris as well. Would definitely come back again !

No comment
Take Georgian food, adapt it for what you think are American tastes and you get...crappy Georgian food. Keep it real guys.
No comment

No comment

Love loved loved the wild mushroom cheeseboat, kartvelian salad w/ spices, pear salad w/ walnuts as for their hand cut fries... just superb! Also they recommended us a nice white Georgian wine that was nice, crisp and chill.
No comment
No comment

What does a fantastic "light" (but still absolutely filling) dinner look like? This place! My friend and I ordered the soup dumplings Khinkali and Smoked Gouda Cheeseboat. The khinkali was solid, but the Cheeseboat knocked this meal out of the park. Now I understand why people say they would give up sex for cheese. It was so melt-in-your-mouth delicious and comforting! The Happy Hour wine for $5 certainly helped as well. It's good quality for $5. While the portions aren't as huge as you might want for the price, it's still enough food for two smaller people. The service, although a bit slow at first, was friendly and became more receptive later on. Finally, the restaurant itself is also beautifully decorated- what a charming space!

Cheeseboat is RIGHT. Cheeseboats are like Georgian fondues, only the container is bread, which you rip off to dig into the cheese. I got the mushroom version, and the bread was soft and fluffy and warm, and the cheese stayed melty and gooey. The meat dumplings are also really good - they're incredibly flavorful and definitely douse all of it with generous helpings of the green cilantro/parsley sauce.
Cheeseboat was very unique and delicous! If you are a cheese lover this is a must try! Deffintely something good to shar among friends because it would be way too much for one person in my opinion!

I found this place on instagram, and like many was intrigued with their cheesy goodness baked in soft bread. I mean who doesn't like a side of cholesterol with their starchy carbs? Bake an egg in that shit, and bam! I took a friend who is a little more food adventurous than my husband.  It was so good. In fact I'd go so far as to say it wasn't enough. Like i just wanted more! They also had a sparkling red wine which was *kisses fingers to the sky*.  This joint is in Williamsburg. Which means i will visits few and far between. My suggestion would Be to open a small outpost on the upper west side. And I'd visit that shit every day. Cheeseboat have your people call my people. Thanks
No comment

My boyfriend had the shrimp cheese boat and I had an amazing lasagna for Valentines Day. It was a nice quiet and romantic experience. It was hard to decide what I wanted. Everything on the menu was so appealing.
No comment

No comment
No comment

Food is awesome! Three friends and I shared an imeruli khachapuri, cheeseboat with truffle butter, fried eggplant roulette with spiced walnut paste and soup dumplings khinkali. The cheese breads were amazing but it was definitely a bit much to have both, haha. Eggplant was okay; I prefer hot eggplant dishes to cold ones like this. Dumplings were amazing and possibly the highlight. Minus one star because the service wasn't great. Took forever to get our waiter every time!
No comment

Beware! They have changed their brunch menu as of one week ago and not updated it online. A group of friends and I came, eager to try the various different cheeseboats only to find that their menu had drastically changed and they no longer serve cheeseboats until after 4 PM. This change with lack of update onto their website is the primary reason to knock their stars down. There was very little flexibility in accommodating to us based on our disappointment and expectations except that they could make the regular cheeseboat. Some of us got the regular cheeseboat which was very delicious and freshly made. Others tried the pumpkin French toast and pear salad, which were also good.
No comment
No comment

We were in the neighborhood and decided to enjoy some Georgian food and we were familiar with the place as we have been here before. The menu is full if fusion versions of cheesebread that you cant really find in Georgia and other dish options are limited. We tried phkhali, which was ok, and beef kabab which came with veggies and was a bit overpriced for the size ( 25$) and flavor. Overall, I remembered they served better food in the past. It could be the case that the place is better for cheesebread than other Georgian specialties

First time here over the weekend and my partner and I got the burger because nothing else passing by on trays looked good. Burger was $25 for a thick cheese patty and fries. We both got food poisoning.

I used to love this place, however, proportion sizes are much smaller than they used to be, almost half the size and prices haven't really changed much. Not the same as it used to be, sadly, and not sure if it's worth going back.

Fresh and yummy ! Really loved our meal. They made everything fast and good. Khinkali were especially good !

I have never had Georgian food, but I wish I had more near me after coming here.  I ordered this cheesy bread bowl... it was a rainy winter day and this made my day.  I was there with family and the place was full and everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves.  This place is a must if you are in Brooklyn and near the brewery.  Now if ur lactose intolerant, I'm sorry, u may want to suffer a little because the cheeseboats are amazing

The only time I thoroughly regret leaving NYC is when I think of Cheeseboat. I cannot say anymore...it's melted cheese, butter and bread. All baked fresh. We even loved their stir fried veggies. Oh, the fries are pretty damn awesome too. I wish I had ordered at least another 10 things on the menu. I am no longer living in Brooklyn and I miss this place like hell!!! :'(

The ambiance was really nice and the waiter was super helpful. This was my first time at a Georgian restaurant and was was very pleased. My boyfriend and I got the Bacon Cheeseboat and the Gouda cheese. I enjoyed the bacon one but felt that the Gouda was way creamier which was how I thought the bacon would have been as well. All in all I would definitely go back!

It was a rainy day so seating wasn't a problem ordered the prosciutto cheese boat. It was hard to finish because it was a lot but it was tasty.  Waiter was attentive and never had to ask for refills on water.  House red at the time was Malbec which is my favorite.  Environment was comfortable but the chair can accidentally stab you as made of like a wood hay bottom.

This place was great. Went last Monday around 6pm with my sisters (we do a weekly meal together) and had a great experience. The food was awesome (each got big cucumber salads and two cheese boats to split which was more than enough). Topped off by great service from two super nice, attentive, and personable staff members who wore masks the whole time. Appreciated the safe social distancing in the outside dining too!
No comment
No comment

Came here for my sister's birthday lunch. The place is very homey and cute and the service is fantastic. The food was good, (our first time trying it out). Overall, the experience was ok however it was very hot out and their air system was not working. It was extremely hot inside and my sister's twins were struggling.
No comment

I finally got here. Ordered the chupacabra cheese boat and it's really tasty and really fun to eat. I only ate half as I was having an early dinner, about 4-5 hours from then but liked it. Again, I think it's really fun to eat, similar to eating a soup bowl in bread. Part of the enjoyment is your eating your whole meal and using your hands to do it.

This is like heaven on earth for cheese lovers! But I would definitely recommend you order to share and split one boat between 2. Also, don't just order cheese boats try other things in the menu!!!

The food was definitely worth it. The mushroom soup was phenomenal and the salad was also ready good.  We ordered the mushroom cheeseboat and the Mac and cheese cheese boat. They were cheesey and cooked very well. However, I did NOT like thee service.  No introduction, no welcome, took forever to come speak to us and the fork had to be replaced for being unclean.

I really never heard of this place until two of my foodie friends decided to drag me here. And I am so happy I went along with them because they food was so good and so instagram photo worthy!! We ordered Cheese Boat with Egg and Butter and we ordered a Cheese Boat with Sausages. They both were so delicious. The cheese boat with egg was just so instagrammable and it tasted so good and it was so cheesy. The cheeseboat with the sausages was packed! They put so much meat on it. We were all so full too. I love hiw their portion size is big. It's definitely will fill up 2 people with just one cheese boat. I am definitely going back to try others, but this place was so amazing
No comment

I would take my family and business clients here for any meal of the day. Staff is lovely and food matches. I believe they are still waiting on a liquor license but I don't even care. Food takes a little while to cook but worth the wait.

I was asked: "What's the best thing you ate in 2017?" I answered "Cheeseboat."  I think that pretty much sums it up.  It's like a fresh, open-faced, melty, doughy calzone and you pick what goes inside. Soooooo good.

The staff was very welcoming. There was a DJ performing while we were there. The menu had an assortment of food to choose from but of course we had to try the famous cheese boats. We were instructed how to go about eating the cheese boat and were blown away by the food. The cheese was out of this world there was an assortment of flavors and in contrast to my prior belief, it was not messy to eat, the cheese is thick and therefore makes it easy and enjoyable to eat. In addition, the presentation of the cheese boats are absolutely stunning! The prices were very fare and the store has a great ambiance. I came when the season was nice and they had opened the windows to the store. I cannot wait to visit again and try more of their selections!

Very cute atmosphere with super authentic food and people. Our waiter was friendly and accommodating. We ordered the fried pierogi, a smoked Gouda cheese boat and the lamb lemon wrap. All of the food was flavorful and cooked perfectly. Our only gripe would be that the lamb plate didn't even come out until the rest of us had finished eating the cheeseboat, so we weren't able to all eat together.

Experience the beauty of Georgian food and come here. Excellent Cheeseboat (yes, it's a thing here!), Georgian wine (the driest ever!), and just purely delicious Georgian salad (onions galore!) and soup dumplings (not sure whether they're Georgian, but whatevs!). I'll be back.

This place offers great food and service. I went there Saturday night with over 10 friends and the place was super busy. Even with a busy night they offered us all great service and were very helpful. The food was so food, torr bacon and the macncheese cheese boats were our favorites. Their dinners were so good, they just a garlic chicken, lamb wrap and kabobs which all were delicious. Everyone loved the food and service. They have chocolate stout which you can't go wrong with and have tasty house wine options too. I would recommend this place for groups and for just for two. The place is well decorated for the holidays and I would recommend this place to any cheese lover. Can't wait to go back.
No comment
No comment

I loved the place, staff was super friendly and the atmosphere was amazing. I tried the mushroom cheeseboat and it was perfectly cooked n baked. Also, their eggplant roulette was very light and tasty tho it's fried. I wld definitely come back
No comment
Wonderful cheeseboat ! The place is cozy.  Helpful waiter !   Perfect service! I recommend it!
No comment
So much cheese. So amazing. The soup dumplings and steak/egg cheeseboat were out of this world

Disappointed that they charged $11 fee for paying with credit card, no where in the menu says that they are cash only/charge a fee for credit card and we were a table of 7 and paid with one single credit card. When confronted, server said this is "common practice in the area and we must not be from here". We live in Williamsburg and have never heard of such an absurd charge. When we said that was f* ridiculous, we were called out for using language, but we never referred to the server, but the situation itself. They didn't have the dumplings we ordered and only mentioned it when we questioned after waiting a long time, and didn't bring a glass of water for one person until mid dinner. Food was ok. We were requested to leave as soon as we paid due to billing confrontation, but will never go back anyway.
This place has been in my bookmarks for a while and I finally was able to go.  The cheeseboats are delicious and the ambiance is very casual.  Glad I went.
No comment

Where do I even begin? Wow. My friend and I showed up on a Friday night (during COVID) without a reservation, and there was a slight wait, but by the looks of the food on the tables, I insisted we wait it out and try this place. And boy was that a good decision! Having never heard of a cheeseboat or tried Georgian spice, I was in for a treat. To start off, we ordered a shot of the "adios don" and the meat dumplings. They bumped our shot up to a full martini, which inspired the other patrons in our area to order the "adios don". Then, we all cheers'd (6 feet apart, air-clinking our glasses of course) that the inauguration was only 2 weeks away!! Adios!! Then came the dumplings. I couldn't get enough - I would have ordered another plate of them if our cheese boats didn't arrive at that moment. For 2 people, I'd say 2 cheese boats is quite the challenge and will result in left overs. We tried the brie and honey boat, as well as the steak and eggs boat. I truly can't pick a favorite - both were incredible in unique ways. The steak was cooked perfectly medium rare; it was unbelievably juicy and it wasn't even the main event!! We joked that the Brie boat made a good dessert as it's on the sweeter side. The bread for the boats was so warm and just what we needed on a chilly night. The atmosphere, the food, and the staff are all around incredible and I can't wait to try more boats!

This place was amazing! My husband and I tried the eggs benedict Cheeseboat, burger, shrimp and grits, as well as the Pkhali. Everything was BEYOND delicious and unique!  There's literally something on the menu for everyone.  I highly recommend Cheeseboat for its ambiance, quality food, and family-friendly feel!
No comment
No comment

Found out about this place through a video focusing on cheese on Instagram. Had to come out and try out. Had their Meatball Cheeseboat and thought it was fantastic. It's my first time trying out Georgian cuisine so was a little skeptical at first. But overall I thought the restaurant was inviting and brings out a nice crowd.
Very nice, romantic and cozy place. Traditional Georgian food. Warm hospitality. I like the place.
No comment

Ok so you know, it was good - quite good.  It's just a lot.  A whole cheese boat is so rich, so buttery, so fatty, it's just ... a lot.  The service was incredibly pleasant, and I enjoyed our meal, the titular dish was just overkill.  My advice? Split it with at least 4 people, and make sure you load up on bright, acidic sides to keep you interested (I don't remember if there were any but I hope there are).
No comment
No comment

Great location for the brewery hopper! Every time I come here I manage to grab some seating at the bar. A cheeseboat is not a one person job, you're going to need help! Can't wait to come back and try more of their menu. Food is superb. Cocktails are good, but on the smaller side.

I really dont know what the hype is about .. first thing i notice that if you have a kid with a stroller dont bring the stroller leave it in the car or at home .. the place was so tiny i couldn't even get comfortable .. when we finally sat down the server automatically had an attitude.. we order our drink they told us it will be hot because they have to get it downstairs. Where is downstairs idk .. drink never came , another waiter come talking about "what did you guys get to drink " we have to remind them again .. the drink came OMG IT WAS HOT .. tasted nasty .. fries came it was good .. we can never be disappointed with fries .. soup dumpling was good the two stars are for the soup dumpling.. so now lets talk about the Cheeseboat omg dont fall for it its nastyyyy ... the bacon one was so greasy. I ask for napkins they told me the only paper napkins they have was in the bathroom. So pretty he wanted me to use the napkins in the bathroom to remove oil from my food ... when i went to use the bathroom those napkins were all over the floor .. how gross but anyway,, The dough wasn't all that .. pretty much its basic... I've eating better food for less .. worst $140 spent ..

No comment

Please try to avoid this place! No complaints about food, it was amazing! Service is disgusting!!! First of all during COVID all places provide masks if you don't have one, this place tried to sell you mask for $9. Second of all they told us to leave exactly in an hour! Third of all they don't except card and it doesn't say anywhere, they don't even aware you when you come in. But they take Venmo..... seriously guys?! Restaurants take Venmo now?! Stuff were very unprofessional! Not the place to spend good time with your friends or family! Awful service!

I discovered the Cheeseboat via Insider New York and I just knew I hard to try. I placed a reservation for the end of our trip and waited impatiently for it to arrive. The food did not disappoint. The cheeseboats were magnificent, baked just right with the cheese melted perfectly. The atmosphere, unfortunately, was not. The entire restaurant is the size of a Starbucks, but they had 2 large speakers blasting EDM music throughout our entire meal. It took away from the ambiance of the place and made conversation difficult. I would return to have the cheeseboat again, but it would be take out.

The Cheeseboat is a cozy restaurant that fills up quickly, so get in early. Call ahead and make your reservation, and get a cheeseboat! I cannot stress this enough. My wife and I ordered the Soko Ketze ($15) which are mozzarella filled button mushrooms, the soup dumplings ($12 at 4 per order), and the Bacon Cheeseboat ($19). We shared everything and were more than content. The manager of the restaurant was friendly, informative and influenced our dining selections with his strong expertise. Remember, "one does not simply...pass by the Cheeseboat"!
No comment

Holllllllllyyyyyyyyyyyyyy shitakkeeeee mushrooms!!!!!!!!!! When I tell you this is on of the best meals I've ever had!?! This lil spot in Williamsburg is absolutely amazing. My group and I all ordered different cheese boats.... and ALL of them were slamming. The wine complimented everything and then we received the complimentary dessert for showing up 2 hours before they opened lol.

No comment

First off, the food was perfectly average. Nothing special. The check was split among a number of people. There was a mistake made on the total after the cards were run. We caught it and brought it to the owners attention. She refused to acknowledge the issue or to return the money. We basically got robbed. There are much better places in the neighborhood, avoid this place if you do not want to get ripped off.
No comment
It was a great experience and beautiful afternoon, was a last minute decision and so worth it...need to visit again soon.  It's worth the wait...

We spent an enjoyable Wednesday evening here. It was not too crowded and we arrived at 7:30 or so. Seated in an open airy window we had the added entertainment of people watching. After reading the reviews we knew that sharing is the way to go here. We had the meatball, the chorizo and the mac and cheese cheeseboats. They were all delicious and filling with interesting spices. The boat bread was fabulous for sure. We also ordered the tomato/cucumber salad which was flavored with a lovely spice. We enjoyed the grilled vegetables but they were more sautéed rather than roasted. We wanted the Brussels sprouts and the mushrooms but they were out of those items. Our wine which was a dry white from Georgia (the country) was a nice compliment to all the cheese. Our server was friendly and not too obtrusive-we had to find him to get the check. A lovely evening for sure.

i'm a huge fan of bread and cheese. since i heard about this place from a thrillst video, i knew i had to come here to try out the cheeseboat! my best friend and i came here on a monday around 4pm. we decided to split the bacon cheeseboat and we waited about 10 minutes for our order to come out. the dish was really big! you need more than 2 people to split this dish. we were able to devour a little less than half the dish. the bacon and cheese was good and satisfying haha. i did feel pretty guilty about eating so much carbs and cheese, so we ended up walking around for a bit. the bacon cheeseboat doesn't taste good the next day. i would recommend splitting the dish with at least 4 people and eat it while it's fresh! i'm glad i was able to give it a try during my visit in NY.

Went here today earlier and sat outside. We ordered the fries, the eggs benny cheeseboat and the steak and eggs cheeseboat. We also ordered the mimosa tower. The mimosas were so good and so worth the price and the french fries were some of the best I've ever had! The steak was ridiculously tender and the cheeseboats did not disappoint. The eggs benny was a little over cooked with a hard yolk, but the hollandaise sauce made up for it because it was delicious! I would definitely go back and recommend to anyone!
Got OVERCHARGED almost 40% (by mistake); brought it up to manager and got very rude, negative response. Very disappointing to see places with potential undermine clients and doing what's right.
No comment

Had the Mac n cheese boat and flaming chicken... the bread of the Cheeseboat was yummy, but it really was cheese times 100.. I love cheese but this was too much for me.. the flaming chicken was pretty spicy for someone who does like spicy... besides I did not like the way the chicken looked, it was cut irregular and felt as though it was just done... the water bottles at the table need a good cleaning they look old and foggy... the food especially the cheese boats are way overpriced

The food here was amazing!!!!! The staff was able to accommodate us and give us an all vegetarian dish which wasn't on the menu. Really great ambience if you like an old rustic vibe. Def a must if you're in the Williamsburg area!

Carb overload. So magical. We came here after seeing some stuff online about it and weren't disappointed. I got the spiced chicken curry, my gal got the spinach. Definitely would have been nice for the menu or the server to mention that these are meant to be shared - we saw an entire table comfortably splitting one, meanwhile we were full after just a few bites each. Pictures don't really do the size of them justice. The surprise upside to this is that I actually think these things are even better as leftovers, the flavors get to know each other for a day in the fridge and can be enjoyed just as well cold or reheated. I'm not a little guy in stature or appetite but my cheeseboat was an easy 3 meals. Family owned and operated too, which is nice.
Prosciutto Cheese Boat was ok, definetily wasn't the best. The taste got tiring and honestly soooo much money for something that tasted just "ok". Wouldn't really go back.
No comment

Loved my experience here. Staff were super nice and helpful with what to order. Food was DELICIOUS. Amazing outdoor patio for COVID and felt very safe and clean. Amazing Halloween fit out. Will be going back very soon.

I came here with my friends on a Saturday night. We passed by and decided to try it. We ordered a bottle of wine. Also, if you check in on yelp, you get a free glass of house wine with the purchase of an entree. We shared stuffed grape leaves. They had meat in them. We also shared the spinach cheese boat with truffle butter. It was really good. We enjoyed it. My friends had the cheese soup dumplings and they enjoyed them. I'm giving them 3 stars for service. They didn't have enough wine glasses so they used different glasses. Not all the glasses matched. Also the spacing of the courses was off. We wanted to share everything at once, even though it was a mix of an appetizer and entree. They brought it out at different times and I think they forgot about one of them. When we mentioned it, the server did take care of it.

Went for my birthday dinner. I called in advance to order food family style. Everything was absolutely delicious. The service was great. My friends and I had a really nice time. Highly recommend. Order the kartvelian salad and the chupacubra cheeseboat. Eggplant appetizer and beef kabob were also a big hit.

Warning, cheeseboats are huge!! We ordered one each expecting more of a cheese fondue in bread bowl entree kinda thing (that's how it looked in photos on here!). These are massive & quickly filling. Kinda wish this was mentioned on menu or by waiter. Definitely delicious and awesome spot for the epic cheese lover though! We brought them home and will have bready cheese deliciousness for days !

I wanted to taste a bit of home and given that there pretty much aren't any Armenian places in NYC, I got the Khinkali (soup dumplings) $12, Pierogis $12, and the Khabizgina $12. The Khabizgina was huge and I was able to take it home and eat it for days. The food was so authentic and fresh, I absolutely loved it. The pierogis were larger than I'm used to and cheesier, but thats not a bad thing. The decor was very cute as well, traditional. I even got a glass of wine with my yelp check in, which was a boost. It's worth a try whether you love Georgian food already or have never tried it before!

Definitely a guilty pleasure spot. All the melty cheesy goodness! I've been a few times now and always try new things. Everything I've had has been fantastic and they have a unique wine selection of Georgian wines. The owner and staff are always warm and friendly, you feel like you're at their home for a good family meal with lots of laughs and good times.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I'm disappointed and I know Georgian food well. My friend and I had the Cheeseboat, which was extremely cheesy and hard to eat. The crust seemed like it wasn't fully baked. I had the turkey with traditional Georgian sauce and for that price was surprised it didn't come with a side of potatoes, rice, fries, or even a mini salad. We also wanted to point out that the drinks had no alcohol in them whatsoever.... won't be back. Very disappointed considering we spent over a $100 on measly food.
The only thing I can say: GO HERE!!!! Cheeseboat was INCREDIBLE. Wine was lovely, and food is worth what you pay for.
No comment
No comment
Amazing ambience, amazing food! The chicken soup was to die for. Left feeling full and happy!
No comment

My friends and I came here for brunch. When we arrived the place was quiet, but quickly filled up around us. Service was very kind, relaxed & attentive. We had the guacamole which was surprisingly delicious as well as the chicken soup dumplings! I had the eggs Benedict which were ok, but my friends had the cheese boats which were amazing! Can a bowl of cheese and bread be anything short of gluttonous perfection? Overall we will return!

My favorite place in Brooklyn! Delicious food, nice cozy atmosphere and friendly staff. Cheeseboat was huge, could not finish. The only downside is the timing... food takes too long to come to the table.

I've been wanting to try this place out for a while now, and finally had the chance to do so. We first started out with the fried squash blossom stuffed with cheese and the potato piergois. Both are delicious, but I preferred the squash blossom nuggets- they were crispy and flavorful and I mean you can't go wrong with cheese. It was seasoned nicely. The piergois on the other hand were just alright. The actual dumpling itself was a little gummy, but the filling was quite nice. We ended off with the chicken garlic cheese boat. We both really enjoyed this. The sauce was on point. I would totally come back.

WOWOOWOWOWOWOW. this place truly does the most in the best way. i ordered the cheeseboat with truffle butter and their soup dumplings and they were the perfect mix. i split this with a friend though, because the cheeseboat does get quite heavy as you continue eating it, but it's SO delicious. the soup dumplings pleasantly surprised me! i'm used to only eating chinese soup dumplings, but these were surprisingly good.
What a wonderful establishment!  They went out of there way to deliver an order just before closing AND threw in lots of extra goodies for FREE.  I have nothing but good things to say about them.

Visited NYC last week and stumbled on this hidden gem in Williamsburg.  We experienced deliciousness and awesomeness of modern Georgian cuisine, and its signature dish cheeseboat (Adjarian khachapuri), famous Georgian hospitality, and enjoyed traditional Georgian "qvevri" (clay amphora ) wines. My personal favorites - original cheeseboat and Chkmeruli (chicken dish from mountainous region - Racha). Absolutely recommend for anyone who wants to explore flavors of mystery land - birthplace of wine!
Amazing selection of dishes. If you've never tried Georgian food you should give it a try! My favorite is the Oliver salad. The atmosphere is also so cozy.

It maybe  a decent place. However the two dishes we ordered werent great  one was the guado cheese boat   And the other is  elakir (last thing on the entree menu )  pls avoid this  i disliked it  price is good. But i like the raclette cheese better

I got the shrimp cheeseboat and the portion was very large. Definitely too much for one person to eat on their own. I'd definitely recommend splitting it. The rosé I ordered was the perfect complement to the meal to cut through the bread/cheese. Overall, the food was tasty but a little too one note in terms of flavor.
We were seated, waited over 30 minutes, asked repeatedly to order, and no one ever took our order. The restaurant was only at half capacity, too.
No comment
No comment
No comment

I ordered the bacon cheese boat and the honeycomb Brie. My roommate and I sampled them both with the best expectations and we were beyond impressed. My roommate began with the bacon as he felt it was the most comfortable choice to start with before moving on to the unknown.  He believes this was the best way to warm up to what was to come next. He claimed the bacon was a 10/10 but when he sank his teeth into the honeycomb Brie it opened his eye to a dimension of numbers beyond 10. Simply put the honeycomb Brie cheeseboat was life changing. I took the opposite approach and started with the honeycomb Brie as I didn't want anything to influence my tastebuds going in. It made me believe in a higher power. It revived me.

Omg amazing! If you love cheese like i do this is the place for you! The atmosphere is totally chill and cozy and the food is absolutely delicious!!! I will definitely be returning again and again and again!

I came here with some college friends because their cheeseboats look similar to pizza we'd eaten in college. I arrived early with half of our group and the servers constantly came over asking if we were ready, even though we told them there would be four of us. The last of our group arrived and we quickly ordered. I ordered a regular cheeseboat. It came with an egg and a pat of butter. It was so amazingly delicious. The bread was the perfect texture of fluffy and crunchy. It absorbed the oils from the cheese and butter without getting soggy.  It was so good, I can't wait to try their other cheeseboat options

I ordered through seamless about two hours ago. Apparently they "ran out" of everything and it took Seamless (not even the restaurant itself) two hours to contact me. I tried calling several times and no one bothered to answer. Terrible service.

Got the Groupon deal which is pretty reasonable for wine, appetizer and 2 entrees. Honestly was a little disappointed in the quality of the cheeseboat as I love cheese and had high expectations. I got prosciutto which was good but overall pretty boring. My wife liked her cheeseboat better with the egg on top. They give you a ridiculous amount of ok quality wine that we couldn't finish. Service was nice however not most romantic place with close seating and kids running around.

This place has delicious food. The service isn't great and the workers have attitudes, but the food is always delicious. If you can arrive early and put your name on the list or make a reservation, I suggest it. I wish I had taken pictures, but I was too busy devouring my food. The restaurant is small and usually crowded. They also have live music at times. The music was loud and not so great.

I can't say enough good things about this place. From the namesake Cheeseboats to the appetizers and entrées; everything is awesome. Be sure to get the truffle butter. The spicy chicken dinner was amazing!
No comment

So amazing! Get the cheeseboat, all the cheeseboats.  The family that owns the place is great super friendly but the food is fantastic, everything is fresh and unique.  The cheeseboats are basically open face calzones but better. Come here to support great food and you will not regret it

Me and bear have been here twice amazing food and awesome service. Extensive menu. Had the khachapuri skewers, kartevelian salad and napoleon cake everything taste delicious!! Would 100% be coming back here.

Spinach cheeseboat was great! Our waiter wasn't really much help, he came by to make sure we were doing okay maybe once & took 15 minutes after we were done eating to get our check. Other than the waiter, the food was amazing. Definitely going back.
Our favorite place for cheeseboats! Always nice service . Have been there more than 10 times probably, never disappointed
No comment
No comment

If you love cheese and you love bread, you're going to love Cheeseboat as much as I do. This place is of course known for their namesake dish, the cheeseboat, which is exactly what you'd expect--a boat (of bread) full of cheese--and it is amazing. My girlfriend and I shared the original Cheeseboat and the Shkmeruli Chicken Cheeseboat and both were cheesy, flavorful and delicious. We actually finished both because we were starving, but if you're not that hungry, I'd recommend getting one to split between two people and maybe an appetizer, as they really are filling. Can't wait to come back and try other cheeseboats the next time we are in Williamsburg.
No comment
No comment

I have never physically been to this restaurant but my partner and I have been ordering different kinds of cheeseboats around once a week for a couple weeks during quarantine. They are incredible, the food is amazing, I have no idea how they make it so that the bread isn't super soggy on the bottom. If you're a big cheese person this is just heaven. I love this restaurant they go above and beyond, and I can't wait to go there for the first time when quarantine is over.
Well, if the real Georgian wants to come back here, do I need to add anything else?! Authentic food, nicely decorated place, everything is fresh. I am still dreaming about their dolma.
No comment

Great place to eat. Can get really cozy if all the tables are filled. The Cheeseboats are great but think about sharing with someone taking some with you for later. Cheese can get really heavy. Would definitely recommend you visit at least once. For those of us watching our wallets, price points on the menu are very reasonable.

This was on my husbands list of places he wanted to go to. He see it on Facebook I think. Anyways, the food was freshly made and good. It was just way to much cheese! Idk how people eat the whole thing. I wish they had smaller potions. We got a free glass of wine for checking in on yelp!

Definitely order a cheese boat- bread, cheese, butter, egg. Devilishly delicious. Perfect for sharing. We ordered the squash nuggets- also fantastic. Had a glass of the house Malbec for $9- great pairing. The other appetizer-a mix between salad and a spread- was interesting but not a favorite. It was like a spread that wasnt minced fine enough. Tasted fine but not memorable. Great experience overall!
No comment

This place used to be my absolute favorite restaurant in the city. It was a bit expensive but you got a huge cheeseboat that really filled you up or you could save the rest for another meal. I recently went for dinner and was sad to find out that they shrunk the size by quite a bit. Not really worth the price tag anymore. I love the concept - melty cheese and bread? Who doesn't want that? Especially the shkmeruli chicken cheeseboat, wow it it's to die for. Once, a very frequent customer. Now, probably only a once every 6 months or so customer.

Came here with a friend whom had raved about this place. We ordered the Georgian soup dumplings and it was amazing! So flavorful and the meat was cooked just right. The broth inside didn't taste like it was all oil and fat like other soup dumplings I've had. I haven't had the chance to try the cheesebread yet but this 5 star review is def for the dumplings and I can't wait to come back to try their most popular dish soon!

My charge should have been 89$ soon looking at my bank statement they ended up charging me 105$. Can't seem to get a hold of a manager nor hear back from one. Horrible service as well. No wonder it was dead when I went in.

We order classic Cheeseboat  and mushroom Cheeseboat and we loved it so much. The food is very good and delicious.  I like the environment, and the place is very cozy.  The classic one definitely tasted better. But we enjoyed a lot!
Visiting from L.A. and decided to visit Williamsburg. This spot has delicious food and it's very affordable. Staff extremely friendly. Drinks are very yummy too. Love love love it!

Overrated hipster place that is messing up the Georgian dishes by filling them with insane amounts of spice. The Khachipuri aka "cheeseboat" was good. The magic mushroom cheeseboat was disappointing, the mushrooms were so spicy they cut into the flavor of the cheese. The kartvelian salad had so much salt in it I felt like they were trying to cover something up. Mushroom soup dumplings nobody at the table could eat because the red pepper flakes were the main ingredient. The music was blasting, & not Georgian music either, I remember a country cover of "99 problems" *eye roll*. Lastly, the reason I say this place is hipster & overrated: the kompot is $8 a glass! are you out of your mind??? go anywhere on brighton beach an it will cost you $2-$4 TOPS!!! how dare you?!?! Not coming back, I don't care where they were featured.
No comment

I'd been wanting to try this place for a while and it did not disappoint! The prosciutto cheeseboat was fantastic and the dough was perfectly cooked. Roasted chicken was a bit small, but flavor was nice. I'd definitely go back! (And probably order multiple cheeseboats...)
GLASS IN THE FOOD. There was glass in the dumpling. INSIDE OF IT. Nobody cared but me. Repeat: Nobody in the restaurant cared that I was served glass. IN THE FOOD.
No comment

Great atmosphere. WINE On point.  BREAD BOAT was delicious. The  was CHEESE was cheesy. the CHICKEN was dry. My friend had the BACON CheeseBoat and says it was delicious. Server was awesome. Very pleasant. EC

Cannot say enough great things about Cheeseboat! My fiance and I have been dreaming of this place ever since our visit. It was super easy to find - just a 10 minute walk from the L stop. We stopped by around 3pm on a Saturday and were seated immediately. The ambiance was truly unique - it felt like we were walking into a close friend's dining room. The staff were so friendly and helped us narrow down our choices. We went with the smoked gouda cheeseboat - the bread was perfectly fluffy and the cheese with deep, smoky flavors. One cheeseboat was more than enough for two to share, and we ended up walking for hours afterwards to fully digest. Cheeseboat was truly a unique experience and I can't wait to go back!
A wonderful experience of authentic Georgian food. Jazz night on Wednesday is where it's at.
No comment
Very heavy meals but delicious food. The cheese boat is really good and so is the chicken meatball soup. I would not order the quinoa salad again.

We had the prosciutto cheese boat and the whole chicken dish (forgot the name!). They were both extremely savory. It vibe of the restaurant is extremely comfortable and the servers were all very helpful. The raspberry margarita is definitely worth trying. I would def. go back (when they have the all day happy hour :) )
Was walking to a concert and the delicious smell  brought us in. Shared a cheese boat and the soupp dumpllinga with my gf. Everything was awesome and staff was great
No comment
Really good food. Everything we ordered including Cheeseboat, Georgian salad and few other dishes tasted great unfortunately the service was not up to par. That's the only reason they got 4 stars.

I came in with a party of seven. We order $700 worth of food and drinks. All menus state 18% gratuity added to all parties of six or more. Our bill showed that 20% was added automatically. When asking the waitress what is that about she pretended to not know why and that the menus have a mistake. Clearly lying when all menus show otherwise. No honesty and not worth 20% when you visited the table twice in the three hours we were there and we had to approach the waitress. Truly disappointed.

Mixed bag, unfortunately. The cheeseboats were legitimately amazing but the service was not good, the other food had too much pepper and the chicken entree took forever to come out. Everyone else was almost done by the time our last entree came. They did give us a free dessert but then ignored us when we wanted the check. Might come back when we're in town again but just for the cheeseboats.
No comment
Order a Cheeseboat. Only order a cheeseboat. Overall, good vibes and a good spot for sharing. Don't order the dumplings, they're horrible.
I love the service. My friend ordered a salmon it was a little flavorless for my taste. The kids loved the Mac and cheese boat. The atmosfera was great. I loved the a live music

This is a go-to place for me and my friends. The food is usually amazing. As of our recent gathering,  they added a a charge for using a credit card but didn't post it on the wall or on the menu. It's a bait and switch and really messed up. Don't really want to go back now
No comment

The 1 star is for the cheese bread. That's all the deserve. 30min wait for the appetizers, 1 hour wait for main dish and still nothing! People around us that came after us are getting food and drinks and we can't even get water !! We have to ask for it , are you serious !!!!!!!!!? We got our dessert before our main dish and when we asked what happened with our dinner than said "oh it's ready do you want it now ?" !!!! Another 15 min and we asked again and than it was brought to the table! The dessert that looked delicious was dry as wood, we couldn't even choke it down since we didn't get no water ! Oh don't bother with ordering wine the prices are crazy, they want $42 for a $6 bottle of wine. After all that I was mad and checked in to get the glass of wine of course it never arrived. Needless to say will never be back and would never recommend to anyone.
No comment

Loved this place. We had a Groupon here...I think it was $15 for $40 worth of food plus we each got a free glass of wine with a Yelp check in. The food was great, ambience was nice, and I'd say the menu was reasonably priced even without the deal. Definitely stop by if you're in the area.

This place is obviously well known for its cheeseboats which two of my friends got and those looked good/came out to us at the table in a normal amount of time. I ordered the lamb which comes as a wrap with sauce on it, served over vegetables. My issue with this restaurant is that my dish didn't come out until 50 minutes after my friends got their food. The waitress never acknowledged that there was an issue. Her coworker apologized and I'm pretty sure he put in the order as it didn't seem like they had any idea they were missing anything for our table previously. They then tried to charge us for the dish! We told them we weren't paying for it and the waitress responded with " she's eating the lamb" I would definitely steer clear due to service issues.
The cheeseboat and the soup dumplings are incredible. The chicken soup is also what I want every time into sick.

Went here for the one of the last hurrahs of the summer. 5pm on a Friday, not that many people, in fact we were the only ones in there. We had a reservation and they were able to take us. Our waiter was very friendly and knew of some really good suggestions and very accommodating. Friday was all day happy hour :) I was starving so I had the pirozhki and the house white which was 15$ for a yummy cheese mushroom and tarragon sandwich. The food came out fairly quickly and the presentation was spotless, wood plates and had a very rustic feel to it. The spinach cheeseboat was the star of the show, A cheese fondue inside a bowl made out of crunchy and warm bread. The service was pretty good, although nearing the end it started to take a while so we had to call waiters over. Overall service was good and the food was excellent. I had never tasted Georgian food, I'm glad it turned out to be so delicious. I'll be back. If you're in the area, check this place out.
Hahahahahaha! This place was a joke. Don't go. Seriously, the food, the price, the service, the whole thing. Melt your own damn cheese at home.

This place is amazing!! Not only is the food top notch but the service was warm, welcoming and inviting. The atmosphere is cozy and quaint and the cheesboats are obviously not to be missed. 100% recommend!!
No comment

Omg cheeseboat! Cheese and bread what more could you want. I got the spinach cheese boat which was amazing. I recommend their food but be prepared to wait a bit these boats take 20 minutes to prepare but are totally worth the wait! They also put that right on the menu so if you're in a hurry they have lots of other tastey options

We went there this Saturday for lunch and ordered a regular Cheeseboat and some meat soup dumplings (we shared both in 2). Both were delicious and I highly recommend it. The bread of the cheeseboat could be a little more cooked for our taste, but it was amazing anyway. The service was good but too slow, we had to keep trying to get the attention of the waiter a few times to order anything. But overall a very good experience that I recommend!
