Can I even say how good this place is? Finding a place that makes Khatchipori was heaven sent in the first place but a place that serves quality like this cannot be underestimated. The dining experience could be bumped up by some more interested waitstaff but the quality of food trumps everything bi will not only come back. But I will tel everyone willing to listen about what a great place this is.
YUUUUMMM!!! Never had Georgian food but OMG so good. Get ready for that cheese if you're getting a Boat aka bring Lactaid pill and wear loose pants. Totally recommend!
No comment
No comment
Horrible food, horrible service! They gave our order to others and than bring it back like nothing happened. And Cheeseboat was such bad, I wanted to throw up.
Nice place but terrible service. Food looks like Georgian but far away from original. Prices high and not  Anywhere not going to visit this place again.

I am Georgian myself and have tried Georgian food at almost every Georgian restaurant in NY but honestly.. taste-wise this place has got to be #1. I visited this Restaurant with 2 of my friends and i was really really impressed, atmosphere was warm, very friendly staff and honestly food was amazing. I will definitely be coming back.

Cheeseboat! Cheeseboat!  I came here on a Thursday night with my roomie and we shared the Spinach Cheeseboat with truffle butter and the Soup Dumplings Khinkali.  When I think of soup dumplings, I automatically think of Joe's Shanghai Dumplings; these were a lot bigger, had a thicker skin, had a beef & pork base seasoned with Georgian spices and came with a creamy sauce with fennel seeds in it - not much soup inside, but I would definitely order these again.  We checked into the restaurant via Yelp to get a free glass of house wine when we first arrived - the waitress totally forgot until we reminded her and after we received our food.  The main attraction was the cheeseboat - loads of cheese and spinach inside of a hollowed out piece of bread with glorious truffle butter on the top.  Something to share, would be great as a drunk food, but after eating just melted cheese and bread for 20 minutes straight I felt like it was a little much.  Not saying it was bad at all - just that I shouldn't stuff my face with cheese and carbs so fast ha.  Would come back again for little bites :)

After waiting over an hour for my chicken I requested the check since it still had not left the kitchen. Was told by the waiter I would need to take it to go and still pay for it since it was already being prepared. My husband ordered the salad and cheese boat which came about 45 minutes later. Cheeseboat was good but would not recommend going here as the waiter didn't even apologize for the wait.

The food was good, but the service left a bitter taste in my mouth. It took forever to get the food or drinks out, and some orders were missed. In the end there was a mistake on the bill in the restaurants favor. Once they got the money though, they refused to correct it. The waiter just gave us the run around, and the owner/manager refused to fix it even after a 20 minute conversation. Shocking. Left frustrated and will never be returning.

After this was hyped up on Insider and Facebook, of course I had to journey to Williamsburg to try it for myself. It definitely met the hype. I got the Mac and Cheese Cheeseboat which was so good. I am an avid fan of Mac and Cheese and also of just Cheese in general. I would say to get a single cheeseboat and something else and share that amongst two because it really is a lot of cheese, even if you love cheese. But it really was so good.

Really wonderful restaurant.  The service is friendly and warm, the interior is lovely and romantic, and the food divine. The khachapuri is one of the most comforting foods in existence. Their dumplings and dessert are also outstanding. A very welcome addition to the neighborhood!
One of the best Georgian restaurants around! I'd give 10/10 for their food. It's always busy there so you gotta make sure you call ahead and make a reservation!

Had a slightly befuddling experience. Asked waitress if she had any particular recommendations (as we're not familiar with Georgian food), and she said 'no.' I guess it was a language barrier issue? We were like, "Just ... 'no'? None?" She was like, "No!" OK ... we ordered an appetizer but they didn't have that one available. Went with our second choice for app, but she said they actually had none of the four appetizers listed. Huh. OK, we mulled whether to get meat or mushroom dumplings, got the mushroom, but then both versions came. We explained we'd only wanted mushroom and more confusion ensued. (The mushroom were tasty.) We got chicken entree, which was meh. Would love to try the appetizers if they are ever on offer!
This place was great! The servers were very attentive and the food was amazing! We had the Smoked Gouda with Bacon Cheeseboat and the Mac and Cheese Cheeseboat. Everything was delicious!

This place is super cute with great ambiance! Great for a date night! My date and I tried the Chicken Cheesboat and it was excellent! We ordered the eggplant roulette which was not very tasty and seemed a bit expensive for what it was worth! I live in the neighborhood so I plan on coming here again! I would greatly suggest this for a night out in Williamsburg- the prices are decent and the cheesboat superb.

I feel bad giving this place 2 stars but its honestly accurate. The flavors are a hit and miss unfortunately, especially for the price... WAY TOO HIGH for food that doesn't resemble the authentic flavors of Georgian Cuisine... Thats not me talking out of my ass either... I've honestly had much much better experiences for a much cheaper price, in lively Georgian restaurants, in sheepshead bay, also with far more rich authentic familiar flavors. A bit disappointed. Not sorry guys.
Very tasty food and homey vibes. Staff is nice but amateurish. Getting our food took a bit too long but definitely worth it. Classic cheeseboat

We came in on a weeknight and I was surprised by how crowded it was. We were able to get seats at the bar and ordered the meat soup dumplings and a regular cheeseboat. The dumplings came out first and I wasn't hugely impressed. They weren't super flavorful and had no soup to speak of. When the cheeseboat came out I was impressed with it's size, definitely large enough for 2 or 3 to share. The cheese was salty and gooey and delicious. It's clear they use several types of cheese as you get several different textures while eating it. I would definitely come back again though I would skip the dumplings next time. I'd really like to try some of the other cheeseboats.

Delicious! Every dish we've ordered was great and tasted very traditional , which was one of the main criteria for us. Stuff was very hostile. We loved the atmosphere which is my first criteria anywhere I go, interior, patio like layout, cool bathroom, DETAILS- all that we love in European restaurants Last night dinner reminded me of my beautiful trip to Georgia a year ago and I believe that rates this place as A+ pretty distinctly. Thank you!
Made a reservation for six for dinner on a weeknight. Shared almost all of the food on the menu. You can't go wrong with any of it but my favorite is the Spinach Cheeseboat with the butter.

Our server overheard us talking about "How much cheese is too much cheese" and immediately offered to bring the table some Lactaid. He did and we ordered a boatload of cheese, and I vowed to write my first Yelp review in 8 years. 12/10, would patronize again, with my own pills in tow.
No comment

I love the idea of this restaurant, because I LOVE cheese, but it was almost too much for me. The waitress ended up forgetting my order (the prosciutto cheese boat), so my friend's cheese boat came out before mine. While we waited for mine to arrive, the cheese ended up getting kind of cold and chewy. I enjoyed the first few bites but after a while, it was just too much cheese. I would definitely recommend sharing one to start, and see if you want more afterwards.

After a day of walking in Brooklyn my girlfriend and I decided to stop here for a quick bite. Everything we had made our jaw drop. We started with the raspberry margarita which was so refreshing and yummy. As for our Cheeseboat we opted for the magic mushroomed which was to die for. Cannot wait to bring our friends back.

First time having Georgian food. Staff was helpful in picking out the good stuff. Ended up a beef soup dumplings (little different than the Chinese version) and a chicken filled "cheeseboat". Basically delicious baked bread filled with cheese and garlicky chicken. Awesome intro to Georgian food. Was too much food to eat myself.

My waiter was the absolute worst. At first he forgot our water that we had to ask another server to bring it. We had ordered two coffees and he brought them without the milk and sugar and when we asked if he could bring them he completely forgot about us and kept clearing other tables. Then another server was kind enough to bring them to us however, our coffee was already cold and unenjoyable. Thirty minutes had gone since we ordered without any update as to why the delay so I had to literally hail him from the other side of the restaurant to ask because he was not even trying to come to our table. After finishing our meal I had asked for a box to take my leftovers, which he again forgot so I had to yet again ask another server to kindly bring a box for me. Shako turned what was supposed to be a good time at a new restaurant into a frustrating event and nearly ruined our first experience at Cheeseboat. Extremely discouraging.

I'm a big fan of khinkali and ajarski khachapouri and I would eat them very often before moving to NY. I was very happy to find Cheeseboat in the middle of Williamsburg. The restaurant is really cozy inside and the waiters/waitresses are super attentive and welcoming. I loved the homely vibe of the restaurant, it's a nice place to eat with family or on a date! I ordered the khinkali, naturally, the pierogi, and khabizgina which is cheese and potato stuffed in freshly baked bread. The food took a little long to come out but immediately I could tell it was all made fresh from scratch so I didn't mind the wait. The khinkali was delicious and easily my favorite dish, just like what I used to eat at home. Everything else was really good too, and the portions were so large we ended up bringing  a lot of food back home. All in all, I would come back here if I was craving Georgian food. Next time i'll be trying the cheeseboat!

Can you say CHEESE?  I got the bacon cheeseboat and holy smokes (pun intended ) it was good. The boat just oozes with cheesiness and the bacon wasn't too crispy (just the way i like it). It took them around 25 minutes to prepare our cheeseboats so that gives you time to chow down on some appetizers or have a conversation with whoever you're with. The place also gives off a fancy vibe as it has exquisite decor. They also have a bar inside for the alcohol enthusiasts out there. I wouldn't recommend ordering a cheeseboat just for yourself as it can get pretty overwhelming to try and finish it (plus all them carbs o.O).
What a place! Amazing atmosphere, great and welcoming staff and even better food! How can you beat that?! If you haven't been there yet, you're missing out for sure!

How can you hate a place that delivers on the promise of cheeseboats? We had some Georgian wine with our food which was flavorful and complemented the meal well. Definitely go there hungry. I was eating leftovers for days afterwards though and it never stopped being amazing. Even though they're a new restaurant, the service was great too!

The whole experience seemed a little upside down. Online they had an extensive brunch list but when we arrived on Sunday early afternoon, they said they have one menu, a "dinner menu." The food was delicious but each item was wrong from how it was described on the menu. The quinoa bowl was missing several ingredients and the waiter sorta laughed when asked about them. The soup came after the main course. The "diet coke" was more of a sarsaparilla. The items themselves were done beautifully and with much care-the salmon was cooked perfectly, the cheeseboat was really delicious. But the overall dining experience was off somehow.
Catastrophically bad service. Mediocre food. Indifferent and would never go again or recommend.

I'm sorry to say, but this isn't the way Georgian food should taste. If you want a real taste, go to South Brooklyn- there you'll find a plethora of Georgian restaurants that are far better than this one.
Stop whatever you're doing and go here. Delicious food, great happy hour, and the best staff I have ever met. I can't wait to go back!

Ate here with a friend last night after purchasing a Pulsd deal, and it was a fantastic meal. Neither of us had any experience with Georgian food, and our waiter was very patient with us as we asked for explanations of nearly every item on the menu. We went with the mushroom cheeseboat and the shkmeruli - that garlic sauce tho - with a bottle of the house red (delicious!). The whole staff was extremely attentive and kind. Can't wait to come back.

This place is great..i love the atmosphere and those tasty cheeseboats are so comforting and the staff are so attentive....thanks again cheeseboat.....cant wait to bring someone else to have a cheeseboat..wow!!

Excellent food quality - the Cheeseboat with chicken had perfectly cooked chicken thigh and leg. Give the Georgian wine a try - delicious! Very nice servers. Never been to a Georgian restaurant before so don't have anything to compare it to but fun to try we things and I'm sure it's an Americanized version. Space is large - brought the baby and had plenty of space for the stroller

I am sorry but for all the hype the food I ordered was inedible. The guest who invited me was extremely embarrased.  I should have suspected something when I learned that their main dish is based on a women's vagina! Don't believe any reviews in New Yorker mag

The cheeseboat was incredible but too big for one person!!! You need at least 2 people to split it. Still, restaurant was bomb and the atmosphere was really cute. They also have gluten free items on the menu, which was a plus!

food was okay. Service seemed fine until they took advantage of my drunk friend and overcharged us by $300 on a $1K bill and didn't want to fix the situation when we brought it up to them. Won't be coming back.

We were overcharged and they refused to give the money back, saying that they thought we meant the extra funds as an additional tip. We had a table of 14 ppl, the total "extra tip" came to $300 (on top of the $150 tip that we already paid). Escalated the matter up to the owner who said that she didn't feel right taking the money away from her hard working staff. Mind boggling.

Had brunch here this weekend and we had a great meal. The food is so tasty, the music set such a great tone, I loved all the plants, and the service was so friendly & knowledgeable. Obviously get the cheeseboat, it was killer.
Love the new Georgian spot with yummy delicious boat shaped Hachapuri bread with cheese! Cute and cozy atmosphere. Must try!!
This is the best place of Georgian food I have tried in the city. I totally recommend it.
Um yes. Cheeseboat is ridiculous it's so good. From the food to the service and atmosphere I have only the best things to say about this place. Please come here and get your cheeseboat on!
Loved the actual cheeseboat dish and the unique wine. Authentic Georgian fare served by amazing friendly staff who own the restaurant. I can't wait to be back for more dishes.

The food was great! However what crappy and disorganized service they have there. Wow I give it an F seriously. No acknowledgment whatsoever. Never going back because of the service. Lost business right here
Super busy cause of the recent article circulating online. Definitely work a trip for those delicious cheese boats. Also make sure to get the flaky layered cake!

We ordered the classic cheese boat (cheese and truffle butter) and it was the perfect choice. The portion was big and could easily be shared between 3/4 people. We also ordered the soup dumplings (also big, but ok). A must try is the apple dessert - it was perfect!). Different from all other reviews, I thought service was great. The restaurant wasn't crowded and it didn't take us a lot of time to get our food and drinks. Definitely coming back.

If I could give this place 0 stars I would! Let me just explain that I am one of the most patient people and last night pushed that patience to the limit. My sister and I walked in at 6:15pm to an empt restaurant. There were only a few other people there-- mostly finishing up their meals. We were sat by a man who spoke zero english but was clearly doing this best. The waiter was this young kid who took 15 minutes to come over and take our drink order. By then 2 other tables had come in, waited and left because they were not greeted. We proceeded to order the spinach Cheeseboat and an appetizer knowing the wait for the food would be up to 30 mins. After only 20 mins a table who came in around the same time  got their food so I told the waiter to cancel the app. He looked very confused like... What app? Another 20 mins past, and the table behind us that came in a half hour after us got their food. Then another table, then another. Finally I asked the waiter how much longer and he said he never put it in and would comp us. I asked for bread because at this point we were starving. He said it would be 10 mins. 45 MINS LATER... no food. We walked out after waiting 2 HOURS!!!! I have never in my life experienced this before. I went to bed without dinner because it was 9pm and too late to do this all over again. I want to mention that the poor guy who spoke no english wanted to help but couldn't meanwhile two women gabbed behind the bar never helping the waiter. The food coming out to all the other tables looked great. Im sure it tastes great too but this was the worst service I have ever experienced and is WHY I took to Yelp. I'm still mad about it a day later and that is very much not my personality. So my advice.... skip Cheeseboat.
Great food if you loooove cheese. And great service with it. I'd definitely come back and try more of the authentic Georgian food.
Im sure the food is good if it ever arrives. Orded delivery 2 hrs before they closed and my food never arrived. When someone called to check the status no one answered. Not a good look Cheeseboat.

This place is fantastic! My boyfriend and I ordered two appetizers and a cheeseboat. While I can't remember what the eggplant appetizer was called, it was so freaking good I want another one now. The mushroom dumplings were okay, but the cheeseboat with truffle butter was incredible. All of the service staff was super sweet and we thoroughly enjoyed our night. Also, not once did we wait too long for anything.
No comment

You can't go wrong with any of the food here, everything is delicious. My favorites include the mushroom dumplings and shkmeruli chicken made in a decadent sauce. The owner Netty takes such passion in her restaurant and it's a family affair. Just go, you won't be disappointed!
No comment

By far the worst experience at a restaurant. As we came in, it took 10 mins for a waiter/ waitress sit us down and an additional 10 mins to approach us and give us water and take our order. It took a very long time for the appetizer to come and half an hour for the main dishes to come. Waiter/waitress took awhile to check on us, give us our receipt and pack our food and drinks to go. Please hire more people or better train your waiters/waitress. They seemed occupied with everything other than their job, very timid and shy and seemed to not check on their tables often. Coming from a background in working with restaurants, the servers need better training on customer service.

This is a hipster interpretation/distortion of Georgian baked classics.  The adjaruli khachapuri is their classic cheeseboat.  While the dough approximated what one would find in Georgia, the cheese was way off. The achma was severed on a slice of wood and you can get it with bacon.  The pkhali was served with warmed up tough pita chips.  It would have been better with fresh bread. Our group tried some of the original cocktails which were pretty good. The first waiter we had didn't seem to know anything about Georgian food.  It took asking for borjomi 3 times to find out that they didn't have any.  While the service was ok, the quality of food didn't merit the price. An unauthentic, semi-disappointing experience.

The original cheeseboat with egg and butter is KILLER. also the vegetarian dips rock. Love the spicy sort of hummus dip. And the bread that comes with the dips is spongey and delicious. And all reasonably priced! My friend and I split those two things and were very satisfied.
First, Jack the server was so friendly and helpful. The cheeseboats were so delicious. Bread was perfect and the inside was gooey and flavorful! Can't wait to go back.

I wanted fondue but my boyfriend wanted Cheeseboat, so we went there, and I must this say all my cheese cravings were answered. I didn't realize how deeply filled with cheese the boat is. We shared one among three people as an appetizer. So decadent! I also had the Elanji (sp?) which includes a huge cheesy bowl of polenta along with a beef walnut stew. The dumplings were interesting looking and juicy. The stuffed cabbage was tasty and lighter in portion than some of the other plates I saw. The only thing I would skip is the 4-dip appetizer. Very small dips for $16.. there's just so many tastier things on the pretty extensive menu.
No comment
No comment

this is one place we will never go again. it has all the hallmarks of a business that will shut in a year. nasty waitress, ridiculously loud club music at 5 pm, over priced cheese with bread and did I mention the "sister" of the manager? so rude .... go do some more coke in the kitchen honey, your restaurant is pretty terrible. join the list of other places that shut ... never again. was sooooo disappointed as Georgians have such a solid reputation for food, wine and hospitality. was basically disgusted by the place. at best it's bar food ... bye bye Cheeseboat, better grab a life preserver, you'll never last
No comment
No comment
This place is awesome. I had a lovely time with my friends. The cocktail was great the bread was great everything was amazing. I would love to go back here sometime soon until then Yum Yum Yum.
First time here on Wednesday night. Live music, great service, and AWESOME dishes. Really satisfying experience. Can't wait to bring my siblings here.

Good service, nice place, meh (to be generous) food. The cheese bread itself, however, is quite delicious. Guess it's worth passing by to pick up if you're in the area. I feel like the dishes are well intentioned, but don't quite pull through. Good luck Cheeseboat!!
Love there food cheese heaven I keep coming back to try a different cheesy bread any chance I get  determined to try them all great selection of meat dishes too flaming chicken is 10/10 . :)

Literally the best surprise I had for my Birthday ever. The food is awesome. They had a band going. I ordered a bacon filled cheeseboat. My date ordered a spinish filled cheeseboat. Small and cozy. Will repeat.
Very good Uzbek food. The cheeseboats are amazing and the dumplings as well. The best is the dessert!!!
No comment

I just moved to Williamsburg and I've been to Cheeseboat 3 times so far. I've brought friends here and we all agree that Georgian food is AMAZING. Highly recommend the chicken soup to start out. Its the best chicken soup Ive ever had. The Khachapuri (cheeseboat) is better than pizza!
No comment

In my opinion this place is over rated. The first time I went I was told a two hour wait (Friday evening) so I made reservations and returned the following week.  I was quite disappointed, I ordered the Mac &cheese boat and felt it just had no flavor. The bacon pieces were cooked to a crisp and made up for the lack of flavor, but unfortunately I won't be returning. no complaints on the service

I went following Yelp advice and I was not disappointed. I had a free glass of wine for checking in. The bacon and cheeseboat was wonderful. I loved it. I had Benedict eggs as an entree but I didn't like them that much. I would just order wine and the bacon cheeseboat for next time and it would be marvelous. The service was also excellent. Very nice people and excellence place.

The worst service experience I ever had in a restaurant. The food is good but unfortunately we got it 1 hour and a half after ordering!  We came with two 3 years old kids who have no patience to wait for such a long time. All in all, good food, terrible service. Not a family friendly place!!!
cheeseboat was ok, but i dream about the mille feuille 10/10
No comment

Amazing food. The pictures don't even do it justice. By far one of the best meals I've had. The service was not great, they only had one waiter and it was clearly a busy day. But the food was definitely worth it. Can't wait to eat here again

FIrst time trying the cuisine which I believe is Georgian, Russia.  Super salty cheese and carb overload with the bread; Also tried the chicken dumpling soup and it was okay, chicken filling was way too firm- and dumplin too doughy, the Asian version much better.  I did not care too much for the food and service was lackluster.

Cheeseboat goes a long way in helping me turn my friends into fellow khachapuri fanatics. Its menu features the standard, scrumptious staples one finds at other solid Georgian restaurants like Oda House and Old Tbilisi Garden. Cheeseboat stands out, however, with its more contemporary ambiance and deliciously inventive twists on khachapuri. I mean, generous helpings of bacon swimming in a bath of melted cheese, contained in the fluffiest, most tender bread you've ever eaten -- who wouldn't love that? Bring your friends, spread the word, get everyone on board the Cheeseboat! (See what I did there?)

Just spent two weeks eating all of the cheese Switzerland and France had to offer (fondue, raclette, aligot) and my boyfriend and I agreed Cheeseboat was STILL the best cheese dish we've ever had. Get the classic cheeseboat to split, the walnut salad, some of their homemade punch, and some dumplings. You won't be sorry!

Food was surprisingly good, but we ordered the Napoleon and it was another hour before they told us (after we flagged two waiters) that they ran out of Napoleon. We also ordered Borscht, tea, and coffee which were never received. Are you fucking serious?
No comment

I went last night with a friend and it was a horrible experience. The service was terrible and I'll explain why. You can tell the restaurant was understaffed, there were about 3 people working the floor meanwhile the entire restaurant was filled with people. We ordered the eggplant appetizer and when it came out, it was freezing cold and under seasoned. Our waiter (the only male with blonde hair) asked how the food was so far and I made a comment how we were a little disappointed that 1) the eggplant was cold and should probably be a warm dish, and 2) it was under seasoned. His response was, "Well, that's just the way it is. It's supposed to be like that" in a dismissive and rude tone. Not only did he not apologize, but his overall attitude was just unprofessional. The girl next to me tried to get his attention to order another drink and from afar, he raises his finger and says "YOU HAVE TO WAIT ONE SECOND." Not to mention right after he does this, he chugs an entire glass of champagne. Ugh. We ordered the mushroom cheese boat and it was pretty tasty. Based on the other reviews, the cheese boats all sound delicious but based on the service and staff alone, I'll never come back here again (especially with all the other food options in the neighborhood) and I'll make sure to warn my friends not to go or order from there as well. Such a disappointment!
No comment
This is my new go to spot in Williamsburg.  Perfect ambiance with incredible food, wine and service.  I am so happy this place exists.  Will be coming back often.

This is the first time I've had Georgian food. I'm sold. The food here is great. Plenty of vegetarian options too. The cheese boats are delicious. The Mertsvi (think mashed potato fondue) was scrumptious as well. My friend had chicken soup that he says was the best he ever had. The thing that sets Cheeseboat apart though is the relaxed, family owned vibe. 2 sisters and their brother were bartending hosting and waiting on us, all so friendly. We hung around at the bar and had some great glasses of wine and conversation with them.

In 7 years of living in New York and trying new restaurants every weekend this was by far and large my worst restaurant experience to date.  We waited 90 minutes for our appetizers, 60 minutes for our drinks and 30 minutes for our water.  Our table was forgiving because it was clear that the restaurant was slammed, however, knowing the recent write-up on Insider Food I believe they should have been better prepared in anticipation of all the hungry and excited customers.  There were 2 waiters, 1 bartender and a 1 hostess serving a packed restaurant. There was no busing service.  Our table was not cleared once and we were forced to stare at the remains of the skeleton from the Branzino we ordered for the remainder of the night.
You can't go wrong with cheese! The mushroom one was FANTASTIC, the mac & cheese one a little bland but still good. The bread is incredible as well!

The other night, me and my cousin, went in this lovely Georgian restaurant,and I can say the food was really good, but Hospitality was amazing we felt like we were in Georgia. We are definitely going back to taste some more of that delicious Georgian food, and I suggest you all to do the same:)
No comment

Like every restaurant in NYC now, incredibly overpriced.  The cornish hen was over $30 dollars and it was the hen chopped in four pieces in a bowl of sauce without a single side dish.  Arrive hungry, leave hungry, with a hole in your wallet.

I seriously can't get enough of this food - can't believe I didn't know about it until I stumbled across this new Williamsburg staple. Highly recommend it if you at all love Italian, Middle Eastern or Chinese food - interestingly combines all three into one incredible menu. The wine is amazing, and reasonably priced. It's a true family restaurant - which definitely brings the comfort of home to your table.

The food was great but the music was extremely loud to the point that it ruined the dinning experience.  We were not able to maintain a conversation at all. The tables next to us were very annoyed too.

Day trip from the city! Went here based on the yelp reviews and was not disappointed! Tried the cheeseboard with bacon. It was so great and filling. The chicken kabob was amazing. We really enjoyed the atmosphere and the staff. They were helpful, patient and friendly!! Go here for a nice lunch or brunch in the weekend!
Good place to carb load. We really traveled out of our way to get here, which I wouldn't recommend.  But if you're in the area, great place to to go instead of pizza.
No comment

After all the facebook buzz about this place, we knew we had to visit. However, the wait for our food and the service was horrendous. It started with cold coffee. Then, we had to repeatedly ask for water because they "forgot." We ended up having to ask 3 different people for our check. We had to literally hunt down our waiter in the backroom to get our check and found him swiping through facebook.. come on guys, GET IT TOGETHER!

Will not be back. The Cheeseboat was the only thing that we truly enjoyed. Other items we tried were Borsht and Harcho soup which were okay but not great. Dirty silverware and glasses but The service is where things get ugly and the wait time for the food was ridiculous , be prepared to spend at least 3 hours at this place.
Swrvice was excellent. Met the owner she truly loves her restaurant. Great history and story. The food was authentic and delicious.

One of the best eating experiences I've had in a long time. I'm sorry to admit I've never had Georgian cuisine before, but I'm glad I've finally been introduced to it. The cheeseboat was excellent and a perfect "tear and share" entree for the table. I also had the dumplings which were sooo delicious. I've never heard of Georgian dumplings before. The Chinese could learn a few things from this place.  Service was excellent and attentive. I ordered several drinks from the bar, but the best was the Georgian wine. Very tasty!
Great food! Great music! Great people! Went there with friends and we had a great night!!! Try Georgian Lobiani with bacon! Rest of the food is also great  and menu is really rich!!!
No comment
Food was great but service took forever. Be prepared to wait at least 30 minutes between each appetizer and  entree.

We saw cheese and bread and were very excited to try this place! We tried to order delivery to Greenpoint and they were like no. Fine. I'll go pick it up. Ordered food online. Done. Great. One minute later we got a call saying that we needed to cancel our order. They were too busy to get to it....WHAT? I called the restaurant to check if that is what was actually happening. If they had called me to say "Hey, its going to take a while but we will make sure you get fed." I would have felt better about it. Or if they were like "Sorry, its going to take a while here is some kind of coupon."  But no, "Hey you have to cancel your order, bye." I will not recommend this place to friends.

Absolutely terrible service. Had to ask for water after sitting for 20 mins. I forgot I ordered a drink because it took 30 mins to get from me. The cheeseboat was good, however I will definitely not be returning based on the service. What should have been an hour and a half dinner turned into 3 hours and it wasn't even busy.
Ordered delivery from this place. All the appetizers were delicious ( soup dumplings, salad, cheese balls) but the main pork dish was so salty is was inedible. Would try this place again though!
Decadent and amazing.  That said, a little hit or miss. Have ordered take-out from here several times and the same dish can arrive pretty drastically different.

I came with a group of Georgian friends and we ordered a variety of dishes to share.  The consensus was that while some of the food was quite good (for example, the khinkali), the overall experience was mediocre and seriously overpriced.  The staff were very friendly, but the service was odd:  hot dishes were brought first and appetizers last, there were long wait times between dishes, and one person didn't get served tea because the kitchen had run out of cups!  A couple of traditional Georgian dishes were also frankly sub par.  Overall, this place has a nice ambiance, but we probably won't be coming back.

Horrible. Where to start? We were a party of 6, early enough on a Friday night that the restaurant had only 4 other tables occupied. Nevertheless service was non-existent. None of the meals came out at the same time. Borscht and dumplings were both mediocre. Quinoa salad did not have the ingredients advertised. Kabobs were tough. But the real kicker is this:  we brought our own birthday cake (with the restaurant's prior blessing) only to be charged $50 fee for the privilege of not eating their dessert. Similar to what is said in other reviews here, there is nothing they will do for mistakes or outrageous charges on your bill. You pay the bill as written or they "will have to call the authorities." Nor is there any advance notice that a gratuity is automatically added (I understand that this is not uncommon for large parties, but 6 is not that large and in any event, they need to give you a heads-up if that this their policy.)  If you need a cheesey meal, avoid the aggravation of this place and go get pizza elsewhere.

I've only had katchapuri a few times, but the versions that Cheeseboat serves are innovative--not the same old same old--and delicious. Katchapuri with spinach is lighter than the traditional version, so you can go as light or decadent as you want (bacon). (I had the spinach.)  And the three dips with the house-made bread are unexpected and interesting. I'm always looking for new flavor combinations and this place has plenty to keep me happy and wanting to return. The place is cozy and there is a real positive family vibe here. We stopped in out of curiosity just to try it while visiting our son in Williamsburg which, in my opinion, is brunched out. We were pleasantly surprised and will  be back for sure, from the wilds of NJ. And for the record, katchapuri is as yummy and comforting as pizza. Dip and enjoy.

Perfect, cozy Williamsburg spot for an intimate date or large, family style dinner with friends. Spent my birthday there and the staff made me feel right at home. The food is the pinnacle of comfort food, filled with delicious bold flavors that go great with their Georgian wine. This place is a must-try!

My friends had been to this restaurant once before and they said the service was terrible, the waitress was rude, and the food took forever to arrive. I'm not sure why we decided to return (I guess a bread boat filled with melted cheese sounds appealing). The food was decent, but the experience was awful. First, it was extremely and uncomfortably warm in the restaurant--the heat was turned up way too high! The restaurant was completely empty but our waiter pretty much ignored us until we flagged him down to place our order, which he didn't write down (a bad sign). He talked us into ordering a $20 "jar of wine" (drink special). The white wine we received seemed to be very watered down (but I guess that's what you get for $20). Our cheeseboats came pretty quickly and were actually very tasty. However, after waiting for over an hour, the other food we ordered still had not arrived. We flagged down the waiter again, who didn't remember what we ordered (surprising, considering the restaurant was still almost empty). He apologized and said that the chicken would take another 15 minutes and the salmon would take longer. It was clear that he had not put in the order for our other food. As we were still pretty hungry, we decided to wait for the chicken, but cancelled our other order. He brought us a free jar of wine while we waited another 30 minutes for our chicken to arrive. The whole meal was fairly cheap split between 6 people, but it wasn't enough food and we all left feeling kinda hungry. I think you can probably find better Georgian food and much better service elsewhere. Would not recommend.

I came with two friends and we split two cheese breads (one classic boat, and a pizza- shaped bread) and an order of dumplings.  The food was filling, and it was really delicious and well- seasoned.  Getting dishes to share seems to be the way to go-- they've got some great variety here and there's lots to try.  We came in at 6:15 on a Saturday night, and I was surprised that my friends and I were able to get a reservation (and seated right away) considering all the hype this place has gotten recently. The service here was a little different than what I've experienced at other restaurants-- at most other places I've been to, servers are assigned a specific section of tables, but on this particular night at least, all servers seemed to be helping with all tables.  This may contribute to other reviews I've seen mentioning slow service.  Getting our meals and the check was a tad slow, but we didn't mind since we weren't in a rush and the servers were really friendly and helpful.
Romantic atmosphere, great martinis, yummy small plates, and always has availability. What's not to love?

Deux Chats is an exciting addition to the Williamsburg food and drink scene. I stopped by to grab a quick bite at the bar & loved the casual but refined ambiance. The west coast oysters were delicious, but the salmon crudo was my absolute favorite. Everything was super fresh, and appreciate the fact that they use seasonal ingredients. Will definitely be coming back to try the lobster roll & seafood towers!
No comment
No comment

Deux Chats, is a nice addition to the area! I stopped by here recently and had an amazing time with friends. The ambiance is great and lively! The decor is easy on the eyes when dining in or outside. From the menu I had a couple of cocktails and they were fantastic! The food items I had was the beef tartare, mussels, crudo, and oysters. Everything is meant for sharing, so its good to order a couple of dishes to share. The oysters were amazing, they have both east and west coast oysters! Definitely worth checking out and trying out!

Worst service. Made to feel unwelcome and rushed from the moment we sat down and the hostess made it abundantly clear that she only cared about filling our seat with the next table. Definitely will never be back.

We are locals and were excited to try it. South Williamsburg is in need of a seafood heavy hitter but sadly this ain't it. We ordered a dozen oysters, the shrimp, salmon, deviled eggs and negronis. The oysters were long dead and spoiled, tasted more like mud than brine. The shrimp were over-salted to cover up a lack of freshness. The crudo was a d-grade salmon likely bought at city acres next door. Not thoughtfully dressed or plated. And the laziest deviled eggs with hard boiled yolks still in tact. Negronis somehow made with little to no alcohol- all that and a $250 bill for two people for a casual Friday snack. Massive disappointment. Do better!!!
I came in separately from people I knew. I ordered food and drinks and they wouldn't let me have my own tab because I said hi to people. It was suggested i Venmo the people I knew. Lazy

Tightly packed restaurant with a small menu. I enjoyed getting cocktails and a seafood tower but have to go in with the expectation that you are paying to eat in a "cute" place. Cocktails and food were good tho.

This hole-in-the-wall Thai restaurant doesn't seem like much, but it's absolutely amazing. Possibly the best Thai food I've ever had (with the important note that I've never been to Thailand). Great service, good portion size, reasonable price, and absolutely delicious.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Hi. I am writing this review, because of the service i got. I had ordered veg pad kee mow. I ordered the food for delivery and received a meat piece in my noodles. I was not sure when i saw it so i ask my korean meat eater friend to verify it. She verified it as meet. I called them to complaint and asked them to exchange my food. To which they did not. They kept denying it and accused me that i have complained such way many times before. To which i asked them to check the records. I have ordered only 2 times from here till now. First time i pickup 4months back. I liked their food so i ordered today. But their service was a disaster. It disheartens me. The lady was rude, kept arguing and hung up the call. I wish i could give them negative ratings for such baseless accusation

This place has fallen off a cliff. It used to be my go-to, but the flavorlessness of my last few orders has me questioning myself. Practically inedible pad Thai and now I see their grade is pending, sooo...
No comment
No comment
Very cute spot love the blue greeted with such welcoming energy definitely a spot worth going back to

I visited this place with a friend and it was nice and cozy, the food was amazing. It was a nice place to talk and catch up, the staff was very attentive. I ordered the Pad Kee Mow with shrimp and my friend ordered Thai rice with shrimp and we shared Mommy shrimp with (2) Thai iced teas. So good!
No comment
No comment

I wasn't joking when I said I will be back. Brought my bf here yesterday for dinner. Once you open the door, there was a slight musty smell. The smell went away after a bit, so it didn't really bother me. The food was delicious and we enjoyed every dish we ordered. The dipping sauce for the chive pancake was really good. I even dipped the pork skewers into the sauce. The short ribs dish was very flavorful and the beef was tender.
No comment
No comment
No comment
We stopped in at Charm Kai for lunch and the food was outstanding!  Highly recommend the the spicy basil with rice, so good!
Best thai food ever! I had them all! Go get you some, i enjoy all of it.  I will go there next time im in Brooklyn
No comment
The green curry was amazing. Fresh ingredients with incredible spice. Only a couple tables.

Very cute Thai shop that offers great food and amazing service! I came for a quick bite with a friend. All staff are wearing masks and check for vaccination records for indoor dining. The food is delicious and I'll definitely be back for another lunch trip to try their other dishes!

The food is super yummy, price is reasonable, and excellent customer service! Overall a very pleasant casual dinner!! The place is small, but cozy, with a few tables only. That's why I see they do a lot of takeouts.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Best Thai food I have ever had. The space is a quaint hole in the wall with only a few tables. The service is great, everyone working here is lovely. We had the vegetable dumplings, chicken satay, mango salad and green curry. The food was so good we went back twice in one week (were staying at a hotel down the street). Highly recommend for a casual delicious dinner.
No comment
Khao Soi was very good. Tangy, spicy and creamy. Was flavorful and the noodles were great as well
No comment

Looks like there's been a change in management or chef because the food was really watery and bland which is such a shame. Id try some other Thai restaurants as there a much better ones for less money.
No comment
No comment

cute little spot with a couple tables outside. prices are a bit high but for some items but overall a decent place if you're in the mood for thai food. They've got your typical pad thai and pad see ew but they also have massaman curry with beef short ribs, whole fried fish and some regional specialty dishes as well. Staff is nice and accommodating and food prep was relatively quick. the husband is a thai food fiend and he approves!
No comment
Cashew chicken is one of my Sunday night takeout go-tos. They're quick, consistent and tasty. Recommended!
No comment
No comment
Good taste compared to UES Up Thai, but portions significantly less at comparable price point
No comment

I was very disappointed in the Pad Kee Mao and Mango Salad I ordered for delivery. The Pad Kee Mao had good flavor but really grainy texture. I had to throw out the salad because of how bad it smelled immediately when I opened the container (so much fish sauce).
No comment
No comment
No comment

Passed this place multiple times but never noticed it until I searched Thai place in Yelp today! It turned out a pleasant surprise. I only ordered Duck Pineapple Curry, but the portion is huge enough that I  can only finish half of it. Flavor is amazing and brought me back to days in Bangkok. Will definitely come more and try other dishes in the future!
This is my first time here but it was a very pleasant experience with very good food. We found this spot using our Yelp app, good choice
One of the best Thai places around. We needed a place like this in the area. I've ordered takeout and dined in. Both were great. Nice depth of flavor and spice if you want it. (I do)

My favorite thai food EVER!! Everything always is hot and fresh. It's never greasy like some places can be. I order here at least twice a week and will continue to do so for as long as I can!! And if you do eat inside and not get takeout, the shop is clean and decorated so cute! Go to food favorites are thai fried rice with chicken and shrimp pad thai. If you haven't tried, it's a must do!!
No comment
No comment

Thoroughly impressed!! Ordered the pad kee mow - wide rice noodles with egg, scallion, basil, and choice of protein. I got shrimp. It was grilled very well! The noodles we're cooked to perfection with a good bounce. Just the right amount of spice and portion size was good too! It's a small space to sit down but the inside is super cute. Total came out to $14 plus tax and tip. I can't wait to go back!!
I have had LOTS of pineapple fried rice from various Thai spots around New York, but was so surprised at how good Charm Kao's was. Their pineapple fried rice is probably one of the best I've had!

My family gets takeout here often because they are SO GOOD!  Literally everything on the menu is delicious though the fried chicken is an especially delicious meal as is the short rib curry. My picky kids love the Pad Thai.  The staff couldn't be more lovely.

This place is very small! It only has 4-5 tables in the whole place. It seems really new so I guess that's why my friends and I were the only table on a Saturday evening. But, the food was really good and totally worth the wait that it took to get to the table! I got the Drunken noodles (which I always get at every Thai restaurant so I have a lot to compare this dish to). The dish was excellent. The balance of noodles, beef, and vegetables was delicious. The meat was cooked perfectly and the noodles were tasty and well sautéed. I would definitely come back here again and get the drunken noodles! I am interested in trying the other dishes, as well, so it looks like I'll be coming back here more often in the future.

It's okay. I had the lunch special pad see ew with Thai salad and it was middle-of-the-road Thai food. Not the worst, not the best. The bigger issue is the price. The going rate for a Thai lunch special in the area is about $9. This was $11.95 + tax. Glad I tried it but there is better and cheaper Thai in the area.
My 1st time try from  there. Ordered the pad see ew. And it was soo good. The Taste was authentic. I would try another menu from them.
No comment
this place is amazing!! small, but adorable decor and great service! i'm gluten free and the server was well informed. the fried tofu and green curry was AMAZING!!! i recommend!!
Amazing Thai food! Beautifully decorated and great service. This was a gem nestled into the streets of downtown Brooklyn. Will definitely be going back when I'm in the area again!

This small spot (seats 12 max) is a gem in this neighborhood. The decor is beautifully simple yet stunning and the food and customer service is phenomenal. The Crab Meat Fried Rice is heavenly, the Pad Kee Mow is delicious and the Crispy Fried Branzino is phenomenal. 10/10 would recommend this spot and can't wait to come back and try the rest of the dishes!

The best Thai in the area! Amazing for delivery, is better than any other Thai delivery that we have had since we have lived in Brooklyn (for 6 years). The food is complex and the meat is juicy - not overly sweet like most places. Tastes authentic and comforting. We are so excited we found Charm Kao!
No comment
Came here late on a Thursday and it was super cute even though it was small. Service was great and food was awesome. I had the best drunk noodles with shrimp ever. Would def come back

My partner and I ordered delivery from Charm Kao twice and we're not fans. We tried the fried rice, pineapple fried rice, and vegetable dumplings. Food was overly greasy and pretty flavorless. It's in a convenient location for us, but we won't be ordering from here again.

Had dinner here tonight. It's a cozy spot with only 4 tables with max seating of 12. For apps, I ordered the GUI chai (pancakes), which was surprisingly the best dish tonight. I also ordered the mommy shrimp (fried shrimp rolls), which was good but nothing special. For entrees ordered the kao soi, which was very flavorful and the chicken wasn't overcooked like many Thai restaurants. Pad Thai was also on point. Recommend the spot for good authentic, quality Thai food.

Small well decorated restaurant with a lot of menu options that are different than a regular pad thai or pad see ew noodle dish. Service is fast and responsive. The salad was delicious and fresh. I'd be happy to visit again for a fast solo dinner. Welcoming place for solo diners.

column3: North Beach/Telegraph Hill, San Francisco, CA
column6: This place is an absolute gem. Having eaten plenty of amazing Thai food in Thailand, I can appreciate authenticity when I taste it! I was transported right back to Bangkok where my friends dragged me around sampling tons of amazing food. Same Same! :)
No comment

Cute Thai place in downtown Brooklyn. Very small so come early for dinner! Appetizers were excellent. Chicken pad Thai was great as well (wish I ordered it spicy). Going to try the curry short rib next time. Definitely recommend!

Agree with the other reviews, very good quality, fresh Thai.  Mango salad was delicious (if a bit drowning in the dressing), and pad Thai was nice, as well - except for a bit of a fishy after taste, which isn't my fave..but that's just me.  Overall a welcome addition to the neighborhood!
Fast, friendly service! Good music, nice decor, nice ambiance. Pad See Ew was a bit salty but awesome portion!

Had the lunch special it was okay, small portions. as I was leaving I was told by the waitress I didn't leave a tip when I clearly left one in their tip jar. Didn't think that was professional at all, she shouldn't have scolded me and tell me I didn't leave a tip when I did.
I have been all over the world and I have to say this is the best Thai I have eaten in America- the flavors are outstanding- the depth of flavor exquisite!  Must eat place in Brooklyn!!

I've been to this restaurant for lunch before and was very pleased with my meal and everything. I saw that they take orders for food delivery so I placed an order today at 7:46 PM. It's already 9:22 at the time of writing this review and I have yet to receive my order. I tried contacting them via phone and no one picks up. I received confirmation from the app that says my order is in the works and that estimated time to deliver was 35-55 minutes. If you're going to offer delivery service, you should at least make your phone available for customers to contact you in case situations like this occur. I don't recommend ordering from this place if this is how they treat delivery service. If you're looking to try them out, you're better off going to the restaurant.

Great addition to this neighborhood.  The area really needed a good Thai restaurant.  Before placing my takeout order I had just eaten a terrible larb dish from City Point and wanted to make up for it at Charm Kao. I ordered the  Kee Mao Noodles and the Chicken Basil sauce.  They were both very good and the spice level was just right.  I liked that the basil sauce had some diced string bean for some extra crunch.  The portions were good size and not overly oily.   My advice to this restaurant is to be mindful of the oil and be careful of the cartilage in the ground chicken.  I noticed a few bits of it that wasn't chew able.

The lunch specials were really well priced. Food was delicious, came out fast and hot. We ordered extra appetizers thinking the lunch special wouldn't be enough, we were so wrong but it was totally worth that mistake :). The atmosphere was cozy and bright, music was soothing and mellow. Staff were nice and food was nicely plated and tasted really good, I would definitely recommend.
Really enjoy their quick service and delivery. Haven't ordered one thing and not liked it!
Very small place 4 tables only , really cozy. Food is always delicious and on point . First time trying Thai food and is very delicious .
This restaurant is fantastic! The best Thai food I've had in New York! All the richness without the oiliness!

duck curry great when they first opened and still good but i think they realized that the portions they were giving were too big because now the amount of duck is at least 25% less then my first few orders. same thing with the short ribs. still very tasty but smaller ribs!

My first visit this week was for breakfast.  At 7:45 AM very few tables were occupied so seating was easy.  The facility is attractively furnished and clean.  The food was quite good however the coffee left much to be desired. It was weak, lacked flavor and failed to stay hot for more than a minute served in a glass mug. The area we found unacceptable was service that was inexplicably slow with tables only 25% occupied. I enjoyed the food and may give it a second chance albeit reluctantly.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Delicious breakfast , great service , perfect quiet classy ambiance. We were looking for something healthy and quiet -away from the hustle of all of the diners and Times Square and we found the perfect spot.

Short rib dinner was excellent, with pine nut and delicious squash purée. Small room, maybe ten tables, and not as loud as most NYC restaurants. A feeling of getting off the busy sidewalk and slowing down. Service was fine, but might slow on a busy night.
No comment
No comment
Fantastic service and delicious menu.  Stayed at the Gotham Hotel and found the Reading Room restaurant.  I'll be back soon.

Came here just for drinks. It's a little hard to find but it's located inside the hotel on the ground floor. Once you get there though it's a nice little quiet find. I was pleasantly surprised with the ambiance. It's definitely very nice for a couple drinks or a light dinner. The servers were very nice throughout the meal and checked in often. Will go back to explore the rest of the drinks menu
A cozy little spot for a delicious steak. The ribeye is really tender. The cocktails are decent. The ambiance is dim and romantic.
No comment

Went with group of 6 after saturday matinee. Reservation held nicely and immediately seated. Service was on point. Butchers plate was nice sharing dish. Salads fine and main course good too. All was nice. Recommend!
Great hidden gem! Food is amazing! The service was impeccable. The staff was very attentive, gave us great recommendations when we were ordering.

Solid 4-plus. I'm not one to give 5 stars unless it's really super unique and special. Was skeptical of so many 5-star reviews but was in the 'hood and decided to try. They do EVERYTHING well.  Service, vibe, dishes with some nice little twists. Tight enticing menu...great cocktails and super friendly and knowledgeable mixologist.  Best part is it's hidden in a hotel and is hardly noticed so no problem getting a seat. Really loved everything about it and will return to try more.

Had a great dinner at the reading room. Grabbed a reservation through Resy but it wasn't crowded at all at 8:30pm. We ordered the Salmon and the Short Rib. Both were phenomenal and enjoyed the sides that came with them too. Our waitress was kind and service was overall good but a tad slow at times. Looking forward to going back!
No comment

Reading Room is a hidden gem. Incredible bartender, great vibe, allergy-friendly. Also -- Best. Steak. Ever. Fantastic option for happy hour that rolls right into dinner. Also an awesome spot for private parties!!
No comment

Just a short distance from the madness of grand central, and overcrowded bars, sits this small, bright establishment with solid drink choices and ... dare we say ... the ability to hear a conversation. Excellent music is even piped into the one stall private bathrooms. Worth it if meeting at Grand Central to avoid the chaos

Truly exceptional. My husband is a picky eater and he states that his filet was the best he has ever had. This restaurant is tucked inside of the Gotham Hotel just blocks away from time square and Rockefeller Center. It has limited seating and a quiet ambiance. The server was kind and prompt and it was not busy at all. We sat at 7 pm on a Wednesday night. Would definitely visit again.

Had been wanting to try this spot for a few months. I came here for a first date a couple weeks back and thought it was great. We split the charcuterie board (10/10), the Brussels sprouts (10/10), and the octopus (10/10). I had the Smokey old fashioned which was great as well. The service was pretty good (except for its New York and they don't have anywhere to hang coats or check bags). I thought the ambiance was good but checking through the front of the hotel wasn't ideal
Great little intimate food spot with great food, coffee and service. Egg Benedict was sooo good!
No comment
Food was subpar but due to the service, this place deserves a 4 star. I liked that the manager? stopped by twice to check in on us. Not a place I would return twice though but glad we did stop by!

Love the atmosphere and decor. Food was also delicious. The brussel sprout app and the braised short rib were both *chefs kiss*. It was definitely pricey and the service was super slow, but I would go again on another trip to NYC. Possibly just for a drink at the bar next time.
Great food, fresh oysters, decent service, good liquor/wine selection. Was a bit noisy when we were there, though.
Absolutely delicious steak and mashed potatoes. Melted in my mouth. Drink was tasty too! A needed respite from the chaos just outside.

I hosted an intimate business at The Reading Room and was thoroughly pleased with my experience. Niamh worked with me to support scheduling and was very accommodating to our changes. The atmosphere was intimate yet inviting. The food was sooooo good! I ordered the butternut squash soup (so tasty). For my main entree I ordered the salmon (without bacon) and it was out of this world! So good; so flavorful. I'm in love with this place. Completely agree this is a hidden gem within the Gotham. I will be back!
No comment

The food is delicious! The restaurant is very well decorated. I love the custom velvet cushions! We ate here for breakfast. The crunchy Benedict is a must!  The waitress was very friendly and very attentive!
No comment

This little dining room boasts loud music (for no reason) and comfortable seating with a small but nice menu. Good coffee and the food is nicely made, very fresh and creative. Quiet too. Wasn't too crowded so it was a great place to catch up with friends. It's in a hotel so not a ton of foot traffic. Servers were also very nice and attentive.
Warm and cozy. Super cute restaurant! The food was really good and the staff was really friendly.
Everything was delicious! Pleasantly surprised to find this gem just by searching in yelp! Definitely would come back! The braised short rib melted in my mouth! Very tasty!
A nice quiet corner with fantastic food and service. The short ribs were falling off the bone and delicious. Average midtown prices but great ambiance for unwinding with a glass of wine.

It is such a cozy and beautiful place! The food was amazing, the rib eye was so juicy and tender, it was incredible! I strongly recommend trying the bone marrow and egg, it was very delicious. The staff is very friendly and attentive and the atmosphere is so relaxing. Gorgeous solid bar with great drinks, i will definitely be back for sure!

Awesome spot with great drinks and food! Started with the meat and cheese board and beef carpaccio as the appetizer, then had the ricotta gnocchi as the entrée, and finished off with freshly made sorbet. Highly recommend!
Wonderful experience here! Staff were great, the chef came around to speak to each table at the restaurant. Fun, creative menu - the food was fantastic!
Fantastic food and service for brunch. Drinks were great as well and the steak and eggs is great
No comment
Amazing. Drinks, service, ambiance, all of it. Absolutely loved it. Cozy, tasteful. Can't say enough good things about the place.
Lovely, quiet place in midtown for breakfast. Great avocado toast. Welcoming service.
New addition to the Midtown Manhattan! Great vibes, really good drinks selection and delicious food! Don't miss Ricotta gnocchi and Bleu gem salad! Yum! I would definitely recommend to everyone!
Nice low key breakfast place  great for early or breakfast meetings. Food was great and atmosphere nice and mellow.

Beyond excellent service by a very friendly and helpful waitress. The food was great too. Highly recommend the grilled octopus and the peri peri chicken. The bartender made us a custom Italian lime soda on request which was very appreciated.
No comment

Came to check out the new spot in the neighborhood & we loved it! Lighting, decor & music were on point. Incredible food & great service. We started with cocktails (all delicious), oysters, beet tar tar & the bone marrow. My god, the bone marrow! Like meat butter, so good. Then the main attraction came of the Rib-eye for 2, cooked perfectly med-rare, incredible. We were so stuffed but always make room for dessert. The three sorbets & lava cake went very quickly. Everything tasted so good & the owners were so nice.

This place was fantastic! My boyfriend and I made a reservation for 8:00 PM when we arrived the hostess told us that their bigger party was running late so our table wasn't quite ready which was fine with us, we were in no rush. She had us sit at the bar and we had a drink while we waited. We only waited for our table for about 10 minutes, then we were seated. We ordered the Cesar salad which was delicious, the dressing was homemade. My boyfriend ordered the chicken, and I ordered the braised short ribs. Both were very good. The drinks were also delicious, I will post the picture above. When we got the bill we noticed that our first two drinks weren't on there, we asked what was the hostess but come to find out also the owner and she said it was on them for making us wait, which I thought was very nice and really not even necessary since we didn't wait long but very good hospitality. The owner was so friendly, she told us all about their new endeavor and told us a couple of other bars to go to. I would 100% come back, and would give the whole experience a 5 star rating! It was not overly priced, delicious food, great drinks and a nice ambiance!
No comment

I absolutely loved this bar/restaurant.  The staff was fantastic!  Everyone was extremely friendly.  The chef greeted us at our table at the end of the night and he was delightful. The library theme was subtle, and the food was delicious.  Save room for dessert!
No comment
No comment

I've visited the Grotto BK on several occasions and each time I've always been impressed with their food and service. My favorite dishes are the Escovitch Shrimp, Grotto Pasta with Shrimp, and  their Mac + Cheese is 10/10!
No comment
No comment

I enjoyed my visit to the grotto! My favorite dish was the starfish and bake. They do have bottomless mimosas here which will definitely sneak up on you! You can also purchase hookah here guys! The spot is small but once you go to the back there's more room.
No comment

If you're looking for great decor and even better drinks, look no further! Came in on a Wednesday for happy hour and enjoyed their fruit punch, 2 for 1 during happy hour!! We sat at the bar and were greeted by the owners daughter and then got a chance to chat with the owner as well.  Very down to earth family and service was great! Great set up with their DJ and hookah. The place gets packed very quickly so be sure to grab seats early, they have a variety of menu items as well! We'll be back for hookah!!

The food was okay. I've had better shrimp and grits, the mimosas will get you drunk but the service was REALLY SLOW. It took forever to get our mimosa refills and brunch is only 90 mins so we probably each got 1 refill. We spent $83 each for brunch and it was not worth it. It's $40 for the unlimited mimosas PLUS the price of your meal which is something that should be explained because we all assumed it was $40 per person plus tax & gratuity. Even getting our water pitcher refilled took forever. Getting cups took a long time too. I don't know if it'll be worth it to come back to this place again. There's only seating in their outside area, the inside area is strictly a bar so no tables there. Our server was MIA most of the time we were there,  yet when it was time to pay the bill she hovered over us like we would run out on her.
No comment
No comment

I had such a horrible experience there. The seating is located in an uninstalled extension of the outside. I wore my coat the entire time. Food took 2 hrs to come, plastic plates, no knives, Did I mention I was freezing, those outdoor heating lamps are not pushing out enough heat. No one has any hospitality training, however, the food was good but the overall experience would not allow me to recommend this place...
No comment

Food was amazing ! I had curry goat rice and peas with cabbage  . Also had the shrimp appetizers the Thai sweet chili shrimp and the escovitch shrimp that I would highly recommend! Service was great! I will definitely be coming back! Great experience!
No comment
The food was amazing. I had the Rasta pasta and oxtail delicious. They also have drinks at reasonable price and hookah. I tend to go out by myself and the vibe was just right nothing

Unassuming ... seemed so quiet. I was unsure if they was still open for the night. But i pushed pass my awkwardness  and headed to the back and the backyard was a vibe. The drinks are strong even though i don't see a full bar. The food was definitely made fresh to order and flavorful. I was craving oxtails. I had a decent serving for what i see places serve these days. I asked for my rice to side and ordered mac n cheese. Mac n cheese was good.  It was alot of rice and tasted really good. I'm not sure who created that meme that Jamaicans dont make good rice cause that's a damn lie. My sister got the jerk nachos which also came out fresh to order and tasted very good. I have been in the cut lately due to covida and glad i got to  experience a new spot

The wings &  mac & cheese was amazing but the service was TERRIBLE. Was going to order an actual entrée but the appetizers took so long that we didn't even want to order any more food from there. It isnt the servers fault since she was covering a bunch of tables but as the customer it isn't fair to pay an automatic 20% tip when the server was not attentive nor did she offer water or utensils for our table we had to keep requesting for something as simple as napkins. But they included tip automatically even tho it was just a party of 3. So yea might just order take out from here but never dining in. The ambiance was okay everyone was frustrated on how long the food was taking. A customer was saying how he waited over an hour for 5 wings :/
No comment
No comment

I went to Grotto with a few of my friends for brunch and I'll start by saying I left full and we all left drunk. My chicken and waffles was good and so was my boyfriend's French toast. Now on to the not so stellar things. 1. The shrimp and grits was literally soup 2. There is only outdoor seating, inside is only a bar no tables. 3. They advertise 90 minutes of bottomless mimosas for $40 on the brunch menu but fail to mention that the $40 does NOT include food. 4. The service was super slow. In the 90 minutes I only got two mimosa refills because the waitress kept disappearing. But when it was time for us to pay she made sure to HOVER over us. Also they serve Caribbean food but had American hot sauce (Tabasco) which I found strange. All and all I would not go back.

The food is absolutely AMAZING!!! The is the perfect spot close to home! Always great vibes and friendly staff! The Mac & cheese is my absolute favorite! Everything on the menu is excellent! Brunch on Sundays are a hit! Love here and it's walking distance

I love The Grotto BK!  Listen! It's like having your parents busting it down in the kitchen! The food better than  good, it is AMAZING! Authentic Jamaican food at it's best!  The staff is helpful and pleasant and make you feel at home.

Met up with my new friend here after work. First off the place is small there was only 2 tables in the front and they only seat 2 ppl per table. Next, they took forever and a day to come and take our order we sat at the table for at least 30 minutes before our order was taken. Nowwwww the wait for our food was longer than the wait for them to take our order and to make it worse they only brought out my friend food and I had to wait another 20 minutes to get mines. Lastly the drinks were pretty good  my we had the coconut Caribbean drink really good, I notice it was a popular drink because the little ppl they had in there had the drink. Moving on to the food my friend had Buffalo wings and fries she said it was good, I had Oxtails, white rice, cabbage and sweet plantains the oxtails was pretty tuff  they didn't fall off the bone I had to fight to get the meat off the bone however the gravy and everything else was good they even give you gravy on the side for your rice. And, lastly the music was good...
Tomatoes, Tomatoes... waited over an hour for food that never came. When I finally asked the waiter how much longer do we have to wait for our food, they said they're getting started on it now.

One of the best dining experiences of my life. The food was delicious and beautifully prepared. You could taste that thought and care that went into each plate. Honestly the best wine pairing I've had since moving to NYC. Highly recommend.
No comment
No comment

Totally deserving of the two Michelin stars they have held for years. Was excited to finally try it and I was not let down. Aska is kind of aquavits hip moody little brother who lives in Brooklyn. The dark interior can seem oppressive but the lighting really lets the food shine. Tidy efficient kitchen is in sight and the staff is super attentive. Neve waited for anything! It's prolly better they make you pay ahead that way you can just focus on the food. And I would be lying if I said it was expensive. It is and yes you may leave a little hungry. But, personally I felt fine and not like a stuffed pig by the end. This is quality over quantity and I am ok with that. The neo-Scandinavian food is seafood heavy. But, each bit is refreshing and flavorful and unique. Inspired sauces and flavors drawn from nature rather than pounding the food with spices. This really lets the ingredients sing. I left pictures and am not going to say what was best, because every dish was solid. In fact what was most impressive was that the meal built. Each dish flowed into the next and in a way was better then the last. It was a truly harmonious meal. Worth the splurge for a special occasion. Only wish is that they had liquor and cocktails but not a big deal.
No comment

Amazing service, awesome food and amazing attention to dietary restriction! I'm gf and they made gf bread/ sweets for me so I don't miss out! Everything was interesting and I loved 90% of everything I tried (I'm really picky too)! My first Scandinavian food tasting journey and so glad I came here for this! Will be back!

Yum! Came here for my birthday dinner 6/2022 and loved it. The all black aesthetic really set the mood and the kitchen was the main focal point. Everyone worked in perfect synchronization and the staff didn't miss a beat. Food was spectacular. Very creative presentation and unique flavors. The Langoustine from Norway was immaculate it will definitely be a dish I will remember for a very long time. Would come back again! This restaurant completed my journey of trying all the 3 and 2 Michelin star restaurants in NY and I must say this was overall a very memorable one!

Continuing on our fine dining journey, we decided to finally give this restaurant a try. They have definitely proven to be creative with all their dishes. the amount of effort in each dish and the fine details were evident in the presentation. As for the taste, a lot of the dishes are interesting. Interesting in the way that we were like woah what is this? This is a new blend of flavors in my mouth.  And we couldn't register a oh we love this or an oh this is odd but I guess good or maybe just odd. Regardless, we had a great time. We left quite hungry and ready for our second dinner. Street parking wasn't too bad that night.

Aska was definitely a memorable experience and I'm glad I got to experience it.  There were some missteps with some of the dishes, but all in all they were delicious- especially those dessert truffles!  I appreciate that they were accommodating of the fact that my lovely friend came a little late and still let us sit and enjoy the meal.  When the table was needed for another party, they graciously accommodated with a table outside.  The reason I gave 4 stars VS 5 stars is I felt that some of the dishes weren't what I had expected them to be but all in all it's definitely an experience worth having.
No comment
Impeccable and intriguing. Beautiful service start to finish. 10/10 recommend this experience

This place is simply incredible. Such a fun and unique experience! Each bite melts in your mouth and pairs perfectly with all of the wines they serve you. I love how they have an open kitchen so that you can see the chefs preparing your food. The sommeliers are also very attentive and make sure that you are properly fed and wined. I love how dark the restaurant is as well. Perfect for a fancy, romantic date night.

Food was very beautiful and everything was tasty. Some things were superb. wonderful service. Not filling at all though and left hungry. My friend and I got McDonald's afterwards :/ it was nice, but I feel no need to go back. I know it's a fine dining experience and the point is not to leave feeling stuffed, but for the amount of money you pay it would be nice to get more food.

Sat down at 7:30pm on a Thursday (group of 8 people). "Dinner" took ~4.5hrs. John (tall bald gentlemen) should evaluate his demeanor towards guests paying $500 per person and pay attention to requests/details. When a restaurant asks about dietary restrictions and then bluntly ignores such restrictions- a piece of your soul dies. Icing on the cake (or lack there of) was being chases out into the street for a larger tip.
No comment
No comment

Loved the consistent use of edible flowers and flavorful liquids. Enjoyed the first dish (on kelp) and ice cream dessert less than other courses. Food arrived at a comfortable pace; usually a few minutes between each of 14 courses and about a half-dozen paired drinks. As aesthetic as it was delicious, to the extent that, for a few courses, it seemed premature for the servers to immediately cover the artpiece with sauce/etc. Maybe a solution is to ask the customer whether they'd want to pour it themselves. Nonetheless, impeccable coordinated service. Environment and scenery feel NYC-esque (more condensed and low-key than one may expect). Overall an impressive, unique, unforgettable meal. Aska deserves its stars: both Michelins and the 5 I give it.

This place is absolutely amazing! Worth every penny! Got the wine pairing alongside the menu. I was blown away by the food. So many flavors. One of my favorite meals!

Appearance without substance. The art of high cuisine is to combine presentation, taste, and texture. They got the presentation but seem to have forgotten about the taste and texture. All show and pretense, without the actual pleasure. I've dined at most 2 and 3 Michelin starred restaurants in NYC and this was the worst.

Creatively curated menu in a Scandinavian inspired interior design setting.  Every dish was flawlessly executed, and the in-house sommelier was very knowledgeable.
