No comment
The nachos with carnitas or chicken is the dish to order here. The guac, fish taco and breakfast burrito we had for brunch were just ok. The margaritas were decent.

They keep it simple here but in the best way. Can't go wrong with any of the tacos. The mole is tasty. The enchiladas are worth the calorie bomb and the prices are fair. No watered down flavor here everything is thoughtfully prepared and well seasoned. I wish they kept the pork chop on the menu which was great but maybe it will make a return. It's not as trendy as other options but you will leave happy for sure.

Food and service amazing! There was a party of 12 of us and we had such a great time. My friends sister had reserved a table and put together a little menu for us in honor of the bride-to-be. The drinks were on point, I was obsessed with the Oaxaca Express. Delicious. For a starter I choose the fish tacos (pan fried to be Gluten Free-thanking the server who helped me figure out my options!) And I had the chicken poblano which was excellent. Also, I wound up leaving my phone in the bathroom!!!! And they happily returned it to me before they closed for the night. A+

Great for outdoor dining. I stopped by for a quick drink. Had the guacamole appetizer. The sangria was great too. The outdoor dining is great they have lots of tables and chairs, separated by plexiglass. I can't wait to go again and have some tacos!!!!

Lovely brunch menu at La Contenta! The outdoor dining set up is so charming and the heaters kept us very warm. Reasonable cocktail prices and good service! Have yet to be disappointed by this restaurant and am already looking forward to my next trip back.

Told my friend I was craving "meaty tacos" so we have this place a try bc the carne asada taco pics on Yelp looked INCREDIBLE. And guys, I kid you not... even after my expectations had been heightened by the other 5-star reviews and pictures, I was STILL blown away. We opted for the $18 lunch special which included 3 MONSTER gourmet tacos, a soup or salad and a coffee or tea. Soup was also so, so, so good--- Mexican "squash soup" he called it? Comes with fresh avocado, cheese, tortilla chips and sour cream as garnish. Was divine. Service was also amazing and our waiter was super informative and attentive. Will come here again, and how great is it that they take reservations? See you again soon La Contenta, I definitely ate to my heart's content.

No comment

Yummy cocktails and delicious tacos! Also very cute and festive vibe. Went on a hot summer Sunday evening and sat outside in one of their little plastic tents which was cute but a bit too warm given the sunny sticky weather. Really loved the cocktail selection but wish the happy hour deals were better and the guacamole was just ok.
No comment

Me and my friend decided to try this restaurant out after perusing the restaurants that were participating in restaurant week. It was INCREDIBLE. The service was so friendly, welcoming and attentive! They didn't rush us and let us talk for long after we had finished (I promise we weren't holding up a table, when they started to fill up we obviously paid and left) the food is delicious and so fresh. We got the carne asada tacos and the shrimp enchiladas-INCREDIBLE. Also the drinks are delicious and so pretty. This is our new go-to spot. Still not over how nice and friendly everyone was on top of the incredible food and drink.

I went to this bar for the first time, as recommended by my best friend. As soon as I walked in I felt like family. José  is the best bartender!! His drinks are not only strong by the alcohol to mixer ratio is on point! I hate my in laws but I KNOW that José will bring me and my bitchy-mother-in-law together!
Found this little gem after coming out of the banksy exhibit. Food was delicious and the drinks were on point! Can't wait to go back.

Didn't expect it but, La Contenta Oeste was certainly outstanding. It was very reasonably priced. By the way, have Pollo En Mole Poblano, you will genuinely love it. The crew was really pleasant and service is fabulous. La Contenta Oeste, I cannot say enough great things about this gem.

Space is tight . The food was great . Great brunch place. We were a group of 7 and the service was excellent. Their coffee was also good.  It's a safe bet!  if  you like mexican food I would recommend it.
No comment
No comment

Came here with a big grp and was really pleased with the level of service (and patience). Food were so flavorful and the cocktails were strong and delish. Highly recommend for some girls night and this place also seems to be a popular date spot (saw at least 6 dates on a Tuesday night). Do not miss the queso fundido and the ceviche!

I am addicted to this place's fish tacos, Id go as far to say my favorite right now in Manhattan. I also drink way too many mezcal margaritas when I go. Their drinks are authentic and taste great. Prime location. Try it!

I have had the pleasure to visit the smaller la contenta and their drinks are amazing and I came to this one and it's even bigger and the drinks are still amazing and the food is still perfect Always come here with my boyfriend in several occasions and we just enjoy the ambience and the drinks my favorite is the pulque and as far as the food it's amazing especially when it comes out it's very hot so it's very good I like the nachos de pollo and I also like The steak

Ok..I just stumbled into this place with a good friend who happens to have lived in Mexico for the last five years. We just came in for coffee but I must say, the menu and items are as close to being in Mexico as possible. Truly authentic. They have tepache which I have never seen anywhere until now except in Mexico. Really a great immersive experience. I will tell you everything is there. I will say that this is the BEST Michelada I be ever had, and I've had a lot in my travels. I'm especially fond of the michelada al pastor. The pineapple and tajin rum are it. I will be back to immerse myself in the food. Based on the items on the menu and people ordering around me, it looks, smells and reviewers say it is the place. Also helps that 4 out of 5 of the investors are Mexican. Viva Mexico!!
No comment

Came here on a Monday and had a great time! I sat at the bar waiting for my friend. We had a couple of cocktails and shared the mole. Everything was great, it was the first time I had mole! The bar staff was very friendly and knowledgable. I definitely recommend checking it out, its a good date spot or you can bring a group there as well.
No comment
The best fish tacos in the area hands down. The stuffed pepper was also phenomenal. The nachos were probably the beat bang for your buck if you don't want to pay west village prices for everything

We went here on Christmas Day and it was great!! The restaurant has set up outdoor seating where each party has their own closed structure to sit in. Even and windy 35 degree dinner was so comfortable because of how much the wind is blocked by these closed structures. The enchiladas are delicious! Also the cocktails are legit.
No comment

Came here late at night after dinner hours hoping to grab a quick bite. The only menu available at the time was the bar menu so we decided to order fish tacos as a snack and a few drinks. The fish tacos were perfectly cooked and paired wonderfully with the Cole slaw and sauce on top - I will be returning again for the fish tacos alone and cannot wait to try more food on the menu. I tried the El Mixteca drink as well and really enjoyed it. Highly recommend both items and this restaurant overall!

Waited patiently for an hour since we were told we were second on the waitlist, only to watch the hostess seat every party except us. At one point, after a two person group left, she sat a three party walk in and told us she couldn't sit us there because it wasn't a two person table. after a two person group got up? Horrible hosting, couldn't even try the food and never will.

My daughter & I made reservations at La Contenta but by mistake, ended up at their sister restaurant, La Contenta Oeste. We were seated promptly & ordered margaritas. They were excellent! From there we ordered homemade chips & guacamole, also delicious. What we didn't realize was that a bowl of complimentary chips was provided. If we knew that, we might not have ordered the chips & guac. Our dinner was fish tacos; when they arrived we were surprised at how tiny they were and we only got two per order. Nonetheless, they were scrumptious, crispy and very well-seasoned. Would we return? Definitely! Just not on an empty stomach.
No comment
Amazing Mexican food and drinks. The staff was so friendly. We had a great experience here and will definitely be coming back.
No comment
A bit pricy, but the quality of the food and drinks is phenomenal. Friendly staff, great cuisine.
No comment

Let me first say that the food was delicious, and the service was impeccable! But I can only give it 3 stars because dining inside was completely un enjoyable due to the extremely high volume of everything in the place. The host and waiters couldn't hear me and I couldn't hear them over all of the noise. I felt bad for them, because it made their jobs that much harder. Definitely try to sit outside if you decide to go there. I usually order dessert and more than one cocktail when I go out to eat, but it was so unpleasantly loud that we ate and left as quickly as possible. It's a shame, because it is such a cute place AND the staff, cocktails, and food were fantastic. I couldn't get out of there fast enough.
No comment

The food is great. The staff is terrific. We've done both pick up and delivery during the pandemic. Both were timed perfectly and the food traveled well. The branzini is a stand-out favorite, but everything else is delicious too. And the to-go margaritas come in these cute little bottles -- and they don't stint on the tequila!
No comment

La contenta is consistently amazing food and all the people who work there are so incredibly nice. I love the nachos and the Chile relleno is incredible. The fish tacos are also a nice lighter option as well.

Over priced, we went there for thanksgiving and the menu is really short of options, Mexican restaurant but they don't have burritos? Also at the checkout the server take 20 minutes to bring a back our card and he said it was because he was busy training a new employee... not coming back for sure.
No comment

Walking buy myself Sunday morning looking for a place to enjoy a brunch and came upon this place. I opened yelp and saw that it was the place to be for brunch. Manger greeted me at the door and welcomed me to the bar area by my request. Sat down and my delicious adventure began. I ordered a beverage " bloody Maria" yum and at a special price. Then a small plate of chips and salsa was placed in front of me to enjoy while I scanned the menu. I ordered the Heuvos Rancheros. A personal favorite for a Mexican brunch. Ate every bit of it including the chips and salsa. Chef also welcomed me. Charming and lovely to talk with. The staff was wonderfuland very attentive. I finished off with a few delicious cups of coffee while I waited for the rain to let up. I will go back again next time in the city. But will call for reservations just in case.

Happy hour even on weekends until 6pm! Food was good - 4 stars for the fish tacos and 5 stars for the guacamole. The bartenders Miguel and Miguel were both great!! They were friendly, attentive and fun so I definitely recommend sitting at the bar when you go!! All of their drinks are made with alcohol from Mexico which was really interesting! First time having wine from Mexico!

Two times at this place and amazing experience both times. The food and drinks are top notch and speak for themselves. I loved the decor inside and the outdoor seating areas are wonderful, private and warm. The staff goes above and beyond. There was an honest mistake during our dining and our server immediately fixed it and brought us shots on the house. Exceptionally kind and attentive staff and very clean restaurant. Will to back here a hundred times over.
No comment

No comment

If you are interested in the most authentic Mexican cuisine in New York this is it. The menu is extensive and everything that I ordered was very fresh. The deserts were also delicious. It has a nice atmosphere and ambience.

This restaurant is excellent in every way. The food was delicious, Mexican with a twist. I accidentally ordered the wrong thing and the waiter nicely brought me another dish, no questions asked. The drinks where amazing and so are the desserts. Check this place out

No comment

Came to this place for a group dinner and I would say this place is overpriced. The portion on the enchilada was good but the portion for tacos was way too little. I would say the flavor was a bit more bland to me thinking that Mexican food usually blast you with all different kind of flavors and senses. The happy hour food and drinks were okay but nothing too special about this place I would say.

I absolutely love this restaurant. Perfect location, obliging, caring staff and the food is exceptional. Even when they are extremely busy, yes, it's loud, jostling, crowded...you don't feel neglected. Cocktails are top-notch. I like mezcal a lot and the "Epazote Hardcore" was so good. As is its name. My wife had the Mayan - I snuck a taste. Delish. As for our meal -- crab taquitos, corn chowder, fish tacos, chile relleno...we just rolled out of there. One of the best Mexican spots I've been to in NYC. It's the real deal. Highly recommended.

We're in week 6 (or is 7, or 8) of the Covid Era and it's Cinco de Mayo. I was walking up 6th ave today on an admittedly gorgeous afternoon, and lo & behold i discover this little wonder of a restaurant/bar. It was all dressed up for cinco, had 'contactless' but fresh made craft margaritas, palomas (and sophisticated tacos, quesadillas, taquitos, grilled branzino and more on offer), all created with good vibes. Note: the Blackberry Margarita was definitely well made.

Love La Contenta! I had a great experience here recently. I tried their punch cocktail (I believe this may have been a seasonal drink... if you enjoy cocktails on the "sweeter" side, I cannot recommend this drink enough, it was highly addicting!). For food, I ordered the queso (because apparently this was a "must") and guac. Both were very tasty and hit the spot. I also tried the shrimp enchiladas and they were very filling and flavorful. If you're in the area, I recommend trying La contenta. This location also has a much larger dining area, compared to the other La Contenta (in LES) location.
No comment

10/10 La Contenta is one of the most authentic Mexican restaurants in all of New York City. I love when places keep simple menu with classics and don't compromise with peer pressure to be trendy. The enchiladas are incredible and the steak tacos are huge and excellent. A perfect lunch, dinner, or brunch spot. They have a few locations in Manhattan and I'll definitely be back soon!
Amazing food! Amazing service! We got seated right away and we ended up ordering some tacos for happy hour. They were on the pricier side but so worth it!
No comment
Great spot, best tacos, quesadillas and margaritas! Very busy so make sure to get a reservation, but always a great time! They've also done a fantastic job during Covid.

A second location that is both larger and accepts reservations? AMAZING. I am a big fan of their original LES spot, and was excited to stumble upon this restaurant while walking around the area one day. I have to say, they have kept the drinks consistent (strong, just how I like it) and the food is just as delicious (though, the chips that come with the salsa, aren't quite piping hot vs. the LES location). A visit is never complete without queso fundido and fish tacos...oh and a margarita of course!

Great place to have fun, the ambiance and the staff are so friendly and attentive, I'd definitely recommend the restaurant to all, it's so much fun and the cocktails and food are amazing and unforgettable, something to remember for ever... Alex you got the formula figured out man.. I'm so happy for you and your stuff .. Rigo  and Rafa saludos brothers

This place is promising but the original location in LES has them beat. The cocktails are great but service and food is not where it should be. I have faith that this may be growing pains and that they will create the same dining experience as their original so I will be back again to update!
When your at the bar, watch your pockets.  There is a well oiled machine there and your pockets are going to be picked. Low key money earning and discrete.

Really recommend this spot! Service is awesome food and drinks are great. I love drinks and their drinks are really good u had carne asada tacos they are bomb! Shout out to Alex and the team they are all great service and attentive to everyone!

It was a nice Mexican place. Me and my friend were looking for a happy hour. The prices for the Happy hour ere pretty high, but the beer was great and the appetizers pretty awesome. Overall, u would recommend it

Great place for Micheladas or queso fundido con chorizo. Everyone is so nice and the location is amazing. You should try it!

Extensive tequila choices. Experienced and pleasant bartenders. Good Mexican food: the relleno is a joy. What else do you need?

Went here for Dog restaurant week with my pup. The staff was very accommodating and welcoming when we arrived for our reservation. My pup even got to enjoy a slider on the house which she LOVED! Service was excellent! Food was delicious. Will be coming back for sure!

I can't wait to go here for date night! The intrepid cactus cocktail looks phenomenal but the mojito also sounds good; I'm thinking of trying the enchiladas suizas since I rarely ever order that, and the greens look good, as long it's not spicy! The sopa de pollo looks so appetizing too. Queso fundido

Good place for a brunch, affordable prices and good service. I ordered chilaquiles, they we spicy and good. But i think they put a lot salsa. Their complementary chips are great, i was just hoping a better salsa.
No comment

I ate at this restaurant the last day when I visited NY.  My husbands uncle recommended it and it truly was great.  We enjoyed everything!  The branzino was amazing, and you can never go wrong with guac and chips. You must try it :).

We are here now having a Sunday brunch! It's sunny and we are sitting outside, we have live music playing from inside. Staff is very attentive and food was very good. Looks busy and fun. I really like the food, specially bc it was not salty! Usually Mexican food can be too salty. I would recommend this place!

The star of my meal here was the guac and chips. The chips are fresh with a perfect amount of salty crunch, and they keep them coming. The guac had a good kick of spice and plenty of tomatoes, and I loved the presentations. I got the enchiladas suizas with the tomatillo salsa on the side so I could control how much I used. Because my enchiladas weren't covered in salsa, it was really clear that the chicken had absolutely no spice or flavor it. I used some of the guac that was still left to spice things up a bit and add extra flavor. Overall a decent meal and attentive, accommodating waitstaff. And the place is wheelchair accessible.
Everything was pretty good, I really enjoyed the Tamarindo Michelada, the fish tacos and the Queso fundido, Im coming back to try the  chicken Quesadilla and the nachis they look yummy
Amazing Queso Fundido. And the Bocanegra beer was to die for. The staff was super nice and the service was incredible. The fish tacos and tres leches cake were also standout hits!
UNREAL cocktails! Super trendy. Go for the Oaxaca express! happy hour is before 6pm. Awesome enchiladas as well!

The food is hit or miss here. I came for dinner once which was a four star experIence and then brunch was subpar. More than the flavor of the food, it bothered me that there wasn't even an attempt at appealing presentation during brunch time - just an enchilada on a plate. Even at home I make this look better - for the price, at least give a girl a sprig of cilantro or something!
Honestly this is my fav Mexican place to eat from the drinks to the food amazing I recommend

Yo estoy contento. The mezcal, the whiskey(mexican), the rum(mexican too?) The service was impeccable,  supremely welcoming and knowledgeable.  The cocktails were expertly done. The food was delicious, fresh, and balanced.  I left there so happy and wanted to come back as soon I left.

No comment
One of my favorite spots in the neighborhood. The food is absolutely delicious but the cocktails are amazing !

Go there for the gorditas (so incredibly yummy) and stay for the lively ambience, excellent service and delicious menu. Highly recommend the El Dorado cocktail and the Fig Tartlet besides the gorditas. But the gorditas are the star
No comment
It's nothing short of a religious experience.  Come with no expectations, just your sensuality.
This is a larger version of thes smaller one we ate at this afternoon.   Very good food and great service.   Thank you
Amazing service and great atmosphere. Also not to mention the BEST nachos I've ever had!!!!

Came here for lunch with a friend. We both ordered margaritas and enchiladas suizas. The service was prompt, attentive and friendly.  The enchiladas were pretty good. The margaritas were not too sweet and not too strong but not too weak. If in the area, I would definitely come back to try the dinner menu or happy hour. Good solid food and we had great service.
Definitely a place to come back to. Drinks on point. Staff chill and friendly. Food is bomb and interior design is super cute.
The food was just okay. I ordered the chilaquiles and the chicken felt separately made, the flavors didn't mesh well. I also felt sick the entire day so I  wouldn't recommend this.

This is my all time favorite Mexican restaurant in NYC. The food, the drinks, e v e r y t h i n g is amazing. I've had the enchiladas, Chile relleno, their chilaquiles, brunch specials, and everything continues to hit the spot, every single time. I keep bringing friends and introducing them to this restaurant, because it never ceases to amaze me. They have a good selection of mezcal too! I have celebrated several birthday's here, happy hours, my husband and I can't get enough. Thank you La Contenta for making our heart and tummies happy!

Wonderful ambiance and the food was delicious. Outdoor seating is well done with partitions between tables and ample seating too. Miguel, our server, was attentive and helped us decide what to order. I highly recommend the crab taquitos and the guava cocktail!!

Not gluten free menu (despite how menu is marked; tortilla chips in shared fryer, guacamole served with chips in the bowl despite telling server of gluten allergy). Was given spoiled orange juice and slight smell to restaurant upon walking in. Service was very inattentive. 4-star food and ambiance, 5-star drinks.

I came to La Contenta with 3 other people on a Friday night. We made a reservation in advance, which was needed. We started off with guacamole which was very good. My boyfriend and I shared the chicken tacos and the steak tacos. They were both delicious. They were full of a lot of meat. Then we shared the short ribs entree plate. It was delicious. Plate portions were a good size and we were so full that we had no room for dessert, regretfully. The service provided was attentive. The drinks were great. Delicious tacos and margaritas, what more can you ask for?! I will definitely return!
No comment

My favorite Mexican restaurant in the city! I have already been in the other location where I had terrific brunch. Here, I came for late night drinks. Service was great, waiter was very nice, and the cocktails were so good! This location is also bigger with great vibes. Great date spot - highly recommend it!

First the service was outstanding. Sasha our server was friendly, attentive and her recommendations were perfect. The guava margarita was delicious. The food was fresh and very good.  Try the chocolate cake with ice cream. The only reason I did not give it 5 stars was because the portions were small and the price was expensive.   However, a must try. And ask for Sasha.
It took me awhile but finally I found good chilaquiles in NY. Definitely come here for a good brunch

This is my absolute favorite restaurant. I've been here several times already and I've never been disappointed. They start you off with chips and salsa which were good (chips were fresh and tasted housemade). For entrees, I've tried the chilaquiles, mexican omelet and huevos rancheros (which were my favorite). The fresh squeezed orange juice is sooo good and refreshing. Even the coffee tastes good ( I always get a capuccino). Nothing I've tried has been bad. Also, the service is excellent. It doesn't get too crowded cause I don't think a lot of people know about it.
No comment
Second time here on a Saturday night, super busy but their service is great. Their tamarindo micheladas are amazing! Highly recommend this place.

I highly recommend to go to another restaurant. Not only is the food overpriced, for me was the quality of the food. I order pollo en mole poblano and it was terrible! The chicken had no flavor and was raw! I was surprised I had to pay $22 for terrible Mexican food. It's not traditional at all. I rather go to Taco Bell and get a meal worth it's price. The only good thing I will say is that the tortilla chips and sauce was good but not worth having dinner here.
No comment
No comment
Great drinks and amazing food. All the cocktails are fantastic, but I just happen to love the blackberry Michelada. Try the carne asado tacos and the shrimp enchiladas - they are amazing!
No comment
No comment

Cocktails were pretty good but food was mediocre. (Like most Mexican food in. NYC)  greasy, heavy and lacking in fresh ingredients. Menu looked promising but the execution was lacking. Don't know if original location is better...
The guacamole was amazing and the pollo de mole poblano was delicious. The plantains gave it a nice sweetness.

Excellent brunch cocktails. Both "La Diabla" and the Mexican Coffee were delicious without being overly sweet. Breakfast burrito was solid, but not life-changing. I'd return for drinks and some other food choices.
No comment

We have loved this restaurant from the moment they opened their first branch on the Lower East Side.  Alex - the mixologist/bartender - and Luis - the chef, serve *authentic* Mexican food and cocktails that are simply spectacular.   Yes, we used to live in the West Village too - and we understand that you staid folk like blander food and sweeter  drinks than the cool kids in the Lower East Side, but please, do yourself a favor and try this place and enjoy the real flavors of Mexico.  You are hugely fortunate to have this place in the neighborhood- embrace them and have a pulque de guayaba and ask them to make the ceviche de camaron or the queso fundido and DON'T ask them to make it less spicy - you will be missing out.
No comment
Came at 11:30 pm and the kitchen was still open. Had queso fundido and guac. Both were excellent and service was wonderful. Cute atmosphere!

We got to the place around 5:45pm and the place has at least 8 empty tables. The Host told us the reservation was booked until 9:30pm and seated by the bar. I had fish taco and the fish was so blend. There were no sides dish with the fish taco. They put too much sauce. My friend got chicken enchiladas and it was blend. The portion were small. They charged $8 for a lemonade. The food and drinks were over price. When we left the place, they still have 5 empty tables. We could have gotten a table.

One of my favorite spots in the East Village. The food is fantastic for every meal there, I especially love the brunch menu. However the best part of La Contenta is their amazing servers. I'm a regular there and Sasha always makes dining out an absolute pleasure. She's fantastic!

Wow, truly blown away by excellent food and even better service. I had the Shrimp Enchiladas and was surprised by how large the pieces of shrimp were. I also tried the gangsr Steak- the portion was huge and the marinade was citrus filled and bright. To top it off, our server was attentive and constantly refilled the free tortilla chips. I will definitely be back!

Truly high quality Mexican food. I love this spot, especially during the summer when it's a bit more open. It's big enough that the wait isn't typically too bad, but bar seating is good too! The price point is a little high for the vibe and food, but the enchiladas keep me coming back.

Came here for weekly sunday brunch. Cramped seating and loud atmosphere, but that's normal for new york restaurants. Complimentary chips and salsa, the salsa tasted like straight tomato sauce. I got the cubana and my girlfriend got the steak tacos. $14 for two tacos and rice/beans, which i thought was too much. Wasn't impressed by the food or the service. My girlfriend liked it though. 3/5 from me but 4/5 from her so
No comment

Nice atmosphere and good food. Plates may seem a little pricey, but the serving sizes are huge. The La Contenta nachos were amazing  and something I would definitely order again. The Pollo Wellington was also very good. I found the puff pastry the chicken was wrapped around slightly too oily for my taste but otherwise the flavors in the dish were all great.

I never write reviews but you guys need to avoid this place. Maybe it was an off night but the reviews were so great I'm shocked at how bad it was. Terrible service. Waited ages just to get a drink order in. Overcharged for desserts we didn't order. Mains came 7 mins after apps so my mains got cold. Food was bland and frankly tasteless. The catfish taco was best but tasted like any fried fish taco I've had.

This place is a gem!! I love their place in the LES so I had a last minute date there last night. The drinks at both spots punch above their weight (I would be happy if I paid twice the price) they especially have a deft hand at using Sotol, Mezcal and Raicilla. The food is bright and delicious. The best aspect is the service. They are technically sound but also very warm. You get the impression that everyone likes working with each other and that palpable attitude translates to the guest. I wish more restaurants were this sound. Bravo!! For someone who hates eating at the same place more than once you've made a regular of me!
Had the enchiladas suizas for lunch and they were better than any enchiladas I've had before! I was also very impressed with their drink menu, and friendliness of the staff.
No comment

Came here on a Sunday during the early evening hours. No reservations and I was seated right away! The service was very prompt and I ordered the Mayan which I highly recommend (just was a tad sweet)- everything here you can tell is fresh and made to order. I had the guacamole and the chicken soup- both were great! My only complaint is how cold it was inside! I could not get warm.

Went here for dinner. Drinks were so good! Food so good (I recommend the mole chicken)!! But really long wait time and a little expensive. But overall, would definitely recommend!!! Just have a reservation before.
No comment
Very average and would not return. A shame as we often visit the La Contenta on Norfolk St and it's always excellent.

It was an amazing restaurant with exceptional staff, David , Ivan and rest of staff were amazing. I am of Mexican decent and am very picky when it comes to these type of food, however they made it to where I felt right at home. The taste was just as if I had gone back to Mexico, absolutely amazing. Would recommend to anyone, in love w this place.
No comment

I want to give this 4 stars but we NEED to talk about the chips and guac. Chips and guac are a STAPLE at a Mexican restaurant and the order came out with the chips stuck into the guacamole...this was just strange and poorly thought out. It was good guac but putting the chips in makes them soggy. The pollo en mole poblano and Enchiladas Suizas were wonderful--good portions and very tasty.
The food and drinks here are excellent, as is the service, but the sound level is ear-splitting. It's party-time every night of the week!
No comment
No comment

Had a very good dinner here.  Highlights were the ceviche, queso fundido and the branzino. The branzino was really an incredible dish. We substituted the rice withe veggies and it was excellent. Service was good also.
No comment
Delicious steak and eggs! Somewhat slow service, but it was fine because of my excellent company :)

We had an incredible time! Our waiter, Victor, had the best personality and was super attentive, even though we were a group of 10! The drinks are strong and delicious, and the food is even better. I highly recommend the chilaquiles and margarita
No comment

We went here for brunch. I had the steak tacos and red sangria. We started with the guacamole which was so good. My daughter had the French toast. Everything was really good and very fresh. Reservations are key as it gets very busy. I would like to come for dinner and try some other things

While visiting friends in New York, two of our friends would not let us leave without going to this restaurant, and we're very glad that they didn't. One friend told us to go there for the mixology, the other said go there for the food. They were both right. Everything was amazing. Their crafted drinks were rich in flavor and combinations you wouldn't think went together. We were also very impressed with their food. We sat at the bar, because the restaurant was packed, and the service was incredible. Our bartender was very attentive and friendly (not your usual "flag me down when you're ready" bartender). Overall so happy we stopped in and will definitely be back on our next trip.

I love this place I don't know where to begin! I came here for my birthday dinner. The margaritas were amazing, the nachos on point, the fish tacos delectable! And the service was incredible- some of the best service I've ever gotten at a restaurant.
Fabulous happy hours and food! Fun atmosphere, always a good time here.  Service is on point too!  Can't go wrong with this place

The fish tacos are everrrrrrrything!!! I went here with my girls for a my bday dinner and they had the hanger steak which was delicious and i had the enchiladas de camaron which had a little bit of a spicy kick to it. For drinks i had the pulque de guayaba which was sweet and just right. For dessert, we tried the tres leches cake and a chocolate cake which was super mouth watering. I definitely would love to come back.

We really enjoyed eating here - great ambience, cocktails, and wait staff. The food was very good, with one disappointment: the giant poblano chili holding my chili relleno was hard and crunchy rather than cooked through properly.
This place was great, the service was awesome, our waitress was super nice and helpful with the menu. Don't pass on this place!

We had such high hopes based on the great reviews but sadly were disappointed. The food is fine but nothing great. The guacamole was fine but didn't have any unique aspect. The red salsa was tasty and they are generous giving you refills of chips and salsa. The ceviche was fresh. The crab tostados were a disappointment. The crab was a mixture that masked the flavor of crab. The steak tacos just tasted charred. The consensus of our table of 5 was it was fine but nothing special and a one and done.
The scallops are divine and the service is great. Pleasantly surprised about this restaurant.  The severs are well-informed about the cocktail menu.

$15 cobb salad was basically very salty guacamole with chopped lettuce in it...mushy and overwhelmed, no crunch -- we actually used chips to scoop it up, but ultimately could not eat. Bizarre and disappointing.

I am a big fan of La Contenta and I think this is still my favorite Mexican restaurant in the city. This was my first time at the larger location and the food was just about the same quality as the original. I am a big proponent of quality over quantity and La Contenta clearly displays this. Their small menu selection may be an issue if their food wasn't so amazing. The service was really great and the cocktails were outstanding. Overall, I would highly recommend.

If you've been to Contenta in Lower East Side, you know what to expect in Contenta Oeste.  On the basis of two initial experiences (one dinner and one brunch) Contenta Oeste delivers and some more.  Everything that made Contenta great - great food using the freshest of ingredients and wonderful cocktails that you can't really get elsewhere coupled with excellent service - is here.  Additionally, the much larger space (and kitchen I assume) makes for comfortable dining, and gives us a menu that goes a bit deeper.  I was glad to see the old stand-bys (the chilaquiles, the fish tacos) together with the reappearance of dishes such as the crab tostada that at some point disappeared from Contenta's menu.   I am also excited to see new dishes (such as the breakfast item of eggs with nopal that will get me coming here at breakfast time!)  Last, but not least, I should mention the burger.  Having followed chef/owner Luis in Cafe Condesa, Ofrenda and then Contenta, I never had a burger cooked by him until brunch-time today.  What a mistake on my part; the burger with jamon serrano was absolutely delicious.

I came here for brunch and got the Tequila Sunrise Mimosa and Poblano Benedict. Both absolutely delicious! Service was friendly and warm. There was a difficult customer at another table and I watched the staff working to make sure she was satisfied and taken care of. I can't wait to come back!

Came here on a Friday at 1:00am for a late night dinner. They only had the appetizer menu which includes the chicken tacos that I ordered. The tacos were great. The waiter was very attentive. I had the infierno cocktail and it was amazing, one of the best tequila drinks I have ever had. FYI they close the kitchen at 1:30. I will be back to try the earlier menu.
The food is consistently delicious. Staff are friendly and they routinely put on special events with live music, etc.

Disappointing. Very slow service and mediocre food. Waited 30 minutes for food, had to ask for check 3 times. Restaurant was not busy, so no excuse.  We were seated at a dirty table immediately after the previous customer left, no one wiped the table. Food didn't taste like professional cooked it. It was bland and forgettable. I won't go back.
The food is shockingly good here. They did charge us $15 for a basic cocktail, but I'll let it slide. Go for the mole and the huitlacoche
lovely, friendly, elegant brunch. a real attention to the details of the cooking and the experience of dining. careful and caring.

I love this place!!  My dad moved to BPC so family dinner is now downtown.  They were so welcoming and helpful with my dad. Drinks are amazing - interesting and balanced!!  Can't get enough of that Oaxaca Express! Best mole I've ever had, tacos and shrimp ceviche delicious. Rest of the family loved their's too.  And you can't beat the staff!

Solid place for Mexican. The diablo hibiscus drink was WAY more hibiscus than ginger beer--but that might be your style. We split nachos and the quesadilla between 4 of us for appetizers. Quesadilla was especially flavorful with a good kick. I split the Chile Relleno w one other person. It was delicious.

Waited 45 mins for 2 tacos. A man came to ask me to move over so two people could sit next to me at the bar. He told me not to move, as he said he was going to pick up my chair and move both me and my chair over. He then stuck his thumb in my taco to move my plate, which had finally arrived (there was a large party at the time and my taco had "gotten stuck behind their order"- I had not complained or asked where it was). I was confused when the man who touched both me and my food did not sit down. The hostess told me he was the manager. He had seemed to be a customer who wanted to sit down. He then called me "babydoll". I had no problem moving over. I do have a problem with physically being moved over. This was one of the most inappropriate interactions I have ever had in a restaurant.

I've been to the LES location and always loved the food but it was always difficult to get a table bc the restaurant was too small. This restaurant took over the old french roast location. The scene is mostly young girls in their 20s doing brunch. The food (brunch) is very good although guacamole was $13! It's fairly new so I think they may be still working out their kinks on staffing / expediting in the kitchen and bar. Staff / host are very nice but they need to work on little things.. our table had multiple knives not enough forks, my drink took 15 minutes from the bar, wait for food between appetizers was long. Enchiladas and Benedict were yummy (they use corn tortillas and allowed me to switch out the English muffin). Salad was overdressed. Acoustics are also pretty bad so be prepared to talk very loudly to hear the person sitting across you. Saw a sign outside for a happy hour that looked like a good deal. Definitely will be back hopefully with better service.

No place will ever beat Casa Enrique for Mexican food in NYC. (Trust me.) However, the staff here in the former French Roast space is great, and the Mezcal list is superb, one of the best I've seen in the area. I'm always pleased when I stop in here for a bite to eat and a drink or two. Highly recommended.
Some of the best guac I've had in New York. Fish taco good also. Service is great up until when you get your food and then no one is around to ask for or collect you bill.

The hostess was the best part about this place honestly, didn't know what to get cause I don't like Mexican food but, helped me all the way I think her name was Ashley, really great place my parents and I enjoyed the prices are a bit too high.

My favorite new restaurant in the village and possibly the city. Had dinner here Thursday night and returned today for brunch. The food is so good and the drinks are too. Like the original sister restaurant way down on Norfolk Street, the people who work here are some of the nicest most engaging restaurant employees I have ever encountered. The brunch prices are very reasonable. Dinner is a bit pricey, but given commercial rents these days, that's understandable. I hope they make it in this new, larger space. I understand that some people in the neighborhood still hold a grudge over French Roast closing down in this space, but I can't think of a better new tenant than this.
Since the place opened I have experienced consistency in Charm,excellent food, great drinks, lovely service. Louis and his partners are on hand and make sure you have  a good time.

Lively Mexican with a creative drinks menu and new takes on traditional dishes. This restaurant can get loud, just keep that in mind. We opted to sit outdoors as the Thursday evening happy hour crowd was just too much for us. The drinks menu includes several different micheladas - an inventive touch! The shrimp enchiladas ($23) are well worth it. Full of flavor, and a generous portion. (I could only finish half, and I'm usually proud member of the clean plate club!)

If you're looking for hands-down the best omelettes in NYC, tasty Mexican food light on fat and high in taste, fabulous drinks before and after happy hour and gracious service, this is where to go! Casual, warm, worth repeat visits any time of day.

By NYC standards this place is pretty good: the food is flavorful, the prices reasonable, and the margaritas excellent. Still waiting for a sit down Mexican restaurant that can compete with the places in Southern California, New Mexico, Texas, etc.; this isn't in that league but it is one of the better places you'll find in the city and so I've rated it based on that.

Possibly the best chipotle dipping sauce I've ever had. The fish tacos a feast for the eyes. Wait service is caring and there when you need them without being obtrusive. Upbeat atmosphere. Loved this place I was taken to by friends. Really lovely staff. The tres leeches cake was too yummy for words joined with delicious coffee.

Went for brunch and the food was pretty good. If I were just judging based on the food, I would've given this place four stars. Now for the bad. First the service was horrible, sat down and took 10 minutes for a member of the waitstaff to come to our table. The couple sitting next to us had to wait so long for a waiter to come to their table that they just got up and left. Second, the bathroom is disgusting, it looked as if it hadn't been cleaned in a week. It was dirtier than most bar bathrooms in New York- which is saying something. Management definitely needs to do something about the lackluster service and the insanely disgusting bathroom.

We had the most amazing surprise birthday party here for my wife. It's one of the more ambitious parties I've ever planned, and they were super accommodating about the menu, the logistics, everything. Everyone agreed the food, cocktails, wine, dessert were amazing -- including lots of difficult-to-please foodies who know their Mexican food (and my mom, who usually doesn't care for it)! Go there for lunch, dinner or a party, and I guarantee you'll be very glad you did!!

A group of 3 of us were there this weekend and the waitress told us that she'd ask the chef to make us 3 of each kind of taco so that we could order several kinds and all try them.  She neglected to mention that each taco would cost an additional $6.  The fish taco was good.  The chicken taco was not good.  I did not try the carne (or maybe it was listed as steak) taco, though my table-mates like it.  We also ordered the queso fundito which was hard in no time.  I thought La Contenta Oeste was over priced and nothing special.  I would not bother to go back.

Five stars for the food. The noise level was deafening and really took away from the experience, add the tight quarters......La Contesta is not a place for lingering. The quesadillas were sublime and our mains were quite wonderful. I think that the Enchiladas Suizas are the best I have ever had, even better than in Mexico.......(and I've eaten alot of them in my lifetime, my first at Casa Sanborn's in CDMX back in the 70's). For the life of me, I cannot understand why restaurants do not do better soundproofing for their spaces. At the prices for the margaritas on the rocks, La Contesta certainly could afford it.

The immediate area is small, but not too small, however there was a party in a backroom that I think I overheard had 17 or so, so, that's a good amount of added space.  I liked the joint, the huevos rancheros were very good, but not the best I've had and the the eggs were a little overdone.  We sat at the window on stools near the door which was fine, and the people watching on the street was great, but we felt that we were a bit of an afterthought for our server, thus my rating.  Service was very mediocre, but food was decent.  The place was crowded for a Saturday brunch mid-afternoon so clearly many people have enjoyed the atmosphere and Chef's style. I generally liked the place, but probably wouldn't go out of my way to go back...with that said, if someone suggested it, or wanted to go, I wouldn't in anyway refuse.  The drink menu was ok at best, but they did have a good selection of agave, so if that's your thing, you may love this place.  Pretty good, overall, but some opportunities for improvement.
No comment

No comment

No comment
No comment

Fantastic cocktail spot. I've been here a few times and have enjoyed the drinks each time I've gone. It's also got a really cool & unique atmosphere inside. It can be a bit crowded/loud but would recommend if you're in the area!
Great spot to drink, with great drinks! And they have oysters! Charcuterie is a little underwhelming tho.

Such a unique bar on Smith Street! Bartender was friendly and recommended me a cocktail to try and even said if I didn't like it he would make something else for me (spoiler- I loved it). Perfect for a date night or if you are a cocktail aficionado and want to try something new!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Hello hello! AllFunNYC here :) ok so this place is soooo freaking awesome!!!! It is of course very busy because is so fun! The music is on point the whole time youlll be moving your head and for me always dancing haha  the cocktails wow!!!!! I mean like incredible!! My favorites were the Splendor and Misery (had 3) lol The Little Dead - smoky and delicious!!! Both of these super strong and you can definitely taste the flavors of liquor so if you like something lighter those are not for you!! Now not as strong but equally delicious! The Dirty old mean cocktails yummmm!!! Super refreshing and easy to down be careful!!!  and the George Washington's night out! Yummy!!! Also the last one The Harlots progress was soooo gooood Anyways the whole experience is amazing must go there! The staff was friendly and they were busy I mean BUUUSSSYYYYYY! Only one bathroom so don't hold it too long before going for it
No comment

Came here with a date, and I really liked the decor, sat intuw bak room.The music was great, as well as the drinks and the oysters, which were good. The dirty Oldman drink is a must, but I have a feeling all of their drinks  are good. I also had a drink with crushed ice, which was  good as well. Our waitress was very polite and attentive. I will definitely come back.
Fantastic cocktail bar in Brooklyn! Definitely worth stopping by and checking out the entire menu. Me and my two friends stopped by for a couple of rounds. Staff was great and very knowledgeable!
No comment

Great spot for cocktails! I loved the frose and the dirty old man cocktails. It has a great speakeasy vibe, the bartenders are incredible and while it can get a little loud as the place fills up, I'd return here again. Perhaps when the weather isn't quite as warm, I'll come back again to enjoy the outdoor garden area.

Another amazing night for the books!!! David knocked it out the park with our Martini's, IPA was delish. Jeremy ( Owner) you are a ROCKSTAR! You keep your customers engaged with the music, you mingle with us, you dance with us. Thanks for the Shots!!! See you soon! Ellie we missed seeing you and Julia we missed you too!!
The atmosphere, ambiance and design makes it such a special spot. Delicious cocktails and perfect spot for date night or girls night

This is my go to place for drinks and atmosphere. I just let Olivia choose my journey and she never steers me wrong.  While I love the smokiness of the Little Death, my new favorite is Splendor & Misery. Just tell Olivia your flavor profile and let her take it from there. A perfect evening for me is when Olivia steers and Ellie pours.  Ellie's got more art to her than just the ink on her sleeves- Truly a master mixer.
No comment

Amazing amazing amazing. Amazing vibes, amazing drinks and amazing bartenders. I just never want to leave. I recommend getting a few different drinks here because every drink I had here was really good including the Japanese whiskey drinks (I am a big fan- they know how to make a really good Japanese whiskey cocktail - spirit forward and also in a more refreshing cocktail)
No comment

Beautiful bar. It has a sexy, gothic vibe. The drinks are delicious, but fairly pricey. The bartenders know what they're doing. They also have good oysters and "small plates" (eg olives, cheese, etc).
No comment

No comment
Donating to The Sex Workers Project does not make this OK. Did you even ask The Urban Justice Center?
This place is AMAZING! Excellent cocktails, exquisite service, and the backroom has a bed?!? Highly recommended for an after work cocktail or a chill date hang.

i have never been so pleased with a bar in my life! upon arrival, i was greeted by the lovely hostess who was so ecstatic to tell me that there was one table that just opened up that i could have. she was so sweet and genuine about it, it really made me so happy. i was floored by the atmosphere and decor- the attention to little details was giving me something to look at every second and kept my brain entertained. the drinks were phenomenal, and our server was so sweet in helping explain things as well. it really seemed like i was being helped by my friends, not just employees. the charcuterie board was amazing all throughout - a really great selection picked by the chefs! everyone that i encountered so so sweet and clearly loved being there. i will definitely be returning. i have never felt so welcome and at home at a bar before :)
No comment
Indoors and outdoors, this place is worth a visit just for the atmosphere. But the drinks are no joke. Creative and presented with considerable flair. Loved it.
No comment
No comment
I only can say I consider myself so lucky to have the best cocktail bar in New York City in my neighborhood.

Unique and tasty drinks! I ordered the woman in red and my friends got the dirty old man. Both really expertly crafted! This place has a lot of character and the service is phenomenal! I love all the details they put into everything (be sure to look for a carved face in the ice!!). Gorgeous place I'll be back for sure!

Definitely a neighborhood spot, with great crafted cocktails in a quaint, romantic setting. Kudos to David for all the tasty drinks he makes for us every time we visit. I look forward to the summertime, to sipping cocktails in their back garden and listening to the DJ spinning some cool tunes. And let's not forget the oyster bar!

This place is almost a hidden gem! The cocktails were fantastic! The inside is a very dimly lit bar with great date night aesthetics but they also have a lovely back patio with tons of seating which I would say is better for groups. Drink favorites include the Flow & Willow World, George Washington's Night Out and the Little Death.

Arriving on a Saturday night (10/08/22), looking at the menu and they're missing a lot of those premium ingredients! But, cool, still charging $16. What a old fashioned is basic, yet let's change the same (I've had better). Also most patrons did feel comfortable in your shitty room with the bed. I don't plan on returning for a basic cocktail..

This bar is what would happen if your favorite Manhattan cocktail bar and your favorite Brooklyn Beer Garden had a baby. Amazing cocktails coupled with and amazing setting / ambiance. We kept ordering the mezcal infused "Dirty Old Man" mostly because it was fun to say "I want a Dirty Old Man" to the waiter. Our waiter was great too. We were a group of around 15 for our friends birthday and they were exceptionally accommodating.
No comment

Came here based on a recommendation from a friend and it couldn't have been better! Looking like nothing from the outside you walk into a gorgeous bar that takes you back into speakeasy times, with a great assortment of liquor and beautifully crafted cocktails. Perfect date spot or a fun night out with the girls, did I mention the incredible outdoor patio?!! Pictures can't even do this place justice!
No comment

This place is the BOMB. Upscale cocktails and top shelf liquors welcome you at this beautiful gem of a bar that envelops you in a great vibe, chill tunes, and a diverse crowd, making the environment welcome for everyone. The decor is classy chic without the attitude. Their backyard is what really sets this place apart...it's an oasis, capped off with a killer oyster bar--it doesn't get any better than this!! Highly recommended: Olde Salt Oysters, George Washington's Night Out. Get here...

Pretty tasty drinks and a great backyard that's currently open during covid. tables are well spaced out so you should feel better about maintaining distance from others.
No comment
No comment
No comment

I totally loved this cocktail bar!  Unfortunately because of Covid, I couldn't explore the interior, but we sat in the lovely garden. The specialty cocktails were interesting and tasty, and basically Brooklyn priced ($14-15).  They also have an extensive whisky list. As long as the weather holds, I will be stopping back by here on my walk home from work to check out some additional offerings.

Such a cute place! My friends and I happened to get there as a few people were leaving, and snagged a seat at the bar. The only downside is that their cocktails are batch made so you can't edit it. But it was great nonetheless.
No comment

This perfectly curated gem of a bar is worth more than 5* -- from the first time to last nite, Barely Disfigured continues to put a smile on my face and willing to make a trip to visit. From the STUNNING private garden, to the incredible cocktails and (most important) whisky selection, it's a place I escape to feel removed from the heaviness of the world. The staff, impeccable and good-looking I might add, with attention to details never sacrificed HIGHLY RECOMMENDED xx
This place is awesome!  They are reopen post Covid and SO worth the visit!  Amazing cocktails, cute backyard, attentive and sweet servers, and the vibe is just right.  Great music!  I love it!
No comment

love seeing a bar that clearly puts effort into making their menu and ambience so unique! my friend and i discovered this place after dinner - immediately upon entering we were greeted by multiple friendly staff, which is rare in a brooklyn bar. inside was beautiful (loved the couch layout) but the backyard was really stunning! so much space and places to sit - it would be great for a birthday or a date. service was great, drinks were delicious and there were so many fun ones to choose from. this place is a great addition to the neighborhood!
No comment
No comment
Delicious drinks, great atmosphere, and friendly staff. Wish they had more food options.

The boys from Marseilles (or just outside of Marseilles) sure know how to show their guest a good time. Morgan, you're a fabulous bartender. The presentation on "The Little Death" is almost as enjoyable as it is delicate (amaro sweet vermouth bourbon bitters). The back room is a nice change of pace, more like a bedroom crossed with a lounge. And you can't beat the oyster nights. Our favorite bar in the neighborhood by a mile.
Great drinks, atmosphere, and bartenders! I've been here twice so far and highly recommend this place if you want some great cocktails
No comment
No comment
My favorite bar in Brooklyn. Stylish and beautiful patrons.  French snobbery with twist of Brooklyn chill mode.  Great place to take your date and a sit it the back room.
No comment
Favorite cocktail bar in the city. They have a really big backyard area along with their really cool interior. The cocktails are fantastic as have been every server/bartender we've chatted with.
Darn good cocktails! Also this place was super cool. The whole this is not a brothel theme is pretty corny. But doesn't really disrupt the vibe. I'll be coming back.

Great bar with an amazing atmosphere and cocktails. Above all, the service is the best! And it's only gotten better since Covid. Backyard, indoor and out front all have such a great vibe. Highly recommend, this is the best bar in the area.
No comment

Pretty cocktail bar with friendly bartenders. There's also outdoor seating and a back room area with some comfy seats and a bed you can choose to sit around.
No comment
No comment

I love it that Barely Disfigured is open. My go to place for the good time. Friendly staff and great cocktails. My favorite is Dirty Old Man. Give it a try! Highly recommend their backyard is nice and cozy.
No comment

where do I start? the cocktails, it's meticulously prepared, balance and well shaken! I love the great Babylon even though it's slightly weak on the scotch.  The bar, it's beautifully curved w marble top, the green accent chairs are super comfortable to sit on and sip! And yes, as the window says, there's no prostitutes, but there's a bed on the back of the room that you and your partner can do all sorta things on while sipping on your drinks ;). there's a back yard garden i have yet to check out, no food serve so you better not come w empty stomach! I will certainly return very soon!

Very cool bar with great cocktails and an intriguing backstory (spoiler: it was a brothel). Great outdoor patio with a lot of seating, and love the bedroom theme inside. Overall very thoughtful design, and the level of detail is impressive. Would come here more often if drinks were a little cheaper, but otherwise probably my favorite bar in Brooklyn. Bring out-of-towners here if you want to impress them!
Once of my favorite bars on Smith Street! The cocktails are tasty and I just discovered the $1 happy hour oysters! Will definitely be back after work and try every drink on the menu!
No comment
No comment
Night at #gowanus with a stop at #barelydisfigured for some #stiffcocktails including 'The Little Death' and  'Splendor & Misery' and some lovely $1 oysters! Great service and love the decor
No comment

Well just 4 for now , cause haven't tasted the food yet . But the place is awesome ! The interior is unique, cocktails are great , bartender is very friendly . Very cute backyard, with couch and loads of tables .  Inside interior has so many details, one of the places you want to bring a friend , who is visiting. Super nice .

No comment

Amazing ambience! I always order an old-fashion and love the way they make it. There's a cute bedroom/chill area with tables in the back. I definitely would recommend this place for dates. People are super friendly and service is spectacular! Will be going back for sure!

Derek you are everything; (our bar master) for the evening.  Amazing cocktail program, beautifully crafted and original. I cannot wait to come back for more. Thank you for bringing cocktails to another level; unique, delicious and fabulous all at once. Great experience!
this place is such a f**king vibe. the owner and bartenders are all so lovely and sweet. the drinks are amazing. the atmosphere is fantastic. 100000000/10

small bar and back area with the bed. very dimmed lighting. very interesting place. i got the george washington and it was light and strong just the way i wanted. friend wanted a drink and server said it can only be ordered at the bar. didn't understand why.  4 tiny tables in the back.

Props to whoever the architect/interior designer is. That's the only great thing about this place. In the end, if your service doesn't match the quality of your drinks, then what's the point? I could just go to another craft bar with better service.

Been coming to this bar on average once a week for the last twelve months. The music, the bar itself, the decor, the drinks, the team, the outdoor area (during the warmer months), the location all make this place one of my all time favorites in New York!  hard to put perfection in words!

Accidental found this place and couldn't pass it up and had to check it out. The bar vibe was really moody and felt like a 1940s movie set. Really love the story as told through embossed wall paper, vintage found objects and book wall art. Very tasteful the whole thing, thou its inspired by brothel. The drinks were about $14-$15 a bit on the pricier side but was pretty good. There is an unique back room just follow the red light. Our french speaking bartender was very friendly and made conversations which was a nice change from snooty bars. This spot is worth trekking to Brooklyn.

Such a cool bar with great cocktails and a classy, divey-bar vibe. There are limited seats (mostly at the bar) but if you can get a seat, it's a great place to hang on a Friday night. They also have great HH deals for oysters on week nights!

Weird experience. Came here once a while ago on a Friday night after dinner-- we had an amazing time. We got two rounds and our bartender was fantastic-- chill with quiet but ambient music, dark, and cool. Here now on a Monday and very different. Bartenders are careless and drinking with their friends (which is fine-- it's industry. But pay attention to patrons while you're at it), weird Latin hits played at full volume, drinks still good though. Might be back, but fair warning -- not consistent enough to make this a favorite in a neighborhood full of bars.

The bartenders were so nice and accommodating. And dollar oysters!!! Come here! Drink! Check out their fun little bed! It's a blast. Also, there's a very nice backyard.

Love this place. Great cocktails. Friendly Bartender from France explained all the drinks and made recommendations.  New bartender / waitress behind the bar was very friendly.  Enjoyed my time and will return.
I've been here for 4 times. The Madam Kelley drink is awesome. Love the atmosphere of the Bedroom area. Beautiful decorations. Very recommend!!
Best cocktails in the area, great oysters, super friendly staff and the back garden is magical.

So glad this place is open again. Love the outdoor seating set up. The staff is super friendly. The drinks are amazing, this place is definitely an experience I love the ambiance.

LOVE THIS PLACE!!! The best drinks, vibes and staff in Brooklyn.  As a cocktail lover, I've yet to find a drink better than the "Dirty Old Man" in all of NY.  If you're searching for a place that makes you feel like you're on a vacation in the middle of a pandemic, Barely Disfigured has you covered (and safely).  Not to mention, the owner, Jeremy is an absolute gem!!!
We love this place. Cocktails and atmosphere are perfect. Maybe an appetizer menu would make it better. Overall it was great!!

Oh man...was really looking forward to checking this place out. When I walked in two nights ago I was overwhelmed by a heavy smell of POOP or someone who had extreme gas. It's was so potent it would make your nose tingle. I unfortunately had to stay for one drink because I was meeting friends who hard warned me about the rancid smell before I entered. I ordered the dirty old man...the drink was very good so BD gets two stars for that. I'm sure this place is better when someone is not having a case of explosive gas (it was an employee). Hope to get it another shot in the future (I'll let my nose clear out a bit first).

One of my favorite bar in Brooklyn! Most beautiful decor, great music, professional and fun staff but most importantly the selection of cocktails and wines is amazing. The vibe is great for a night with some friends or a classy date. In the summer they have the best backyard to enjoy drinks under the stars!

I don't often go to brooklyn but this was worth the trip. This cute little gem was a nice spot for a date. The drinks are delicious and nice bourbon collection. The room with " an actual bed " is DOPE , love love the mirrors around it . Will go back to chill in the back patio in warmer weather.

Little hidden gem in the neighborhood. Good cocktails, nice staff, classy ambiance. They also have a little patio available, which is always a plus.
Best and sexy bar in Brooklyn. Splendor misery my favorite drink. Very friendly staff and acknowledge.

My husband and I visited their bar this evening. The owners were great. They provided spot on recommendations. Our cocktails were delicious, The Harlot's Progress and Splendor and Misery. The place was so well planned out. Beautiful and clever.
Great vibe, friendly and attentive service, great drinks
Very nice bar. Such a shame it is run by people with no respect towards the customers.
LVE this place! Great vibe, delicious cocktails, cool design, and the staff is amazing. This will be my new local.
Adore this spot wholeheartedly. As an artist I always appreciate a good eye for interior design. Wonderful service from the bartenders and most importantly, cocktails were well-crafted and delicious.
A hidden gem in Cobble Hill. I am a fan of mixology and this place is a winner. The manager and staff are very humbled and welcome everyone. Coming back again because I love this place so much.
Great cocktail bar. True professional mixologists. Great vibe. Worth trying their super cooled cocktail which is made at the bar with a great show.

Had a blast at this bar.  We randomly walked in and the drinks were all great and service was good too. We sat in back patio.  There are mosquitoes so be aware. The back room with the bed was really cool. Totally would go back.

It's like stepping into something from the past.  But where? New Orleans? Paris?  Or, something more familiar--a bar in a famously haunted hotel?  Mysterious and inviting, reminiscent of 'Sleep No More,' the details have been meticulously curated, and leave all your senses satisfied.   From the amazing cocktails to the delicious oysters, this is the best place in Brooklyn.

Absolutely great spot to get drinks and music! Always a place for me to rewind and chill. Very clean and love the staff and management. Jeremy is a great owner and highly recommend this place when your in the carrol garden location!

Beautiful space, superdelicious cocktails and the best food I've had at a bar. Sexy vibe without being skeezy, nice mix of people at bar and very friendly/fast service. A new favorite for sure. Cocktail & food prices really good for what you get compared to other places.

This was THE worst bar experience I have ever had in my whole life. The co-owner was a total jerk to me and my entire group of friends. When I walked in on a SATURDAY night, I was greeted by friends and the owner said very clearly "this is not a dive bar, this is a classy place." So, apparently hugging and saying hello to your friends is something you can only do at a dive bar!??? Wtf. If I want to get speciality cocktails, I will walk over to my favorite spot Clover Club, where I feel welcomed and always have an enjoyable time. Even after the owner was rude we stayed for a while and spent well over $100 on drinks and he was STILL spewing snarky comments. For a bar that JUST opened in a very populated neighborhood, you'd think the owners would be nicer. I will never return and I will warn everyone to stay clear unless you want to get scolded for having a good time. Plus, I feel so strongly that I had to create a Yelp account to review this place.
Always a good time! Great decor, fun atmosphere and delicious drinks.  If you want a good Moscow Mule then ask for Morgan ;)
This place is simply amazing down to the cocktails and the customer service. I took a couple clients here and they were blown away. Hands down best cocktail bar in Brooklyn.

Really unique design, friendly owners and the drinks were seriously on point. They're clearly phenomenal mixologists and really know their stuff. Do yourself a favor and walk all the way to the back. I found this really cool room looking for the bathroom!

Best cocktail bar I've been too with staff as creative and passionate as their drinks. Clever concepts, inviting atmosphere, well priced. Having been to many cocktail bars, traveling for work, Barely Disfigured stands to be the best.
Absolutely amazing little cocktail bar. Fantastic drinks and a great atmosphere. The owner and staff are amazing. Really cool place worth checking out!

Really elegant and cozy atmosphere. Super tasty drinks and well priced for what you get. I didn't try the food but it smelled and looked amazing, so I'll def go on an empty stomach next time! There are tons of beautiful details in the design of this place, which I always really appreciate. I've never written a yelp review before but I chatted with the owner and his wife (locals to the area) and they were super sweet and interesting. Looking forward to having this in the neighborhood!
Beautifully decorated, great atmosphere, excellent cocktails and enough good quality food to also have dinner.

10/10 on the beef tartare! Had to start there. Service is fast and professional. Very knowledgeable people working here. Okay so the beef tongue: this is a level of heat that works for me; in other words I seek out the heat. But I am impressed this is on the menu, as I would bet most people can't handle this level of heat. The tongue is fine enough, but the curry sauce is deep. Hot. I challenge you, heat seekers, to come and order this. We also ordered the pork belly curry, which is a lovely compliment to the beef tongue. The cocktails were also notable - mezcal Passionfruit and the dealbreaker - both very tasty. Okay this review is completely in reverse: pomegranate prawns and whitefish relish as our apps - both very packed with flavor. Must dos!

Sooo yummy and incredibly inventive. If you like spices and layered flavors, this place won't disappoint. Worth the price for the culinary experience~ the staff were also attentive and lovely. Our server was quite knowledgeable about all the dishes and gave great suggestions!

My friends and I decided to come here for dinner tonight. The interior of the restaurant is beautiful and we received a warm welcome. We started off with the jackfruit salad which was very good and the steak tartare. Our waitress then recommended that we order a relish dish so we decided to order the Lon Crabmeat which was surprisingly good. For the main course, we had the Pork Belly Curry and Apple Curry. The food was great and it wasn't too spicy. For dessert, we ordered the Peach Melba which was very delicious and the Kabocha Cream Cone. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars was because the portion size were small. Also, keep in mind that there's happy hour from Tuesday-Thursday from 5:30-6:30pm but you need to sit by the bar to get 50% off drink menu. The staff here were very friendly and their service was great. Overall, it was a wonderful experience and we were satisfied.

I've been to KRU once and enjoyed it. Not quite 5/5 though because some of the dishes were a miss (one of the apps had so much ginger in it). Our waiter was a bit pushy and we ended up over ordering based on his recommendations/tips. I'd say give it a try, ignore the hype, go with your gut, see how it goes

I had a 7 PM dinner reservation on Thursday and it was all delicious. We got one from each category and a desert and we were more than full. No cocktails or alcohol however, I must comment on the glassware that's beautiful and just the whole aesthetic of the place is gorgeous. Their gallery wall of frames is amazing. I will say that we were not warned that the dishes were spicy however, every dish was quite spicy, some more than others. The fish golae sauce was amazing but spicy, the pork jowl relish was good, has a bit of culantro in it which i had mixed feelings about since I'm not a cilantro fan (sister of culantro). But the flavors were good and it wasn't a strong taste and i love the crudités it came with - such as apples, grapes and Brussel sprouts. The curry was delish, had a bit more of an Indian flavor to it, also pretty spicy. The peach Melba was AMAZING, sliced almonds and the cream were beyond delicious.

Interesting restaurant. Was in town for the upcoming holidays and visiting with my son who lives nearby and had wanted to try this place. I noted the seemingly limited menu options but we booked a table and gave it a go the other night. First off I think the food was thoughtfully worked out and for sure it was interesting but I must admit I thought there was a disconnect between the food served and the prices for the various items. The starter shrimp dish worked out to be a single item only for two people - so we had to double the order (and the cost) for what was one tiny shrimp per person. Tasty but hardly worth the cost IMHo. The salads and dips where also an interesting next course and despite what I thought was going to be a glorified crudités with a dip the two dishes we ended up with there actually highlights for the meal. The hog jowl dip was my personal favorite including a bunch of veggies and some crispy fish to crumble on top and the second one was a very spicy paste with veggies and some crusty shrimp you crumbled on top. These were both tasty. The curries were limited options and quite spicy - the beef tongue was not something I'd order again but my partner liked it and the highlight was the lobster Curry but once again it was a small portion in a bowl for almost $40. We also had the veggie curry which was full of potatoes making its price (almost $30) for a tiny bowl once again a fact that made me pause. The restaurant is in a garage that seems to not have heating that circulates well - so despite being seated far from the entrance we were ice cold the entire meal. Making the option of a rice milk based cream scoop desert an odd but tasty close to the meal. With a few beers and mostly waters our bill for four exceeded $320 which I don't think was honestly worth the $$$. Nice folks, interesting take on Thai food but not sure small $30-40+ dollar bowls of curry are something I'd return for. This old hipster will head back to SF and find other Thai food for much less $$$ and so I can eat more than a single shrimp in a lettuce leaf. E for effort.

The starters were great but unfortunately they were the most impressive part of the meal. The relishes were over powered by coconuts and largely forgettable. Gaeng kua lobster curry was bland and also with too much coconuts, lacking the tang and spice profile typical of gaeng kua. Overall, there was not enough diversity for the main dishes. I wish there were some non-curry entrees.

Kru is a fantastic addition to the Williamsburg food scene. They balance authentic and novel flavors/ingredients with some great technique and friendly service. Can't wait to go back and try more of the options!

Loved the jackfruit! Get the stuffed pepper entree. Great vibe and service. 4.5 Stars

The food was so good and so fresh tasting. Most dishes definitely had some spice but mostly manageable. The lobster curry was spectacular.

Exceptional staff! Food was so delicious that I asked what spices were in the banana leaf rice dish and the server said she didn't know but would find out. She came back a little while later with a note card with all the ingredients written down! So touching! So personal! The owners of the restaurant should be very proud of what gracious, thoughtful staff they have! Keep up the good work and excellently tasty food !
Amazing authentic Thai dining experience with Williamsburg vibes, and welcome addition to the neighborhood!
Overpriced. Meant to do authentic Thailand dishes but taste no good. Not worthy the price.
Phenomenal food and drink menue. With playful spins on traditional cocktails and a fresh take on dishes you may have tried before.
amazing food and space! everyone was really nice and knowledgeable of the menu. went with 4 of my friends, great place for sharing plates. had a great time and would come back :)

I love coming here! It's so affordable and I always end up leaving stuffed lol. They have the most amazing fried turnip cakes, best I've ever ordered. So flavorful. The taro buns are my fav dessert. Chili oil, black vinegar, and soy sauce are brought to your table. Service is always speedy. The place is very large with a back room for more private parties. Love coming here with a big group. Decided to check this place out for weekend lunch; the line was long as expected but we got seated in 20-25 minutes. The servers were attentive, refilled our hot teas as often as they can. We ordered various dim sum plates, and beef Lo Mein, which were flavorful and filling. There are a lot of options nearby, but this is definitely one good options to consider when you are debating about which one to check out!
