We had a great dinner, great service, everything we order was great! The special rolls, meatballs, sashimi platter, drinks, sake, all great.

Great food, cocktails, environment and service, definitely will visit again! The tempura is good to try, fresh and not oily. Each cocktail has great combination, really match the sake and refresh, love it so much! The eel rice and the Momoya tasting box are great! I hope I can eat more because I haven't try the dessert yet, I will be back. I highly recommended this place if you look for good Japanese food.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Go whenever you can but if possible I recommend brunch on the weekend! Then not only can you get their delicious sushi - you can also order their fluffy soufflé pancakes! We absolutely loved the tempura, momoya box, black cod & soufflé pancakes. And of course we had to finish with one of their beautiful parfaits. And everything here tastes as good as it looks! Services was excellent - kudos to our waiter Alejandro. Enjoy!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Came here for brunch primarily because of their fancy parfaits!  They seem to be seasonal as they had just changed it up prior to one I had seen on social media.  The quality of that parfait was excellent.  At other restaurants, they usually aren't made with quality ingredients, but the parfait here tasted as good as it looked!  It may be pricey, but it is worth it.  I would definitely come back again to try other renditions of it.  I also had the pancakes which were solid Japanese-style ones.  They were fluffy, but not so much the jiggly ones like some people might expect, so just a warning.  But that was fine by me as the flavor was perfection.

My friend and I went to Momoya for dessert after brunch and made a reservation for 2:30 pm on Sunday. We arrived an hour early, but we were still thankfully seated. We indulged in the seasonal parfait, which comes with a small pamphlet detailing all the parts of the parfait along with the backstory of the dessert. We enjoyed consuming each component with the many different flavors and textures elegantly combined together in the parfait. The white wine jelly layer on the bottom was particularly interesting. Although the parfait is pricy, coming in at $28, it was an enjoyable experience!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Instagram knows how to find me. I saw the parfait & I kept saying wow.. I need to get this! What shook me was the savory dishes this restaurant has to offer! I enjoyed the crispy rice since it's not common to get. My boyfriend enjoyed the spicy tuna more where I enjoyed the waygu appetizer. It's a filling dish, so everything we ordered was just perfect to not over stuff us. But, let's get to the Momoya box featuring 9 mini chirashi bowls. This was perfect for two of us and worth the money! Of course, the main event was the dessert. I love the creativity & complexity of the ingredients and presentation. Definitely worth it in my book. Also cute interior & bathroom!
Super cute and clean looking place. Wonderful sushi bento box. and great drinks!
No comment

This place was phenomenal in terms of food and customer service! I and may party all got variants of the sushi meals, 2 of us got the sushi and sashimi platter, one person got the sushi special, and my partner got the sushi lunch. All of the sushi and sashimi offerings were super fresh and tasty and the presentation was lovely! My partner also got the Yuzu Ricotta soufflé pancake and she thoroughly enjoyed it. On top of that the two ladies in our party of 4 got the lychee cocktail which is a sleeper of a drink if one ever did exist because it tasted like straight juice. Then I got the Suntory beer. The ambiance of the restaurant was very bright and fresh and there was a lot of aquamarine color tones in the restaurant mixed with white which made the restaurant feel super crisp and refreshing if that's even a way to describe interior decoration. Would definitely come back!
No comment

Short and sweet rating. This place was delightful, the service was outstanding, the food was unique and so fresh and flavorful. We just rolled up without reservations and the staff worked really hard to seat us and accommodate our variety of food allergies. This was a random impromptu choice and we are SO glad to have stumbled in. Highly recommend.
No comment
No comment
No comment

The location was in soho so it was convenient after a shopping trip. The place looked cute. We got a sushi entree, which was a little bit disappointing because the rice fell apart. We also got the sukiyaki gozen, which was ok and the beef was a little bit too fatty. For dessert, we cannot miss their tiktok-famous seasonal parfait. The parfait looked huge and tasted very nice. It had bunches of fall flavors like apple, cinnamon, sweet potato and they even gave you an instruction and a breakdown of the ingredients on a paper. Overall, I would only come back for the parfait.
No comment

Had a great experience for lunch at Momoya SoHo. I made a reservation in advance on resy for a Thursday lunch, during the holidays. The host was very welcoming and my friend and I were seated right away. The restaurant itself is very refined and the decor is great (especially the small touches of holiday decor). For appetizers we ordered the wagyu beef tataki which was very tender and the ponzu sauce was a nice touch. For lunch my friend and I ordered the sushi and sashimi combo which comes with one roll choice ( I got yellowtail and she got spicy salmon) four pieces of sushi and four types of sashimi with two pieces for each type. We also had a choice of soup or salad. The sushi and sashimi was very fresh and of good quality. It's a fine lunch option and for the quality you get I would say it's worth it although there are cheaper sushi lunch options (but you get what you pay for, and for soho this is a good deal). For drinks we got a lychee cocktail and it was sweet and refreshing (could only taste a hint of alcohol which I actually preferred). For dessert we split the seasonal dessert which was the "Tsuru No Ongaeshi" -White Wine Gelée, Ginger White Chocolate Ice Cream, Clementine Sorbet, Lemon Verbena Espuma, Apricot Shiratama, Rare Cheesecake, Genmai Crumble, Kinmoku-sei. It was very intricate and there were several layers of flavors to it. At $28 it is definitely on the pricier side but it is an experience and worth while if you are splitting it with at least one other person. I'm curious to try the other seasonal desserts available as the winter parfait was delicious and light. Overall I would definitely come back for lunch!
No comment

Sushi was pretty good and they have a decent sushi/sashimi deals for lunch. I got 2 maki rolls and 5 pieces nigiri for ~$28. We also came during a weekend day during restaurant week and they had a very good nigiri plate on the menu! The ambiance was nice and the downstairs was very open and airy. We sat upstairs which was much smaller and quiet, which would be good for larger families.

Came here on a Saturday for brunch and was really impressed. We ordered the matcha molten French toast, yuzu soufflé pancakes, shokadou bento box, and sushi and sashimi combo. The fish was really fresh and the bento box had a great variety of things to try. However, my favorites were definitely the matcha molten French toast and yuzu soufflé pancakes. The combination of whipped cream, red bean, mochi pieces, and matcha filling was incredible and super unique. The yuzu soufflé pancakes were also super light and fluffy, and the honey added the perfect touch of sweetness.

Went here for brunch and my pancakes were soooo fluffy & yummy. My friend liked her matcha toast as well! The inside and outside were really pretty and visually stunning. The service was great too! I didn't like the dessert that much but it was definitely beautiful!

Amazing restaurant week deal! Appetizer, entree, and dessert all for $60. I've been looking for a good sushi place and Momoya Soho is the first place in a long time to really wow me with their sushi! Truly fresh, authentic, and balanced with their menu offerings. Definitely looking forward to coming back soon.
Some of the best sushi we've had in the city. Our server, Yisi, was truly incredible - attentive, kind, and all of his recommendations were top notch!
No comment
No comment

Everything was delicious & fresh! The staff was very friendly.. the ambience in the outdoor patio was a bit awkward. It was completely silent and felt weird to carry on with conversation. I am obsessed with the crispy rice! Overall, great experience!

Love the box. 9 pieces which looked small but because they had rice in each small bowl, this 9 pieces box was able to fill you up. The spicy scallop and shrimp roll was delicious. Really wanted to try the jasmine crème brûlée but it was not available last night. Overall I had a good pleasant experience.

Great restaurant week offering, their momoya box is awesome, it comes with the freshest fish possible, probably the best o'toro I've had in a while. I think it might be a good date spot, but only indoors, the atmosphere is much better there compared to outdoors.

Such a pretty spot for brunch or dinner (perfect for a date)! It's really modern and bright inside! There are plenty of outdoor seatings too. They use blue chairs that reminds you of Tiffany vibe. The food looked pretty and it tasted good! My friend and I ordered two lunch sets and they came with a dessert each (I wasn't a fan of the tofu one). We also ordered sangrias, it had variety of fruits and looked really pretty but it tasted just okay. The price is on the higher end but I'll wouldn't mind going back one day to try their other items.

The sushi and sashimi are fresh! Their sesame agedashi tofu is unusual like mochi and delicious. They do a good job with the eggplants too! The only minus is that I find the price point higher than places with comparable quality of food
No comment
No comment
No comment

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: I sat at the bar by myself. The bar tender was super attentive asking me right away if I needed another drink when my first one became empty. She was also super attentive with how much water I had and asked to refill it as soon as it was needed. The food was extremely tasty and fresh. The restaurant has a warm and bright atmosphere and is so welcoming. I would definitely come back here.
No comment

Sushi was delicious. You have to get the crispy rice spicy tuna roll if you go. Devoured everything in under an hour, and was left completely satisfied. The restaurant is very pretty. Our server accidentally seated us outside when our reservation was for inside, but it was a nice night so it wasn't a big deal.

We came here on a Thursday evening and ordered off the "Restaurant Week" dinner menu. I will say the Chicken Karaage and Brussel Sprouts did not stand out but were still good. However, the Momoya Box was excellent and fresh! Surprisingly filling too. The Dorayaki we also very good--not too sweet. The decor was trendy but I prefer the ambience of the Upper West Side location more. Service was great.

I wasn't sure how to review this restaurant and wanted to be very clear that my expectations was met but i would not go back. Now walking in i was extremely excited I felt everything in me so nervous because i heard a lot of good things about this restaurant and it was beautiful. I stopped by after doing some birthday shopping on a Friday. I was alone and was in a great mood, Soon as i walked in the host greeted me and was very pleasant i sat at the bar and couldn't stop checking out the details "it was eye appealing"  the aesthetic was everything u would want your Friday after work to be like and feel because the music was on point and i was smiling because i was enjoying every moment. The bar tender came he was very basic gave me a menu and i placed my order. My drink was pretty good and i was happy that i order something simple and it came out in a timely fashion. I noticed the bartender was very short with me not much smiling or conversation and that's okay but the service he gave the other guess was by far what i expected. He asked what was they food allergies and what was the mood they was going for because it seem like we all wasn't sure on what to order "it was many great options" I did love that for them so i was upset my service was so dry. Things did change i ordered the seasonal dessert and I'm not sure if he was the manager and i hope he was because he did a great job putting a smile back on my face. Every detail about the dessert was explained and how to eat it as well  i felt that the money i spent was about to be worth it. Because of him act of kindness i left a great tip and was okay with stopping by. Would i go back hell no but i would say u have to experience this restaurant once. If the service wasn't so off i would go back it would be no question asked.

Absolutely had a great meal here. Their food was so good I had to talk about it to my colleagues and friends too. Their dessert was also very different from other places I've tried too. Different in a good and surprising way since I didn't expect some things to taste the way they taste, but better. Such as finding a pink pineapple, to a floral looking jelly, to a thin piece of mochi in the pancake ice cream. Way too good! I would recommend going to try this place!

Great atmosphere, love the big windows, super friendly service. There are lots of options for sushi, and the prices are really reasonable. Our waiter, noburo, was super attentive and helpful. Loved the creative presentations and quality was great. Awesome for a date or fun with friends

Heard this place for a while and finally have a chance to come try the brunch here!  The food is delicious with good service.  Love the Ochazuke and kids are happy with the good choices of sushi rolls.  Matcha molten French toast is so good you don't want to miss.  We are so happy with the food and we need to come back to try other food next time.

The sushi here is awesome! You'll have a great experience. Went during restaurant week and they had amazing specials! Definitely one to keep on your radar and if you have a chance go during restaurant week because the deals are unreal.

Wow!  Really impressed by the quality of the sushi and to top it off the service was great.  The sampler box left me wanting more but unfortunately the portions filled me up.  Fish was very fresh and the cuts were very generous.  I'll definitely be back in the future.
No comment

We have been coming back to this restaurant 4 times within one week.  We tried their restaurant week menu, their regular menu also the brunch menu.   All of them were good.  Everything so fresh and good value.  Love all their desserts all made in house.  Very creative and very good favor.  Highly recommend!!

We were walking to Blue Ribbon when we came across Momoya.  Decided to just drop in. We were welcomed and we were able to sit right away (ok. It was early) but I'm telling you.... This Nolita hotspot is going to kill it.  We're sitting at the bar and the attention to detail is awesome. Amazing food.
Nice Sushi restaurant. Minimalist decor but sushi is great. Price is reasonable considering NYC. Sushi was fresh and tasty but the show stopper was the melt in your mouth black cod.

I was excited to try this place, but it turned out to be a disappointment. The rice for the sushi roll and all of the chirashi bowls in the Momoya box was a bit hard and didnt seem seasoned. The duck and tartare were good. Service was mediocre. Interior was cute.

If you remember the location of the previous venue (Miss Paradise), you'll understand that Mamoya satellite to SoHo from the UWS/Chelsea is a huge gain for the neighborhood. The inside looks like a k-pop bar from Seoul - not a negatory comment, just a state of fact. There is ample seating outside, but limited seating inside (although plenty of space at the sushi bar). The sushi bodes well at its prince point and the brunch cocktails were mediocre. If you are not crazy about Japanese wine or sake, I would not recommend the options here. The staff was overly nice and prompt to serve us our meals. Overall, I am inclined to return to this venue. I'm excited to dine here when it becomes a bit cooler out, as the outdoor space looks pleasant. I suggest this franchise invests in matches for their guests, I know those who like to collect like myself would enjoy the design they come up with.

Wonderful food, beautiful presentation, amazing staff, and exceptional atmosphere. A must if you can reserve a table to this great experience. The start of the show was the Yuzu Souffle Pancake but everything was magnificent.

Truly a gem. I am seldom blown away by every aspect of a restaurant, but this new location goes above and beyond. Before I get into the food, I have to give an honorable mention to the thoughtful staff. I was at the bar waiting and a server gave me a great recommendation for tea before my meal (maybe the highlight)! From there the edamame was super fresh and sushi rolls were unique. The decor was overall beautiful. The staff though really did take the prize...they were all really sweet and took great care into providing exceptional service!
Great omakase experience! Excellent fish quality and presentation, would definitely go back!
Excellent atmosphere and friendly staff. Food is very much instagrammable, but not as tasty as I hoped.
No comment

We celebrated my bf's bday today. Food was yummy. My favorite were the fruit parfait and  oysters. Definitely on the pricier side but very nice outing for a celebration. The fruit parfait is as good as it looks without being too sweet. Very good mixture of different textures.
No comment

Rachel my friend is gluten free and dairy free and generally a pain but the servers were super accommodating and nice! I didn't take any pictures of the food but the crispy rice is 10/10 and we tried the black cod roll too which was great. We got some sake that came on ice and also the table next to us ordered some sake that looked like milk. We'll be back (much to Momoya's disappointment)

What a great place for Sunday brunch.  My husband enjoyed the matcha French toast.  And the sushi is the correct and authentic size, cut into small bites for a human sized mouth.  At other sushi places, I whisper "Gorilla" to indicate the giant size and make my daughter giggle.  The outside seating is next to an impressive old cathedral.  Lovely.
No comment
No comment

Good ambiance and location. The parfait was really fun to eat and their lunch menu was decent for sushi. The staff is new just like the restaurant so there are small kinks to work out but nothing major.

The food was actually quite good, but the service was horrendous. We ordered a bottle of champagne right when we sat down, and over an hour later, it still hadn't arrived. After canceling the order (since we were done eating), the restaurant offered to give us two glasses for free. Thirty minutes later, those didn't even arrive. Knowing restaurants make the majority of their money from drinks, it was bizarre to say the least that you couldn't score a drink in this place under any circumstance. A real shame, considering the food was pretty decent.
No comment

It was pretty busy on a weeknight at 8:30pm but that didn't stop us from having amazing service from our waitress Kritta (sorry, I have bad memory but her name was longer). She was so sweet and attentive to us and made sure to top our sparkling rose wine and sparkling seltzer as we ate. Once our plates were finished they were cleared out immediately and we didn't have to wait long for our food. The Crispy Rice definitely gets the hype it receives, it was delicious! The Wagyu Tataki was chewy, and fatty. It's something worth trying out, if you like it cold. I was very very happy with the Crispy Duck, it was juicy and tender and bursting with flavor, besides the typical gamey flavor you get from eating duck. I wasn't impressed with the Toro Scallion but it's okay because my date enjoyed it, as with the Chef's Choice sushi! The most anticipated menu item was the infamous Sakura Strawberry Parfait. Kritta was sweet to explain our menu items once she served us and what was on the platter. For dessert she showed us pictures of the dessert menu (of course we got the parfait!). If you like super sweet and fruity flavors, it's so good! The homemade strawberry sauce was amazing and the parfait itself had all kinds of treasure chest pieces like Sakura dango and macaroon and raspberry chocolate shards! We loved our time here, we would definitely come back, especially if Kritta was serving us! She also fixed our wobbly table, lol.

The food was amazing, as was the service and ambiance at Momoya soho. We had several appetizers and entrees, my favorite was the wagyu takati, as well as the sushi which is so fresh and melt in your mouth delish! I would definitely come back, and don't forget to try the dessert menu - it was the cherry on top to my experience at Momoya :)

Well worth the visit and a great addition to the neighborhood - momoya fills the the void for loan upscale sushi restaurant with lots of options on the menu (not just a 200/person omakase) - our meal was great - sashimi was very fresh as was our sushi - dessert was also awesome - service at momoya was top notch

Very cool atmosphere, gives off LA vibes when you're inside. Skip all of the appetizers, the edamame was kind of tasteless and the calamari was really sour and had the consistency of a funnel cake. Wagyu beef was delicious but very thin slices. No liquor license yet so we couldn't get a cocktail but even if we could the menu seemed like it would present better than it tasted. The rolls were the best part, crispy rice tuna and the shrimp and lobster roll were the best. Skip desert and go to Van Leeuwen down the street.

Very attractive building and sleek interiors. I ducked in from the rain thinking of just having a drink at the bar. From the receptionists to the managers, everyone was welcoming and helpful. I got Kumamoto oysters, a seasonal sake with a lovely aroma, and spicy salmon roll with crunchy rice. I could stay there all day! The food presentation is amazing.  Special thanks to Yummy at the bar.

I have been to Momoya twice already since it's opening, once for the dinner menu and once for the omakase. Both times were mind blowing and fantastic! This is my number one favorite Japanese restaurant in NYC - they use the finest quality fish and have many delicious menu combinations. I was very happy to see this location open after visiting Momoya UWS countless times. Highly recommend! I'll be back again and again.

Exactly what this neighborhood needed! Momoya Soho has the freshest sushi / fish in the area and the sake selection is second to none. The prices are more than justified by the welcoming staff, delicious food and lively environment. I'll be back!!

GUYS, you have to go to Momoya Soho! The food is amazing and reasonably priced. They have the best crispy rice in the city, yes even better than Nobu. Also, all the employees are so welcoming and the service is great. So basically if you want to go to a hip sushi place that isn't too stuffy than go to Momoya.

Went with a group of 4. The sushi is good, nothing crazy. Everything is more on the pricier side which is why the food could be better. Fish tastes fresh, portions are very small. However, the service was horrible! We had a middle aged Hispanic lady with pink hair serving the patio Saturday night and she took our order and that was the only time we really saw her. Then there was another middle aged Hispanic man serving other tables on the patio the same night who was killing it and checking on all his tables. He kept walking by and we wish he was our server! When we got our check we waited like 30-45 and the lady never went to get it. The man did instead and we wished we gave him our tip. At the end, she tried to tell us that our Visa gift card couldn't be accepted because there wasn't enough on there for her tip even though we said we would tip in cash! So when she made us pay another way instead, we paid in cash and she awkwardly stood there waiting for us to give her more cash for her tip. We told her to just take the payment for the bill first and we would leave a tip on the table. Weirdest service encounter any of us ever had! We had to ask for a dessert menu and she literally never checked on us. If the service wasn't so bad I'd come back!
Overpriced sushi, long wait for food, not friendly serving - I would not come here again.
Great new sushi in soho. Fish was very fresh and service was great. Recommend dimming the lighting more but other than that the atmosphere is perfect for a night out
No comment
No comment
Amazing fresh sushi for restaurant week, very generous with portion. Highly recommend

Celebrating a 27th wedding anniversary, I wanted this to be special. Unfortunately, our experience was incredibly mediocre! The waitress was nice but forgot to put our order in as we waited forever for starters. When we asked her she apologized and said it was her mistake. The fish quality was just ok. Did not have that super fresh delicate quality at all. Then my husband ordered 2 more pieces of fatty tuna and same waitress brought out uni. She again apologized and said, "not sure what's wrong with me tonight?" We also ordered sparkling water and a gentleman refilled our glasses with tap while our sparkling was still in our glass. I didn't want to stay any longer as I was disappointed in the meal, so we just skipped dessert. The bill came to $450.. not $$ well spent and would not recommend or go back.
Amazing restaurant, I travel a lot and this is THE BEST SEAFOOD restaurant in NYC. Favorite place to come with my husband and friends after a long work week.
What impeccable and attentive service matched with exquisite and high quality tasting food! Bravo!

Do not come to this restaurant for quality or fresh sushi. My friend ordered the 8 piece nigiri and I ordered the 12 piece one. Both of our plates came out with fish that looks and tasted old some of the fish was literally browning. Neither of us finished our plates and left. This place is lively and inviting but that's it

Honestly overall very uncomfortable experience. The staff are lovely however the managers are rude. My friend and I were told to wait for our table at the bar we did, at the same time two of the managers sat beside us watching us the whole time I over heard them whisper "let's kick them out". We were sat far away from other customers. Terrible would not recommend this location AT ALL.

Worst restaurant experience I have ever had! Our table was completely neglected. Our food came out an hour after ordering and there were still dishes missing that we had to remind the staff about. Our waiter (Costas) was extremely rude, did not check up on us all night and did not address the delay. As someone who's been a server for over 4 years I would have never treated my customers the way I was treated tonight. Costas, don't work in customer service if you can't be respectful.
Momoya soho is the best sushi combination! Beautiful and trendy vibe coupled with fabulous fresh fish and impeccable service. This spot is worth the trek to soho!! 5+ stars
Delicious specials, friendly service/owner, and great outdoor area. Perfect spot to eat good food and people watch

Great restaurant but Omakase is overpriced for what you get. Do not recommend doing the $150/person tasting. However I Would highly recommend sitting at a regular table and ordering from the main menu.
This is has an awesome vibe and welcoming to everyone. Thank you for keeping Soho cool.

My friends and I recently dined there, and we were blown away by the food, drinks, service, and atmosphere. The waitstaff was incredibly knowledgeable, and was attentive to all of our needs. The sushi was some of the best I've ever had, and I'm still dreaming about the crispy rice! This is a perfect place for a celebratory dinner, or a low-key night with friends. Can't wait to go back!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

First as soon as we got there - the decor ? Absolutely gorgeous outside and the inside definitely matched. So pretty, definitely aesthetic (insta worthy if you're into that) and the view of the river and skyline is great. The servers were wonderful! Super attentive and friendly - our waiter even brought us a sample of their tomato soup to try (really good btw). The menu has a good amount of options, especially for brunch. I got the Keftedes Pocket and it was out of this world - the flavors, the portion, and presentation were great. Would definitely recommend, especially if you're visiting NY, and can't wait to come back :)
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
The best views with amazing drinks, definitely recommend the Louboutiny... thanks Stephanie for your outstanding service, we love you.... So exited to be back.

We came back to enjoy the good food while we were watching the sunset... food was delicious, drinks were great and the service was outstanding... thanks Steph for always giving us a great welcoming... we are definitely coming back. So exited for Sumer time.
No comment
No comment

Went with a friend for happy hour and was seated at a high table with an amazing view. Our server Juan was extremely helpful with suggesting appetizers and drinks. We ordered the hummus with flatbread and half a dozen oysters. He took his time explaining the different hummus options and kept checking on us to see if we were enjoying them. Since were stayed past happy hour, we decided to share a main. We asked about several but chose the truffle squid ink lobster pasta... it was delicious! Can't wait to go back and try the rest of the menu.

I really wanted to love Mezze on the River, but just too many flaws to give it five stars. First the positives. It is right on the river with great views. The space is well done and the service is good. The food is pretty good as well. So why not a five? We ordered the oysters to start and they were the proverbial bottom of the barrel. I understand that on a Sunday evening that you are down to the end of you seafood since you haven't had a delivery since Friday, but simply say you are out of oysters rather than serving subpar ones. Second, their house cocktails have little taste. Look nice but no taste. Third, the wine list is pretty bad. They sell a bottle of "Two Buck Chuck" Chardonnay for $65 and it is the only California Chardonnay on the wine list the Greek wines on the list are similarly overpriced. If they can get it together they will be a five.
Service, ambiance & food were great. I want to come back during sunset and try another dish. The ravioli was bomb!
Amazing food!!! Was definitely worth the wait! We'll probably be back before we leave NYC

So good. The service was wonderful the music was great the atmosphere was beautiful... the views of the Hudson& statute of liberty while eating were phenomenal, and I haven't even gotten to the food yet! Huge portions, super yummy and ample options for vegetarians. Highly suggest sitting outside on the gorgeous patio and making a reservation. They are great for large parties too!
No comment
I drinks are really good. The food was good too but was super impressed at the drinks. This place is great for a date night. It's by the water and has a really cute mural to take pictures.
No comment
Loved the Saganaki Cigars and the bartenders were great! Place has a nice view of the river as well.

Back again for the 100th time and this place never disappoints! The new Waygu that was added to the menu is out of this world! Cooked to perfection and the choice of spices are unmatched! Had to come back and leave another review because the Waygu is that good!

Got a deal on Travelzoo so we decided to go for dinner and stay over.  First off the view was spectacular.  I don't think there's a bad seat in the place.  Our waiter Mirland could not have been nicer.  We had the grilled flying octopus and the whole branzino.  I have a mushroom allergy so we didn't do the mussels with truffles or the lobster with truffle pasta.  Both the octopus and the branzino were excellent.  We loved the fennel salad that came with the branzino.  We also ordered the brussel sprouts which were so good.  We are looking to go back and try the brunch.  We loved everything about the restaurant..the food, the staff, the view.

Went there with my girlfriends for happy hour & dinner. Great Venue along the riverside. We loved the ambiance and took pictures by the swing in front. The Mezz plate was marvelous for sharing and the Grilled Octopus was divine!

Beautiful restaurant along the Hudson River with stunning Skyline views. The service was great. The manager Stephanie is amazing. She is super attentive and friendly. The drinks we had (the almafi, blue velvet and a mocktail) were amazing. The food is great too. We had the Tartare Trio Platter, flying Octopus and squid ink Truffle Lobster. Highly recommend this place and can't wait to go back!
No comment

I used to go here when it was Merchants and i used to love it. Last night was my first time since they opened Mezze. I wasnt sure what to expect because i used to love Merchants. I was blown away. The location is of course amazing and the view is beautiful, that would never change. But the food and drinks were beyond. Tasty and beautifully served and presented. We had the flying octopus and the tuna tartar and few other appetizers and for enters we had the branzino and the lobster pasta. From apetizers to entres everything was delicious. Love it.
No comment
No comment

The octopus was chewy and the tomatoes in the salad were not fresh. Tasted old and had no flavor. We were sat in a corner with a bunch of flies. We asked to be sat in another table but the hostess was not helpful and end up ignoring our request. The waiter lacked enthusiasm. I wanted a cocktail but they did not have two of the ingredients needed for the drink. I keep seeing reviews on the different social media platforms about how good the food is! But my experience was COMPLETELY different. I guess the one star is for the gorgeous view of the river:
No comment
No comment
No comment
Delightful restaurant with quick service.  We enjoyed our meal and ate as much as we could.  Beet salad, steak kabob and burger were delicious.  Get the feta fries!!!
No comment

Great food, great location, great service!! We sat at the bar & our bartender Maya was great. Drinks are all fantastic. For food, we started with the hummus spread & then Tartare Trio, which has a beautiful presentation. The octopus was so flavorful & so fun with it being on a clothes hanger line. Red Snapper for 2 was more than enough food & was seasoned & cooked to perfection. It's a perfect spot to watch the sunset.

This place blew us away! The setting is absolutely gorgeous, nestled along the Hudson River, surrounded by greenery, you truly feel transported to the Mediterranean. The cocktails are as creative as they are delicious and just when you think it can't get any better, the food comes out! To start, we had the traditional dips with fresh pita, the crispy zucchini, the saganaki cigars oozing cheese and the showstopper trio of tartare. And we couldn't stop there. We continued with the incredibly flavorful squid ink lobster pasta, Greek salad and whole roasted branzino. My mouth is watering all over again as I write this. I cannot wait to come back!
Amazing view, food, cocktails and vibe! It's such a stunning place and the service is great! I really enjoyed their brunch. We ordered Saganaiki cigars and wow you just try!
So happy to have found this place. I recently ate the paella here and it was fantastic. The view is amazing and the staff couldn't be friendlier. I plan on adding this to my regular rotation.

Mezze on the River not only has great food, but the views are amazing! It's a perfect place to bring visitors or to go whenever you want to be by the water. Everyone who works there is great as well (Avi is awesome!) and the service is prompt. If you're looking for the best things to order on the menu, the spanakopita is a must!
came here on a Monday with a group of friends! So much fun, great food, amazing staff and overall just a great experience. Will definitely be back!! Not to mention the view was incredible!!
No comment

Mezze on the River is the new hot spot in Manhattan. The restaurant transports you to Greece and gives you the most authentic food and delicious colorful drinks. The service is impeccable. I highly recommend. 5 stars

Beautiful decor, both inside and out. Very friendly knowledgeable staff. Drinks were well mixed and with a respectable amount of booze. Food was delicious and well presented. You also get an amazing view of the Hudson River and the people and dogs walking by the riverfront. Overall, fantastic spot and I'll be back
No comment

Incredible! Everything was OUTSTANDING! Beyond Incredible.  Was visiting my son this past Saturday and was able to enjoy a special 2&half hour lunch at Mezze on the River. The appetizers & Main dishes were unbelievable.  The cocktails were tasty & generous.  One word: Amazing
Great service, great food and ambience. Must haves are the squid and the "cigars" - you'll see. Also the views are very pretty of the river.

Very nice concept but very odd in reality. People walk through the outdoor dining area with bikes and dogs going in and out of some building complex... (dirty) glass shields prevent you from even seeing the water view from some tables, and tourists come and take pictures with the neon sign and swing who aren't even dining there. Outdoor experience is 0/10

What's better than dining on the Hudson River!? The food was fresh and tasty. Cocktails were equally as good. Great spot and will be back. Had the restaurant week Salad/Pita and dips, Salmon/Chicken, and chocolate cake / cheese cake. All great

Great start for a new place.  They were able to seat 7 of us outside on a perfect summer night.  Cocktails were all very good, service was friendly and efficient, food met all expectations, and the two vegetarians in my party had good options.  We had 3 apps (dips, fried zucchini, and burrata) which kept us all happy.  The mains were satisfying as well.  I had the lamb chops which were delicious.  One person ordered the Octopus which had a great presentation and we wound up sharing.  My wife commented how she'd like to bring her mother back so we'll be back.

Great atmosphere and intimate decor with awesome views. We had the chicken and filet mignon skewers with a side of broccolis and fries. The portions were bigger than expected and the staff was very friendly.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Absolutely gorgeous all around! The food is delish (and so pretty!) The views are insane and the staff is very nice and hospitable!

I had a reservation at 5:30 and I was sat at 6:15pm. I sat at the bar and I was not even offer a free drink after waiting for 45 minutes for a table. I can give 5 stars for the service. The wait staff is very friendly. I ordered the pita bread was delicious but I wouldn't go back because I work in the hospitality business and waiting for 45 minutes for a table while having a reservation is not acceptable.
Excelente Restaurant. Volvería a visitarlos su comida y atención es extraordinaria. Gracias
Brand new addition to the battery park waterfront. Great food and service! The new cabanas give unobstructed views of the waterfront and the new menu is amazing!

I don't think this place is worth the money! 100% overpriced. A chicken skewer cost $20 and doesn't come with any sides. The Mezze has very little dip and just not worth the price. Overall, food is just ok and it's very expensive. I would pass on this place.

It would have been nice. The location was beautiful, and I even called to ensure they had availability before I headed there. Knowing it was a Friday night, it would be busy, so I figured going there a little after the dinner rush would be perfect. The person on the phone said to come in about 20-30 minutes, and we can get a table for two. I went online to make a reservation for the slot in 30 minutes. We arrived on time and understood there was a wait since I booked the reservation too close to when I'd arrived. I told the hostess that I would wait by the bench so I don't block the entrance because I understood. Sadly, 20 more minutes went by and all the other people standing outside (who came after us) were seated except for us. When I looked at the hostess, they just walked away and I felt I was not welcomed. There were two hostesses, so it's not like they were understaffed. Both were equally demeaning. So after 30 minutes on top of the original 30 minutes wait, I decided to go elsewhere. I got an email from OpenTable that I didn't show up, which was not true. The two stars are for the location, but service-wise, I wouldn't waste my time. Getting takeout from somewhere else and eating it on the bench would probably be a much better experience.

This restaurant is beautiful wow. The bartender was amazing. I fell in love with him . The appetizers & cocktails great. My reason for the 3 stars is because there were so many flies inside this restaurants. I was in disbelief how a restaurant could have so many flies while customers are trying to enjoy a drink or meal. I was sitting at the bar and had to ask for my check. I was so disappointed couldn't continue to enjoy the wonderful drinks. I had to keep waving my hands around for the flies to fly away. How is this possible? Why the restaurant owner hasn't taken care of this issue. This is very bad for business. I felt horrible for the poor bartender because while he was trying to make the drink drink he had to keep trying get flies to move away from his face. I would definitely return once they fix the issue with the annoying flies.

column3: Town of North Hempstead, Long Island, NY
column6: I came to eat at this restaurant on a Sunday evening. The decor was great. I loved the ambience and the servers were nice. The food was decent. In my opinion, it was a bit overpriced. Nothing compares to "Taverna Kyklades" in Astoria for best Greek food in The city. I did not like how they charged my card extra because I made a mistake on the "tip" for not adding appropriately. They added an extra $20 onto my balance without my approval. I didn't think that was ok. If you want amazing Greek food, go to Taverna Kyklades instead!!!
Amazing service and great food. Beautiful river scenery is an added bonus! Will be returning. Request Juan for a good time

Nice restaurant, beautiful views! The matchstick zucchini fries were so good! Only complaint is the seared tuna grossed me out, was basically a hunk of raw tuna and was ice cold. I would recommend slicing it before serving. Other than that, great place with delicious food.
Beautiful views of the water and even better food! Loved everything about this! Will be coming back!

Manager gets a table of his own outside, drinks wine, he is super loud talking to employees, he screems names of waiters for them to come to his table, the worst part is someone at his table by mistaje broke his glass of wine and the glass qas on the floor for about 15 mins, the problem was that the table is next to a building entrance, so all the dogs entering could step on broken glass and he didn't tell people nor cared that dogs were stepping on the glass. Very dissapointing.

Had the pleasure of dining here on a weeknight with my boyfriend. I was able to secure a reservation the day of. The place is absolutely beautiful inside and out. Right on the water with the most beautiful views and perfect area to watch the sunset. All the right touches from the decor, music, drinks, menu and presentation of everything. Food was absolutely delicious, we ordered jumbo shrimp cocktail, pita with traditional dips, saganaki cigars, grilled flying octopus, and lamb chops. For drinks I had the Mykonos Nights and it was so good and refreshing. It was a beautiful night so we ate outdoors and it was perfect. Highly recommend. Can't wait to come back here for Brunch! Waiters were attentive and the Manager Stephanie was a doll and checked on us throughout the evening. Being in the Hospitality business for over 10 years it's nice to enjoy a night out to eat and be catered to with excellent service and cuisine.
Great restaurant! Try the flying Octopus you won't be disappointed! Great service Avi and Lindi were great! I felt like I was on vacation!

Nestled in the heart of Battery Park, this is a great new neighborhood find and sure to be the next hotspot. Can't beat the amazing sunset views from the outdoor cabanas, floral wonderland vibe, chic refreshing cocktails and delicious food. The black squid ink truffle lobster pasta is a must try!

Not sure which is better... the vibes or the food. We did restaurant week, which is $45 per person, and this was a great way to try a lot of the menu! Many places do smaller portions for restaurant week, but not Mezze on the River. We will DEFINITELY be back!
No comment
No comment
No comment

My friend and I came here for dinner during the week and sat at the bar for dinner.  You can only order a la carte at the bar, but you can also order the tasting menus at the bar.  We decided to order a la carte because we wanted to try some things that weren't on the tasting menu - the food we ordered ended up being more than the tasting menu anyway, but it was nice to have the flexibility to order what we wanted, we also ordered a bottle of white wine, and then also had a glass of red each with our main course.  We ordered the Crabe Royale, the Risotto, the soup, duck and the Wagyu, as well as 1 dessert (they gave us a second on the house).  The food was incredible and the steak was one of the best I've eaten.  Would definitely return to try other items on the menu.
No comment

I've now been to l'abeille 4 times (or is it 5?) and am basically just in love with the place.  At its price-point, I really don't think there's a better French (or French-Japanese) restaurant in NYC (including some of the specific ones mentioned by other Yelpers), and I'm positive there isn't one with such a great, reasonably priced wine list.  Every visit I've had has been better than the last, both in terms of food and service, and my most recent experience (yesterday night) was perfection.  L'abeille is the kind of place you want to take friends, dates, people visiting from out of town to enjoy a fantastic, luxurious, interesting meal; amazing drinks; attentive, elegant service; and easy-to-hear conversation in a beautiful setting *without* feeling rushed at all.  It's a rare experience in NYC nowadays, and I highly recommend it.

Wonderful restaurant but sometimes a bit difficult to get to due to lots of traffic in the area. Sat at the bar and has excellent service by Dylan and the sommelier.  Enjoyed the sweet bread special, truffle pasta and white chocolate dessert. The sommelier helped pick a great bottle of Rhone syrah. Always an incredible experience.
No comment
No comment

l'abeille is a truly excellent French restaurant in TriBeCa by a Joel Robuchon alum. Fortunately, while the food is as fine as any fancy French restaurant the ambiance is very casual. When we walked in there was a man eating at the bar wearing shorts. The food and service were totally refined. We had a wonderful evening.
No comment
No comment

Overall typical tasting menu French experience with some modern Japanese update.  Dishes were hit or miss. Foie gras was great. Trout was bad. Dessert was meh. Nice setting, great service. Nothing too memorable.
No comment
No comment

Wow the Food was phenomenal. I don't do tasting menus that often anymore but every dish we had was beyond good. When reading the menu I was skeptical bc it seemed pretentious but the flavors and textures were on point. The foie gras, salmon, scallop, Wagyu and the desserts were my favorite. I actually think i liked all the dishes. I cannot wait to go back and psyched it's in my neighborhood.
No comment
No comment

It started out great. The food was excellent but the reason I gave them 2stars is because I want to celebrate my boyfriend's birthday and told them that I want to surprise him. However, after we finished our dinner, we were ignored. Never offered dessert. I've been waiting for a moment if we would get something since I saw some other table also got the birthday dessert and the card However, its nothing. Then I felt oh they already just forget what I have told them. Not sure what happened. But I would say Im very disappointed. I love the food and the service during the dinner. But there is some thing that your restaurant really need to put more attention about.

An intimate and rather quiet space. I got a sidecar to start, it was quite good. The seaweed butter that came with the bread was unique (in the best way) and I would have asked for more if I weren't saving space for the actual meal. Everything in the tasting menu was delicious; standouts were the foie gras crème brûlée with onion ice cream (sounds weird but such a good pairing) and the lobster with green pea foam. The bite sized caneles were a nice touch and the perfect way to end our meal.
No comment
No comment

I so wanted to love this place.  First of all, the service and atmosphere is outstanding.  From the moment you walk in the restaurant you think you will be having a great meal.  Then the food appears.  It looks beautiful.  Picture perfect.  The plates, glassware, presentation all off the charts.  Then there is the taste, or lack of it.  Almost every dish lacked flavor.  Even the beautiful foie gras was overly subtle.  The beef was well prepares, however the beef lacked flavor.  The squab tasted more like charcoal than squab.  Desert was a big miss, just not wroth the calories.    The cocktails were good and the bar is beautiful.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Came here to celebrate an early anniversary.  This French restaurant just opened and the staff here delivered an incredible experience.  We did the six course menu with wine parings.   My favorite was the squab (fancy word for baby pigeon) because apparently it's fresh flown in and served medium which seems hard to get right.  Our sever Ernesto and the GM really made it an unforgettable experience.  Highly recommend!
No comment

A real disappointment. I couldn't get bread for the table so I ended up not eating the pate appetizers I had ordered as then my main course came. Bread still hadn't been brought (despite many requests) by the end of the meal. They press the high priced items but don't give basic service. The servings were small and the very over priced duck was 2 slices. Not great food and really regrettable service.
stunning space - super elegant, kind staff, great music - excellent and varied wine selection & fantastic food - don't miss the cheese plate!! L'abielle is an NYC "must"restaurant!

Foie gras was not as soft. Seaweed butter for the bread not as good. Lobster dish pea sauce didn't go well together and small portion although it was ordered as an a la carte. Scallop crudo sauce not impressive at all. Service was slow and the only nice thing was the decor of the food.  Would not recommend.
One of the best French restaurants in NYC. Had the foie gras, beef and seared scallops - all dishes were excellent and would return again.
Upscale French-American restaurant. Nice environment but the food is noticeably overpriced. Modest wine list, but outstanding prices. You can find much better in this area
Service was pretentious and rude in a way which is not French at all. When given a chance to fix things, management doubled down. They are clueless.

Most expensive nightmare! Food is mediocre to say it kindly! Supposed manager John McKenna could well be voted the Rudest Manager ever!  Someone ought to teach him some manners or better yet, just relearn How to Treat Customers 101. Overall, don't even bother with this pretentious place!
Food and service are both amazing. I personally love their squab and the fish. But everyone in our group ordered different things and I'd honestly rate everything we had 5 stars!

Came here the second day after opening from a nyt mention. The food and service was incredible. Staff is extremely kind and attentive. Many are from other high rated restaurants. My removal of the stars comes from the fact that the menu is very small and the wine list also small but overpriced. I assume this is just because they are new and these things will change over the next few weeks and months. Nevertheless the food was delicious and when I return I will rereview.
No comment
Nice atmosphere and presentation, but menu is strange and food just doesn't taste good. Hard to imagine anyone going twice, so this place is unlikely to make it absent a new chef and menu revamp.

I can't wait to go back to l'abeille! I knew it was brand new and was prepared to expect a few hiccups as the restaurant finds its rhythm but I left so incredibly impressed. Everything was absolutely top notch. I used to work in the restaurant industry and I know about all the behind-the-scenes chaos that can happen. There was no evidence of any of that at l'abeille. I sat at a table that had a great view of the kitchen and the team worked so well together and appeared really collaborative. So naturally, this led to perfectly executed dishes! My friends and I ordered different dishes so we could try most of their opening menu. Our highlights were the foie gras with mango chutney appetizer (the layer of charred mango on top of the foie gras is genius) and the fish. The bouillabaisse served with the fish was soooo tasty. The a la carte dishes are reasonably priced, especially when you factor in the quality of service and the level of thoughtful detail throughout the restaurant. This will be a great place for a special occasion but I think it's also suitable for an elegant night out with girlfriends or to bring an out of town business client. Not a stuffy/super formal atmosphere. Go try it now while it still has that hidden gem feel!

Awesome French food cooked by a Japanese head chef with his team. The food menu is small but the qualities of the dishes are excellent! They have a seriously great wine menu. Service is the best you could hope for at anywhere!
Culinary experience was A++, service was impeccable and smooth (opened only for 7 weeks). We did the tasting menu.  Wow. A gem. We will be back.  As foodies, this restaurant is a must try.
l'abeille is an exceptional restaurant - elegant and well executed with the most exceptional and refined service in nyc
No comment
No comment
No comment
Love this place. Consistently great food and amazing service + lovely design! I love tuna bowl, and a duck of course!
Amazing cbd cocktails , amazing Peking duck & special shishito peppers !! I loved everything & my go to place if I don't make a res for Saturday
No comment
No comment
No comment

Solid taco spot, kinda pricey but one of the better tacos I've had on the East Coast (def cannot compare to CA tacos though). Very quick service which is nice and lots of standing tables in the restaurant! I got 1 carne asada and 2 adobada with corn tortilla and everything on top. I usually like adobada more bc juicier but this time I actually felt like carne asada won with the flavor and juiciness while adobada was a little bit on the drier side. Overall still satisfied my taco cravings though. They take card!
No comment
No comment
No comment

This newer location of Los Tacos No. 1 had quick, efficient service. It's the standard protocol--you order, give your receipt to the chefs, and get your tacos within 5 minutes. They put lime wedges and additional spices out so that you can grab however much you need. I ordered the pork, chicken and steak tacos on flour tortillas. The chicken was a little too charred for my taste, but the steak was just right. Their pork is always such oily goodness, with a way stronger flavor profile and a little kick, which I appreciate. The tacos hold up really well throughout your meal and are generally such a good deal.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Mmmmm yummy street tacos! We were in Soho today and in desperate need of a snack when we saw Los Tacos. There was a decent number of customers inside and the Yelp rating also looked good, so we went it for a snack. I got two of their tacos - the chicken and the pork - on corn tortillas and both were very satisfying, although I think I preferred the chicken. The tacos were topped "con todo" which included onion, cilantro, salsa, and guacamole and then I squeezed some lime juice on top. What a quick, delicious meal!

Living in LA, I've had my fair share of really good tacos and Los Tacos serves up some tasty tacos. You first place your order at the register and are given a ticket that you hand to a cook on the other side of the counter. You then wait for your order and find a table to eat at. I ordered the carne asada, pollo, and adobada. Of the three, the carne asada was by far my favorite. The meat was perfectly marinated and tender, with a lightly charred flavor I enjoyed. The other two were not as memorable to me, but if you love tacos this spot is a must in NY.
No comment
No comment

Absolutely delicious, no frills Mexican food. The taco is great, the tostada was wonderful, but the real star is the Mula especially if you want some cheesy goodness. Every bite is heavenly. The lines are long but they move pretty quick and the service is friendly.
No comment
No comment

Tasty tacos! I ordered one each of the carne asada (grilled steak), pollo asado (grilled chicken), and adobada (marinated pork). I got all of them on corn tortillas and asked for them "con todo" (onions, cilantro, salsa, guacamole). While the chicken and steak were good, my favorite was the pork because the marinade was super flavorful and the pineapple on top was a nice touch. There is also a toppings bar at the side of restaurant with other salsas (pico de gallo, spicier varieties than what is served behind the counter) and additional toppings like dried chilis and radishes. Service was efficient: you place your order at the register, they hand you a ticket, you give it to the worker behind the counter, and they make your tacos with your choice of toppings.

I went in to Los Tacos No. 1 with high expectations and I was not disappointed! I was expecting a long line which there was, but they move through the line so fast (Chick fil a fast). The tacos were just fantastic and you can customize your toppings and pick either a corn or flour tortilla. The Jamaica was just amazing (not too sweet, but refreshing) and is a must get. I definitely will be back! My sister and I both agreed the carne asada was our favorite.

I freaking love this place! I went in yesterday after my running class. I was hesitant because it looked packed, but figured it had to be good... to my surprise the line moved really quickly. Ordering was a little unconventional, you pay you get a ticket, and you move down the line. you then watch the chefs, put your taco together and what looks like almost a flower banquet. it's about $5 for the taco but all the toppings are free. i really enjoyed the presentation and flavor. Looking forward to going back :) it was a great experience!

Finally! A really good casual authentic Mexican taco joint in nyc. I know it's been around for awhile but this trip was my first time trying it. When I lived in nyc I would have loved if this place was around. It's obviously not as cheap as street or truck tacos in LA, but it's so good. Well worth $5 a taco. Super flavorful and excellent salsas. The homemade tortillas are amazing. I heard about the nopale taco so I only tried that and it was quite good. I will definitely try the meats when I am in the city and need a taco.
No comment
No comment
No comment

It doesn't get much better than this when it comes to authentic tacos in the big city! Being from Texas, I think I know a little something about authenticity in this space and Los Tacos No.1 is a must for us every time we're in town! Love how quick they get your food to you with zero time wasted! Whatever you decide to get, you really can't miss! I would highly recommend however topping off with a fresh horchata every time!

Simple menu, easy ordering process, and delicious food. It's everything you need for a quick and satisfying meal! I recommend getting their quesadillas vs the tacos. It's the same but with cheese melted on the bottom. It's so flavorful and the chicken is marinated and cooked perfectly.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I parked the car around here. Sunday morning, kind of empty and avoiding paying for parking in midtown where I was attending a conference. Came back and decided to have a few tacos before the drive back to Baltimore. Two chicken tacos, corn of course, with everything. And orchata water. This wasn't in my list of NY things to do. Now it is. Mexico in Manhattan
No comment

Best tacos in Manhattan for sure, but that's cause there isn't a lot of places or it's too expensive. Big tacos filled with meat with your choice of corn or flour tortilla. I still think the taco trucks in Brooklyn/Queens is way better than this place, but if you're stuck in the city and don't wanna travel out, this place could hit the spot. It just doesn't have that kick.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

There's not much else to be said that hasn't already. The reviews are accurate -- don't walk, run!! Fantastic tacos, two fill me right up for a quick lunch that is slightly over 11$. I get the pork with everything every time. Heavenly.
No comment
Love the al pastor tacos on corn tortillas and with everything here. Chips and salsa are also great. Everything's fresh and well made.

This goes on my must-do list whenever I am in NYC. Excellent tacos/quesadillas and excellent operation. You may think you have tried tacos, but this is a place of taco mastery. I have had tacos in Mexico. Los Tacos is very similar to Mexican taco stands but with fresher ingredients and NYC's tougher standards. The staff inspired confidence with efficiency and authenticity. Try the cactus tacos but their standards are what people come for.
No comment

I'm sorry if anyone is offended but who goes to eat tacos and ask for flour tortillas? You must have these with corn tortillas. They're freshly made in house. The tacos a bit pricey than what I'm used to but I've been dying for a good taco in NYC. I got a Carne asada tostada. The corn chip was a bit burnt. The beef was well cooked and had that char grilled taste mmm. I had them put everything on my food; the salsas, onions, and cilantro! The adobabda tacos has a lot of juice and oil that I just poured out as I ate. I wished they gave bigger slices of pineapple because it would have balanced everything out so much better. I was just teased by the sweet small slices.

So glad I found this other branch of los tacos, I first tried this in Chelsea but for some reason I didn't like the experience, it was so chaotic. But here in Soho branch, I enjoyed the food sooo much. I had 2 Pollo Asado,  2 Nopal and 1 Carne Asada on tortilla flour with everything on it.  The Pollo tortilla stands out to me, I loved that it has that smoky flavor from charcoal grill, everything is freshly cooked and prepared . The staff are efficient and organized. The place is clean and although it has no sitting area you can just eat and enjoy your food at the table. It's okay for a quick bite. Go and try it for yourself if you happen to go and shop in SOHO. Their prices are reasonable too.

If I could eat here every single day of the week, I would! My friend and I absolutely loved this place, it was so delicious. I ordered the carne asada tacos on corn tortillas, my friend ordered carne asada tacos on flour tortillas with guacamole. We each ordered two tacos and they were more than filling! I went around 1PM and the line was decent, at around 1:30 the line was wrapped around the inside of the restaurant but it went by pretty fast. I will say that there are no chairs but plenty of spaces to stand and eat. My meal came out to around $9 and again it was super filling! They had a variety of cold drinks to choose from as well. I would definitely visit again!
No comment

Ay dios mio papi! Full transparency, I do not speak Español nor have I ever been to Mexico but every time I take a bite of the little vessels of love called tacos at LTN1 I'm transported from the bustling streets of NYC to the salty air and sandy beaches of the Yucatán Peninsula. Chefs here are more like artists and the tortilla is their canvas, painted with tender carne asada, delectable adobado, spicy pollo asado or succulent nopal all con todo! Don't be shy when stepping up to the counter at LTN1, the  fast paced scene may be intimidating but the lovely staff will make even a gringo feel welcomed.
No comment
Great as always. Quick. Fresh. Spicy! Plenty of tables to eat at. Loved the horchata. This place truly never disappoints.

Moving from California we were really missing authentic taquerias - this place totally filled that void! Love how quick it was, standing only and small menu. All street style tacos were great and fresh
Order anything on the menu! It simply does not matter because everything is so good. I wash down my tacos with horchata and a glass coke

The tacos are so so good! And they are nicely priced! There's a small seating area so you can sit and eat but it's seems like it's more designed to take it to go. When i'm in manhattan and don't know where to eat or can't decide Los tacos it is!
No comment
No comment

My go to taco spot! As a west coaster it's been a struggle finding good Mexican food on the east coast. These tacos are made fresh - the grilled chicken is juicy and extremely good (highly recommend). I like to add toppings such as hot sauce and fresh tomato salsa from the sides bar.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
New location in Noho! Best tacos in the city! You have to get the carne asada and horchata!

This is actually a bit pricey if you compare to a food truck. About 5$ for a small taco loaded with meat. If you were to compare, you are spending about 15$(3 tacos) for a average meal. Flavor wise, it's all tasty and salted very well. I think the money should go to the busy kitchen who prepares with great views of how efficient it is for them to throw out 12 tacos in under 3 min. Honestly I love the flavors but the price may hit hard considering 60$ for about 3 people.

Tried the carna asada quesadilla and it was definitely some of the best (if not the best) I had in New York City. They make the tortillas themselves so it's fresh and warm. Would go there again soon..

The tacos were great (I got chicken - see in the picture), but were a little expensive for what it was. I liked how quick the service was, you order and then hand the chef your ticket and it's made for you FRESH. The taco also comes with a lot of toppings - even guacamole. I definitely would come back again if I was in the area.
I got cactus and it was so spicy idk if it was a sauce but so spicy! The inside was cute
As someone visiting NY from LA, these tacos are LEGITTTTTTTTTTTTTT comparable to Tacos el Gordo if not better imo
I come here every Tuesday they don't miss . Love the tacos and love the vibes .. place is definitely amazing

Such a gem in the city. They have multiple locations but this one was perfect since it is away from the tourist areas. Walked in and was not much of a line but the place was packed. Really like the order process as well. The tacos were fantastic and even had a little spicy kick to them which was delicious.
Great place for tacos. A must try  NYC Fast food and great quality. Till now it's my favorite taco spot in the city. I went to the one by Grand Central Station
These are not expensive. They are incredibly well made and delicious. I had the best quesadilla of my life here today. These guys are so nice, awesome music, this was heavenly, all of it. Let's GOOOO
Cant go wrong with adobada. My go to for a quick bite. Flavorful and juicy meat with fresh in house corn tortillas and free toppings

Los Tacos No. 1 has been one of those restaurants I've had in my list that I always wanted to try, but never quite got around to until much, much later. I regret doing that - I seriously, deeply regret doing that. All I have to say is that this was the BEST taco I've ever had in my life. Although I'm not one to speak on the authenticity of the flavors, I can confidently say that their adobada (marinated pork) taco was juicy from the meat drippings, packed with seasoning with the various layers of toppings, nutty from (what I think are) fresh corn tortillas, and refreshing from their pico and wide array of sauce offerings. Not included in the photos was also a separate section dedicated to extra sauces and toppings for customers that like to dress / load up on their taco fillings (like myself). My only regret is not having ordered one of every flavor - which I will be doing very soon!
Best tacos in NYC and it's not even close. The place is spotless and service is top notch.

just left, tacos were very good and the people were friendly and service was really fast, would def go there again. i figured it was gonna be good when i walked in and there were many people eating in there. one thing to remember is that you can't sit in there to eat, only stand. but really good experience!
Best tacos in NYC! Seasoned perfectly meat with freshly made tortillas! Big fan of the carne asada
Best taco in New York. Incredibly fresh. Very authentic. Great vibe. Absolute go to if you're in SoHo
No comment

the salsa, fucking great ! spicy but not so spicy and the flavor is so. good.  i tried three different tacos and all of them left me wanting more immediately. unfortunately i got it to go so i couldn't. but literally going back today right now actually . buying at least six tacos.

First solid mexican spot I've been to since moving out to NYC. Got an adobada taco along with a cactus taco. Adobada was a solid 8/10 and the cactus a 7/10 that didn't have as much flavor as other cactus tacos I've had in the past.
Best tacos in NYC. Hands down. Especially the adobada (al pastor). On par with some of the best spots in TX where I grew up.
No comment
The best tacos and worth the hype.  I've never been disappointed.  The line is usually pretty long but it moves quickly.

Ummmm- HOLY Smokes!  I meant to post a picture but I inhaled my pollo taco/corn and pollo quesadilla/flour  (best I've EVER had & I'm for San Antonio!) so quickly I couldn't take a break to photograph the masterpieces.  Oh well- you'll have to take my word for it this time.  Get the pollo quesadilla on flour- you'll be GLAD you did!

The quesadilla is the same size as a taco and looks exactly the same. Only difference is the $2 extra and the cheese. You have to go up to the chef with your ticket after ordering which wasn't mentioned at all, so I waited for for my food that wasn't even being made for 15 minutes. The sprites look like "Mexican" soda but are actually just American- difference is that US sodas are made with high fructose corn syrup while the Mexican sodas use cane sugar. They have a sign listing all the toppings that the food comes with, but fail to mention pineapple. Major let down for $4.75 per taco and $6.25 for a quesadilla that looks exactly the same as a taco. The food at least tastes good, but not worth the price point or experience.
The adobada pork taco was the best taco I have ever ate. It also has great 1920's burger joint vibes.

I was looking for something hearty for dinner and because this restaurant has been on my list, I thought I might give it a try. Thankfully I only waited 20 minutes without any reservations. The customer service felt elevated and the food was delicious, especially the mandoo (dumplings). Honestly, the best kimchi mandoos I've ever had. I would come here again just for them. The Dweji Gomtang (Pork Rice Soup) was really good too and was perfectly seasoned. The interior and lighting was really nice and felt like an experience, especially for dinner.
No comment

Okdongsik only had two things on their menu for food - Dweji Gomtang and Kimchi Mandoo ($12). While the menu is limited and they don't have as many side dishes as other Korean restaurants, the food came really quickly and everything was delicious. I was initially worried that I'd still be a bit hungry after, but I felt decently full even though I split the mandoo with my friend. I also tried their Tangerine Ade ($8) and liked how it was sweet, but not overly sweet. I'd love to come back but getting reservations for this place isn't the easiest thing, so we'll see what happens!

They only have two menu items and I wasn't really impressed by it to go back. The food is simple, fresh and tasted good but was a little bland for the price point and ambience. It's definitely a high demand upscale set up that gives okdongsik the glamour.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Okdongsik has an incredibly simple menu of two food entrees. You're here to try the kimchi mandoo and dweji gomtang. Both are solid and are perfect for a chilly day. The kimchi mandoo has a very thin skin and the filling itself is on the softer end. The gomtang is on the lighter side, with rice sitting in a bone broth and slices of pork on top. I'm glad I had the chance to try it. Overall, it's a quick meal, where you know exactly what you're ordering and you're likely in and out within 30 minutes.
No comment
No comment
