No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

The menu is very very small so I expected it be perfect since it's their specialty and they don't make anything else. I've never had rice in soup like this but it was okay. the soup was very light and it just tasted like a bone broth my dad would make. It seemed very very overpriced at 18 a bowl. It wasnt very filling but it wasn't bad either. It was okay. I'd rather have ramen to be honest.

Not sure what the hype is, but at least it wasn't pricey (but I've been told it is pricey for the type of food it is). The rice soup was a little bland (I know you're supposed to taste the quality of the ingredients) but I couldn't taste anything at all. However, the dumplings were delicious and got a second serving. This is the kind of spot where you eat your meal and be gone in 30 minutes. The back is actually a speakeasy that you can check out after dinner! Overall experience was alright. Very nice and polite servers though, who came from Korea just for this pop-up.
No comment

This place only serves 2 items: Dweji Gomtang and Kimchi Mandoo. The Gomtang is a bowl of broth served with thin slices of pork and and rice, which is really the ideal meal I'd want for a cold day. While soup is quite filling in itself and is definitely the star of the show, the kimchi dumplings are also delicious and a great choice for a side to share with two people (or just for yourself if you're hungry). Reservations are strongly recommended as this place is tiny.
No comment

EXCELLENT!  Make a reservation.  Simple yet incredible and the price is right.  They serve three dishes pretty much.  This wonderful clear broth pork soup with short grain rice at the bottom.  Texture of the rice is great too.  Soup, kimchi, and excellent kimchi dumplings.  That's all you need.  Hope to go back in a couple of weeks.  Worthy of the high praise.
Awesome pop-up in NYC by way of Seoul! The pork gomtang and kimchi mandoo were so good. Excellent taste of Korean "soul good"! Definitely want to visit their home location in Seoul soon!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

First of all, getting reservations for this place was impossible, but luckily I got two seats for my husband and I for lunch. The only items on the menu are pork gomtang and kimchi mandoo. Honestly, you can skip kimchi mandoo. The gomtang was extremely clean tasting and kimchi that comes with gomtang was incredibly refreshing as well. I initially thought gomtang tasted very bland.. but I keep thinking about gomtang on a rainy/cold day..

10/10 - food was so so good. They have a very simple menu with just 2 items. The broth was so flavorful and perfect for a cold day. The kimchi on the side was so flavorful and definitely the best I've ever tried. So glad I got to experience this pop up!

So glad my friends and I snagged a resy at this pop-up! When we arrived, there was quite a wait. The shop is tiny and there is very limited seating but very cozy. The menu is small and really focuses on the gomtang. It definitely hits the spot on a cold day and warmed my soul. Although, the true star of the show were the kimchi dumplings!! It was such a good meat to skin ratio. My friends and I were very pleasantly surprised.

Was lucky enough to visit this spot! I got their famous Dweji Gomtang ($18), which was a bowl of amazing broth in a bowl of rice, topped with slices of pork. I kid you not that was the most amazing broth I have ever had and the pork was sooo perfectly tender and delicious as well! Plus the kimchi they served with it was a 10/10  Also super cool to see the chef himself in action on the other side of the bar! Would definitely recommend visiting before the pop-up closes!

The smell as you walk in is just heavenly! Tiny pop up but doesn't feel crowded. Pretty easy to get a reservation but you need to book at least 2 weeks in advance. The service was great and staff is very friendly. They only have the gomtang and dumplings so I got both! Definitely enough food for 1 person. The gomtang had more pork than I expected and there isn't a need to add extra pork unless you're a biggggg meat eater. The broth is soooooo clean and delicious - something you would crave on a cold winter night and a broth you can drink daily. I left feeling satisfied and not bloated as I usually would be after eating rice.
No comment
No comment
No comment

It certainly wasn't the best meal I've ever had, but it is still very well executed, high quality, fairly priced food. There are only two things on the menu and you will probably be expected to finish your meal in ~30 minutes given the space is not that big. One of my friends actually gave me and my other friend her reservation (lucky us!) so I didn't have to go through the difficulties of booking one. For those who are trying to get a reservation, I recommend following their Instagram page to see when reservation slots will be released. It's worth trying while they're open for this limited time pop up!
No comment
Solid gomtang, reminded me of my grandma's soup  kimchi Mandu is a must! Super quick and simple food for the soul

Amazing! This pop-up restaurant revitalized my Korean soul. My friend and I came here on a Wednesday evening. Not sure if you can drop by since the restaurant is fairly small with limited seating. We got a reservation ahead of time and got seated right away. We both ordered the Dweji Gomtang and shared the Kimchi Mandoo. Both were incredible! The broth for the gomtang was simply divine and the pork was delicious. The mandoo were also amazing. I would definitely recommend getting both. Highly recommend trying this place!
No comment
No comment

Okdongsik really surprised me. We ordered the Gomtang and Kimchi mandu (the only 2 food items on the menu). I'm usually not a fan of mild foods, but the Gomtang was so clean yet flavorful. It paired well with the homemade spicy ssamjang and the fresh kimchi, which was fitting since it's less sour than typical cabbage kimchi. The fresh kimchi mandu was terrific as well. With 2 mandu and a bowl of Gomtang, I left feeling pretty full but still very good (which is rare).
No comment
No comment

This spot was not easy to get in since it was small and popular on social media. Pro tip: check resy in the same day, you may see some openings in the afternoon. I checked around noon on the day I was free and got an 2:30 one. The soup seemed basic, but it was warm and wholesome for the winter. There were lots of meat, they were just sliced very thin. The dumplings were pretty yummy too. Overall, I would recommend this place.
No comment

loved okdongsik - thought it was a tiny little soupy hole in the wall, and was surprised to see the Michelin 2022 sign in the window when we walked up! only two things on the menu: pork gomtang and kimchi mandoo - we got both and both were exactly what I had been craving. the food is warm and comforting, and reminded me of my mom's food. this place COULD be a hole in the wall. there is nothing pretentious or elevated, it is not a creative spin off of Korean soup. It is simply just truly good, well made korean soup, and I enjoyed it immensely. also: the kimchi + gomtang combo was elite!!
No comment

It's pretty impossible to get a reservation at Okdongsik, but you can be a little lucky with a walk-in. But the gukbap is amazing here. The kimchi crazy good. The mandoo is a must have. Hope this place stays permanently.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Good soup. They only serve 2 things - pork gomtang + pork/tofu dumplings and a few selection of drinks. The soup was good but not mind blowing. It's a hard pill to swallow to know that the soup is $18 tbh. I wanted to try it before the popup leaves on April 2. I shall try it in Korea and see the true taste (and price) difference. Worth trying! Definitely share the dumplings or order a set for yourself.
No comment

Two food menu items popup Gomtang and Kimchi mandoo. Gomtang is fine but not packed with flavor so don't go in thinking it's something crazy (more nostalgic) for people eating this growing up. Kimchi mandoo was very good. If I were to go back, I would get maybe one soup to share and two orders of dumplings.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
The wait here was not bad. The gomtang was delicious! The service was great and attentive. Will definitely come back. It was great for the NYC cold weather.
No comment
The dumplings was super comforting but the kimchi mandu and side of kimchi was my favorites. Would recommend you guys to try it!
No comment
Solid food and nice vibes. The broth had a clean taste and was very simple. Seating is small so expect to wait a bit even with 2 people. A little pricey but a nice wholesome meal!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Excellent service and ambiance, extensive drink list, a private room for up to maybe 10, great bar for making custom dipping sauces, lots of delicious cooking broths and super fresh food items, and you can opt for individual hotpots or a large one for the table. Perfect for large groups or a fun interactive food experience for a date.
No comment

No comment
No comment
No comment

If you've had the original Sunset Park Lao Jie, you know it's one of the tastiest and still affordable hotpots in the city. I'm happy to report that the Manhattan location is the same way! It has an even more spacious interior, which is better decorated than the original. The food is the same, super delicious and affordable. Nothing crazy in terms of meat quality but the broths are great and add a lot of flavor. I think due to the layout servers are more easily able to move around as well so you get faster service too. Overall this place rules and I'm glad there is a Lao Jie closer to me now!
No comment

I think this place has a brooklyn location that I've been to and I have to say both locations don't disappoint. The meat is well sliced and the spicy beef soup base is definitely on my "you have to try it list". My friends and I ordered many things from lamb, beef and shrimp balls to chicken skewers, beef skewers and watercress. There are many options to try from so it may be a bit overwhelming if it is your first time doing hotpot. However, the staff was very helpful in giving recommendations. I would say stick with what you are familiar with unless you go during the all you can eat time. On a cold day in New York or even just to catch up with friends, this spot is at the top of my list.
No comment
No comment
No comment

New favorite AYCE hotpot in Chinatown. It's a bit pricier than the other places but I'd gladly pay a few extra dollars for the cute decor, good quality food, and nice selection of broths. What really sold me was the beef tongue (they don't usually have this at AYCE hotpot places. At hometown, you can only order tongue if you also pay for BBQ) and humongous clams (seriously never seen such big clams). Service was extremely friendly and fast. Their sauce station is a bit small but I usually only use scallion and garlic.

I honestly didn't have any expectations for this spot but my group of 3 came on lunar new years and they told us the wait would be two hours but ended up being 40 minutes. The Ayce hotpot was $34 per person and the food was really good quality. The pork belly, beef, fish balls, soup, sauces- everything was great!! And the inside was decorated so festively.
This was my last meal before leaving NYC and was definitely my favorite meal! The restaurant was very clean! Service was great, very attentive and quick! I will definitely return when I am in town!

We had a great time. Come hungry, they don't rush you out. About $37 per person. We had three teenagers with us and got our money's work. Excellent staff!!!! And if it is your birthday be prepared for song. It is really loud.
No comment

Great experience! Went with 3 others and we were able to make a reservation. It wasn't too busy here. I think our reservation was at 11:30 and maybe got seated at 12. And we were there past 2pm! They didn't rush us and they had a server attend to our order. Quality of the meats and all options were good plus fresh. We had clams, beef, squid, quail eggs, tripe, corn, seaweed knots. For $35 ACYE is pretty worth it. There was also mantou with condensed milk and a dessert option after. Decor here was also super cute. We are very happy that this hot pot place is now in Chinatown.
No comment
No comment
Best high quality and affordable hot place in Manhattan! Everything was delicious and the ambiance was great. Would definitely come back!
No comment

So good we came back three times in the past week!! Two hours all you can eat for $35 pp! Unreal. Come hungry because you can literally order so much food until you have to be rolled out of there. They are so attentive and really have the freshest ingredients! If you are vegan or vegetarian it works well for you too. If you come here for your birthday you get a free meal if you come with more than 4 people! It gets so packed at night you better make reservations in advance! I feel like if I talk about it now it's going to be too busy for us to go. Line will be around the corner very soon!

column3: Long Island City, New York, NY
column6: No comment

Love this all you can eat spot that has hotpot and skewers!!! This is like the best combination in my opinion. Definitely worth and great value. Great variety of food and service is good. Food arrives promptly as well. One of my favorite hotpot places in NYC. The line is getting a little long nowadays. The decoration is nice as well. The watermelon juice is good, but it is a separate cost.

Great new AYCE hotpot place. The selection is a bit more premium than other places I've gone to. They have shrimp paste, fish paste, and fish fillet which I don't typically see on other menus. Will definitely returning!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

SO SO SO GOOD. AMAZINF EXPERIENXE. yes we waited a little bit around 9 pm on a Friday night, but the food and service was impeccable. Great sauce bar, AMAZING AND ATTENTIVE SERVICE, lots of choices for your hotpot. From the moment you walk in to the moment you leave, you are taken care of. Man everything was so good i wish i was eating it right now.

Such a good deal!! We chose the ayce bbq & hotpot option - $41 which was more than enough food. Unlike most ayce places, the service was super fast and attentive. Even though we did mot speak chinese, we had no trouble ordering stuff. Honestly everything on the hotpot menu was so high quality it did not disappoint! The bbq option was not as good but still worth it. We will come back probably for the hotpot option because that alone was enough food.
No comment
No comment
No comment

What a great night!  This spot was perfect for a rainy day. If you're a fan of all you can eat hot pot this is a good choice in Manhattan. The food was fresh, the broth was flavorful and the service AMAZING!  I do recommend making reservations so you don't end up waiting for a long time as it is a very popular place. If you feeling some bbq skewers, it is only a few more dollars and well worth it. If you pay cash you'll get a discount. This might just become my regular place for hot pot.
No comment
No comment
No comment
This was my first time having hotpot ever. It was such a cool experience. The food was abundant and it all tasted so good. They always topped off our soups and were so kind.
No comment

The selection here is quite extensive! The service is great and attentive. We definitely ordered everything we wanted and some. The price comes out to about 45 per person. The soup bases are pretty decent.

Very good all-you-can-eat hotpot place that just opened a location in Manhattan. The variety and quality of the ingredients are impressive for an AYCE place - fatty beef, fatty lamb, tripe, pig blood, shrimp paste, fish balls, they've got it all! The price is on par with other AYCE places in Manhattan - $35 pp. For soup bases, they offer single soup base individual pots and single-, double- and triple-soup base options for groups.

This place was pretty good in terms of menu options, pricing, etc. but I will say that they fell short in two areas. One, the sauce bar was pretty lacking and was kinda set up like a make shift sauce bar on the bottom floor. Second, the bottom floor itself was very lacking. There's seriously a difference between dining at the top floor versus the bottom floor. It was significantly colder in the bottom, less tables, and just the ambiance was not as nice down there and lacked a lot of decor. Service however was pretty decent.

Hands down my favorite hotpot place in the area! Includes AYCE hotpot/bbq skewers for 2 hours. You'll leave full no doubt. The best thing about this place is the staff- they are so friendly and make sure to keep checking up on you. At other places, they just bring you food once and that's it. Also the vibes are so nice :) will return
No comment

Probably the best AYCE hotpot in Chinatown! I was particularly impressed by the wide selection of seafood offered--I looove blue crab so I demolished a full order myself. Good variety of soup bases, meat and fish balls. Docked one star because some items would be left off of our orders and service was a little bit slow, but overall a great deal for $35!

First hot pot experience in NYC and I loved it! Super attentive and great service. Make your own sauce bar and AYCE hot pot, bbq skewer, and combo options. We went with just the hotpot and we're stuffed to the gills after 2 rounds. Fish balls are just like the ones I've had growing up, meat was thinly sliced and fresh. Definitely will be coming back

They gave us some BS that their credit card machine wasn't working so its cash only, which should have a been a red flag to leave but we decided to give it a try still. They walked us through this lively upbeat dining room with loud music, karaoke on the TV, cool lights and ambiance, people drinking and having a good time. Then we turned the corner and went downstairs to eat in the bowels of the restaurant in a dark dingy room filled with the lovely sounds of clunk and clatter from the kitchen. The way you order here is you tell your server what you want, they punch it in an iPad (funny the iPads work but the CC machine doesnt), then you eventually get your food. I don't know why they didn't just give us the iPad.... Our server barely spoke any english which lead to many incorrect orders(I ordered a pitcher of Sapporo and got an order of fish balls) or some items just completely missing. Some other unfortunate souls were banished to dine in the dungeons with us. They kept sending their food to our table, we figured this out after getting a lot of things without ordering and realizing the other table had nothing after they ordered. The sauce bar down here matched everything else in the basement, dingy, dirty, disgusting. The spicy broth was pretty good here, lots of heat. The meat was not that great, once it touched the water it shriveled up and almost completely disintegrated as if it were a piece of foam to an open flame. Overall I would never come here again, however its not so bad that I wouldn't still sentence my worst enemy a lifetime of dining here.
No comment
No comment

I came in on a Friday night with a group of 5, with a reservation. I definitely recommend one, because they were busy and there was a line for people trying to get a table. I've enjoyed their sunset park location deeply, so I was expecting the same here. They did not disappoint! Excellent and friendly service, great food, and a nicely designed new location in the chinatown/les area. Their vegetables and meat are always fresh, they had two broths I hadn't tried before, spicy beef tallow and dark chicken satay with wolfberry. Both were excellent! The spicy beef tallow had a great kick to it. I also love their fresh cooked bbq that is brought out to order on skewers rather than cooked on the table; always hot and fresh and delicious.  I'll definitely be back to all of their locations when I'm craving hot pot and bbq!
No comment

This spot is phenomenal! 99 Favor Taste used to be my favorite, but Lao Jie is everything: incredibly fragrant broths (try the beef tallow base on mild spiciness), quality meat that's already defrosted, LARGE portions of everything (be aware!), and great service. The price is extremely reasonable for what you get. We were blown away and will be back way too soon, to our waistlines' detriment.
Best ayce hotpot in Manhattan. Value, service (very attentive), interior decor are all top notch. Only downsides are limited selection and drinks are extra. Overall, highly rec!

By far the best service I've had at Hotpot but also AYCE. Staff takes ur order and they also have bubble tea. Really nice and attentive. The combo is around 41 and 35 for just BBQ or hotpot. I would recommend with ordering some then adding on as you go. Pretty decor and good size for groups!
Amazing service and fresh food. All you can eat so you can't go wrong. The staff was super friendly and knowledgeable. Would definitely recommend!

Discovered this little gem on a whim after work. It was on a Sunday night around 9:30 pm. The place was lively and very lovely as well. Spacious seating decor was nice beautiful fire like wall. $34.98 for unlimited bbq and around 41 I believe for hotpot and bbq. Great prices. What made it all the better was the great service. Very attentive staff. Patrick who I believe was the manager was very nice making sure all the tables were good and checking in on us. We really appreciated the attentiveness skimming of the broth but also in a way that lets you just enjoy and continue talking. I completely understand what one of the reviews meant by the meat is so flavorful you don't even need to dip it in the sauce. I ate it just plain a few times. Seafood fresh veggies nicely cleaned and fresh. Overall great food great service great ambience. Can't wait to go back! One of the best hotpot places I've been to and will be stopping by after work on the regular!

Service was great. We were seated downstairs and our server was highly attentive. The hot pot lives up to its name though the skewers were so so. The tomato broth was the best! This is definitely one of the better hot pot AYCE places to go.
Came here for lunch and it was delicious pretty on par with their Brooklyn location which is the one I usually go to!

Came here with my sister last Saturday and the restaurant is so nice. Service is great. A lot of choices to pick. The decorations are so unique. Will definitely bring my other family members here. Please keep it up. Thanks

Sharing this we are happy to drop by Hotpot/BBQ and especially the environment seems a bit unique just like a taste of "Old /Classic" taste..also give a plus to those servers..well manners and friendly...

Overall can't complain for an AYCE place.  Ambience was fun and buzzing. Loved how the server offered bags to put my coat / purse in. Food quality was solid. Would I go back? Yeah. Would I rearrange my plans to go back? Ehh
No comment
Terrible hot pot base. Makes everything else taste bad. Really should work on quality of soup since it touches everything you eat there.

The price is honestly amazing for all of the items that they include in the menu. I have never seen a deal this good before, hopefully they never change it. For 35 dollars for AYCE, it includes a wide assortment of protein, including CRAB, seafood, including FISH BALLS WITH ROE, vegetables, and APPETIZERS. The set up in the restaurant is so cool, and the staff is so friendly. The broth was really good too, highly recommend.
They have more variety of hot pot foods than I thought. Great service and the seafood is fresh. They gave us free mango pudding after the food. Love this place!!
I have a high expectations because of the reviews but this is totally disappointed. Not much selections for hot pot and cheap to give out food.
No comment

The burger here are as good as shake shake but their soft serve is overhyped. The chocolate dipped have a oily aftertaste and it melts like crazy. The interior and the waterside view outside was pretty for a nice walk.
No comment

I came here on a Thursday afternoon for a treat after ice skating at the rink. It's conveniently right by the rink and I've seen their dipped cones on Instagram so I decided to check it out. I ordered the seasonal special ice cream dipped cone the Grinch (eggnog custard ice cream, holiday sprinkles, wintergreen dip). It was adorable since it looked like a Christmas tree with a star on top (star is not edible, don't eat it haha). I like that it's in a plastic cone cover in case it gets messy. I'm not a fan of eggnog in general but the eggnog flavor wasn't too strong. I liked the crunchy chocolate shell. It wasn't messy at all as long as the ice cream doesn't melt too fast. There was a lot of indoor seating and there was a water station which was great. It's a bit pricey ($8 for an ice cream cone) but once in a while it's ok since you have to treat yo self!
No comment

Can endorse the dirty dipped waffles as a satisfying drunk snack. $7 for a heaping cup of waffle-cut potato fries. Perfect seasoning as standalone fries, but they're also doused with a cheese sauce, a second cheese sauce, pepper flakes, and scallions. Ketchup on the side. Fun, a little messy to eat, as salty, fatty, and filling as any slightly tipsy patron would want.
No comment

No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Not a fan of french fries but this one i love. Perfect for snack. Crispy & tasted fresh. We had it as a snack while sitting in the riverdeck. Frenchfries with a view, how good is that!
No comment

We were looking for some ice cream spots in the city and decided to give this a try. Was a pretty hot summer day so it was a perfect time for ice cream. I got the recess come and my gf got the berry one. The cone looked really cute and I love the fact that there was a recess cup hanging on the side, was a nice surprise along with the ice cream. I really liked the coating on the ice cream as well. The berry one was really good too. I just didn't like the cone since it was a bit bland but that's mostly my preference. Overall, would recommend this place, makes for some good pictures and pretty nice spot to walk around and have some ice cream.

Maybe my review is heavily influenced by the current inflation environment of 2022, but I don't feel good spending $20 on a burger, fries , and a canned diet coke even blasted on 3 old fashioneds and coming from Oktoberfest on pier 15. Burger definitely could be juicier, but it's just a smash burger so there's not much room for juice anyway. Probably a fried chicken or ice cream would've been the move at a place called Mr Dips. The waffle fries were great. Very crispy and freshly fried. The ketchup dish is not shaped for these to be dipped in. Ironic.b
A fun spot to grab a snack if you are walking along the pier. They serve really cute ice cream! We got the winnie the pooh themed cone to share.
No comment

This might have been the best burger I've had in a very long time if not ever. This was my first time trying Mr. Dips but not the last. I want to try them all. The waffle fries were nice and crisp. The cheese sauce was creamy and flavorful but make sure to have napkins. The ice cream come, in addition to being cute, was also really good.  I just wish I ate it faster since it melted due to the summer heat.

After dinner, we decided to get ice cream. We decided to share one of the more popular flavors: Berry Gibbs ($6.79), which consisted of strawberry, nilla wafer, and sweet cream. For some reason, I found the strawberry cover tasted more like medicine. The flavor wasn't really hitting it for me, so I was glad I just ate most of the cone. Maybe the other flavors might be better though.
No comment
No comment

Very cute ice cream and burger place near Seaport! I had their food truck bookmarked for a while but didn't get to go. I'm glad they opened this brick and mortar store. We came here after catching a movie at ipic. You order at the front of the store and then pick up there when ready. The food was actually prepared really quickly- especially the ice cream cones. I've been there a few times and they have a different monthly flavors for their ice cream. They're always really good but pretty messy- the plastic sleeve that they provide for the cones really help though! The burgers are great- on par with shake shack. I've also gotten their honey chicken tenders. They don't skimp on the honey! There was a puddle of it in the container after I finished lol. The cheese fries are also really tasty and is covered with lots of cheese. Loveeeee!!

This was my first visit to a Mister Dips. It was a Saturday at 1:30pm. Honestly, it was one of the least busy eateries at the time. I ordered the Double Dip burger and the Blackberry Buttermilk shake which came with whip cream. I enjoyed my meal while watching plenty of pier traffic on a sunny October day and listening to only the fast paced 80's tunes. The burger was fine for the type of establishment this is. The bread gets special kudos. The shake was fantastic.

Nice location overlooking the Brooklyn Bridge and there were a good amount of seats. The food was really good; the root beer was the best I ever had... flavorful and not too sweet. The waffle fries were perfectly crunchy and full of real potatoes. The bacon burger was good; the feta cheese made it very interesting. You must go especially for the fries.
No comment
No comment

I really enjoyed the burger and ice cream. The cone consisted of a fall flavor for a few weeks. It was Maple flavored. The worker let me try a sample first and it sold me. The service was great and the worker was very polite. I will definitely be back!!! The atmosphere was also great. Nice view of the river .

Came here over the holidays and tried the "grinch" ice cream which is an eggnog custard cone dipped in chocolate and sprinkles. It was SOOOO good and had such a nice unique flavor. Chocolate crunch with creamy ice cream! Can't comment on anything else like the service, because we just took ours to go and walked around the pier. But definitely check out this seasonal ice cream flavor whenever it's available. YUM!

The absolute best chicken tenders you will EVER have. The hot honey and blazing Buffalo are both amazing. Only disadvantage is that the forks are absolutely awful they break every time you use them! Just be sure to bring your own silverware!!!
No comment

Cute little burger & ice cream shop in the Seaport area, right off of Pier 17. 5 choices of "Dairy Dips" (ice cream), including 1 rotating flavor of the month. I tried the Berry Gibbs (strawberry, nilla wafer, and sweet cream), which I thought was exceptional. I was pleasantly surprised at how packed with flavor this ice cream cone was. I appreciated the fact that they put the cone in a plastic holder/container, that allowed you to 1. Not touch the actual cone 2. Held up any drips from the ice cream. Highly recommend grabbing an ice cream and taking a stroll on the pier!!
No comment
No comment

The berry Gibbs was so good! The strawberry soft serve was lightly tart and not too sweet. The dip was the perfect hardness. The Winnie the Pooh was so cute bursting with honey flavor. The bee candies were too hard to eat so we picked them off. Fries were great but could use more sauce

I rushed here when it first opened so excited to have something née on the seaport during covid. Me and my mom had a lot of fun trying their boozy milkshakes. Can def taste but doesn't get you wild. My soul needed a cheeseburger this week ans I got it to go. Really yummy. Wanted to love the dirty waffle fries but found them too saturated in sauce to really eat. But overall a great lil spot for fun eats. Check out their monthly specials they always look delicious!

We don't live to far from the south street seaport so we decided to enjoy the day on the board walk and had to stop in at Mister Dips!!! It's a simple menu and easy to read!! A lot of guest were getting ice cream cones which they seem to love so my husband and I decided to get the single dip burger and the ranch strips which were both amazing my husband loved the burger,it's only cooked well which was not bad cause it's like a smash thin burger and strips were big and full of sauce Omgggg we so enjoyed Mister dips .As for price,be prepared to spend some money cause that one single dip burger was 9 and change !!!! But worth it
No comment
No comment

I've been "eye-ing" this place for probably almost a year now and I finally made my way to Mister Dips! First and foremost, they have sanitizing stations throughout the inside of the restaurant and an outdoor area for eating with no chairs but high-top tables. They seemed short staffed and were still pushing orders out efficiently. However, I did not see anyone sanitizing tables after customers so you might want to come prepped with your own wipes. The food was a 7/10. I would probably only come back for the ice cream, the fries were my FAV. Oh, and the hot bae chicken strips were pretty much just dumped in honey. For two people we spent $50, which is pricey in my opinion for the amount of food we got. I'll still to my shack burgers.
No comment

I got a vegan beyond burger with everything on it and some waffle fries! It was so yummy! I like my fries a little mushy and not so crunchy, they were perfect! They tasted so delicious paired with the burger! The burger had some epic vegan sauce on it and lots of veg! It was quick and easy to pick up to go as well! Would definitely recommend if you're looking for something easy, not too expensive, and yummy!

So I went for my first time, the place looks very nice first off. As for the food, the burger was good not great but still good. The ice itself was okay, I think the hype is more on dipped portion then it is the actually ice cream. I still prefer Ample Hill Creamery and Van Leeuwen Ice Cream
Cute ice cream. Pier 17 is a great area to see bridge views. Mister dips is located at the seaport and great place to hang.
No comment

Mister Dips is Andrew Carmellini's retort to Shake Shack and since he is a James Beard Award-winning chef, Mister Dips is the absolutely amazing version we have always dreamed of. This is the real deal folks. Ubercreative fast food with wonderful ice cream treats for dessert. It is clear that this will be a winner. I can only imagine the drama the next time Carmellini is with Danny Meyer as Andrew struts over, looks Danny in the eyes and says "call me Mister Dips!"

I was a little let down by the cone here after following them on Instagram for a few months and seeing their monthly specials. Maybe I built it up too much in my head. My friend got the banana boozy shake and I liked that more than the cone I ordered which was just a little small and not really anything big in terms of flavor.
No comment

We were walking around the seaport district and I decided to let my son pick the lunch spot. He of course settled on mister dips. It was our first time visiting this restaurant and they have a limited menu. Well let me say.... Everything on the menu was amazing. We both had the single burger, waffle fries, loaded fries, a root beer float, and a frozen lemonade. The service was amazing and the food was so delicious, we might stop in again before we leave New York. It's a must visit in my opinion. Especially if you have kiddos.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
I had Winnie the Pooh. I like the drizzle honey. The coating is a bit too sweet but the vanilla inside was really good. The ice cream texture was soft and sweetness not too much

This is Mister Dips newest location on Pier 17 at the South Street Seaport. The space is obviously clean and new and the staff was really friendly. I got a chocolate and vanilla skinny dip with sprinkles (about $5) and has it right on the water. I will be back to try out some of their other more unique items. Enjoy!

Mister dips is a great addition to Pier 17! They are open later than some surrounding businesses which is great. I got the skinny dip and loaded fries. Both were delicious. I loved the spiciness of the fries. They will soon be adding a monthly special flavor which is exciting! Definitely will be back.

I've been wanting to try mister dips for a while. I stopped into the new seaport district location. I've always wanted the peanut butter cone that I've seen all over. It was ok. It's small for what you pay for. For sure a good picture, but maybe not worth it. I was tasty without a doubt, just wish you got more, or it cost less

My my my. I am never a burger and shack kinda girl but this place sold me the American Dream. Wonderful staff with big smile under their masks and super yummy burgers and fries! The burger tastes and looks as if Shake Shack and In-N-Out had a love child ha! The dirty waffle fries reminds me of love can manifest in the form of queso. We also got two soft serves and both were amazing. Pro tip is to only bite off the tip of the casing (dip) and suck the ice cream out so you don't make a huge mess. Once the casing is gone, the ice cream misses its friend it will cry all over you which means your hand will get to eat ice cream not you lol.

Good ice cream, but pricey! $7 for a cone! I tried 'think pink' which is vanilla cream with a berry dip over the ice cream. The plastic cone made it easy to hold and eat the ice cream cone inside. Seating is tight and the place gets busy fast. Restrooms are available with code needed to enter. Grab a cone to go and sit by the water at Pier 17 just as you pass Malibu Farm.

Food is great and deceivingly bigger than you expect. Drinks are great too, but a little pricey. Staff is very funny. I love that they have a water station - it's honestly a hard thing to find in NYC.

My son loves the vanilla ice cream w/the chocolate eyes added. It would be nice to have a vegan soft serve for those that want to experience the fun flavors. The burger & waffle fries are delish. The chicken tenders are yummy!! Great spot for my munchkin

My first experience here was on Aug 28th when I was in the mood for some ice cream and stumbled across this store. I'm a plain jane when it comes to my ice cream so although the options look great, I went with a vanilla cone. It was soooooooo good! The first thing I noticed was how neat and full the cone looked and the second was how cold it was. You can literally see the frost coming from the ice cream as you eat it. My boyfriend tried the berry gibbs which ended up in the trash can after a few bites. The ice cream didn't taste like strawberry but more like berry and the outside red harden shell wasn't a good flavor either so that was money wasted, unfortunately. After letting him try some of my ice cream he loved it and went to order one for himself. A few days later we were in the area and decided to dine in for some food. We got the single dip burger, bbq bacon dip burger, dirty dipped waffle fries, a frozen lemonade, and the hot bae chicken tenders. Of course, after our meal, we had to end it with another delicious vanilla cone.  We were pleasantly surprised! The waffle fries were really good but would've been better with fresh fries as they were lukewarm with some pieces of suuuper old fries probably from throwing new batches onto old fries. I'd recommend them to properly dispose of old fries so there isn't a mixture of 3+ batches in there. My boyfriend looooved his bbq burger but the single dip burger didn't have much flavor so I wouldn't order it again. The hot bae tenders were fresh out of the oil and not too spicy as I had prepared myself for which was a plus because I don't like spicy foods. Frozen lemonade was ok and messy because it started to melt within seconds all over the table. We will definitely be back now that we know what we like and don't like. Plus the cashier Raheem (that's the name on the receipt) was super knowledgeable and friendly. I had like a million questions and he was very helpful in answering them.
Good burger, better waffle fries. Frozen lemonade was amazing. Fun ice cream, friendly staff. Highly recommend if your at the seaport.

After crossing the Brooklyn Bridge on foot we decided we deserved to fuel up for the walk back across the bridge. I love my burger simple but tasty and Mister Dips delivered. The Dips Loaded Waffle Fries were fabulous!! We got light whip on our buttermilk berry shake which for us was perfect. The burger was fresh and tasty. Enjoyed every bite.
Obviously the ice cream is amazing, but I was pleasantly surprised by how good the food was too. The chicken fingers with hot honey were unreal paired with this ice cream cone
No comment

Mister Dips was a must visit on our trip to NYC due to its Instagram popularity and it did not disappoint. The chicken was delicious and the fries were some of my favorites I had in quite some time! The ice cream and shakes were very good and we can see why this place is so popular! I look forward to visiting their other locations.

fun soft serve spot on the pier! their menu is full of amazing soft serve creations, in addition to burgers, fries, and shakes. the ice cream was so fresh and delicious! they lost a star because the employee who took my order would not stop complaining to me about the people in front of me in line. amazing spot for ice cream on a hot day!

Stopped in Mister Dips because I was in the area to watch a movie. I ordered the peanut butter cup ice cream cone. It looks Aesthetically pleasant for photos and whatnot. The taste itself was good and messy to eat. I highly recommend a lot of napkins lol. I would go back again to try their burgers and fries. The smell and the look From others eating in the restaurant made me want it!!
Such a fun place. Thank you for being open late on a Saturday night. I enjoyed the milkshake and waffle fries. And really funny music and fun decor!

A really cool, funky vibe to the place but I wasn't impressed by the food. I ordered a frozen lemonade, bacon cheese burger, fries and strips. It wasn't anything special. The strips were the standard, heavily coated, overly salty and fried strips you'd get from McDonalds. The burger patty was super, super thin. Our frozen lemonade was served in a tiny cup, almost like a child's cup and it was just, sugar water. And for the price point I expected it to be at least enough for one (adult) person to enjoy. It also didn't have an authentic lemon taste. I was expecting more from this place, meaning- I thought the food would be more homemade or fresh. Everything seemed to be just the regular, fast food, junk you can get anywhere.

Not really a place to sit down inside (a few tables if you want to), but taking your burger and fries outside is an incredible experience! Nice way to enjoy some cheap ish eats on the water. Gorgeous views and delicious food. Burger was a bit small but ok for the price.

so good. Honestly I had just come from another restaurant and was still hungry so I got a burger and fries. It was sooo good. It reminded me of a shake shack burger, which I love, and the fries were also very good. The staff were also really nice and I would definitely go back!

First off, the food and ice cream are actually pretty good. The two star rating is purely about the level of service (or total lack thereof). Apparently none of the front desk staff can muster a smile or a friendly word, at least going by the  2 to 3 interactions  I observed during my visit. I got the distinct impression that none of the counter personnel want to be there or that any of them give a hoot about the customers who they treat like an unwelcome intrusion. Unfortunate for the owner / operator of this establishment but apparently good staff is increasingly impossible to find.

I went to get the "Winnie the Pooh" Ice cream, but ended up ordering waffle fries and chicken fingers. Although I really liked the ice cream, what really won my heart was those waffle fries. I wish I had taken a picture. They were  delicious! The chicken was pretty good too.  The place in itself is cute and it's in a beautiful location by the seaport. Their ice cream creations are fun and worth the trip.

I waited about 15 minutes to order on a late Sunday afternoon. And the Winnie the Pooh Berry was delicious. But I was really disappointed that the employees left the ice cream cone sitting on the counter for several minutes and melting (you can visibly see the food prep line behind the cash register) before calling my name. They actually served customers their food who ordered AFTER me. I would not go back.

I ordered a mint chocolate cone and some waffle fries with queso & scallions to share and they did not disappoint! I will say tho, especially on a sunny day, WATCH OUT because those cones are MESSY so take your pics quick and eat up! They were also running the limited edition pride cones at the time so lots of people were ordering that instead of the other cone options so my wait time was quite long compared to my friends & other people who ordered before me (who got the pride cone), around 10-15 minutes.

Finally got to try Mister Dips recently! I had previously seen their ice cream pics on insta and I knew I had to try it. Got a chance to go with my gf and try two of their cones. It was cold outside but its never a bad time for ice-cream! We tried their limited ed ice cream for December which was "The Grinch". It had eggnog custard ice-cream with holiday sprinkles and wintergreen dip. It looked like a Christmas tree ice-cream and tasted ok. Our ice-cream cone didn't have a Christmas star but a ball...We were not a fan of eggnog ice cream. The second cone we tried was the  Chocolate Pbd with chocolate ice cream and salted peanut butter dip, chocolate ice cream and a peanut better cup. It tasted pretty good and we would definitely try it again. The location itself was pretty cozy compared to the weather outside. Next time we plan on trying their food alongside the ice cream. Overall I recommend this place!

Stopped here in a late night during my stay in NY, they were extremely busy and seemed short staffed but the staff member working the register was extremely nice! The food was delicious , was one of my favorite burger places during my visit

Cool new spot in pier 17, highly recommend the waffle fries if you go. Ice cream would have been great but they made it before the fries and had it sitting there for a few minutes, so ice cream melted inside the shell. once you bit into the shell it exploded so the catcher wasn't even useful. Around $7 for each ice cream

A really satisfying burger! Thin crispy patty but so filling. I got the bbq bacon dip without cheese and devoured it. The waffle fries are crispy and seasoned well. My friend got the blackberry milkshake and loved it. Very reasonable prices, too!
I got the chocolate peanut butter cone. Beware, the ice cream starts melting instantly. Good flavor. The menu is limited but has alcohol offerings (including alcoholic ice cream).

Good option if you are at Seaport and in the mood for some American classic. Grabbed one soft serve and one shake for the July 4th fireworks. Bold, unsophisticated flavors, the shake turned out better than I expected and the dark rum taste actually came through - was an overall good experience.

I had to stop by after I saw my favorite food blogger post pictures of the delicious looking ice cream. It's in a convenient location at the pier . I definitely recommend to anyone who is visiting the seaport . They have boozy options as well .
Great food - burgers, fries, and ice cream. Service and staff was great as well! Great views in seaport too

Stopped after dinner for a very expensive ice cream cone. Got a dipped cone and the soft serve was melting with the first bite I took making it a very messy experience. Less than pleasant atmosphere as well. Overall would not recommend and would not go back.
The atmosphere of the restaurant was very unique and the staff were super friendly. The food was wonderful and of course the ice cream!

Yoooooo....yooooooo....taste, quality, price ...this place is too good to be true. I don't even want to promote it because i dont want them to start thinking their prices and food should be priced higher...no please! This place is so good i will be back many more times! Love their trixxxytreat Halloween icecream! Fries were good too! Clean place and cool location. Love it!
Great location right on the water, super cute photo op! I've cream was rich and creamy, in summer it melts quick outside, ask for a cup! Overall delish!
Came here on a Saturday . We got 2 of their ice cream cones . Pretty tasty ! I will try their food soon
Came on July 4th because it's was the only place that wasn't super crowded. Yummy waffle fries, decent burgers and milkshakes. Hip environment.

Went to try the burger. It's not the best, you can actually get much better across the street at cobble. The waffle fries were also just OK nothing great. But if you'd like to try out a new place on pier 17 do go but don't have high expectations.

$4.30 for a tiny frozen lemonade that made us wait 20 minutes for. It was given to 5 different people before us, because everyone's order was messed up. I get it, new store, staff are still working things out. But the price point is just outrageous. Even on the way out, people stopped us and made jokes about the size of the lemonade and the wait time.

I'd like to give it ZERO STARS.  Just tried this place for the first time and I will NEVER eat there again.  The burger tasted like a salt lick. I had the BBQ Bacon burger and didn't taste any flavors other than SALT.  You need a gallon of water to get through it. Disgusting!
